name: Asger Hartvig Aaboe
summary: Asger Aaboe was a Danish mathematician who is known for his contributions to the history of ancient Babylonian astronomy.

name: Ernst Abbe
born_place: Eisenach, Grand Duchy of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach (now in Germany)
summary: Ernst Abbe was a German instument maker who made important improvements in lens design.

name: Edwin Abbott Abbott
summary: Edwin Abbott was an English schoolmaster who wrote the popular book Flatland as an introduction to higher dimensions.

name: Niels Henrik Abel
summary: Niels Abel was a Norwegian mathematician who proved the impossibility of solving algebraically the general equation of the fifth degree.

name: Pedro Abellanas Cebollero
summary: Pedro Abellanas was a Spanish mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry and wrote many important text-books.

name: Shreeram Shankar Abhyankar
summary: Shreeram Shankar Abhyankar was an Indian-born American mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Raimundo Chela Aboudib
summary: Raimundo Chela was a Venezuelan mathematician who made a substantial contribution to improving the teaching of mathematics in Venezuela at all school and university levels.

name: Abraham bar Hiyya Ha-Nasi
summary: Abraham bar Hiyya was a Spanish Jewish mathematician and astronomer. He wrote the first book to introduce Islamic algebra to Europe.

name: Max Abraham
summary: Max Abraham was a German physicist who worked on electromagnetism and relativity.

name: Nicolae Abramescu
summary: Nicolae Abramescu was a Romanian mathematician who worked in descriptive geometry.

name: Abu Kamil Shuja ibn Aslam ibn Muhammad ibn Shuja
summary: Abu Kamil Shuja was an Islamic mathematician. He was one of Al-Khwarismi's successors and applied algebraic methods to geometric problems.

name: Mohammad Abu'l-Wafa Al-Buzjani
born_place: Buzjan (near Jam), Khorasan region (now in Iran)
summary: Abu'l-Wafa was an Islamic astronomer and mathematician who wrote commentaries on the works of earlier mathematicians. He made astronomical observations and constructed accurate trigonometric tables.

name: Wilhelm Ackermann
summary: Wilhelm Ackermann was a mathematical logician who worked with David Hilbert in Göttingen but spent his career as a high school teacher.

name: Francisco Javier González Acuña
summary: Francisco González Acuña is a leading Mexican topologist whose works represent fundamental contributions to low-dimensional topology. He had been a keynote speaker at many international conferences, and has exerted tremendous influence on topology in Mexico.

name: János Dezső Aczél
summary: János Aczél was a Hungarian mathematician who spent the second half of his career in Canada. He was a leading expert in functional equations, organised many international conferences on the topic and wrote important books.

name: Pedro Puig Adam
summary: Pedro Puig Adam was a Spanish mathematician and engineer who worked in relativistic mechanics.

name: Edwin Plimpton Adams
summary: Edwin Adams studied at Harvard, Göttingen and Cambridge and became Physics Professor at Princeton. He is best known for his translations of some of Einstein's lectures.

name: John Frank Adams
summary: Frank Adams was an English algebraic topologist who pioneered methods for calculating the homotopy of spheres.

name: John Couch Adams
summary: John Couch Adams was an astronomer and mathematician who was the first person to predict the position of a planet beyond Uranus.

name: Louise Doris Adams
summary: Louise Doris Adams was a school teacher and school inspector who did much to improve the teaching of mathematics in schools. She was enthusiastically involved with the Mathematical Association and in 1959-60 she served as its President, being only the second woman to hold this role.

name: Iain Thomas Arthur Carpenter Adamson
summary: Iain Adamson was a Scottish mathematician who worked in algebra and published several widely appreciated text-books.

name: Adelard of Bath
summary: Adelard was an English philosopher who translated Arabic mathematical works into Latin.

name: José Adem Chahín
summary: José Adem was a Mexican mathematician who made many outstanding contributions to topology. He is remembered today for the "Adem relations" which were introduced in his Princeton Ph.D. thesis of 1952.

name: Julián Adem Chahín
summary: Julián Adem was a Mexican applied mathematician and geophysicist specialising in atmospheric sciences. He is most famous for developing the Hemispheric Thermodynamic Climate Model which simulated the natural climate.

name: Sergei Ivanovich Adian
born_place: Kushchi, Dashkesan District, Azerbaijan Soviet Republic
summary: Sergei Ivanovich Adian was an Armenian mathematician who worked in group theory and is known for his work on the Burnside problem.

name: Leonard Adleman
summary: Leonard Adleman is an American computer scientist best known for being one of the creators of the RSA encryption algorithm.

name: August Adler
summary: August Adler was a mathematician who was born in what was then Austria and who worked on geometric constructions using compasses only.

name: Robert Adrain
summary: Robert Adrain was an Irishman who was one of the first mathematicians to work in America.

name: Adriaan van Roomen
summary: Adriaan van Roomen or Adrianus Romanus was a Flemish mathematician who calculated π to 16 decimal places using Archimedes' method.

name: Franz Maria Ulrich Theodosius Aepinus
summary: Franz Aepinus was a German scientist who did important work on electricity and magnetism.

name: Tatiana Ehrenfest-Afanassjewa
summary: Tatiana Alexeyevna Afanassjewa was a Ukrainian-born Dutch mathematician and physicist who made contributions to the fields of statistical mechanics and statistical thermodynamics.

name: Maria Gaëtana Agnesi
summary: Maria Agnesi was an Italian mathematician who is noted for her work in differential calculus. She discussed the cubic curve now known as the 'witch of Agnesi'.

name: Nkechi Madonna Adeleine Agwu
summary: Nkechi Agwu was born in Nigeria where she eared her first degree, then went to the United States for her doctorate. She is an expert on mathematical education and is particularly interested in ethnomathematics.

name: Lars Valerian Ahlfors
born_place: Helsingfors, Finland, Russian Empire (now Helsinki, Finland)
summary: Lars Ahlfors was a Finnish mathematician who made important contributions to Complex Analysis and was one of the first recipients of a Fields Medal.

name: Ahmed ibn Yusuf al-Misri
summary: Ahmed ibn Yusuf was an Islamic mathematician who wrote a commentary on Euclid's Elements which influenced later European mathematicians.

name: Ahmes
summary: Ahmes was the Egyptian scribe who wrote the Rhind Papyrus - one of the oldest known mathematical documents.

name: Wilhelm Ernst Martin Georg Ahrens
born_place: Lübz an der Elde, Mecklenburg, Germany
summary: Wilhelm Ahrens was a German mathematician best known for his work on recreational mathematics.

name: Aida Yasuaki
summary: Aida Yasuaki was a Japanese mathematician who published about 2000 works.

name: Howard Hathaway Aiken
summary: Howard Aiken was a pioneer designer of early computers.

name: John Robinson Airey
summary: John Airey graduated from Cambridge and became Principal of the West Ham Technical Institute. He is best known for his work in producing tables of mathematical functions.

name: George Biddell Airy
summary: George Airy was Lucasian professor at Cambridge and Astronomer Royal. He made many major contributions to mathematics and astronomy.

name: John Aitchison
summary: John Aitchison was a Scottish statistician who made contributions to distribution theory, practical Bayesian statistics, statistical diagnosis in medicine and other areas of applied and theoretical statistics.

name: Alexander Craig Aitken
summary: Alec Aitken was a New Zealand mathematician who served at Gallipoli and in France. He had a prodigious memory and calculating ability and worked in Statistics, Numerical Analysis and Algebra.

name: V Ramaswami Aiyar
summary: Ramaswami Aiyar was an enthusiastic amateur mathematician who worked as a civil servant in India. He was a founder of the Indian Mathematical Society.

name: Chokuyen Naonobu Ajima
summary: Naonobu Ajima was a Japanese mathematician and astronomer who developed a theory of integration.

name: Naum Il'ich Akhiezer
summary: Naum Il'ich Akhiezer was a Soviet mathematician whose main work was on function theory and approximation theory. He also produced works on the history of mathematics.

name: Daniel Afedzi Akyeampong
born_place: Senya Beraku, British Gold Coast (now Ghana)
summary: Daniel Akyeampong was a Ghanaian mathematician known for applying algebraic methods to theoretical physics. He was important in the development of higher education in Ghana.

name: Baha' ad-Din al-Amili
summary: Al Amili was a Lebanese-born mathematician who wrote influential works on arithmetic, astronomy and grammar.

name: Abu Mansur ibn Tahir Al-Baghdadi
summary: Al-Baghdadi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote about different systems of arithmetic in a work of great importance in the history of mathematics.

name: al-Marrakushi ibn Al-Banna
summary: Ibn al-Banna was an Islamic mathematician who wrote a large number of works including an introduction to Euclid's Elements, an algebra text and various works on astronomy.

name: Abu Abdallah Mohammad ibn Jabir Al-Battani
summary: Al-Battani or Albategnius was an Islamic astronomer and mathematician. He made important accurate measurements of the stars, moon and planets. His measurements and methods were used by later astronomers.

name: Abu Arrayhan Muhammad ibn Ahmad al-Biruni
summary: Al-Biruni is one of the major figures of Islamic mathematics. He contributed to astronomy, mathematics, physics, medicine and history.

name: Kamal al-Din Abu'l Hasan Muhammad Al-Farisi
summary: Al-Farisi was an Islamic mathematician who made two major contributions to mathematics, one on light, the other on number theory.

name: Abu Ali al-Hasan ibn al-Haytham
summary: Al-Haytham is also known as Alhazen. He was an Islamic mathematician who wrote early works on optics as well as geometry and number theory.

name: al-Abbas ibn Said Al-Jawhari
summary: Al-Jawhari was an Islamic mathematician whose main work was a commentary on Euclid's Elements.

name: Abu Abd Allah Muhammad ibn Muadh Al-Jayyani
summary: Al-Jayyani was an Islamic mathematician working in Spain. He wrote important commentaries on Euclid's Elements and he wrote the first treatise on spherical trigonometry.

name: Abu'l Hasan ibn Ali al Qalasadi
summary: Al-Qalasadi was a Spanish Islamic mathematician who took the first steps toward the introduction of algebraic symbolism by using letters in place of numbers.

name: Abu Bekr ibn Muhammad ibn al-Husayn Al-Karaji
summary: Al-Karaji was an Islamic mathematician who wrote about the work of earlier mathematicians and who can be regarded as the first person to free algebra from geometrical operations and replace them with the type of operations which are at the core of algebra today.

name: Ghiyath al-Din Jamshid Mas'ud al-Kashi
summary: Jamshid al-Kashi was an Islamic mathematician who published some important teaching works and anticipated Stevin's work on decimals.

name: Shams al-Din Abu Abdallah Al-Khalili
summary: Al-Khalili was an Islamic astronomer who compiled extensive tables for astronomical use.

name: Omar Khayyam
summary: Omar Khayyam was an Islamic scholar who was a poet as well as a mathematician. He compiled astronomical tables and contributed to calendar reform and discovered a geometrical method of solving cubic equations by intersecting a parabola with a circle.

name: Abu Jafar Muhammad ibn al-Hasan Al-Khazin
summary: Al-Khazin was an Islamic mathematician who worked on number theory and astronomy.

name: Abu Mahmud Hamid ibn al-Khidr Al-Khujandi
summary: Al-Khujandi was an Islamic astronomer and mathematician. He made accurate astronomical observations and may have made some advances in trigonometry.

name: Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Musa Al-Khwarizmi
summary: Al'Khwarizmi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote on Hindu-Arabic numerals. The word algorithm derives from his name. His algebra treatise Hisab al-jabr w'al-muqabala gives us the word algebra and can be considered as the first book to be written on algebra.

name: Abu Yusuf Yaqub ibn Ishaq al-Sabbah Al-Kindi
summary: Al-Kindi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote on the Indian mumber system as well as geometry and optics.

name: Abu Sahl Waijan ibn Rustam al-Quhi
summary: Al-Quhi was an Islamic mathematician who was a leading figure in the revival and continuation of Greek geometry.

name: Muhyi l'din al-Maghribi
summary: Muhyi l'din al-Maghribi was a Spanish-born Islamic astronomer who is most famous for his work on trigonometry.

name: Abu Abd Allah Muhammad ibn Isa Al-Mahani
summary: Al-Mahani was an Islamic mathematician who tried to solve some of Archimedes' problems on cutting up spheres.

name: Abu l'Hasan Ali ibn Ahmad Al-Nasawi
summary: Al-Nasawi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote summaries of some of Euclid's Elements.

name: Abu'l Abbas al-Fadl ibn Hatim Al-Nayrizi
summary: Al-Nayrizi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote commentaries on work by Ptolemy and Euclid.

name: Shams al-Din ibn Ashraf Al-Samarqandi
summary: Shams al-Samarqandi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote works on theology, logic, philosophy, mathematics and astronomy.

name: Ibn Yahya al-Maghribi Al-Samawal
summary: Al-Samawal was an Islamic mathematician who was able to extend the arithmetic operations to handle polynomials. He used an early form of induction.

name: Abu Said Ahmad ibn Muhammad Al-Sijzi
summary: Al-Sijzi was an Islamic astronomer and mathematician who wrote on the geometry of spheres.

name: Nasir al-Din al-Tusi
summary: Nasir al-Tusi was an Islamic astronomer and mathematician who joined the Mongols who conquered Baghdad. He made important contributions to astronomy and wrote many commentaries on Greek texts.

name: Sharaf al-Din al-Muzaffar al-Tusi
summary: Sharaf al-Tusi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote a treatise on cubic equations.

name: Abu Abdallah Yaish ibn Ibrahim Al-Umawi
summary: Al-Umawi was a Spanish-born Islamic mathematician who wrote works on mensuration and arithmetic.

name: Abu'l Hasan Ahmad ibn Ibrahim Al-Uqlidisi
summary: Al-Uqlidisi was an Islamic mathematician who wrote two works on arithmetic. He may have anticipated the invention of decimals.

name: Abu Ishaq Ibrahim ibn Yahya al-Zarqali
summary: Al-Zarkali was a Spanish Muslim instrument maker, astrologer and important astronomer. He invented a form of the astrolabe.

name: Mihailo Petrović
summary: Mihailo Petrović was a Serbian mathematician and inventor who worked in differential equations and phenomenology.

name: Cristoforo Vincenzo Francesco Alasia
summary: Cristoforo Alasia was an Italian school teacher who produced papers on astronomy, geometry, rational mechanics and the history of mathematics.

name: Giacomo Albanese
summary: Giacomo Albanese was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry. He finished his career teaching in Brazil.

name: Albert of Saxony
summary: Albert of Saxony was a German mathematician who acted mainly as a transmitter of the mathematics of others.

name: Saint Albertus Magnus
born_place: Lauingen an der Donau, Swabia (now Germany)
summary: Albert (or Albertus Magnus) was a German Dominican who wrote a commentary on Euclid's Elements. He was made a Saint in 1931 and, in 1941, was made patron of natural scientists.

name: Abraham Adrian Albert
summary: A Adrian Albert was an American mathematician who worked on associative and non-associative algebras.

name: Leone Battista Alberti
summary: Leone Alberti was an Italian mathematician who wrote the first general treatise on the laws of perspective and also wrote a book on cryptography containing the first example of a frequency table.

name: Alcuin of York
summary: Alcuin was an English mathematician who wrote elementary texts on arithmetic, geometry and astronomy.

name: Henry Aldrich
summary: Henry Aldrich was an English mathematician who published an important work on logic.

name: Aleksandr Danilovic Aleksandrov
summary: Aleksandr Danilovic Aleksandrov was a Russian mathematician and physicist who worked in geometry and a wide variety of areas of physics. He wrote many textbooks.

name: Pavel Sergeevich Aleksandrov
summary: Pavel Aleksandrov was a Russian mathematician who made important contributions to general topology.

name: Grace Awani Alele-Williams
summary: Grace Alele-Williams was the first Nigerian to be awarded a doctorate. She became a professor of mathematical education, then the first female Nigerian Vice-Chancellor of the University of Benin.

name: Jean Le Rond d'Alembert
summary: Jean d'Alembert was a a French mathematician who was a pioneer in the study of differential equations and their use of in physics. He studied the equilibrium and motion of fluids.

name: Archie Alphonso Alexander
summary: Archie Alexander was an African-American mathematician and engineer. He became governor of the U.S. Virgin Islands.

name: Conel Hugh O'Donel Alexander
summary: Conel Hugh O'Donel Alexander was an Irish-born British cryptanalyst, chess player and chess writer.

name: James Waddell Alexander
summary: James Alexander was an American mathematician who worked in topology. He is best known for the knot-theory invariant known as the Alexander polynomial.

name: Andrzej Tadeusz Alexiewicz
born_place: Lwów, Poland, Austria-Hungarian Empire (now Lviv, Ukraine)
summary: Andrzej Alexiewicz was a Polish mathematician, born in what is now Ukraine, who was an expert at functional analysis.

name: Hannes Olof Gösta Alfvén
summary: Hannes Olof Gösta Alfvén was a Swedish electrical engineer, plasma physicist and winner of a Nobel Prize in Physics.

name: Ala al-Din Ali ibn Muhammed Ali Qushji
summary: Ali Qushji was an Islamic astronomer and mathematician, born in what is now Uzbekistan, who worked at observatories in Samarkand and Constantinople and whose results influenced Copernicus to produce his heliocentric system.

name: John Alison
summary: John Alison graduated from Edinburgh University and taught at George Watson's College in Edinburgh, He became head of the Glasgow United Free Church Training College and later returned to George Watson's as headmaster.

name: Graham Robert Allan
summary: Graham Allan was an English mathematician who specialised in functional analysis.

name: Robert Edgar Allardice
summary: Robert Alladice studied at Edinburgh University and was then appointed assistant to Professor Chrystal there. He became Professor at Stanford University in California. He worked in geometry.

name: Thomas Allen
summary: Thomas Allen was an English mathematician and antiquary important for his large collection of mathematical (and other) manuscripts.

name: Norman Larrabee Alling
summary: Norman Alling is an American mathematician who worked in a wide range of mathematics, from the theory of ordered groups to Riemann surfaces, including surreal numbers.

name: George Johnston Allman
summary: George Allman was an Irish professor, mathematician, classical scholar and historian of ancient Greek mathematics.

name: Francis Kofi Ampenyin Allotey
summary: Francis Allotey was a mathematician and physicist from Ghana who was awarded a Ph.D. by Princeton University in 1966. He returned to Ghana where he spent his career as a professor of mathematics and did outstanding work promoting mathematics and physics at all levels throughout Africa.

name: Frederick Justin Almgren
summary: Frederick Almgren was an American mathematician who worked in geometric measure theory.

name: Ugo Amaldi
summary: Ugo Amaldi was an Italian mathematician who worked in the fields of geometry and Lie groups.

name: Victor Amazaspovich Ambartsumian
born_place: Tiflis, Russian Empire, now Tbilisi, Georgia
summary: Viktor Ambartsumian was an Armenian astrophysicist who was born in what is now Georgia. He was one of the founders of theoretical astrophysics and worked in the field of the physics of stars and nebulae.

name: Ernst Julius Amberg
summary: Ernst Julius Amberg was a Swiss mathematician who helped to organise the first International Congress of Mathematicians.

name: Shimshon Avraham Amitsur
summary: Shimshon Amitsur was an Israeli mathematician who worked in ring theory.

name: Luigi Amoroso
summary: Luigi Amoroso was an Italian mathematician and economist who wrote on integral equatioins but is best known for his economic works.

name: André Marie Ampère
summary: André-Marie Ampère made important contributions to the theory of Electricity and magnetism. His theory became fundamental for 19th century developments.

name: John Howard Van Amringe
summary: Howard Van Amringe was an American educator and mathematician.

name: Jacob Amsler
summary: Jakob Amsler-Laffon was a Swiss mathematician, physicist, engineer and inventor.

name: John Ceres Amson
summary: John Amson was a person of many talents making impressive contributions to welding, city planning and mathematics. He was a founding member, and later president, of the Alternative Natural Philosophy Association. His warmth, humour and energy inspired his friends and colleagues.

name: Anania Širakuni
summary: Ananias of Shirak was a medieval Armenian polymath, known as the father of mathematical sciences within the Armenian tradition. The corpus of his works includes writings on mathematics, astronomy, theology, philosophy, geography, arithmetic and cosmography, including the earliest known book of arithmetic on the four basic operations.

name: Anaxagoras of Clazomenae
born_place: Clazomenae (30 km west of Izmir), Lydia (now Turkey)
summary: Anaxagoras was a Greek mathematician famed as the first to introduce philosophy to the Athenians. He was imprisoned for claiming that the Sun was not a god and that the Moon reflected the Sun's light.

name: Anaximander of Miletus
summary: Anaximander of Miletus was a Greek scholar who first proposed that the sun, moon and planets revolved around the earth. he invented the gnomon of a sun-dial.

name: Oskar Johann Viktor Anderson
summary: Oskar Anderson was a Ukranian-born German mathematician who was known for his work on mathematical statistics and econometrics.

name: Marie Henri Andoyer
summary: Henri Andoyer was a French astronomer and mathematician who worked on the motion of the moon. He published mathematical tables and works on the history of astronomy.

name: Konstantin Alekseevich Andreev
summary: Konstantin Alekseevich Andreev was a Russian mathematician, best known for his work on geometry, especially projective geometry.

name: Aldo Andreotti
university: Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa and Università di Pisa
summary: Aldo Andreotti was an Italian mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry, on the theory of functions of several complex variables and on partial differential operators.

name: George W Eyre Andrews
summary: George E Andrews is an American mathematician who worked in special functions, number theory, analysis and combinatorics

name: Aurel Angelescu
summary: Aurel Angelescu was a Romanian mathematician who contributed to the development of algebra and the theory of functions.

name: Stefano degli Angeli
summary: Stephano Angeli was an Italian mathematician who worked on infinitesimals and used them to study spirals, parabolas and hyperbolas.

name: Theodor Angheluță
summary: Theodor Angheluță was a Romanian mathematician who made important contributions to Function Theory, to Differential and Integral Equations, and to Functional and Algebraic Equations.

name: Alexander Obiefoka Enukora Animalu
born_place: Oba, Idemili South Local Government Area of Anambra State, Nigeria
summary: Alexander Animalu is a Nigerian theoretical physicist known for his work in superconductivity and solar energy.

name: Dmitrii Viktorovich Anosov
summary: Dmitri Anosov was a Russian mathematician who worked in dynamical systems theory.

name: Robert Richard Anstice
summary: Robert Richard Anstice was an English clergyman and mathematician who wrote two remarkable papers on combinatorics.

name: Anthemius of Tralles
summary: Anthemius was the Byzantine architect who replaced the old church of Hagia Sophia at Constantinople. He described the construction of an ellipse with a string fixed at the two foci and he described the focal properties of the parabola.

name: Antiphon the Sophist
summary: Antiphon was a Greek orator and statesman who took up rhetoric as a profession. He was a Sophist and a contemporary of Socrates. There is some dispute about whether there was one of two philosophers of this name.

name: Louis Auguste Antoine
summary: Louis Antoine was a French mathematician famous for his invention of Antoine's necklace.

name: Kathleen Rita McNulty Mauchly Antonelli
summary: Kathleen McNulty Antonelli was an Irish-born American computer programmer who was one of the first to work with the early ENIAC machine.

name: János Apáczai Csere
summary: János Apáczai was born in Transylvania and wrote the Hungarian Encyclopaedia.

name: Apastamba
summary: Apastamba was the Indian author of one of the most interesting of the Indian Sulbasutras from a mathematical point of view.

name: Roger Apéry
summary: Roger Apéry was a French mathematician best known for proving that ζ(3) is an irrational number.

name: Petrus Apianus
summary: Petrus Apianus was a German mathematician who published important popular works on astronomy and geography.

name: Apollonius of Perga
born_place: Perga, Pamphylia, Greek Ionia (now Murtina, Antalya, Turkey)
summary: Apollonius was a Greek mathematician known as 'The Great Geometer'. His works had a very great influence on the development of mathematics and his famous book Conics introduced the terms parabola, ellipse and hyperbola.

name: Tom Mike Apostol
summary: Tom Apostol was an American mathematician who specialised in analytic number theory and wrote one of the best-known books on analysis.

name: Kenneth Ira Appel
summary: Kenneth Appel was an American mathematician best-known for his part in proving the four-colour theorem.

name: Paul Emile Appell
summary: Paul Appell was a French mathematician who worked in analysis, geometry and mechanics.

name: Dominique François Jean Arago
summary: François Arago was an important French mathematician and politician. He made important discoveries on the corpuscular theory of light.

name: Louis François Antoine Arbogast
summary: Louis Arbogast was a French mathematician who worked on the calculus of derivatives and the operational calculus.

name: John Arbuthnot
summary: John Arbuthnot was a Scottish scholar who translated Huygens' tract on probability in 1692 and extended it by adding a few further games of chance. This was the first work on probability published in English.

name: James Archibald
summary: James Archibald graduated from Edinburgh University and eventually became headmaster of Dalry School Edinburgh.

name: Raymond Clare Archibald
born_place: Stewiacke, Colchester County, Nova Scotia, Canada
summary: Raymond C Archibald studied in Canada, at Harvard and at Strasbourg. He spent most of his career at Brown University in Rhode Island. His main interests were in the History of Mathematics.

name: Archimedes of Syracuse
summary: Archimedes was the greatest mathematician of his age. His contributions in geometry revolutionised the subject and his methods anticipated the integral calculus. He was a practical man who invented a wide variety of machines including pulleys and the Archimidean screw pumping device.

name: Archytas of Tarentum
summary: Archytas was a Greek mathematician, statesman and philosopher who worked on the harmonic mean and the problem of duplicating the cube.

name: Cahit Arf
summary: Cahit Arf was a Turkish mathematician. He is known for the Arf invariant in topology.

name: Jean Robert Argand
summary: Jean-Robert Argand was an amateur Swiss mathematician best known as one of the first to give a geometrical description of the Complex numbers.

name: Ovide Arino
summary: Ovide Arino was a French mathematician who worked in differential equations and Banach spaces.

name: Eizens Arins
summary: Eizens Arins was a Russian-born mathematician who worked in the theory of functions, theoretical computer science, and cybernetics.

name: Aristaeus the Elder
summary: Aristaeus the Elder was a Greek mathematician who worked on conic sections.

name: Aristarchus of Samos
summary: Aristarchus was a Greek mathematician and astronomer who is celebrated as the exponent of a Sun-centred universe and for his pioneering attempt to determine the sizes and distances of the Sun and Moon.

name: Aristotle
summary: Aristotle was a Greek philosopher who made important contributions by systemizing deductive logic and wrote on physical subjects. His philosophy had a long-lasting influence on the development of all Western philosophical theories.

name: Julio Garavito Armero
summary: Julio Garavito was a Colombian mathematician and astronomer who also contributed to political economy.

name: Antoine Arnauld
summary: Antoine Arnauld was a French supporter of Jansen who published some important works on logic and philosphy.

name: Vladimir Igorevich Arnold
summary: Vladimir Arnold is a Ukranian-born mathematician who won a Wolf prize for his work on dynamical systems, differential equations and singularity theory.

name: Siegfried Heinrich Aronhold
summary: Siegfried Aronhold made important contributions to the theory of invariants.

name: William Arthur
born_place: Fergushill School House, Kilwinning, Ayrshire, Scotland
summary: William Arthur graduated from the University of Glasgow and after serving in World War I became a lecturer at Glasgow.

name: Emil Artin
summary: Artin made a major contribution to the theory of noncommutative rings and later worked on rings with the minimum condition on right ideals, now called Artinian rings.

name: Michael Artin
summary: Michael Artin is an American mathematician known for his contributions to algebraic geometry. He has been awarded major prizes, including the Steele Prize and the Wolf Prize.

name: Rafael Georg Artzy
summary: Rafael Artzy was an Israeli mathematician, born in what was then Germany and is now Russia. He worked in geometry.

name: Ole Peder Arvesen
summary: Ole Peder Arvesen was a Norwegian engineer and mathematician who worked in the field of descriptive geometry.

name: Aryabhata the Elder
summary: Aryabhata I was an Indian mathematician who wrote the Aryabhatiya which summarises Hindu mathematics up to that 6th Century.

name: Aryabhata II
summary: Aryabhata II was an Indian mathematician who wrote about astronomy as well as geometry. He constructed tables of sines accurate up to about 5 figures.

name: Cesare Arzelà
born_place: Santo Stefano di Magra, La Spezia (now Italy)
died_place: Santo Stefano di Magra, La Spezia, Italy
summary: Cesare Arzelà was an Italian mathematician best known for his work in the theory of functions of a real variable.

name: Guido Ascoli
summary: Guido Ascoli was an Italian mathematician who worked in the theory of partial differential equations.

name: Leifur Ásgeirsson
summary: Leifur Ásgeirsson was an Icelandic mathematician who was the first full-time mathematics professor in Iceland.

name: Attia Abdel Salam Ashour
summary: Attia Ashour was an Egyptian mathematician who worked in electromagnetism.

name: Margaret Hilary Ashworth Millington
summary: Margaret Millington was an English-born mathematician. She made important contributions to modular forms, but died very young.

name: Richard Askey
summary: Richard Askey was an American mathematician who worked in special functions.

name: Michael Francis Atiyah
summary: Michael Atiyah worked in Topology and Geometry and was best known for his work on K-theory and the Atiyah-Singer Index Theorem. He was awarded a Fields Medal in 1966. He retired from the mastership of Trinity College Cambridge to live in Scotland.

name: Frederick Valentine Atkinson
summary: Frederick Atkinson was an English mathematician who worked in functional analysis and spent most of his career in Nigeria, Australia and Canada.

name: George Atwood
summary: George Atwood was an English mathematician best known for his invention of a low-friction pulley system.

name: Karl Egil Aubert
summary: Karl Aubert was a Norwegian mathematician who researched mainly in the field of algebra.

name: Thierry Émilien Flavien Aubin
summary: Thierry Aubin was a French mathematician who was a leading expert on Riemannian geometry and non-linear partial differential equations.

name: Maurice Audin
summary: Maurice Audin was a French mathematician and an activist in the anticolonialist cause, who died under torture by the French state during the Battle of Algiers.

name: Gerbert of Aurillac
summary: Gerbert of Aurillac or Pope Syvester II was a talented French mathematics teacher who popularised the Indo-Arabic numerals.

name: Louis Auslander
summary: Louis Auslander was an American mathematician who worked in both in pure and applied mathematics.

name: Maurice Auslander
summary: Maurice Auslander was an American mathematician who worked in commutative algebra and homological algebra.

name: Autolycus of Pitane
summary: Autolycus was a Greek astronomer and mathematician who wrote about the geometry of the sphere.

name: Adrien Auzout
summary: Adrien Auzout was a French astronomer who improved measuring instruments.

name: Abu Ali al-Husain ibn Abdallah ibn Sina (Avicenna)
summary: Ibn Sina or Avicenna was the most influential of all Islamic philosopher-scientists. He wrote on medicine as well as geometry, astronomy, arithmetic and music.

name: Artur Ávila Cordeiro de Melo
university: Instituto de Matemática Pura e Aplicada
summary: Artur Ávila is a Brazilian mathematician who has made deep contributions to dynamical systems theory which has transformed the subject. His work has been honoured with numerous prizes including a Fields Medal in 2014.

name: Phoebe Sarah Hertha Marks Ayrton
summary: Hertha Ayrton was an engineer and mathematician. She was awarded the Royal Society's Hughes Medal, and is well known as a suffragette.

name: A A Krishnaswami Ayyangar
born_place: Attipattu, Chingleput district, Tamil Nadu, India
summary: Krishnaswami Ayyangar was an Indian mathematician who worked in Mysore. He produced important work on the history of Hindu mathematics.

name: Charles Babbage
summary: Charles Babbage originated the modern analytic computer. He invented the principle of the analytical engine, the forerunner of the modern electronic computer.

name: Ivo Milan Babuska
summary: Ivo Babuska is a Czech mathematician who works in America and is noted for his work on the finite element method.

name: Louis Bachelier
summary: Louis Bachelier was a French mathematician who is credited with being the first person to model the stochastic process now called Brownian motion.

name: Claude Gaspar Bachet de Méziriac
summary: Claude Bachet was a French mathematician who wrote books on mathematical puzzles which formed the basis for almost all later books on mathematical recreations.

name: Tomás Rodríguez Bachiller
summary: Tomás Bachiller was a Chinese-born Spanish mathematician who worked in topology.

name: Friedrich Bachmann
summary: Friedrich Bachmann was a German mathematician who specialised in geometry and group theory.

name: Paul Gustav Heinrich Bachmann
summary: Paul Bachmann was a German mathematician best known for his work in analytic number theory and for introducing the O-notation.

name: Albert Victor Bäcklund
summary: Victor Bäcklund wasa Swedish physicist and mathematician.

name: John Warner Backus
summary: John Backus was an American mathematician best known for the invention of FORTRAN and for the BNF notation for describing the syntax of a programming language.

name: Clara Latimer Bacon
born_place: Hills Grove, (now Tennessee Township) Illinois, USA
summary: Clara Bacon was the first woman to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics from Johns Hopkins University. She had an outstanding reputation as a teacher, and ten women to whom she taught mathematics at undergraduate level at Goucher College went on to be awarded a Ph.D. from a different institution.

name: Roger Bacon
summary: Roger Bacon was an English mathematician. His most important mathematical contribution is the application of geometry to optics.

name: Jean Paul Albert Badoureau
summary: Albert Badoureau discovered 37 of the 75 non-prismatic uniform polyhedra in 1878. These were in addition to the 22 known at the time (5 Platonic solids, 13 Archimedean solids, and 4 Kepler-Poinsot polyhedra). He is also famed for his work in geology and for being the mathematical advisor to Jules Verne.

name: Reinhold Baer
summary: Reinhold Baer's mathematical work was wide ranging; topology, abelian groups and geometry. His most important work, however, was in group theory, on the extension problem for groups, finiteness conditions, soluble and nilpotent groups.

name: Giuseppe Bagnera
summary: Giuseppe Bagnera was an Italian mathematician who worked in geometry.

name: Hajer Bahouri
summary: Hajer Bahouri was born in Tunisia and is an expert in partial differential equations. She became Director of Research at the National Centre for Scientific Research and the Laboratory of Analysis and Applied Mathematics at the University Paris-Est-Créteil-Val-de-Marne.

name: Emilio Baiada
summary: Emilio Baiada was an Italian mathematician who worked in analysis, topology and differential equations.

name: Édouard Benjamin Baillaud
summary: Édouard Baillaud was a French astronomer who specialised in celestial mechanics, in particular the motions of the satellites of Saturn.

name: René-Louis Baire
summary: René Baire worked on the theory of functions and the concept of a limit.

name: Alan Baker
summary: Alan Baker was an English mathematician, known for his work in number theory.

name: Henry Frederick Baker
summary: Henry Baker spent his whole life in Cambridge and worked on Geometry and Analysis and inspired a younger generation of geometers.

name: Frank Stephen Baldwin
summary: Frank Baldwin was an American who invented a pinwheel calculator.

name: Robert Stawell Ball
summary: Robert Ball was an Irish mathematician and astronomer.

name: Walter William Rouse Ball
summary: Walter Rouse Ball was an English mathematician best known for his popular books on the History of Mathematics and on Mathematical Recreations.

name: Robert de Montessus de Ballore
summary: Robert de Montessus was a French mathematician, known for his work on continued fractions and Padé approximants.

name: Johann Jakob Balmer
summary: Johann Balmer is best remembered for his work on spectral series and his formula for the wavelengths of the spectral lines of the hydrogen atom.

name: Zoltán Tibor Balogh
summary: Zoltán Balogh was a Hungarian-born mathematician, specialising in set-theoretic topology.

name: Stefan Banach
summary: Banach founded modern functional analysis and made major contributions to the theory of topological vector spaces. In addition, he contributed to measure theory, integration, and orthogonal series.

name: Tadeusz Banachiewicz
summary: Tadeusz Banachiewicz was a Polish astronomer, mathematician and geodesist.

name: Benjamin Banneker
summary: Benjamin Banneker was a black American who is best-known for his Astronomical Almanac.

name: Banu Musa brothers
summary: The Bana Musa brothers were Islamic mathematicians whose work is almost indistinguishable.

name: Ahmad Banu Musa
summary: Ahmad Banu Musa was one of the three Bana Musa brothers. He wrote about mechanics.

name: al-Hasan Banu Musa
summary: Al-Hasan Banu Musa was one of the three Bana Musa brothers. He wrote about the ellipse.

name: Jafar Muhammad Banu Musa
summary: Jafar Muhammad Banu Musa was one of the three Bana Musa brothers. He wrote about conics.

name: Alberto Barajas Celis
summary: Alberto Barajas played an important role in the development of mathematics in Mexico, both as a researcher and as a teacher. When the National University built the new University City campus, as director of the Faculty of Sciences he led the academic input into the design of the buildings and facilities for that Faculty.

name: Joseph Émile Barbier
summary: Joseph-Émile Barbier was a French astronomer and mathematician.

name: Andrew Jeffrey Gunion Barclay
summary: Andrew Barclay was a Scottish School teacher who with Fraser and Knott he was one of the writers who originally proposed the founding of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society.

name: Nina Karlovna Bari
summary: Nina Karlovna Bari was a Russian mathematician known for her work on trigonometric series.

name: Thomas Barker
died_place: Woodlea, Lightwood Road, Fairfield, Buxton, England
summary: Thomas Barker had an outstanding undergraduate career, being Senior Wrangler in the mathematical tripos at Cambridge and 1st Smith's Prizeman in 1862. He went on to play an important role in Owens College, Manchester where he was professor of pure mathematics for twenty years.

name: Charles Glover Barkla
summary: Charles Barkla was an influential English physicist who became professor of Natural Philosophy in Edinburgh. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1917 for his work on X-ray spectroscopy.

name: Peter Barlow
summary: Peter Barlow was an English mathematician who produced important mathematical tables.

name: Ernest Barnes
summary: Ernest William Barnes was an English mathematician and scientist who later became a liberal theologian and bishop.

name: Franciscus Barocius
summary: Francesco Barozzi or Barocius was a Cretan who is important for translating Greek mathematical texts.

name: Isaac Barrow
summary: Isaac Barrow was an English mathematician who developed a method of determining tangents that closely approached the methods of calculus, and he was first to recognise that integration and differentiation are inverse operations.

name: Iacopo Barsotti
summary: Iacopo Barsotti was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Kazimierz Wladyslaw Bartel
summary: Kazimierz Bartel was a Polish mathematician who went on to become prime minister of Poland after the first World War.

name: Johann Christian Martin Bartels
summary: Martin Bartels was a German mathematician best known as the teacher of Gauss and Lobachevsky.

name: Erasmus Bartholin
summary: Erasmus Bartholin was a Danish mathematician and astronomer who wrote on geometry. He also discovered double refraction.

name: Betty Jean Jennings Bartik
born_place: Alanthus Grove, Gentry County, Missouri, USA
summary: Jean Bartik was an American mathematician famous as one of the original programmers for the ENIAC computer.

name: Maurice Stevenson Bartlett
summary: Maurice Stevenson Bartlett was an English statistician who made contributions to the analysis of data with spatial and temporal patterns.

name: Francis Bashforth
summary: Francis Bashforth was an applied mathematician who invented the Bashforth Chronograph and conducted experiments to determine air resistance. He became the leading British authority on ballistics in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

name: Hyman Bass
summary: Hyman Bass is an American mathematician, known for work in algebra and in mathematics education.

name: Alfred Barnard Basset
summary: Alfred Barnard Basset was an English mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry, electrodynamics and hydrodynamics.

name: Laura Maria Catarina Bassi
summary: Laura Bassi was an Italian physicist and one of the earliest women to gain a professorship in an Italian university.

name: Giuseppe Basso
born_place: Chivasso, Turin, Kingdom of Sardinia (now Italy)
summary: Giuseppe Basso was an Italian physicist and mathematician who produced some important results in mathematical physics.

name: George Keith Batchelor
summary: George Batchelor was an Australian applied mathematician who worked in fluid dynamics.

name: Harry Bateman
summary: Harry Bateman was an English mathematician who did extensive work in analysis -- particularly on Special Functions and Integral Transforms.

name: David Robert Bates
summary: David Bates was an Irish mathematician and physicist who worked on atmospheric physics, molecular physics and the chemistry of interstellar clouds.

name: Frederick Bath
summary: Frederick Bath graduated from Bristol and Cambridge and held posts at King's College London, University College Dundee, St Andrews and Edinburgh. He worked in Geometry.

name: Giuseppe Battaglini
born_place: Naples, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (now Italy)
summary: Giuseppe Battaglini was an Italian mathematician who was important for his work in non-Euclidean geometry.

name: Baudhayana
summary: Baudhayana was the author of one of the earliest Sulbasutras: documents containing some of the earliest Indian mathematics.

name: Heinz Bauer
summary: Heinz Bauer was a German mahematician who worked in measure theory and potential theory.

name: Mihály Bauer
summary: Mihály Bauer was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Gilbert Baumslag
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Gilbert Baumslag had a long career as one of the leading researchers on infinite group theory. In the last part of his career he used his skill in group theory applying it to cryptography.

name: Agnes Sime Baxter
summary: Agnes Baxter was a Canadian mathematician who became only the second Canadian woman to be awarded Ph.D. in Mathematics.

name: Thomas Bayes
summary: Thomas Bayes was an English clergyman who set out his theory of probability in 1764. His conclusions were accepted by Laplace in 1781, rediscovered by Condorcet, and remained unchallenged until Boole questioned them. Since then Bayes' techniques have been subject to controversy.

name: Enriqueta González Baz
summary: Enriqueta González Baz was the first Mexican woman to be awarded a higher degree in mathematics. She undertook research at the Institute of Physics, National Autonomous University of Mexico and lectured on mathematics and actuarial mathematics in the Faculty of Science of the University.

name: Dorothea Beale
summary: Dorothea Beale studied at Queen's College, London where she became the first female mathematics tutor. She became Principal of Cheltenham Ladies' College and a founder of St Hilda's College, Oxford.

name: John Carruthers Beattie
summary: John Carruthers Beattie graduated from Edinburgh University and studied at Munich, Vienna, Berlin and Glasgow. He became Professor of Applied Mathematics and Experimental Physics at the University of Cape Town and was later Vice Chancellor and Principal of the University. He was knighted in 1920.

name: Samuel Beatty
summary: Samuel Beatty was a Canadian mathematician who was the first person to receive a PhD in mathematics from a Canadian university.

name: Jean Beaugrand
summary: Jean Beaugrand was a French mathematician who published works on Geostatics as well as mathematics.

name: Florimond de Beaune
summary: Florimond de Beaune was a French jurist and amateur mathematician who produced the first important introduction to Descartes' cartesian geometry.

name: Edwin Ford Beckenbach
summary: Edwin Ford Beckenbach was an American mathematician best known for for his work on inequalities.

name: Ulugh Beg
summary: Ulugh Beg was the grandson of the conqueror Tamerlane and was a mathematician and astronomer. He founded an important centre for study at Samarkand staffed with the best scientists of the time. He did important early work on trigonometry.

name: Edward Griffith Begle
summary: Edward Begle was an American mathematician and educator who was important in developing school mathematics.

name: Heinrich Behnke
summary: Heinrich Behnke was a German mathematician who worked on complex analysis and wrote many articles on mathematicians.

name: Felix Adalbert Behrend
summary: Felix Adalbert Behrend was a German mathematician who worked in combinatorics, number theory and topology.

name: Jean-Baptiste Charles Joseph Bélanger
summary: Jean-Baptiste Bélanger was a French engineer and mathematician. His ideas influenced strongly the teaching of statics and dynamics, and mechanics in France and Europe.

name: Charles Bernard Bell Jr
summary: Charles Bernard Bell Jr was an African American whose specialties were nonparametric statistics, stochastic processes, and related areas. He was professor of mathematics at Tulane University, then professor of Biostatistics at the University of Washington in Seattle, and finally professor of Mathematical Sciences at San Diego State University.

name: Eric Temple Bell
summary: Eric Temple Bell was a Scottish-born mathematician best known for his history of mathematics book: Men of Mathematics.

name: John Stewart Bell
summary: John Stewart Bell was an Irish mathematician who worked in quantum mechanics.

name: Robert John Tainsh Bell
summary: Robert Bell graduated from Glasgow University. He was appointed to a professorship at the University of Otago in New Zealand. He worked in Geometry.

name: Giusto Bellavitis
summary: Giusto Bellavitis was an Italian mathematician who worked on a large range of mathematical topics.

name: Richard Ernest Bellman
summary: Richard Bellman was an American applied mathematician who made important advances in dynamic programming.

name: Eugenio Beltrami
summary: Eugenio Beltrami contributed to work in differential geometry on curves and surfaces and gave a concrete realisation of the non-euclidean geometry.

name: Abraham ben Meir ibn Ezra
summary: Rabbi Ben Ezra worked in Islamic Spain and wrote works which introduced Islamic mathematics and Indian number systems to Europe.

name: Levi ben Gerson
born_place: Bagnols now Bagnols sur Cèze, Provence, France
summary: Levi ben Gerson was a French scholar who wrote on trigonometry as well as astronomy and philosophy.

name: Jacob ben Machir ibn Tibbon
summary: Jacob ben Tibbon was a French Jewish medical doctor who translated Arabic versions of Greek mathematics into Hebrew.

name: Ivar Otto Bendixson
summary: Bendixson taught at Stockholm, then from 1913 to 1927 he was rector of Stockholm University. He worked on set theory and differential equations. He is best remembered for the Poincaré - Bendixson theorem.

name: Giovanni Battista Benedetti
summary: Giovanni Benedetti was an Italian mathematician who anticipated some of Galileo's work on free fall.

name: Thomas Brooke Benjamin
summary: Brooke Benjamin was an English mathematician who specialised in fluid mechanics and the theory of waves.

name: Georgia McClure Benkart
summary: Georgia Benkart was an outstanding mathematician who received many honours for her research on Lie algebras and related topics. She served the American Mathematical Society and the Association for Women in Mathematics in severable roles (she was President of the AWM) and was an inaugural fellow of each.

name: Geoffrey Thomas Bennett
summary: Geoffrey Bennett was an English mathematician with wide interests including number theory, combinatorics and history.

name: Cecilia Berdichevsky
summary: Cecilia Berdichevsky was a mathematician who played a major role in developing work with the first computer to be installed in Argentina in 1961. This work ended in 1966 with the coup which caused many academics to leave Argentina. She remained in the country taking on numerous accounting and IT roles.

name: Claude Jacques Roger Berge
summary: Claude Berge was a French mathematician who worked in combinatorics and graph theory.

name: Stefan Bergman
summary: Stefan Bergman was a Polish-born American mathematician whose primary work was in complex analysis.

name: George Berkeley
summary: George Berkeley was an Irish bishop and philosopher whose best known contribution to mathematics is his attack on the logical foundation of the calculus as developed by Newton.

name: Paul Isaac Bernays
summary: Paul Bernays was a Swiss mathematician, who made important contributions to mathematical logic, axiomatic set theory, and the philosophy of mathematics. He is the B in the NBG axiom system.

name: Daniel Bernoulli
summary: Daniel Bernoulli was a Dutch-born member of the Swiss mathematical family. His most important work considered the basic properties of fluid flow, pressure, density and velocity, and gave the Bernoulli principle.

name: Jacob (Jacques) Bernoulli
summary: Jacob Bernoulli was a Swiss mathematician who was the first to use the term integral. He studied the catenary, the curve of a suspended string. He was an early user of polar coordinates and discovered the isochrone.

name: Jacob (II) (Jacques (II)) Bernoulli
summary: Jacob (II) Bernoulli was a member of the Swiss Bernoulli family who worked on mathematical physics.

name: Johann Bernoulli
summary: Johann Bernoulli was a Swiss mathematician who studied reflection and refraction of light, orthogonal trajectories of families of curves, quadrature of areas by series and the brachistochrone.

name: Johann (II) Bernoulli
summary: Johann(II) Bernoulli was a member of the Swiss mathematical family. He worked mainly on heat and light.

name: Johann(III) Bernoulli
summary: Johann(III) Bernoulli wrote a number of works on astronomy and probability theory.

name: Nicolaus (I) Bernoulli
summary: Nicolaus Bernoulli was one of the famous Swiss family of mathematicians. He is most important for his correspondence with other mathematicians including Euler and Leibniz.

name: Nicolaus (II) Bernoulli
summary: Nicolaus (II) Bernoulli was the favourite of three sons of Johann Bernoulli. He made important mathematical contributions to the problem of trajectories while working on the mathematical arguments behind the dispute between Newton and Leibniz.

name: Dorothy Lewis Bernstein
summary: Dorothy Bernstein was awarded a Ph.D. in 1939 and had an excellent career overcoming prejudice against her as a woman and as a Jew. She became the first woman president of the Mathematical Association of America.

name: Felix Bernstein
summary: Felix Bernstein established his famous theorem on the equivalence of sets while in Cantor's seminar at Halle in 1897. He also worked on transfinite ordinal numbers.

name: Sergei Natanovich Bernstein
summary: Sergei Bernstein was a Ukranian mathematician who made important contributions to partial differential equations, differential geometry, probability theory and approximation theory.

name: Lipman Bers
summary: Lipman Bers was a Latvian-born American mathematician who worked on pseudoanalytic functions, Riemann surfaces and Kleinian groups.

name: Adolphe-Louis Jacques Bertillon
summary: Jacques Bertillon was a French statistician who applied statistics to social sciences.

name: Eugenio Bertini
summary: Eugenio Bertini was an Italian mathematician who worked in projective and algebraic geometry.

name: Alexis Fontaine des Bertins
summary: Alexis Fontaine was a French mathematician who worked on the calculus of variations.

name: Joseph Louis François Bertrand
summary:
Joseph Bertrand was a Paris professor who, in 1845, conjectured:

          I've told you once and I'll tell you again
          There's always a prime between n and 2n.

This was proved by Chebyshev in 1850.

name: Ludwig Berwald
summary: Ludwig Berwald was a Czech mathematician who made important contributions to differential geometry.

name: William Edward Hodgson Berwick
summary: William Berwick studied at Cambridge and lectured at Bristol, Bangor and Leeds before returning to Cambridge and eventually became Professor at Bangor. He worked in algebraic number theory. His widow endowed the Berwick prizes of the London Mathematical Society in his name.

name: Luigi Berzolari
summary: Luigi Berzolari was an Italian mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry, the theory of forms and differential projective geometry.

name: Abram Samoilovitch Besicovitch
summary: Abram Besicovitch was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked mainly in England on functions of a real variable, analytic functions and almost periodic functions.

name: Friedrich Wilhelm Bessel
summary: Wilhelm Bessel determined the positions and proper motions of stars. He also used a method of mathematical analysis involving what is now known as the Bessel function.

name: Erich Bessel-Hagen
summary: Erich Bessel-Hagen was a German mathematician and a historian of mathematics.

name: Bernard Frenicle de Bessy
summary: Frenicle de Bessy was a French amateur mathematician who is best known for his contributions to number theory.

name: Hans Albrecht Bethe
summary: Hans Bethe was a mathematician and physicist who worked on quantum mechanics.

name: Enrico Betti
summary: Enrico Betti is noted for his contributions to algebra and topology. Betti also did important work in theoretical physics, in particular in potential theory and elasticity.

name: Martha Betz Shapley
born_place: Kansas City, Jackson County, Missouri, USA
summary: Martha Shapley became a high school mathematics teacher. After marrying the astronomer Harlow Shapley she did outstanding research on eclipsing binary stars.

name: Arne Carl-August Beurling
summary: Arne Beurling was a Swedish mathematician who worked in harmonic analysis, complex analysis and potential theory.

name: Bevan Braithwaite Baker
summary: Bevan Braithwaite Baker graduated from University College London. After service in World War I he became a lecturer at Edinburgh University. He left to become Professor at Royal Holloway College London.

name: Christian Beyel
summary: Christian Beyel was a Swiss mathematician who taught at ETH Zürich.

name: Étienne Bézout
summary: Étienne Bézout was a French mathematician who is best known for his theorem on the number of solutions of polynomial equations.

name: Albert Turner Bharucha-Reid
summary: Albert Bharucha-Reid was an American mathematician who worked on probability theory, Markov chains, and statistics.

name: Bhaskara I
summary: Bhaskara I was an Indian mathematicians who wrote commentaries on the work of Aryabhata I.

name: Bhaskara
summary: Bhaskara II or Bhaskaracharya was an Indian mathematician and astronomer who extended Brahmagupta's work on number systems.

name: Giuseppe Biancani
died_place: Parma, Duchy of Parma and Piacenza (now Italy)
summary: Giuseppe Biancani was an Italian Jesuit astronomer and mathematician who made observations of the moon and planets with the newly invented telescope.

name: Luigi Bianchi
summary: Luigi Bianchi made important contributions to differential geometry.

name: Giovanni Giorgio Bidone
born_place: Rosano, Casalnoceto, Tortona, Piedmont, now Italy
died_place: Turin, Kingdom of Sardinia, now Italy
summary: Giorgio Bidone was an Italian engineer, mathematician and an experimenter in the field of hydraulics.

name: Ludwig Georg Elias Moses Bieberbach
summary: Ludwig Bieberbach was a German mathematician best known for his conjecture on holomorphic functions. He was an enthusuastic supporter of the Nazis.

name: Irenée-Jules Bienaymé
summary: Jules Bienaymé worked on statistics and probability.

name: Camille Guillaume Bigourdan
summary: Guillaume Bigourdan was a French astronomer who spent twenty years reviewing and describing the positions of 6380 nebulae. He discovered about 500 new objects.

name: Anton Dimitrija Bilimovic
summary: Anton Dimitrija Bilimovic wasa Ukranian-born mathematician who worked on a wide variety of both pure and applied mathematics.

name: Jacques de Billy
summary: Jacques de Billy was a French Jesuit who corresponded with Fermat and produced a number of results in number theory which have been named after him.

name: Jacques Philippe Marie Binet
summary: Jacques Binet worked on the foundations of matrix theory. He discovered the familiar rule for matrix multiplication.

name: R H Bing
summary: R. H. Bing was an American mathematician who worked mainly in the areas of geometric topology and continuum theory.

name: Jean Baptiste Biot
summary: Jean-Baptiste Biot was a French mathematician who worked in astronomy, elasticity, electricity and magnetism, heat, optics and geometry.

name: Garrett Birkhoff
summary: Garrett Birkhoff was an American mathematician best known for the algebra book he wrote with Saunders Mac Lane.

name: George David Birkhoff
summary: George Birkhoff was an American mathematician who was educated at Chicago and Harvard. He became a Professor at Harvard. His most important work was the Ergodic Theorem he discovered in 1931.

name: Joan Sylvia Lyttle Birman
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Joan Birman is an American mathematician who worked in in braid theory and knot theory.

name: Zygmunt William Birnbaum
summary: Zygmunt Wilhelm Birnbaum was a Polish-born American mathematician and statistician who contributed to functional analysis, nonparametric testing and estimation, probability inequalities, survival distributions, competing risks, and reliability theory.

name: Frederick Francis Percival Bisacre
summary: F F P Bisacre was an engineer who was educated at Cambridge and worked for the Edinburgh publishers Blackie with whom he published a Calculus textbook. He wrote some research papers on X-ray diffraction.

name: Errett Albert Bishop
summary: Errett Bishop was an American mathematician who worked in analysis.

name: Carl Anton Bjerknes
summary: Carl Bjerknes was a Norwegian mathematician and physicist who worked in pure mathematics as well as hydrodynamics.

name: Vilhelm Frimann Koren Bjerknes
summary: Vilhelm Bjerknes was a Norwegian physicist and meteorologist important in the development of weather forecasting.

name: Fischer Black
summary: Fischer Black was an American mathematical economist, best known as one of the authors of the famous Black–Scholes equation.

name: Max Black
summary: Max Black was an Azerbaijan-born philosopher who made contributions to the philosophy of language, the philosophy of mathematics and science, and the philosophy of art.

name: Hugh Blackburn
summary: Hugh Blackburn was a Scottish mathematician who became professor of mathematics at the University of Glasgow.

name: David Harold Blackwell
summary: David Blackwell was an American statistician and mathematician who worked in game theory, probability theory, information theory and Bayesian statistics. He was the first African-American member of the US National Academy of Sciences.

name: Edward Blades
summary: Edward Blades graduated from Edinburgh University. He held posts at Moray House Training College, at Heriot Watt College and at George Watson's Ladies' College, all in Edinburgh. He became Director of Education for West Lothian. After he retired he made contributions to Army Education.

name: Gertrude Blanch
summary: Gertrude Blanch was a Polish born American mathematician who did pioneering work in numerical analysis and computation.

name: Miles Bland
summary: Miles Bland was a 19th century mathematician, a fellow of St John's College, Cambridge, then later vicar of Lilley in Hertfordshire. He wrote a number of mathematical textbooks which proved very popular, one running to nine editions over nearly forty years. He also wrote some religious texts.

name: Wilhelm Johann Eugen Blaschke
summary: Wilhelm Blaschke was an Austrian mathematician whose research was on various aspects of geometry. He also initiated the study of topological differential geometry.

name: Hermann Bleuler
summary: Hermann Bleuler was a Swiss engineer and artillery officer in the Swiss army.

name: Hans Frederick Blichfeldt
summary: Hans Blichfeldt was a Danish-born American mathematician who worked on group theory and the geometry of numbers.

name: Gilbert Ames Bliss
summary: Gilbert Bliss was an American mathematician, best known for his work on the calculus of variations.

name: Nathaniel Bliss
summary: Nathaniel Bliss was an English mathematician and astronomer who went on to become Astronomer Royal.

name: André Bloch
summary: André Bloch was a French mathematician who worked in complex analysis. He spent most of his life in a psychiatric hospital.

name: Lenore Carol Blum
summary: Lenore Blum is an American mathematician who has made important advances in computer science.

name: Ludwig Otto Blumenthal
summary: Otto Blumenthal was a German mathematician who worked in complex function theory and aerodynamics. He was executive editor of the journal Mathematischen Annalen for many years.

name: Ralph Philip Boas Jr
summary: Ralph Boas was an American mathematician and journal editor. He worked mainly in real and complex analysis.

name: Étienne E Bobillier
summary: Étienne Bobillier is best known for his work on polars of curves and of algebraic surfaces.

name: Maxime Bôcher
summary: Maxime Bôcher worked on differential equations, series, and algebra.

name: Salomon Bochner
summary: Salomon Bochner was a pure mathematician who was born in what is now Poland and moved to America to escape the Nazis. He worked on integral transforms and distribution theory.

name: Johannes Boersma
summary: Johannes Boersma was a Dutch mathematician who specialised in mathematical analysis.

name: Anicius Manlius Severinus Boethius
born_place: in or near Rome, Byzantine Empire (now Italy)
summary: Boethius was a Roman mathematician and philosopher who wrote texts on geometry and arithmetic which were used for many centuries during a time when mathematical achievement in Europe was at a remarkable low.

name: Tommaso Boggio
summary: Tommaso Boggio was an Italian mathematician who worked in mathematical physics, differential geometry, analysis, and financial mathematics.

name: Nikolai Nikolaevich Bogolyubov
summary: Nikolai Bogolyubov was a Russian mathematician and theoretical physicist who made contributions to quantum field theory, to classical and quantum statistical mechanics and to the theory of dynamical systems.

name: Piers Bohl
summary: Piers Bohl was a Latvian mathematician, who worked in differential equations, topology and quasi-periodic functions.

name: Harald August Bohr
summary: Harald Bohr worked on Dirichlet series, and applied analysis to the theory of numbers. He is (as far as we know) the only mathematician to win an Olympic medal (a silver for representing Denmark at soccer in 1908).

name: Niels Henrik David Bohr
university: Københavns Universitet and University of Cambridge
summary: Niels Bohr is best known for the investigations of atomic structure and also for work on radiation, which won him the 1922 Nobel Prize for physics.

name: Paul David Gustav du Bois-Reymond
summary: Paul du Bois-Reymond gave a continuous function whose Fourier series diverges at a point (and in fact at a dense set of points).

name: Ferdinand François Désiré Budan de Boislaurent
summary: François Budan de Boislaurent was a Haitian born amateur mathematician best remembered for his discovery of a rule which gives necessary conditions for a polynomial equation to have n real roots between two given numbers.

name: James Bolam
summary: James Bolam was an English mathematician who became head of the Government Navigation School (later the Leith Nautical College). He was a founder member of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society.

name: Andrei Andreevich Bolibrukh
summary: Andrei Bolibrukh was a Russian mathematician known for his work on ordinary differential equations and especially Hilbert's 21st problem.

name: Béla Bollobás
summary: Professor Bollobás is a Hungarian-born British mathematician who is one of the world's leaders in combinatorics.

name: Ludwig Boltzmann
summary: Ludwig Boltzmann was an Austrian mathematician who made important advances in electromagnetism and thermodynamics.

name: Farkas Wolfgang Bolyai
born_place: Bolya (near Nagyszeben), Transylvania, Hungary (now Sibiu, Romania)
summary: Farkas Bolyai was a mathematics teacher, best known as the father of János Bolyai.

name: János Bolyai
summary: János Bolyai was a pioneer of non-Euclidean geometry.

name: Oskar Bolza
summary: Oskar Bolza worked on function theory, integral equations and the calculus of variations.

name: Bernard Placidus Johann Nepomuk Bolzano
born_place: Prague, Bohemia, Austrian Habsburg domain (now Czech Republic)
summary: Bernard Bolzano successfully freed calculus from the concept of the infinitesimal. He also gave examples of 1-1 correspondences between the elements of an infinite set and the elements of a proper subset.

name: Rafael Bombelli
summary: Rafael Bombelli was an Italian mathematician who wrote an influential algebra text and made free use of both negative numbers and complex numbers.

name: Enrico Bombieri
summary: Enrico Bombieri is an Italian Fields medal winner, known for his work in analytic number theory, algebraic geometry, theory of several complex variables, minimal surfaces and the theory of finite groups.

name: Enrico Bompiani
summary: Enrico Bompiani was an Italian mathematician, specializing in differential geometry.

name: Hermann Bondi
summary: Hermann Bondi was an Austrian-born scientist who made contributions to a wide variety of areas in mathematics and physics and was associated with the "Steady-state" theory of the universe.

name: Carlo Emilio Bonferroni
summary: Carlo Emilio Bonferroni was an Italian mathematician who worked on probability theory.

name: Pierre Ossian Bonnet
summary: Pierre Bonnet was a French mathematician who worked in the differential geometry of surfaces. He proved the Gauss-Bonnet theorem.

name: John Bonnycastle
summary: John Bonnycastle was an English teacher of mathematics and prolific writer. He wrote for the early volumes of Rees's Cyclopædia, about algebra, analysis and astronomy.

name: Frank Featherstone Bonsall
summary: Frank Bonsall was a English mathematician who worked mainly in functional analysis.

name: Ronald Vernon Book
summary: Ron Book was an American mathematician who worked in theoretical computer science.

name: Alicia Boole Stott
summary: Alicia Boole Stott was a daughter of George Boole who made some discoveries in four-dimensional geometry.

name: George Boole
summary: George Boole approached logic in a new way reducing it to a simple algebra, incorporating logic into mathematics. He also worked on differential equations, the calculus of finite differences and general methods in probability.

name: Mary Everest Boole
summary: Mary Everest Boole was an English mathematician who was married to George Boole. She wrote a number of books on mathematical education.

name: William Werner Boone
summary: Bill Boone worked on word problems in Groups.

name: James Booth
summary: James Booth was an Irish-born mathematician who was made a bishop and who exercised considerable influence in the development of mathematical education.

name: Kathleen Hylda Valerie Booth
summary: Kathleen Booth was a pioneer in computer development being the first to create assembly language and, with her husband, produced the "Booth multiplier algorithm" and the first rotating storage device.

name: Carl Wilhelm Borchardt
summary: Carl Borchardt was a German mathematician who worked in a variety of areas in analysis. He edited Crelle's Journal for more than 30 years.

name: Richard Ewen Borcherds
summary: Richard Borcherds is a South African born mathematician known for his work in lattices, group theory and infinite-dimensional algebras, for which he was awarded the Fields Medal in 1998.

name: Jean Charles de Borda
summary: Jean-Charles de Borda was a French soldier and mathematician who invented an important surveying instrument.

name: Antonio Maria Bordoni
born_place: Mezzana Corti, now Cava Manara, Savoy,
summary: Antonio Bordoni was an Italian mathematician who did research on mathematical analysis, geometry, and mechanics.

name: Armand Borel
summary: Armand Borel was a Swiss mathematician who worked in algebraic topology and in the theory of linear algebraic groups.

name: Félix Edouard Justin Émile Borel
summary: Borel created the first effective theory of the measure of sets of points beginning of the modern theory of functions of a real variable.

name: Giovanni Alfonso Borelli
summary: Giovanni Alfonso Borelli was an Italian Italian physiologist and physicist who was the first to explain muscular movement and other body functions according to the laws of statics and dynamics.

name: Lars Göran Borg
summary: Göran Borg was a Swedish mathematician who worked in differential equation theory.

name: Piero Borgi
summary: Piero Borgi was the author of the best known 15th Century Italian arithmetic books.

name: Max Born
summary: Max Born was a Polish-born mathematician who worked in Cambridge and received the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1954 for his work on Quantum Mechanics.

name: Valentina Mikhailovna Borok
summary: Valentina Borok was a Ukranian mathematician who worked in partial differential equations.

name: Karol Borsuk
summary: Karol Borsuk was a Polish mathematician who made important contributions to topology.

name: Ladislaus Josephowitsch Bortkiewicz
summary: Ladislaus Bortkiewicz was a Russian economist and statistician. He made contributions to mathematical economics.

name: Ettore Bortolotti
summary: Ettore Bortolotti was an Italian mathematician who worked in various areas in analysis. He was interested in the history of mathematics.

name: Otakar Boruvka
summary: Otakar Boruvka was a Czech mathematician known for his work in graph theory.

name: David Borwein
summary: David Borwein was a Lithuanian born mathematician, brought up in South Africa, who taught in St Andrews, Scotland, for 13 years before spending the rest of his career at the University of Western Ontario, Canada. He wrote 160 papers, mostly on sequences, series, summability and number theory.

name: Jonathan Michael Borwein
summary: Jonathan Borwein was a Scottish born mathematician who spent most of his career in Canada and Australia. Famed for his work on analysis, experimental mathematics and the visualisation of mathematics, he is perhaps best known for his research and publications on π.

name: Peter Benjamin Borwein
summary: Peter Borwein was a Scottish born mathematician who spent most of his career in Canada. He is perhaps best known for his research and publications on π.

name: Lancelot Stephen Bosanquet
summary: Stephen Bosanquet was an English mathematician who worked in analysis, especially Fourier series.

name: Ruggero Giuseppe Boscovich
summary: Ruggero Boscovich's main work was in mathematical physics. He was the first to give a procedure to compute a planet's orbit from three observations of its position.

name: Raj Chandra Bose
summary: Raj Chandra Bose was an Indian mathematician and statistician who worked in America. He best known for his work in design theory, finite geometry and the theory of error-correcting codes.

name: Satyendranath Bose
summary: Satyendranath Bose was an Indian mathematician who did important work in statistical mechanics.

name: Charles Bossut
born_place: Tartaras (near Rive de Gier), Rhône-et-Loire, France
summary: Charles Bossut was a French mathematician who was famed for his textbooks which were widely used throughout France.

name: Anne Lucy Bosworth Focke
summary: Anne Bosworth Focke was an American mathematician who became the first female doctoral student of David Hilbert. She was a professor of mathematics and physics at what is now the University of Rhode Island.

name: Raoul Bott
summary: Raoul Bott was a Hungarian-born mathematician who made fundamental contributions to topology and differential geometry.

name: Matteo Bottasso
summary: Matteo Bottasso was an Italian mathematician who used the vector calculus in studying problems in geometry, mechanics and physics.

name: Oene Bottema
summary: Oene Bottema was a Dutch mathematician who studied geometry and mechanics, specifically kinematics .

name: Edward Alexander Bouchet
summary: Edward Bouchet was an American physicist and educator and was the first African American to earn a Ph.D. from an American university.

name: Louis Antoine de Bougainville
summary: Louis-Antoine de Bougainville was a French soldier and explorer who wrote a calculus book, but is better known for his other exploits.

name: Pierre Bouguer
summary: Pierre Bouguer was a French surveyor who took part in an expedition to South America to calculate the size of a degree of latitude.

name: Ismael Boulliau
summary: Ismael Boulliau or Bullialdus was a French clergyman and amateur mathematician who proposed an inverse square law for gravitation before Newton.

name: Jean Claude Bouquet
summary: Claude Bouquet was a French mathematician who worked on differential geometry and on series expansions of functions and elliptic functions.

name: Edmond Bour
summary: Edmond Bour was a French mathematician and engineer who made significant contributions to analysis, algebra, geometry and applied mechanics.

name: Jean Bourgain
summary: Jean Bourgain was a Belgian mathematician who worked on mathematical analysis and its application to partial differential equations, mathematical physics, combinatorics, number theory, ergodic theory and theoretical computer science. He won major mathematical prizes including the Fields Medal, the Shaw Prize, the Steele Prize for Lifetime Achievement and the Wolf Prize.

name: Joseph Valentin Boussinesq
summary: Joseph Boussinesq was a French mathematician and physicist who made contributions to the theory of hydrodynamics, vibration, light, and heat.

name: Pierre Léon Boutroux
summary: Pierre Boutroux was a French mathematician and historian of science.

name: Alexis Bouvard
summary: Alexis Bouvard was a French astronomer who did the calculations which eventually led to the discovery of Neptune.

name: Charles de Bouvelles
summary: Charles de Bouvelles was a French priest who wrote works on geometry and philosophy.

name: Nathaniel Bowditch
summary: Nathaniel Bowditch was an American mathematician who published works on navigation and astronomy.

name: Robert Edward Bowen
summary: Rufus Bowen was an American mathematician who worked on dynamical systems.

name: Arthur Lyon Bowley
summary: Arthur Bowley was a leading statistician with an international reputation for his work on poverty. His expertise in mathematics meant that he played an important part in developing the mathematical basis of economics. He was a prolific author publishing many influential books.

name: Julia Hall Bowman Robinson
summary: Julia B Robinson worked on computability, decision problems and non-standard models of arithmetic.

name: George Edward Pelham Box
summary: George Box was a British statistician whose name is associated with several different statistical techniques.

name: Carl Benjamin Boyer
died_place: Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA
summary: Carl Benjamin Boyer was an American historian of mathematics.

name: Margaret Edward Boyle
summary: Margaret Boyle graduated from St Andrews and taught mathematics at Dalkeith High School.

name: Robert Boyle
summary: Robert Boyle was an Irish-born scientist who was a founding fellow of the Royal Society. His work in chemistry was aimed at establishing it as a mathematical science based on a mechanistic theory of matter.

name: Charles Vernon Boys
died_place: St Mary Bourne, Andover, Hampshire, England
summary: Charles Boys was an English physicist, known for his careful and innovative experimental work.

name: Georgi Delchev Bradistilov
summary: Georgi Bradistilov was a Bulgarian mathematician who worked on nonlinear differential equations and their applications to mechanics and electrotechnics.

name: James Bradley
