summary: James Bradley was an English astronomer best known for his discovery of the aberration of light and of the nutation of the earth's axis.

name: Thomas Bradwardine
summary: Thomas Bradwardine was an English mathematician and theologian who examined Aristotle's theories of dynamics.

name: Mina Spiegel Rees
summary: Mina Spiegel Rees was an American mathematician and a pioneer in the history of computing. She had a major impact on the academic and research culture of the United States.

name: Tycho Brahe
university: Københavns Universitet and Martin-Luther-Universität Halle-Wittenberg and Universität Leipzig
summary: Tycho Brahe was a Danish astronomer who is best known for the astronomical observations which led Kepler to his theories of the Solar system.

name: Brahmadeva
summary: Brahmadeva was an Indian mathematician who wrote a commentary on the work of Aryabhata I.

name: Brahmagupta
summary: Brahmagupta was the foremost Indian mathematician of his time. He made advances in astronomy and most importantly in number systems including algorithms for square roots and the solution of quadratic equations.

name: William Braikenridge
summary: William Braikenridge was an Scottish mathematician and theologian who worked on geometry and independently discovered many of the same results as Maclaurin.

name: Benjamin Bramer
summary: Benjamin Bramer was a German architect who published work on the calculation of sines.

name: Louis de Branges de Bourcia
summary: Louis de Branges is a French-born American mathematician who is best known for proving the long-standing Bieberbach conjecture.

name: William Brash
summary: William Brash graduated from Edinburgh University and went on to teaching posts at Stirling, Aberdeen and Inverness.

name: Nikolai Dmetrievich Brashman
born_place: Rassnova: near Brünn, Austria-Hungary (now Brno, Czech Republic)
university: Kazan State University and Lomonosov Moscow State University
summary: Nikolai Brashman was a Czech mathematician who worked on mechanics.

name: Jean-Baptiste Brasseur
summary: Jean-Baptiste Brasseur was a Luxembourg born mathematician who was an influencial teacher of geometry.

name: Ola Bratteli
summary: Ola Bratteli was a Norwegian mathematician who worked on operator algebras and quantum statistical mechanics.

name: Alfred Theodor Brauer
summary: Alfred Brauer was a German-American mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Richard Dagobert Brauer
summary: Richard Brauer became interested in work on group characters. He formulated a method to classify all finite simple groups and spent the rest of his life working on this problem.

name: Hans-Joachim Bremermann
summary: Hans-Joachim Bremermann was a German-born American mathematician and biophysicist who worked on computer science and the mathematical theory of evolution.

name: Charles Julien Brianchon
summary: Charles-Julien Brianchon was a French mathematician who worked on projective geometry.

name: Henry Briggs
summary: Henry Briggs was was an English mathematician who published tables of Napier's logarithm and was the man most responsible for scientists' acceptance of logarithms.

name: William Briggs
died_place: At sea off Arousa Bay, Spain
summary: William Briggs was the founder and first Principal of the University Correspondence College and the University Tutorial College in London. He set up the University Tutorial Press with printing and book-binding works. He co-authored many mathematics texts designed for private study published by his Press.

name: Alexander Wilhelm von Brill
summary: Alexander von Brill was a German mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry. He also made mathematical models and was interested in the history of mathematics.

name: Marcel Louis Brillouin
summary: Marcel Brillouin worked on topics ranging from history of science to the physics of the earth and the atom.

name: Erland Samuel Bring
summary: Erland Bring was a Swedish mathemaician who made contributions to the algebraic solution of equations.

name: Raymond Woodard Brink
summary: Raymond Brink was an American mathematician who studied at Kansas State University, Harvard and Paris. He taught at the University of Minnesota though he spent a year in Edinburgh in 1919. He worked on the convergence of series.

name: John Mortimer Brinkley
summary: John Brinkley was an English-born astronomer who became Royal Astronomer of Ireland and worked on the parallax of stars.

name: Francesco Brioschi
summary: FrancescoBrioschi was an Italian mathematician who contributed to the study of mathematical physics.

name: Charles Auguste Briot
summary: Charles Briot was a French mathematician who worked on elliptic functions. He also published on light and heat.

name: Barnabé Brisson
summary: Barnabé Brisson was a French engineer who built canals. He also worked on partial differential equations.

name: John Leslie Britton
summary: John Britton was an English mathematician who worked in combinatorial group theory and in particular on the word problem for groups.

name: Thomas Arthur Alan Broadbent
summary: Alan Broadbent was a British mathematician who was editor of the Mathematical Gazette for many years.

name: Pierre René Jean Baptiste Henri Brocard
summary: Henri Brocard was a French mathematician best known for his discovery of the so-called Brocard points of a triangle.

name: Ole Jacob Broch
summary: Ole Jacob Broch was a Norwegian mathematician, physicist and economist who became a government minister.

name: Selig Brodetsky
summary: Selig Brodetsky was educated at Cambridge and Leipzig. He became a lecturer at Bristol and later lecturer and professor at Leeds. He worked on fluid flow with particular emphasis on aerodynamics. He was President of the Hebrew University of Jerusalem for a short time.

name: Louis Victor Pierre Raymond duc de Broglie
summary: Louis de Broglie was a French mathematician best known for his description of the dual particle-wave properties of the electron.

name: Thomas John I'Anson Bromwich
summary: Thomas Bromwich grew up in South Africa and then graduated from Cambridge. He was Professor of Mathematics in Galway before returning to Cambridge. He made important contributions in both pure and applied mathematics.

name: Jacob Bronowski
summary: Jacob Bronowski was a Polish-born mathematician and historian. He is best known for developing a humanistic approach to science. He made frequent TV appearances.

name: David S Broomhead
summary: David Broomhead was an English mathematician who specialised in dynamical systems.

name: Warren Hill Brothers Jr
summary: Warren Hill Brothers Jr was the thirteenth African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He taught at Talladega College, being Professor of Mathematics and Physics there from 1950.

name: William Brouncker
summary: William Brouncker was an Irish mathematician who was a founder and the first president of the Royal Society of London. He worked on continued fractions and calculated logarithms by infinite series.

name: Luitzen Egbertus Jan Brouwer
born_place: Overschie (now a suburb of Rotterdam), Netherlands
summary: L E J Brouwer was a Dutch mathematician best known for his topological fixed point theorem. He founded the doctrine of mathematical intuitionism, which views mathematics as the formulation of mental constructions that are governed by self-evident laws.

name: Felix Earl Browder
summary: Felix Browder was a Russian-born American mathematician known for his work in nonlinear functional analysis.

name: William Browder
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: William Browder is an American mathematician, specialising in algebraic topology, differential topology and differential geometry.

name: Alexander Brown
summary: Alexander Brown studied at Edinburgh and later at Cambridge. He became Professor of Applied Mathematics at the South African College which later became the University of Cape Town. His main contributions were to Geometry.

name: Eleanor Pairman
summary: Eleanor Pairman graduated from Edinburgh. She went to London where she worked with Karl Pearson and then went to the USA where she gained a doctorate from Radcliffe College.

name: Ernest William Brown
summary: Ernest Brown worked on lunar and planetary motion.

name: Gavin Brown
summary: Gavin Brown was a Scottish harmonic and functional analyst who moved to Australia. He became Principal of the University of Sydney.

name: Thomas Arnold Brown
summary: Thomas Brown studied at Edinburgh and Cambridge Universities. He lectured at University College London and became Professor at the University College of the South West which later became the University of Exeter.

name: Walter Brown
died_place: Marandellas, near Salisbury, Rhodesia (now Harare, Zimbabwe)
summary: Walter Brown graduated from Glasgow University and worked at Hong Kong University. He was interned by the Japanese in World War II and on his release he returned to posts in Scotland.

name: Marjorie Lee Browne
summary: Marjorie Lee Browne was an American mathematical educator. She was one of the first African-American women to receive a Ph.D.

name: Hermann Alexander Brück
summary: Hermann Brück was a German-born astronomer who spent the great portion of his career in various positions in Britain and Ireland.

name: François Georges René Bruhat
summary: François Bruhat was a French mathematician who worked on algebraic groups.

name: Yvonne Suzanne Marie-Louise Choquet-Bruhat
summary: Yvonne Choquet-Bruhat is a French mathematician and physicist who made important contributions to the general theory of relativity. She was the first woman to be elected to the French Academy of Sciences.

name: Nicolaas Govert de Bruijn
summary: Nicolaas de Bruijn was a Dutch mathematician who worked in analysis, number theory, combinatorics and logic.

name: Viggo Brun
summary: Viggo Brun was a Norwegian mathematician and number theorist.

name: Filippo Brunelleschi
summary: Filippo Brunelleschi was a Florentine artist and architect best known for the dome of Florence's cathedral.

name: Francesco da Paola Virgilio Secondo Maria Faà di Bruno
summary: Faa di Bruno is best known for his formula for the nth derivative of a composition of functions. He was beatified in 1988

name: Giordano Bruno
born_place: Nola near Naples, Kingdom of Naples (now Italy)
summary: Giordano Bruno was an Italian philosopher of science who was eventually burnt in Rome as a heretic.

name: Giuseppe Bruno
summary: Giuseppe Bruno was an Italian mathematician who worked in geometry.

name: Ernst Heinrich Bruns
summary: Heinrich Bruns was a German scientist who was interested in astronomy, mathematics and geodesy and worked on the three body problem.

name: Luigi Brusotti
summary: Luigi Brusotti was an Italian mathematician whose most important work was in the study of curves and surfaces in real space.

name: George Hartley Bryan
summary: George Bryan made important contributions to kinematics, thermodynamics and the mathematical theory of flight. He wrote two important monographs and a whole series of undergraduate texts intended for private study.

name: Sophie Willock Bryant
summary: Sophie Willock Bryant was an Irish mathematician who also published on many other topics: Irish history, religion, education, women's rights, and philosophy.

name: Bryson of Heraclea
summary: Bryson was a Greek mathematician who was probably a pupil of Socrates and contributed to the problem of squaring the circle.

name: Alexander Fairley Buchan
summary: Alexander Buchan was a Scottish mathematician who went on to become a lecturer at Moray House College of Education.

name: Richard Buckminster Fuller
summary: R Buckminster Fuller is best known for the invention of the geodesic dome.

name: Adrien Quentin Buée
summary: Adrien-Quentin Buée was a French priest and mathematician who worked on complex numbers and their graphical representation.

name: Georges Louis Leclerc Comte de Buffon
summary: Georges Buffon was a French scientist who was important in the area of natural history. His needle experiment caused much discussion about probability.

name: Nicolai Vasilievich Bugaev
summary: Nicolai Vasilievich Bugaev was a Russian mathematician, born in Georgia, who worked mainly on analysis and number theory.

name: Boris Yakovlevic Bukreev
summary: Boris Yakovlevic was a Russian mathematician who worked on the theory of functions of a complex variable, on mathematical analysis, on algebra, on the calculus of variations, and on differential geometry.

name: Viktor Yakovlevich Bunyakovsky
born_place: Bar, Podolskaya gubernia (now Vinnitsa oblast), Ukraine
summary: Viktor Bunyakovsky worked on Number Theory as well as geometry, mechanics and hydrostatics. He discovered the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality 25 years before Cauchy or Schwarz.

name: Buqing Su
summary: Buqing Su was a Chinese mathematician and educator, regarded as the founder of Differential Geometry in China. He became President of Fudan University and honorary Chairman of the Chinese Mathematical Society.

name: Cesare Burali-Forti
summary: Cesare Burali-Forti was an Italian mathematician best known for the Burali-Forti paradox of Cantorian set theory. He had about 200 publications.

name: Joseph Langley Burchnall
born_place: Whichford, near Chipping Norton, Warwickshire, England
summary: Joseph Langley Burchnall was an English mathematician who worked in the theory of differential operators.

name: Johann Karl Burckhardt
summary: Johann Karl Burckhardt was a German-born astronomer and mathematician who is remembered for his work in fundamental astronomy and for his lunar theory.

name: Alexander George Burgess
summary: Alexander Burgess graduated from Edinburgh and taught at Merchiston Castle School Edinburgh and at Rothesay Academy. He became Rector of the latter school.

name: Jost Bürgi
summary: Jost Bürgi was a Swiss mathematician who discovered logarithms independently of the Scottish mathematician Napier.

name: Heinrich Friedrich Karl Ludwig Burkhardt
summary: Heinrich Burkhardt was a German mathematician who worked on the theory of the elliptical functions, series expansions, group theory and the history of mathematics.

name: John Charles Burkill
summary: J C Burkill was an English mathematician who worked on analysis and introduced the Burkill integral. He is best-known for his analysis textbooks.

name: William Burnside
summary: William Burnside wrote the first treatise on groups in English and was the first to develop the theory of groups from a modern abstract point of view.

name: Floyd Burton Jones
summary: Floyd Burton Jones was an American mathematician who worked mainly in topology.

name: Leone Minna Gold Burton
summary: Leone Burton became a leading British expert in mathematical education. She did pioneering work on equity and gender issues in mathematics education.

name: Ida Winifred Busbridge
summary: Ida Busbridge worked on integral equations and radiative transfer. She was the first woman appointed to an Oxford fellowship in mathematics. She taught at the University of Oxford for 35 years.

name: Raymond Keiller Butchart
died_place: At sea, 65 miles south-east of Colombo
summary: Raymond Butchart was a Scottish mathematician who was badly wounded in World War I and afterwards returned to Dundee as a lecturer. He was appointed Professor of Mathematics at Raffles College Singapore but died of malaria on his way home on his first leave.

name: George Hench Butcher Jr
summary: George Hench Butcher Jr was one of the first twenty African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. Awarded his Ph.D. by University of Pennsylvania, he taught at Howard University for 39 years.

name: John Watt Butters
summary: J Watt Butters graduated from Edinburgh and taught at George Heriot's School and James Gillespie's School in Edinburgh. He became Rector of Ardrossan Academy.

name: Fritz Bützberger
summary: Fritz (Friedrich) Bützberger was a Swiss schoolteacher who helped organise the first International Congress of Mathematicians.

name: Paul Leo Butzer
born_place: Mülheim an der Ruhr, Ruhr, Germany
summary: Paul Butzer is a German mathematician working in approximation theory and harmonic analysis.

name: Mary Emma Byrd
summary: Mary Byrd was an astronomer and mathematician. She was director of the Smith College Observatory for nineteen years. She was one of the first seven women to join the New York Mathematical Society in 1891.

name: Oliver Byrne
summary: Oliver Byrne was an Irish civil engineer and prolific author of works on subjects including mathematics, geometry and engineering. He is best known for his 'coloured' book of Euclid's Elements.

name: Augusta Ada King, countess of Lovelace
summary: Ada Lovelace was a daughter of Lord Byron who became interested in Babbage's analytic engine and described how it could be programmed.

name: Henri Cabannes
summary: Henri Cabannes was a French mathematician who worked on the mechanics of fluids and vibrating ropes.

name: Renato Caccioppoli
university: Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II
summary: Renato Caccioppoli was an Italian mathematician, known for his contributions to mathematical analysis.

name: Emilio Cafaro
summary: Emilio Cafaro was an Italian mathematician who was an expert on thermo fluid dynamics.

name: Luis Ángel Caffarelli
summary: Luis Caffarelli is an Argentine mathematician who has won all the major prizes for his work in the field of partial differential equations and their applications. These major mathematical prizes include the Shaw Prize, the Wolf Prize and, most prestigious of all, the Abel Prize.

name: Federico Cafiero
summary: Federico Cafiero was an Italian mathematician who worked in real analysis, measure theory and ordinary differential equations.

name: Charles Marc Élie Cailler
summary: Charles Cailler was a Swiss mathematician who worked on differential equations and kinematics.

name: Juan Manuel Cajigal y Odoardo
summary: Juan Manuel Cajigal was the founder of mathematical and engineering studies in Venezuela and trained many mathematicians. He founded the first astronomical observatory in Venezuela.

name: Florian Cajori
summary: Florian Cajori was a Swiss mathematician best known for his influential History of Mathematics.

name: Jean-Louis Calandrini
summary: Jean-Louis Calandrini was a mathematician working in Geneva, Switzerland in the first half of the 18th century. A great supporter of Newton's theories, he was a major contributor, along with Thomas Le Seur and François Jacquier, to an highly annotated edition of Newton's Principia.

name: Alberto Pedro Calderón
summary: Alberto Calderón was an Argentinian mathematician who cooperated with Zygmund to found the Chicago school of "hard analysis".

name: Calixto Pedro Calderón
summary: Calixto Calderón is an Argentinian mathematician who has spent much of his career in the United States. He has made major contributions to ordinary differential equations, partial differential equations, harmonic analysis, mathematical biology and the history of mathematics.

name: Nora Isobel Calderwood
summary: Nora Calderwood graduated from Edinburgh University and went on to a lectureship at Birmingham University. A prize in algebra at Birmingham is named after her.

name: Callippus of Cyzicus
summary: Callippus was a Greek astronomer who made accurate determinations of the lengths of the seasons and constructed a calendarused by all later astronomers.

name: Gheorghe Calugăreănu
summary: Gheorghe Calugăreănu was a Romanian mathematician who studied the theory of functions of a complex variable as well as of differential geometry and algebraic topology.

name: Lucien Marie Le Cam
summary: Lucien Le Cam was a French mathematician and statistician who moved to America and produced important resuls in asymptotic theory.

name: Campanus of Novara
summary: Johannes Campanus was an Italian mathematician who published a Latin edition of Euclid's Elements. He also wrote on astronomy.

name: John Edward Campbell
summary: Campbell is remembered for the Campbell-Baker-Hausdorff theorem which gives a formula for multiplication of exponentials in Lie algebras.

name: Charles Étienne Louis Camus
summary: Charles-Étienne Camus was a French mathematician who worked on mechanics and cartography and published an important texbook: Cours de mathématiques.

name: Nicolas-François Canard
summary: Nicolas-François Canard was a French mathematician, philosopher and economist. He was one of the pioneers of applying mathematics to economic problems.

name: Doris Mary Cannell
summary: Mary Cannell was an English mathematician and historian who worked extensively on George Green.

name: Annie Jump Cannon
summary: Annie Jump Cannon was an American astronomer whose work led to the Harvard Stellar Classification Scheme.

name: Francesco Paolo Cantelli
summary: Francesco Cantelli was an Italian mathematician who made contributions to the theory of probability.

name: Georg Ferdinand Ludwig Philipp Cantor
summary: Georg Cantor was a Russian-born mathematician who can be considered as the founder of set theory and introduced the concept of infinite numbers with his discovery of cardinal numbers. He also advanced the study of trigonometric series.

name: Moritz Benedikt Cantor
summary: Moritz Cantor was a German historian of mathematics.

name: Alfredo Capelli
summary: Alfredo Capelli was an Italian mathematician who worked on group theory and independently discovered Sylov's theorem.

name: Bento de Jesus Caraça
summary: Bento Caraça was a Portuguese mathematician who was very active in supporting mathematics and also organisations which supported democracy against Salazar's authoritarian government. He wrote the interesting book Fundamental Concepts of Mathematics and was one of the founders of the journal Gazeta de Matemática.

name: Juan Caramuel y Lobkowitz
summary: Juan Caramuel was a Spanish Cistercian who expounded the general principle of numbers to base n pointing out the benefits of some other bases than 10.

name: Constantin Carathéodory
summary: Carathéodory made significant contributions to the calculus of variations, the theory of point set measure, and the theory of functions of a real variable.

name: Pierre de Carcavi
summary: Pierre de Carcavi is a French amateur mathematician who is better known for his correspondence with other mathematicians rather than for his own mathematics.

name: Girolamo Cardano
summary: Girolamo Cardan or Cardano was an Italian doctor and mathematician who is famed for his work Ars Magna which was the first Latin treatise devoted solely to algebra. In it he gave the methods of solution of the cubic and quartic equations which he had learnt from Tartaglia.

name: Frank Stanton Carey
born_place: Pill St George, Easton-in-Gordano, Somerset, England
summary: Frank Carey was Professor of Mathematics in Liverpool for over 37 years. He was important in University College, Liverpool becoming the University of Liverpool. He wrote several excellent undergraduate texts.

name: David Cariolaro
summary: David Cariolaro was an Italian mathematician who worked in graph theory. He died following an accident in China.

name: Torsten Carleman
summary: Torsten Carleman was a Swedish mathematician who worked in classical analysis and its applications.

name: Lennart Axel Edvard Carleson
summary: Lennart Carleson is a Swedish mathematician who solved one of the most important problems in the theory of Fourier series.

name: Leonard Carlitz
summary: Leonard Carlitz was an American mathematician who published more than 700 papers mainly in finite field theory, number theory and combinatorics.

name: Donald Earle Carlson
summary: Don Carlson was an American mathematician who worked in mechanics and elasticity.

name: Thomas Carlyle
summary: Thomas Carlyle was a Scottish writer who was also interested in mathematics. He translated Legendre's work Éléments de géométrie.

name: Moshe (Ehezkel) Carmeli
summary: Moshe Carmeli was an Iraqi-born Israeli mathematician who worked in various areas of mathematical physics.

name: Robert Daniel Carmichael
died_place: Merriam, Northeast Johnson County, Kansas, USA
summary: Robert Carmichael was an American number theorist best known for discovering what are now called Carmichael numbers.

name: Lazare Nicolas Marguérite Carnot
summary: Lazare Carnot is best known as a geometer. In 1803 he published Géométrie de position in which sensed magnitudes were first systematically used in geometry.

name: Sadi Nicolas Léonard Carnot
summary: Sadi Carnot is best known for his theory of thermodynamics.

name: John Carr
summary: Jack Carr was a Scottish mathematician who worked in differential equations and dynamical systems.

name: Louis Carré
summary: Louis Carré was a French mathematician who published the first French book on the integral calculus.

name: Maria do Pilar Baptista Ribeiro
summary: Pilar Ribeiro was a co-founder of the journal Gazeta de Matemática and co-founder of the Portuguese Mathematical Society, serving as its First Secretary. Along with her husband, the mathematician Hugo Ribeira, she spent 30 years in exile because of her opposition to the authoritarian Estado Novo regime in Portugal.

name: George Francis Carrier
summary: George Carrier was considered to be one of the best applied mathematicians the United States ever produced. He loved applied mathematical problems developing complex mathematical models, which he solved with ingenious approximations and asymptotic results.

name: Charles Lutwidge Dodgson
summary: Charles Dodgson was a mathematics lecturer and author of mathematics books who is better known by the pseudonym Lewis Carroll. He is known especially for Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.

name: George Alexander Carse
summary: George Carse studied at Edinburgh and Cambridge and went on to become a Reader in Physics at Edinburgh.

name: Horatio Scott Carslaw
died_place: Burradoo, Bowral, New South Wales, Australia
summary: Horatio Carslaw studied at Glasgow and Cambridge. He lectured at the University of Glasgow before moving to a professorship in Sydney, Australia. He worked on a variety of topics in both pure and applied mathematics.

name: Élie Joseph Cartan
summary: Élie Cartan worked on continuous groups, Lie algebras, differential equations and geometry. His work achieves a synthesis between these areas. He is one of the most important mathematicians of the first half of the 20C.

name: Henri Paul Cartan
summary: Henri Cartan was a French mathematiician who was one of the original Bourbakistes.

name: Pierre Emile Jean Cartier
summary: Pierre Cartier is a French mathematician who has worked in algebraic geometry, representation theory, mathematical physics and category theory. He was a member of Bourbaki.

name: Dame Mary Lucy Cartwright
summary: Mary Cartwright was the first woman mathematician to be elected to the Royal Society. She became Mistress of Girton College, Cambridge.

name: Harry Clyde Carver
summary: Harry Carver was an American mathematician who worked in mathematical statistics.

name: María Andresa Casamayor de La Coma
summary: María Andresa Casamayor was the first Spanish woman to publish a science book. In March 1738, when only 17 years old, she published the arithmetic text Tyrocinio arithmético designed to facilitate the learning of basic arithmetic: addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

name: John Casey
summary: John Casey was an Irish geometer best kown for his work on the geometry of the circle.

name: Felice Casorati
summary: Felice Casorati is best remembered for the Casorati-Weierstrass theorem characterising the behaviour of a function near an essential singularity.

name: James Cassels
summary: James Cassels graduated from Edinburgh University and became a teacher at Ayr Academy.

name: John William Scott Cassels
summary: Ian Cassels was an English mathematician who worked on the geometry of numbers, diophantine approximation and the arithmetic of elliptic curves.

name: César-François Cassini de Thury
summary: César-François Cassini de Thury or Cassini III was a French geodesist who produced the first reliable maps of France.

name: Giovanni Domenico Cassini
summary: Giovanni Cassini (Cassini I) was an Italian mathematician and astronomer who studied the curve which is the locus of a point the product of whose distances from two fixed foci is constant.

name: Jacques Cassini
summary: Jacques Cassini or Cassini II was a French astronomer and surveyor who carried on his father's work in geodesy.

name: Jean-Dominique Comte de Cassini
summary: Dominique Cassini (Cassini IV) was a French mathematician and surveyor who worked on his father's map of France.

name: Louis Bertrand Castel
summary: Louis Castel was a French mathematician who was a strong opponent of Newton's philosophy.

name: Benedetto Antonio Castelli
summary: Benedetto Castelli was an Italian Benedictine who was a student of Galileo.

name: Emma Castelnuovo
summary: Emma Castelnuovo was an Italian mathematician known for her contributions to mathematics education.

name: Guido Castelnuovo
summary: Castelnuovo was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry. He also worked in probability and relativity.

name: Carlo Alberto Castigliano
summary: Alberto Castigliano was an Italian mathematician and physicist who may be credited with the discovery of the principle of least work.

name: Johann Francesco Melchiore Salvemini Castillon
summary: Johann Castillon was an Italian mathematician and astronomer who wrote on the cardioid.

name: Eugène Charles Catalan
summary: Eugène Catalan was a Belgian mathematician who defined the numbers called after him, while considering the solution of the problem of dissecting a polygon into triangles by means of non-intersecting diagonals.

name: Pietro Antonio Cataldi
summary: Pietro Cataldi was an Italian mathematician who wrote around 30 books on mathematics, and some on other topics.

name: Omar Catunda
summary: Omar Catunda was a Brazilian mathematician. He worked hard to improve the level of mathematics education at both school and university level across Brazil.

name: Augustin Louis Cauchy
university: École Nationale des Ponts et Chaussées
summary: Augustin-Louis Cauchy pioneered the study of analysis, both real and complex, and the theory of permutation groups. He also researched in convergence and divergence of infinite series, differential equations, determinants, probability and mathematical physics.

name: Wilhelm Cauer
summary: Wilhelm Cauer was a German mathematician and physicist who is best known for his work on the analysis and synthesis of electrical filters.

name: Bonaventura Francesco Cavalieri
born_place: Milan, Duchy of Milan, Habsburg Empire (now Italy)
summary: Bonaventura Cavalieri was an Italian mathematician who developed a method of indivisibles which became a factor in the development of the integral calculus.

name: Beatrice Mabel Cave-Browne-Cave
summary: Beatrice Mabel Cave-Browne-Cave studied the mathematical tripos at Girton College Cambridge. She the taught mathematics at a High School for eleven years before becoming an assistant to Karl Pearson in the Galton Laboratory of University College, London. She later became an assistant to Leonard Bairstow in the Department of Aeronautics at the Imperial College, London. She published two papers with Pearson and two with Bairstow.

name: Frances Evelyn Cave-Browne-Cave
summary: Frances Evelyn Cave-Browne-Cave was home educated, then studied the mathematical tripos at the University of Cambridge, being ranked next to G H Hardy. She was the first recipient of a research grant from Girton College, worked with Karl Pearson and published two papers. She spent the rest of her career teaching at Girton College.

name: Arthur Cayley
university: Universiteit Leiden and University College Dublin and University of Oxford
summary: Arthur Cayley's most important work was in developing the algebra of matrices and work in non-euclidean and n-dimensional geometry.

name: Eduard Čech
summary: Eduard Čech was a Czech mathematician known for his work in projective differential geometry and topology. He introduced the idea of the higher homotopy groups of a space.

name: Francesco Cecioni
summary: Francesco Cecioni was an Italian mathematician who specialised in algebra.

name: Anders Celsius
summary: Anders Celsius was a Swedish astronomer, physicist and mathematician. He participated in Maupertuis' expedition to measure a degree of latitude in Lapland. He is best known for the temperature scale that he proposed and which is named after him.

name: Carlo Cercignani
summary: Carlo Cercignani was an Italian mathematician known for his work on the kinetic theory of gases.

name: Jeremiah Chappelle Certaine
died_place: Mount Vernon, Westchester, New York, USA
summary: Jeremiah Certaine was an African American mathematician who was awarded a Ph.D. by Harvard University for a thesis on algebra in 1945. He taught at Howard University for a few years but for most of his career he was an applied mathematician for Nuclear Development Associates and the United Nuclear Corporation.

name: Lamberto Cesari
summary: Lamberto Cesari was an Italian mathematician who worked in the United States. He was known for his work on surface area, functions of bounded variation, optimal control and on the stability of dynamical systems.

name: Ernesto Cesàro
born_place: Naples, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (now Italy)
summary: Cesàro was an Italian mathematician whose main contributions were to differential geometry and divergent series.

name: Ludolph Van Ceulen
summary: Ludolph Van Ceulen was a German mathematician who is famed for his calculation of π to 35 places. In Germany π used to be called the Ludolphine number.

name: Giovanni Benedetto Ceva
summary: Giovanni Ceva was an Italian mathematician who rediscovered Menelaus's theorem and proved his own well-known theorem.

name: Tommaso Ceva
summary: Tommaso Ceva was an Italian Jesuit who worked in geometry, gravity and arithmetic.

name: Qin Jiushao
summary: Qin Jiushao was a Chinese mathematician who wrote an important study Shushu Jiuzang on equations, including the Chinese Remainder Theorem.

name: Zu Chongzhi
summary:
Zu Chongzhi was a Chinese mathematician and astronomer. He introduced the approximation
113
355
to
π which is correct to 6 decimal places.

name: David Gawen Champernowne
summary: David Champernowne was an English economist and mathematician.

name: Jean-François Champollion
summary: Jean-François Champollion founded scientific Egyptology and played a major role in the decipherment of Egyptian hieroglyphics and the demotic script.

name: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
summary: Chandrasekhar was awarded the Physics Nobel prize for his theoretical work on the gravitational collapse of stars.

name: Zhang Qiujian
summary: Zhang Qiujian was a Chinese mathematician who wrote the text Zhang Qiujian suanjing (Zhang Qiujian's Mathematical Manual).

name: Zhang Heng
summary: Zhang Heng was a Chinese mathematician, astronomer and geographer. He became chief astrologer and minister under the Emperor An'ti of China.

name: Sun-Yung Alice Chang
summary: Sun-Yung Alice Chang is a Chinese born American mathematician whose research interests include the study of certain geometric types of nonlinear partial differential equations and the related extremal inequalities and problems in isospectral geometry.

name: Sergei Alekseevich Chaplygin
summary: Sergei Chaplygin was a Russian physicist and mathematician who did important work in hydrodynamics and aerodynamics.

name: Sydney Chapman
summary: Sydney Chapman was a British mathematician and geophysicist who worked on gas dynamics, geomagnetism and the ionosphere.

name: Michel Chasles
summary: Michel Chasles worked on algebraic and projective geometry.

name: Albert Châtelet
summary: Albert Châtelet was a French politician and mathematician who researched in number theory and in algebra. He stood for the post of French president but was defeated by de Gaulle.

name: Gabrielle Émilie Le Tonnelier de Breteuil Marquise du Châtelet
summary: Émilie du Châtelet was a French noblewoman who became important to mathematics as the translator of Newton's Principia.

name: William Chauvenet
summary: William Chauvenet was an American professor of mathematics, astronomy, navigation and surveying who was instrumental in the establishment of the U.S. Naval Academy at Annapolis.

name: Marília de Magalhaes Chaves Peixoto
summary: Marília Chaves Peixoto was the first Brazilian woman to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. In 1951 she was the first Brazilian woman to be elected a member of the Brazilian Academy of Sciences. She made substantial contributions to what is now known as Peixoto's Theorem on the structural stability of dynamical systems.

name: Jean François Chazy
summary: Jean Chazy was a French mathematician and astronomer who worked on the three body problem.

name: Nikolai Grigorievich Chebotaryov
summary: Nikolai Chebotaryov proved his density theorem generalising Dirichlet's theorem on primes in an arithmetical progression.

name: Pafnuty Lvovich Chebyshev
summary: Pafnuty Chebyshev is largely remembered for his investigations in number theory. Chebyshev was also interested in mechanics and is famous for the orthogonal polynomials he invented.

name: Chen Jingrun
summary: Chen Jingrun was a Chinese mathematician who made outstanding advances in the study of Goldbach's Conjecture, proving that every sufficiently large integer can be represented as the sum of a prime and the product of at most two primes.

name: Kuo Tsai Chen
summary: Kuo-Tsai Chen was a Chinese-born mathematician who worked in algebraic topology and analysis.

name: Elliott Ward Cheney
summary: Ward Cheney was an American mathematician who was one of the pioneers in the fields of approximation theory and numerical analysis.

name: Cheng Dawei
summary: Cheng Dawei was a Chinese mathematician who published the Suanfa tong zong (General source of computational methods).

name: Rebeca Cherep de Guber
summary: Rebeca Guber was one of the first Argentinian women mathematicians. She played a major role in the development of computing in Argentina. She also made important contributions to education particularly teaching science in schools.

name: Shiing-shen Chern
born_place: Chia-hsing (or Jiaxing), Chekiang province (now Zhejiang), China
summary: Shiing-shen Chern was a Chinese mathematician who made important contributions to geometry and algebraic topology.

name: Sergei Nikolaevich Chernikov
summary: Sergei Nikolaevich Chernikov was a Russian mathematician who worked in infinite group theory and linear inequalities.

name: Herman Chernoff
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Herman Chernoff is an American mathematician and statistician who worked in sequential analysis and optimal design.

name: Edward Colin Cherry
summary: Colin Cherry was an English scientist who worked on electric circuits, telecommunication principles and the psychology of speech and hearing.

name: Thomas Macfarland Cherry
summary: Thomas MacFarland Cherry was an Australian mathematician who was Professor of Mathematics at the University of Melbourne for many years.

name: Salvatore Cherubino
summary: Salvatore Cherubino was an Italian mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry and probability theory.

name: Claude Chevalley
summary: Claude Chevalley had a major influence on the development of several areas of mathematics including Ring Theory and Group Theory.

name: Jia Xian
summary: Jia Xian was a Chinese scholar who wrote some early arithmetic books. He had an early version of Pascal's triangle.

name: Frances Chick Wood
summary: Frances Wood was an English chemist and statistician who became a fellow of the Royal Statistical Society in 1913. She was awarded the Order of the British Empire in 1917, and an officer in the order in 1918.

name: Charles Bernard Childs
summary: Bernard Childs studied at Birmingham University and then became a lecturer in Physics at Edinburgh University. He was active in adult education.

name: Mineo Chini
summary: Mineo Chini was an Italian mathematician who worked on the foundations of mathematics.

name: Grace Chisholm Young
summary: Grace Chisholm Young was an English mathematician who together with her husband William Young wrote many mathematical articles and several books.

name: Oscar Chisini
summary: Oscar Chisini was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Letitia Chitty
summary: Letitia Chitty began studying the mathematical tripos but, after war work during World War I, she studied the mechanical sciences tripos. She became a civil engineer, applying mathematical theory and carrying out experiments.

name: Choi Seok-jeong
summary: Choi Seok-jeong was a Korean politician and mathematician who was the first to find orthogonal Latin squares. He constructed magic squares and invented the Hexagonal Tortoise Problem.

name: Andre-Louis Cholesky
summary: André-Louis Cholesky was a French military officer and mathematician who devised a clever method of dealing with geodesic measurements.

name: Gustave Alfred Arthur Choquet
summary: Gustave Choquet was a French mathematician who worked in functional analysis, potential theory, topology and measure theory.

name: Wei-Liang Chow
summary: Chow Wei-Liang was a Chinese mathematician known for his work in algebraic geometry.

name: Sarvadaman Chowla
summary: Sarvadaman Chowla was a British-born Indian American mathematician, specializing in number theory.

name: Charles Chree
summary: Charles Chree studied in Aberdeen and Cambridge. He became Superintendent of Kew Observatory and worked on terrestrial magnetism.

name: Sylvia de Neymet
summary: Sylvia de Neymet was the first Mexican woman to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics in 1966. She taught university courses for almost 40 years, published several excellent papers and one book.

name: Bent Christiansen
summary: Bent Christiansen was a Danish mathematician important in the development of mathematical education in Denmark.

name: Elwin Bruno Christoffel
summary: Elwin Christoffel published works on conformal mappings, Riemann's o-function, the theory of invariants, and the Christoffel reduction theorem.

name: Chrysippus of Soli
born_place: Soli, Cilicia, Asia Minor (now Soloi, Turkey)
summary: Chrysippus was a Greek philosopher who is considered the cofounder of Stoicism.

name: George Chrystal
summary: George Chrystal is best remembered today for Algebra: a two volume work which was completed by 1889. He was also involved in educational reform throughout his career and was a major figure in setting up an educational system in Scotland.

name: Zhu Shijie
summary: Zhu Shijie or Chu Shih-Chieh was a Chinese mathematician who developed methods for handling simultaneous equations.

name: Rolando Chuaqui Kettlun
summary: Rolando Chuaqui was a Chilean mathematician who trained first as a medic before turning to mathematics. He was an active researcher and important figure in the development of mathematical logic in Chile.

name: Nikolai Grigor'evich Chudakov
summary: Nikolai Chudakov was a Russian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Li Chunfeng
summary: Li Chunfeng was a Chinese mathematician who worked in astronomy and calendar reform.

name: Fan Rong K Chung Graham
summary: Fan Chung is a Taiwanese-born American mathematician who works mainly in graph theory.

name: Nicolas Chuquet
summary: Nicolas Chuquet was a French mathematician who wrote the earliest French algebra book.

name: Alonzo Church
summary: Alonzo Church made important contributions to mathematical logic and theoretical computer science.

name: Gianfranco Luigi Giuseppe Cimmino
summary: Gianfranco Cimmino was an Italian mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis, numerical analysis and the theory of elliptic partial differential equations.

name: Michele Cipolla
summary: Michele Cipolla was an Italian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Tullio Levi-Civita
summary: Tullio Levi-Civita was an Italian mathematician who is best known for his work on the absolute differential calculus and the theory of tensors. He had problems later in his life with the rise of Fascism in Italy.

name: Alexis Claude Clairaut
summary: Alexis Clairaut was a French mathematician who worked to confirm the Newton-Huygens belief that the Earth was flattened at the poles.

name: Benoit Paul Émile Clapeyron
summary: Émile Clapeyron was a French engineer who designed steam locomotives and worked on the theory of heat.

name: John Brown Clark
summary: John Clark graduated from Edinburgh University and became a teacher at George Heriot's School in Edinburgh. He went on to become Rector of this school.

name: Joan Elisabeth Lowther Clarke Murray
summary: Joan Clarke was one of the English mathematicians recruited to work on wartime German codes with Alan Turing at Bletchley Park.

name: Samuel Clarke
summary: Samuel Clarke was an English clergyman who wrote on mechanics as well as philosophy and metaphysics.

name: Thomas Clausen
summary: Thomas Clausen was a Danish mathematician who wrote over 150 papers on pure mathematics, applied mathematics, astronomy and geophysics.

name: Rudolf Julius Emmanuel Clausius
summary: Rudolf Clausius did important work in thermodynamics.

name: Christopher Clavius
summary: Christopher Clavius was a German Jesuit astronomer who helped Pope Gregory XIII to introduce what is now called the Gregorian calendar.

name: William Waldron Schieffelin Claytor
summary: Schieffelin Claytor was an American mathematician specialising in topology.

name: Rudolf Friedrich Alfred Clebsch
summary: Alfred Clebsch was a German mathematician worked on algebraic geometry and was a co-founder of Mathematische Annalen.

name: Cleomedes
summary: Cleomedes was a Greek astronomer who wrote an influential work: On the Circular Motions of the Celestial Bodies.

name: Agnes Mary Clerke
summary: Agnes Mary Clerke was an Irish astronomer and writer on both astronomy and biography.

name: Alfred Hoblitzelle Clifford
summary: Alfred H Clifford was an American mathematician who worked in group theory and semigroup theory.

name: William Kingdon Clifford
summary: William Clifford was an English mathematician who studied non-euclidean geometry arguing that energy and matter are simply different types of curvature of space. He introduced what is now called a Clifford algebra which generalises Grassmann's exterior algebra.

name: James Gourlay Clunie
summary: James Clunie was a Scottish-born mathematician who worked in complex analysis.

name: John Henry Coates
born_place: Possum Brush, Manning Valley, New South Wales, Australia
summary: John Coates was an Australian mathematician who was the Sadleirian Professor at Cambridge and worked in algebraic number theory.

name: Anne Philippa Cobbe
summary: Anne Cobb was an English mathematician who worked in algebra.

name: Arthur Byron Coble
summary: Arthur Coble was an American mathematician who worked on finite geometries and group theory.

name: William Gemmell Cochran
summary: William Cochran was a Scottish born mathematician who did much to promote statistics in the USA. He wrote a number of books which became statistics classics.

name: Edward Cocker
summary: Edward Cocker was an English scholar who was the author of an influential arithmetic text which ran to more than 100 editions.

name: James Cockle
summary: James Cockle was an English lawyer and mathematician who wrote papers on both pure and applied mathematics, as well as on the history of science. He became Chief Justice of Queensland.

name: Delfino Codazzi
summary: Delfino Codazzi was an Italian mathematician who worked in differential geometry.

name: Judita Cofman
summary: Judita Cofman was the first person to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics from the University of Novi Sad. She worked on finite geometry and mathematical education. The second half of her career was as a school teacher in London.

name: Paul Joseph Cohen
summary: Paul Cohen was an American mathematian who used a technique called forcing to prove the independence in set theory of the axiom of choice and of the generalised continuum hypothesis.

name: Jacob Willem Cohen
summary: Wim Cohen was a Dutch mathematician who worked in queueing theory and statistics.

name: Paul Moritz Cohn
summary: Paul Cohn was a German-born mathematician who worked in England, mainly in the area of algebra, especially non-commutative rings.

name: Stefan Emmanuilovich Cohn-Vossen
summary: Stefan Cohn-Vossen was a mathematician, born in what is now Poland, who is known for his collaboration with David Hilbert on a geometry book.

name: Frank Nelson Cole
summary: Frank Cole was an American mathematician whose main research contributions are to number theory, in particular to prime numbers, and to group theory.

name: John William Colenso
summary: John William Colenso was an English mathematician, theologian, Biblical scholar and social activist, who was the first Church of England Bishop of Natal.

name: Henry Coley
summary: Henry Coley was an English 17th century astrologer and mathematician who published a famous astrology text Clavis astrologiae and taught mathematics at his house in London.

name: Lothar Collatz
summary: Lothar Collatz was a German mathematician who worked in numerical analysis and is best known for the eponymous "3x + 1 problem".

name: Edward Foyle Collingwood
summary: Edward Collingwood was an English mathematician who worked in complex analysis.

name: Roger Collingwood
summary: Roger Collingwood was one of the first professional mathematics lecturers, and, alongside service in the Church, was responsible for the mathematical text, Arithmetica experimentalis.

name: John Collins
born_place: Wood Eaton (4km north of Oxford), England
summary: John Collins was an English accountant and publisher who corresponded extensively with the mathematicians of his day.

name: John Colson
summary: John Colson was an English clergyman and mathematician who translated several of Newton's books into Engish.

name: John Theodore Combridge
summary: Theodore Combridge was an English 20th century mathematician and administrator. He published papers on general relativity and on the beginnings of the Mathematical Association and the Inititute of Mathematics and its Applications.

name: Annibale Comessatti
summary: Annibale Comessatti was an Italian mathematician who worked in in algebraic geometry.

name: Frederico Commandino
summary: Frederico Commandino was an Italian mathematician who published important translations of works of the Ancient Greek mathematicians.

name: Peter Comrie
summary: Peter Comrie graduated from St Andrews and after a series of teaching posts became Rector of Leith Academy.

name: Charles Marie de La Condamine
summary: Charles-Marie La Condamine was a French mathematician and surveyor who took part in an expedition to South America to measure a degree of latitude.

name: Marie Jean Antoine Nicolas de Caritat Condorcet
summary: The Marquis de Condorcet's most important work was on probability and the philosophy of mathematics.

name: Fabio Conforto
summary: Fabio Conforto was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry, projective geometry and analytic geometry.

name: Alain Connes
summary: Alain Connes is a French mathematician and theoretical physicist who works in operator algebras and noncommutative geometry.

name: Conon of Samos
summary: Conon of Samos was a Greek astronomer and mathematician who discovered the curve now known as the spiral of Archimedes.

name: Hermann of Reichenau
summary: Hermann of Reichenau was a German mathematician who important for the transmission of Arabic mathematics, astronomy and scientific instruments into central Europe.

name: Arthur William Conway
summary: Arthur Conway was an Irish mathematician and mathematical physicist who wrote one of the first books on relativity and co-edited two volumes of William Rowan Hamilton's collected works.

name: John Horton Conway
summary: John Conway was an English mathematician who has produced many results in the theory of finite groups, knot theory, number theory, combinatorial game theory and coding theory. He also made many contributions to recreational mathematics, including the Game of Life.

name: Gloria Conyers Hewitt
summary: Gloria Hewitt is an American mathematician who undertook research in algebra. She became the first African American woman to chair a university mathematics department in the United States.

name: Julian Lowell Coolidge
summary: Julian Coolidge was an American mathematician best known for his texts on geometry and on the history of mathematics.

name: Jacob Lionel Bakst Cooper
born_place: Beaufort West, Cape Province, South Africa
summary: Lionel Cooper was a South African mathematician who worked in operator theory, thermodynamics, functional analysis and differential equations.

name: William Wager Cooper
summary: Bill Cooper was an American operational researcher, known for his applications of linear programming to management science.

name: Nicolaus Copernicus
university: Università di Bologna and Università degli Studi di Padova and Uniwersytet Jagielloński and Università degli Studi di Ferrara
summary: Copernicus was a Polish astronomer and mathematician whose theory that the Earth moved around the Sun profoundly altered later workers' view of the universe, but was rejected by the Catholic church.

name: Edward Thomas Copson
summary: Edward Copson was an expert on Complex Analysis and was Regius Professor of Mathematics at St Andrews from 1950 until 1969.

name: Gaspard Gustave de Coriolis
summary: Gaspard-Gustave de Coriolis is best remembered for the Coriolis force. He showed that the laws of motion could be used in a rotating frame of reference.

name: Ernest Corominas i Vigneaux
summary: Ernest Corominas was a Catalan mathematician who worked in South America and ended up in France. He worked on generalised derivatives and ordered sets.

name: Johannes Gaultherus van der Corput
summary: Johannes van der Corput was a Dutch mathematician who worked in the field of analytic number theory.

name: Eugène Maurice Pierre Cosserat
summary: Cosserat studied the deformation of surfaces which led him to a theory of elasticity.

name: François Nicolas Cosserat
summary: François Cosserat was a French engineer and mathematician known by his theories about deformable bodies written with his brother Eugène.

name: Charles Gladstone Costley
died_place: Mount Vernon, Westchester, New York, USA
summary: Charles Gladstone Costley was an African American mathematician who was encouraged by Lee Lorch at Fisk University in Nashville, Tennessee. He was awarded a Ph.D. by the University of Illinois, served at McGill University in Montreal and published an excellent series of papers on integral eqations.

name: Roger Cotes
summary: Roger Cotes was an English mathematician who edited the second edition of Newton's Principia. He made advances in the theory of logarithms, the integral calculus and in numerical methods, particularly interpolation.

name: Mischa Cotlar
summary: Mischa Cotlar was a Uruguayan mathematician who worked in the fields of harmonic analysis, ergodic theory and spectral theory.

name: Charles Augustin de Coulomb
summary: Charles Coulomb worked on applied mechanics but he is best known for his work on electricity and magnetism.

name: Charles Alfred Coulson
summary: Charles Coulson's main area of interest was molecular physical chemistry, but he contributed to many other areas.

name: Richard Courant
summary: Richard Courant was a Polish-born applied mathematician best known for founding the Institute named after him in New York.

name: Antoine Augustin Cournot
summary: Antoine Cournot was a French mathematician who was a pioneer of mathematical economics.

name: William Barron Coutts
summary: William Coutts graduated from Edinburgh University and after a period in the Army in World War I he became interested in the mathematical theory of artillery. He became a Professor at the Military College of Science at Shrivenham.

name: Louis Couturat
summary: Louis Couturat was a French mathematician who worked on logic and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Thomas George Cowling
summary: Tom Cowling graduated from Oxford and worked at Imperial College London. He lectured at Swansea, Dundee and Manchester and became a professor at Bangor and Leeds. He worked on theoretical astronomy and stellar physics.

name: Elbert Frank Cox
summary: Elbert Frank Cox was an American mathematician and was the first African American to receive a PhD in Mathematics.

name: Gertrude Mary Cox
summary: Gertrude Mary Cox was an American statistician who worked in experimental design.

name: Harold Scott MacDonald Coxeter
summary: Donald Coxeter's work was mainly in geometry. In particular he made contributions of major importance in the theory of polytopes, non-euclidean geometry, group theory and combinatorics.

name: James Ireland Craig
summary: James Craig was a Scottish mathematician who made some significant inventions in map projections. He was killed when a mob attacked the Turf Club in Cairo.

name: John Craig
summary: John Craig was a Scottish mathematician who published three important textbooks.

name: Thomas Craig
summary: Thomas Craig was an American mathematician who worked on differential geometry.

name: Alexander Duncan Davidson Craik
summary: Alexander D D Craik was an expert on fluid mechanics writing many significant papers on the topic, but he was also interested in the history of mathematics, particularly Scottish mathematics, and wrote over 30 historical works.

name: Gabriel Cramer
summary: Gabriel Cramer worked on analysis and determinants. He is best known for his formula for solving simultaneous equations.

name: Carl Harald Cramér
summary: Harald Cramér was a Swedish mathematician, actuary and statistician, specializing in mathematical statistics and probabilistic number theory.

name: John Crank
summary: John Crank was an English numerical analyst who worked on the heat equation.

name: Lawrence Crawford
summary: Laurence Crawford graduated from Glasgow University. After a period at Birmingham University he became Professor of Pure Mathematics at South African College which later became the University of Cape Town.

name: August Leopold Crelle
summary: August Crelle was a German mathematician who founded an important mathematical journal.

name: Antonio Luigi Gaudenzio Giuseppe Cremona
summary: Luigi Cremona was the originator of graphical statics, the study of forces in equilibrium, using graphical methods. He wrote papers on geometrical transformations, projective geometry and on graphical solutions.

name: David George Crighton
summary: David Crighton was a Welsh mathematician who worked on fluid flow and acoustics.

name: Morgan William Crofton
summary: Morgan Crofton was an Irish mathematician who contributed to the field of geometric probability theory.

name: Abdulalim Abdullah Shabazz
summary: Lonnie Grafton Cross was an African American mathematician who took the name Abdulalim Abdullah Shabazz. With an outstanding record working to increase the participation of women, minorities, and individuals with physical disabilities into science and engineering, he was awarded the Mentor Award of the American Association for the Advancement of Science and the Presidential Award for Excellence in Science, Mathematics and Engineering Mentoring.

name: John Cruickshank
summary: John Cruickshank was a Scottish mathematician who reformed both the mathematics teaching and the degree structure at Marischal College, Aberdeen.

name: José Anastácio da Cunha
summary: Anastácio da Cunha was a Portuguese mathematician who wrote an encyclopaedia of mathematics.

name: Maria Cunitz
died_place: Pitschen, Duchy of Brieg, Silesia (now Byczyna, Poland)
summary: Maria Cunitz was an astronomer who published simpler versions of Kepler's work.

name: Ebenezer Cunningham
summary: Ebenezer Cunningham was an English mathematician who worked in relativity.

name: Leslie Bennet Craigie Cunningham
summary: Leslie Cunningham graduated from Edinburgh University though the First World War interrupted his studies. He worked for the RAF as an education officer but returned to Edinburgh to complete his doctorate. He worked on various problems of air warfare.

name: Susan Jane Cunningham
summary: Susan Jane Cunningham was a mathematician and astronomer who founded the Mathematics and Astronomy Departments at Swarthmore College. She was one of the first seven women to join the New York Mathematical Society in 1891.

name: Gregorio Ricci-Curbastro
summary: Gregorio Ricci-Curbastro was an Italian mathematician best known for the invention of tensor calculus.

name: Samuel Newby Curle
died_place: Lodge Farm Lane, Settle, North Yorkshire, England
summary: Newby Curle was an English applied mathematician who worked in fluid mechanics. He spent most of his career as a professor at St Andrews.

name: Haskell Brooks Curry
summary: Haskell Curry worked in mathematical logic with particular interest in the theory of formal systems and processes.

name: Nicholas of Cusa
summary: Nicholas of Cusa was a German philosopher and bishop. He was interested in geometry and logic as well as in philosophy and astronomy.

name: Emanuel Czuber
summary: Emanuel Czuber was a Czech mathematician who studied was probability theory and related areas.

name: Louis Robert Jules d'Adhémar
summary: Robert d'Adhémar was a French mathematician and philosopher of science and religion.

name: D'Arcy Wentworth Thompson
summary: D'Arcy Thompson was a Greek scholar, a naturalist and a mathematician. He was the first biomathematician. His book On Growth and Form had a great influence on both biologists and mathematicians.

name: Patrick d'Arcy
born_place: Kiltullagh near Athenry, County Galway, Ireland
summary: Patrick d'Arcy was an Irish mathematician and soldier who studied in France and made original contributions to dynamics. He is best known for his part in the discovery of the principle of angular momentum.

name: Philbert Maurice d'Ocagne
summary: Maurice d'Ocagne was a French engineer and mathematician. He founded the field of nomography, the graphic computation of algebraic equations.

name: Enrico D'Ovidio
born_place: Campobasso, Molise, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (now Italy)
university: Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II
summary: Enrico D'Ovidio was an Italian mathematician and politician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Daniel Augusto da Silva
summary: Daniel da Silva was a Portuguese mathematician and marine officer who made important contibutions in the field of statics and also in number theory.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
summary: Leonardo da Vinci was an Italian artist and scholar who had many talents in addition to his painting. He worked on mechanics, though geometry was his main love. He was involved in hydrodynamics, anatomy, mechanics, mathematics and optics.

name: Haroutune Mugurdich Dadourian
summary: Haroutune Dadourian was professor of mathematics and physics at Trinity College, Hartford, Connecticut. He did important work on radioactivity and wrote five mathematics textbooks for science students taking a different approach from that of most authors.

name: Ernst Mauritz Dahlin
born_place: Handog, Lit Parish, Jämtland Province, Sweden
summary: Mauritz Dahlin was a Swedish mathematicianwho best known for his work on the history of mathematics.

name: Germund Dahlquist
summary: Germund Dahlquist was a Swedish mathematician who worked in the theory of numerical analysis as applied to differential equations.

name: Slamet Dajono
summary: Slamet Dajono was an Indonesian mathematician who founded the "Mathematics Interest Association" which was a forerunner of the Indonesian Mathematical Society.

name: Germinal Pierre Dandelin
summary: Germinal Dandelin was a French mathematician best known for a method of approximating the roots of an algebraic equation.

name: Percy John Daniell
summary: Percy Daniell was a Chilean-born English mathematician who worked in both pure and applied mathematics. He is best known for his work on integration.

name: Ólafur Daníelsson
summary: Ólafur Daníelsson was a Icelandic mathematician who the first Icelander to be awarded a doctorate in mathematics.

name: Egnatio Pellegrino Rainaldi Danti
summary: Egnatio Danti was an Italian Dominican who made contributions to architecture, geography and astronomy.

name: David van Dantzig
summary: David van Dantzig was a Dutch mathematician who worked in in topology as well as probability and statistics.

name: George Bernard Dantzig
summary: George Dantzig was an American mathematical scientist who worked in operations research, computer science, economics and statistics. He is best known for inventing the simplex algorithm for linear programming.

name: Jean Gaston Darboux
summary: Gaston Darboux was a French mathematician who made important contributions to differential geometry and analysis and the Darboux integral is named after him.

name: Georges Darmois
summary: Georges Darmois was a French mathematician and statistician.

name: Charles Galton Darwin
summary: Charles G Darwin was the grandson of the famous biologist. He worked in Quantum Mechanics and had controversial views on Eugenics.

name: George Howard Darwin
summary: George Darwin was an English mathematician who was a son of Charles Darwin and studied the three-body-problem.

name: Johann Martin Zacharias Dase
summary: Zacharias Dase was a German mental calculator.

name: Bibhutibhushan Datta
summary: Bibhutibhushan Datta, born in what is now Banglsdesh, was a historian of Indian mathematics.

name: Ingrid Daubechies
summary: Ingrid Daubechies is a Belgium mathematician and physicist who has done important work on wavelets in image compression. She is on the Board of Enhancing Diversity in Graduate Education, an organisation which helps women get advanced degrees in mathematics.

name: Harold Davenport
summary: Harold Davenport worked on number theory, in particular the geometry of numbers, Diophantine approximation and the analytic theory of numbers. He wrote a number of important textbooks and monographs including The higher arithmetic (1952).

name: Florence Nightingale David
died_place: Kensington, Contra Costa County, California, USA
summary: Florence Nightingale David was an English statistician who worked to increase the opportunities for women to study statistics. She became head of the Statistics Department at the University of California, Riverside. Among her research interests were the history of probability and of statistical ideas.

name: Lajos Dávid
summary: Lajos Dávid was a Hungarian mathematician known for his work on the arithmetic/geometric mean and as a historian of mathematics, particularly on Bolyai.

name: Anton Davidoglu
summary: Anton Davidoglu was a Romanian mathematician who studied for his doctorate in Paris. He was the founder of the Academy of Advanced Commercial and Industrial Studies in Bucharest, and laid the foundations of mathematical education of economists in Romania.

name: August Yulevich Davidov
summary: August Yulevich Davidov was a Russian mathematician and engineer who worked on differential equations, partial derivatives, definite integrals and the application of probability theory to statistics.

name: Donald Watts Davies
summary: Donald Davies was a British physicist and mathematician who worked on the early development of computers and networks. His idea of 'packet switching' made the Internet, and ultimately the world wide web, possible.

name: Evan Tom Davies
summary: E T Davies graduated from the University of Wales at Aberystwyth and then studied in Rome and Paris. After lecturing at King's College London he was appointed to a professorship in Southampton. He worked in Differential Geometry and the Calculus of Variations.

name: Griffith Davies
summary: Griffith Davies was Welsh, born of poor parents, and began life as a slate quarry worker. He set up as a teacher of mathematics in London and became the first Actuary of the Guardian Assurance Company.

name: Paul Charles William Davies
summary: Paul Davies is an English theoretical physicist and astrobiologist who has popularised issues such as the origin of life and extraterrestrial intelligence.

name: Martin David Davis
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Martin Davis was an American mathematician, known for his work on Hilbert's tenth problem.

name: Richard Alan Day
summary: Alan Day was a Canadian mathematician who worked in lattice theory and universal algebra.

name: Pierre de Fermat
summary: Pierre de Fermat was a French lawyer and government official most remembered for his work in number theory; in particular for Fermat's Last Theorem. He is also important in the foundations of the calculus.

name: Bruno de Finetti
summary: Bruno de Finetti was an Italian probabilist, statistician and actuary, noted for his approach to probability theory.

name: Bernard le Bovier de Fontenelle
summary: Bernard de Fontenelle was a French mathematician who wrote on the history of mathematics and the philosophy of mathematics and science.

name: Erastus Lyman De Forest
summary: Erastus De Forest was an American mathematician and statistician and an early user of Monte Carlo methods.

name: Michele de Franchis
summary: Michele de Franchis was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Gan De
summary: Gan De was one of the earliest of the Chinese astronomers.

name: Ennio De Giorgi
summary: Ennio De Giorgi was an Italian mathematician who worked on partial differential equations and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Johannes de Groot
summary: Johannes de Groot was a Dutch mathematician who worked in topology.

name: Ernest Jean Philippe Fauque de Jonquières
summary: Ernest de Jonquières was a French naval officer who discovered many results in geometry.

name: Guillaume François Antoine Marquis de L'Hôpital
summary: De L'Hôpital was a French mathematician who wrote the first textbook on calculus, which consisted of the lectures of his teacher Johann Bernoulli.

name: Philippe de La Hire
summary: Philippe de la Hire was a French mathematician who worked on conic sections and on geodesy and astronomy.

name: Estienne de La Roche
summary: Estienne de la Roche as a French mathematician who published an arithmetic book with good notation for powers and roots.

name: Charles Jean Gustave Nicolas Baron de la Vallée Poussin
summary: Vallée Poussin is best known for his proof of the prime number theorem and his major work Cours d'Analyse .

name: Thomas Fantet de Lagny
summary: Thomas De Lagny was a French mathematician who is well known for his contributions to computational mathematics, calculating π to 120 places.

name: Welington Celso de Melo
university: Instituto de Matemática Pura e Aplicada
summary: Welington de Melo was an outstanding Brazilian mathematician working on dynamical systems. He is perhaps best known as the Ph.D. supervisor of the 2014 Fields Medallist Artur Avila.

name: Abraham de Moivre
summary: Abraham De Moivre was a French-born mathematician who pioneered the development of analytic geometry and the theory of probability.

name: Joseph Privat de Molières
summary: Privat de Molières was a French mathematician who argued against Newton in favour of Descartes.

name: Pierre Rémond de Montmort
summary: Pierre Rémond de Montmort was a French mathematician who wrote an important work on probability.

name: Augustus De Morgan
born_place: Madura, Madras Presidency, India (now Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India)
summary: Augustus De Morgan became the first professor of mathematics at University College London and made important contributions to English mathematics.

name: Juan de Ortega
summary: Juan de Ortega was a Spanish mathematician who devised an original method of extracting square roots.

name: Lucien Alexandre Charles René de Possel
summary: Lucien Alexandre Charles René de Possel was a French mathematician and computer scientist who worked on optical character recognition. He was one of the founders of the Bourbakists.

name: Gaspard Clair François Marie Riche de Prony
summary: Gaspard de Prony was a French mathematician who produced mathematical tables and texts on mathematical physics.

name: Georges de Rham
summary: Georges de Rham was a Swiss mathematician, known for his contributions to differential topology and to algebraic topology.

name: Gilles Personne de Roberval
summary: Gilles Roberval was a French scientist who developed powerful methods in the early study of integration.

name: Adhémar Jean Claude Barré de Saint-Venant
summary: Jean Claude Saint-Venant worked mainly on mechanics, elasticity, hydrostatics and hydrodynamics.

name: Willem de Sitter
summary: Willem de Sitter was a Dutch mathematician, physicist, and astronomer who made major contributions in physical cosmology.

name: René François Walter de Sluze
summary: René de Sluze is best known for the curves called the Pearls of Sluze.

name: Joseph Marie de Tilly
summary: Joseph Tilly was a Belgian soldier who published works on non-Euclidean geometry.

name: D'Amondans Charles de Tinseau
summary: Charles Tinseau was a French mathematician who wrote on the theory of surfaces.

name: Éamon de Valera
summary: Trained as a mathematician Éamon de Valera went on to beccome head of the government of the Irish Republic.

name: Gustav de Vries
summary: Gustav de Vries was a Dutch mathematician who introduced the famous Korteweg-de Vries equation which characterises travelling waves.

name: Hendrik de Vries
summary: Hendrik de Vries was a Dutch mathematician who was interested in projective geometry and in the history of mathematics.

name: Jan de Witt
degree: Artium Liberalium Magister, Juris utriusque Doctor
summary: Jan de Witt was a Dutch mathematician and statesman who wrote on geometry and finance.

name: Jozéf-Maria Hoëné de Wronski
summary: Jozéf Wronski wrote on the philosophy of mathematics.

name: Winifred Margaret Deans
summary: Winifred Deans graduated from Aberdeen and Cambridge. After a period in teaching she joined a Scottish publishing company and translated many important German scientific texts for them. After World War II she worked at the Commonwealth Bureau of Animal Nutrition in Aberdeen.

name: Claude François Milliet Dechales
summary: Claude Dechales was a French Jesuit who published a widely used textbook on mathematics.

name: Julius Wilhelm Richard Dedekind
summary: Richard Dedekind's major contribution was a redefinition of irrational numbers in terms of Dedekind cuts. He introduced the notion of an ideal in Ring Theory.

name: John Dee
university: University of Cambridge and Université Catholique de Louvain
summary: John Dee was an English scholar who wrote on trigonometry, on calendar reform, on navigation, on geography and on astrology. He became astrologer to Queen Mary but was imprisoned for being a magician.

name: Alexander Pell
summary: Alexander Pell or Sergei Degaev was a Russian revolutionary terrorist who moved to America and became a mathematician who worked in South Dakota.

name: Max Wilhelm Dehn
summary: Dehn wrote one of the first systematic expositions of topology (1907) and later formulated important problems on group presentations, namely the word problem and the isomorphism problem.

name: Scipione del Ferro
summary: Scipione del Ferro was an Italian mathematician who is famous for being the first to find a formula to solve a cubic equation.

name: Alfonso Maria Del Re
born_place: Calitri, Avellino, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (now Italy)
summary: Alfonso Del Re was an Italian mathematician who published works on geometry, statics and mathematical logic.

name: Richard Delamain
summary: Richard Delamain was an English mathematician who invented a circular slide rule.

name: Jean Baptiste Joseph Delambre
summary: Jean-Baptiste-Joseph Delambre was an astronomer who produced tables of the location of planets and their satellites. He also worked at the bureau of longitudes.

name: Henri Auguste Delannoy
summary: Henri Delannoy was a French mathematician who worked on probability and recreational mathematics. He was also intersted inthe history of mathematics.

name: Charles Eugène Delaunay
summary: Charles-Eugène Delaunay was a French mathematician and astronomer whose theory of lunar motion advanced the development of planetary-motion theories.

name: João Delgado
summary: João Delgado was a Portuguese mathematician, priest and architect. He made important contributions to the debate about the place of mathematics in a curriculum.

name: Pierre René Deligne
summary: Pierre Deligne is a Belgian mathematician who won a Fields Medal in 1978 for his work on algebraic number theory. He received many other prizes and awards, in particular the Wolf Prize in 2008 and the Abel Prize in 2013.

name: Jean Charles de La Faille
summary: Jan-Karel della Faille or Jean Charles de La Faille was a Flemish Jesuit who was the first to determine the centre of gravity of the sector of a circle.

name: Piero della Francesca
summary: Piero della Francesca was an Italian artist who pioneered the use of perspective in Renaissance art and went on to write several mathematical treatises.

name: Giambattista Della Porta
born_place: Vico Equense near Naples, Kingdom of Naples (now Italy)
summary: Giambattista della Porta was an Italian scholar who worked on cryptography and also on optics. He claimed to be the inventor of the telescope although he does not appear to have constructed one before Galileo.

name: Boris Nikolaevich Delone
summary: Boris Delone was a Russion mathematician who worked on algebra and the geometry of numbers. He was an outstanding mountain-climber.

name: Jean Frédéric Auguste Delsarte
summary: Jean Delsarte was a French mathematician known for his work in mathematical analysis.

name: Democritus of Abdera
summary: Democritus was a Greek scholar who is best known for his atomic theory although he was also an excellent geometer.

name: Arnaud Denjoy
summary: Denjoy was a French mathematician who did outstanding work on the functions of a real variable.

name: Joseph James Dennis
summary: Joseph James Dennis was the eleventh African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He served as the chair of the department of mathematics at Clark College from 1930 to 1974. From 1971 to 1977 he was Fuller E Calloway Chair of Mathematics at Albany State College.

name: Antoine Deparcieux
summary: Antoine Deparcieux was a French mathematician who is best known for an early work on annuities and mortality.

name: Girard Desargues
summary: Girard Desargues was a French mathematician who was a founder of projective geometry. His work centred on the theory of conic sections and perspective.

name: René Descartes
university: Universiteit Leiden and Université de Poitiers
summary: René Descartes was a French philosopher whose work, La géométrie, includes his application of algebra to geometry from which we now have Cartesian geometry. His work had a great influence on both mathematicians and philosophers.

name: Max F Deuring
summary: Max Deuring was a German mathematician who worked in in arithmetic geometry and analytic number theory.

name: Aleksei Alekseevich Dezin
summary: Aleksei Dezin was a Russian mathematician who worked on partial differential equations.

name: Persi Warren Diaconis
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
