summary: Persi Diaconis is an American mathematician and magician who works in combinatorics and statistics, but may be best known for his card tricks and other conjuring.

name: Cândido Lima da Silva Dias
summary: Cândido Silva Dias was a Brazilian mathematician who worked in analytic function theory.

name: Leonard Eugene Dickson
summary: Dickson is known for his contributions to number theory and group theory.

name: Samuel Dickstein
summary: Samuel Dickstein was a Polish mathematician whose work was mostly in algebra and the history of mathematics.

name: Paul Alexander Dienes
university: Eötvös Loránd University and Université Paris IV-Sorbonne
summary: Paul Dienes was a Hungarian mathematician who, because of his political views, had to escape from Hungary in 1920. He spent most of his career in Wales and England, was a highly effective Ph.D. supervisor, and wrote the influential book The Taylor Series (1931).

name: Zoltán Pál Dienes
summary: Zoltan Dienes was born in Hungary but spent much of his life in England and Canada. He was passionate about studying ways to teach mathematics to children and became a leading world expert carrying out numerous experiments in different countries. He was the author on many books on the subject.

name: Jean Alexandre Eugène Dieudonné
summary: Jean Dieudonné was a French mathematician who worked in a wide variety of mathematical areas including general topology, topological vector spaces, algebraic geometry, invariant theory and the classical groups. He was a founder member of Bourbaki and also wrote on the history of mathematics.

name: Thomas Digges
summary: Thomas Digges was an English mathematician who wrote on platonic and archimedian solids. He became the leader of the English supporters of Copernicus.

name: Eduard Jan Dijksterhuis
summary: Eduard Jan Dijksterhuis was a Dutch mathematician best known for his work in the history and philosophy of mathematics.

name: Edsger Wybe Dijkstra
summary: Edsger Wybe Dijkstra was a Dutch mathematician and computer scientist best known for his shortest-path algorithm in graph theory.

name: Robert Palmer Dilworth
summary: Bob Dilworth was an American mathematician who worked in lattice theory.

name: Dončo Dimovski
university: State University of New York at Binghamton
summary: Dončo Dimovski is a Macedonian mathematician whose areas of interest include algebra and topology with applications to physics, statistics and computer science.

name: Alexander Dinghas
summary: Alexander Dinghas was a Greek mathematician who worked in function theory.

name: Herbert Dingle
summary: Herbert Dingle was an English physicist and philosopher of science who wrote a number of influential books. He was involved in several long-running disputes with other physicists.

name: Ulisse Dini
summary: Ulisse Dini was an Italian mathematician whose most important work was on the theory of functions of a real variable.

name: Dinostratus
summary: Dinostratus was a Greek mathematician who may have used the quadratrix of Hippias to solve the problem of squaring the circle.

name: Diocles
summary: Diocles was a Greek mathematician who was the first to prove the focal property of a parabolic mirror and studied the cissoid curve as part of an attempt to duplicate the cube.

name: Achille Pierre Dionis du Séjour
summary: Achille-Pierre Dionis du Séjour was a French mathematician, astronomer and politician.

name: Dionysodorus
born_place: Caunus, Caria, Asia Minor (now in Turkey)
summary: Dionysodorus was a Greek mathematician who solved a cubic equation using the intersection of a parabola and a hyperbola.

name: Diophantus of Alexandria
summary: Diophantus was a Greek mathematician sometimes known as 'the father of algebra' who is best known for his Arithmetica. This had an enormous influence on the development of number theory.

name: Paul Adrien Maurice Dirac
summary: Paul Dirac is famous as the creator of the complete theoretical formulation of quantum mechanics.

name: Johann Peter Gustav Lejeune Dirichlet
summary: Lejeune Dirichlet is best known for his proof that in any arithmetic progression with first term coprime to the difference there are infinitely many primes.

name: Enno Heeren Dirksen
summary: Enno Heeren Dirksen was a German mathematician important in the development of Berlin University as a world-class mathematical centre.

name: Jacques Dixmier
summary: Jacques Dixmier is a French mathematician who worked on C*-algebras and other operator algebras.

name: Alfred Cardew Dixon
summary: Alfred Dixon graduated from London and Cambridge and then had professorial appointments in Galway and Belfast. He worked on ordinary and partial differential equations.

name: Arthur Lee Dixon
summary: Arthur Lee Dixon was an English mathematician who worked on analytic number theory and the application of algebra to geometry, elliptic functions and hyperelliptic functions.

name: Wolfgang Doeblin
summary: Wolfgang Doeblin was a German born French mathematician who made important advances in probability theory.

name: Gustav Doetsch
summary: Gustav Doetsch wasa German mathematician who worked on the Laplace Transform. His connections with the Nazis led to difficulties after World War II.

name: Alberto González Domínguez
summary: Alberto González Domínguez was a major figure in the development of mathematical sciences in Argentina. He worked on analytic functions, the theory of distributions and their application to quantum theory, the representation of functions by Fourier integrals, Laplace integrals and orthogonal series, and on probability theory.

name: Domninus of Larissa
summary: Domninus was a Greek philosopher whose mathematical work was not appreciated until it was published in the 19th Century.

name: Simon Kirwan Donaldson
summary: Simon Donaldson is an English mathematician who received a Fields Medal for his work on 4 dimensional manifolds. He was knighted in 2012 and awarded the most prestigious mathematical prizes including the Shaw Prize, the Breakthrough Prize in Mathematics, the Oswald Veblen Prize, and the Wolf Prize in Mathematics.

name: William Fishburn Donkin
summary: William Donkin was a mathematician who became Savilian Professor of Astronomy at the University of Oxford. He had broad interests writing on least squares, Laplace's functions, attraction of solids, and music.

name: Joseph Leo Doob
summary: Joseph Doob was an American mathematician who worked in probability and measure theory.

name: Johann Gabriel Doppelmayr
summary: Johann Doppelmayr was a German mathematician who wrote on astronomy, spherical trigonometry, sundials and mathematical instruments.

name: Christian Andreas Doppler
summary: Christian Doppler was an Austrian mathematician who is best known for the Doppler effect in wave theory.

name: Otto Martin Karl Dörge
summary: Karl Dörge was a German mathematician whose specialties were real functions, probabilities and analytic number theory.

name: Alberto Dou i Mas de Xexas
died_place: Sant Cugat del Vallés, Barcelona, Spain
summary: Alberto Dou was a Spanish Jesuit and mathematician who worked in differential geometry, elasticity, and partial differential equations. He fought on the Nationalist side in the Spanish Civil War.

name: Charles Shirra Dougall
summary: Charles Shirra Dougall was a Scottish school teacher who became Rector of Dollar Academy.

name: John Dougall
summary: John Dougall graduated from Glasgow. He taught at Glasgow University before joining a publishing firm. He wrote a number of papers on both pure and applied mathematics.

name: Jesse Douglas
summary: Jesse Douglas worked on geometry, group theory and the calculus of variations.

name: Clifford Hugh Dowker
summary: Hugh Dowker was an English mathematician known for his work on knot theory.

name: Arthur Matthew Weld Downing
summary: Arthur Downing was trained as a mathematician at Trinity College, Dublin before spending half his career at the Royal Observatory Greenwich and half as Superintendent of the Nautical Almanac.

name: Jules Joseph Drach
summary: Jules Drach was a French mathematician who worked on number theory, partial differential equations, and differential geometry.

name: Vladimir Gershonovich Drinfeld
summary: Vladimir Drinfeld is a Ukrainian-born American mathematician best known for his work in algebraic geometry over finite fields. He has been awarded some of the most prestigious mathematical prizes, such as the Fields Medal (1990), the Wolf Prize (2018) and the Shaw Prize (2023).

name: Arnold Droz-Farny
summary: Arnold Droz-Farny was a Swiss mathematician best known for the Droz-Farny line theorem.

name: David Drysdale
summary: David Drysdale graduated from Edinburgh University and then taught at George Heriot's School Edinburgh, at the Royal Academy Irvine and at Arbroath High School.

name: Patrick Du Val
summary: Patrick Du Val was an English mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry, differential geometry and general relativity.

name: Francisco José Duarte
summary: Francisco José Duarte was a Venezuelan mathematician whose most important work in mathematics was done in algebra, number theory and mathematical analysis.

name: Artūras Dubickas
summary: Artūras Dubickas is a Lithuanian mathematician who proved important results in number theory.

name: Paul Dubreil
summary: Paul Dubreil was a French mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry. He was married to fellow mathematician Marie-Louise Dubreil-Jacotin.

name: Marie-Louise Dubreil-Jacotin
summary: Marie-Louise Dubreil-Jacotin was a French mathematician who worked in fluid mechanics and abstract algebra. She was the second woman in France to obtain a doctorate in pure mathematics.

name: Henry Ernest Dudeney
summary: Henry Dudeney is best known for his publications of mathematical problems and pastimes, some of which provoked serious mathematical research.

name: Jean Marie Constant Duhamel
summary: Jean-Marie Duhamel worked on partial differential equations and applied his methods to the theory of heat, to rational mechanics and to acoustics.

name: Pierre Maurice Marie Duhem
summary: Pierre Duhem was a French physicist, mathematician, historian and philosopher of science who worked on hydrodynamics and elasticity.

name: Gustave Dumas
summary: Gustave Dumas was a Swiss mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Cypra Cecilia Krieger Dunaj
summary: Cypra Cecilia Krieger Dunaj was the first woman to earn a PhD in mathematics from a Canadian university and only the third person to be awarded a mathematics doctorate in Canada. She is best known for her English translation of Sierpinski's Introduction to General Topology (1934) and General Topology (1952)

name: Robert Taylor Dunbar
summary: Robert Dunbar graduated from Edinburgh University. After service in World War I he lectured in Physics at Edinburgh. He later moved to University College Cardiff and became Professor of Physics there.

name: Pierre Charles François Dupin
summary: Charles Dupin made contributions to differential geometry and in particular invented the 'Dupin indicatrix'.

name: Louis Victoire Athanase Dupré
summary: Athanase Dupré was a French mathematician who worked on number theory and the mechanical theory of heat.

name: Clement Vavasor Durell
summary: Clement V Durell was an English schoolmaster famous for his mathematical textbooks.

name: Albrecht Dürer
born_place: Imperial Free City of Nürnberg (now in Germany)
died_place: Imperial Free City of Nürnberg (now in Germany)
summary: Dürer was a German artist who is known for his work as an engraver. The foundations of descriptive geometry are laid in Dürer's treatise on human proportions published in Nuremberg after his death in 1528.

name: Aryeh Dvoretzky
summary: Aryeh Dvoretzky was a Ukrainian-born Israeli mathematician who worked in functional analysis, statistics and probability.

name: Walther Franz Anton von Dyck
summary: Von Dyck made important contributions to function theory, group theory (where a fundamental result on group presentations is named after him) topology and potential theory.

name: Henry Abel Dye
summary: Henry Dye was an American mathematician who worked in operator algebras and ergodic theory.

name: Eugene Borisovich Dynkin
summary: Eugene B Dynkin was a Russian-born American mathematician who worked in the fields of probability and algebra, especially semisimple Lie groups and algebras, and Markov processes. Dynkin diagrams are named after him.

name: Freeman John Dyson
summary: Freeman Dyson was an English theoretical physicist and mathematician who worked in quantum electrodynamics, solid-state physics and astronomy. He worked in America for many years.

name: George Samuel Eastwood
summary: George Eastwood attended the University of London. He taught at Arbroath High School and Beath Secondary School in Cowdenbeath.

name: John Presper Eckert
summary: J Presper Eckert Jr. was an American computer pioneer. With John Mauchly he invented ENIAC: the first general-purpose electronic digital computer.

name: Wallace John Eckert
summary: Wallace J Eckert was an American astronomer whose work was important in the development of computers.

name: Beno Eckmann
summary: Beno Eckmann was a Swiss mathematician who worked in topology.

name: Arthur Stanley Eddington
summary: Eddington made important contributions to the theory of general relativity.

name: William Leonard Edge
summary: William Edge graduated from Cambridge and lectured at Edinburgh University. He wrote many papers on Geometry.

name: Winifred Edgerton Merrill
summary: Winifred Edgerton was the first woman to receive a degree from Columbia University and the first American woman to receive a PhD in mathematics.

name: Francis Ysidro Edgeworth
summary: Francis Edgeworth was an Irish-born statistician who examined correlation and methods of estimating correlation coefficients in a series of papers.

name: Sheila May Edmonds
summary: Sheila Edmonds was an English mathematician who worked infinite series and went on to become Vice-Principal of Newnham College, Cambridge.

name: James Eells
summary: James Eells was an American mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis.

name: Nikolai Vladimirovich Efimov
summary: Nikolai Vladimirovich Efimov was a Russian mathematician. He worked on the geometry of surfaces of negative curvature.

name: Jenő Elek Egerváry
summary: Jenő Egerváry was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in combinatorial optimisation. He committed suicide after the crushing of the Hungarian revolution.

name: Dimitri Fedorovich Egorov
summary: Dimitri Egorov was a Russian mathematician who worked in differential geometry and mathematical analysis.

name: Paul Ehrenfest
summary: Paul Ehrenfest was an Austrian mathematician who made important contributions to statistical mechanics and quantum mechanics.

name: Charles Ehresmann
summary: Charles Ehresmann was a French mathematician who worked in differential topology and category theory.

name: Martin Eichler
summary: Martin Eichler was a German matnematician who worked in number theory.

name: Samuel Eilenberg
summary: Samuel Eilenberg was a Polish-born American mathematician who worked on algebraic topology and homological algebra. He was one of the founders of category theory.

name: Albert Einstein
summary: Einstein contributed more than any other scientist to the modern vision of physical reality. His special and general theories of relativity are still regarded as the most satisfactory model of the large-scale universe that we have.

name: Carolyn Eisele
born_place: The Bronx, New York City, USA
summary: Carolyn Eisele was a mathematician who spent her whole career teaching at Hunter College. She is famed for her work on Charles Sanders Peirce, particularly in seeing the importance of mathematics in his work on philosophy and logic.

name: David Eisenbud
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: David Eisenbud is an American mathematician who is known for his work in algebra, algebraic geometry and symbolic computation.

name: Luther Pfahler Eisenhart
summary: Luther Eisenhart was an American mathematician who worked in differential geometry and relativity theory.

name: Ferdinand Gotthold Max Eisenstein
summary: Gotthold Eisenstein worked on a variety of topics including quadratic and cubic forms, the reciprocity theorem for cubic residues, quadratic partition of prime numbers and reciprocity laws.

name: Ethel Mary Elderton
died_place: Stanborough Park, near Watford, Hertfordshire, England
summary: Ethel Elderton was a statistician who worked for Francis Galton and Karl Pearson. Although her work was an important contribution applying statistics to social problems, much of it makes difficult reading today because it is written with a eugenic perspective.

name: Erik Gustav Elfving
summary: Erik Gustav Elfving was a Finnish mathematician and statistician who worked in the optimal design of experiments.

name: Edwin Bailey Elliott
summary: Edwin Elliott was an English mathematician whose work included algebra, algebraic geometry, synthetic geometry, elliptic functions and invariant theory.

name: Robert Leslie Ellis
summary: Leslie Ellis was a brilliant man with broad interests and abilities who suffered from ill health all his short life. Senior Wrangler in the Mathematical tripos at Cambridge in 1840, he became a fellow of Trinity College and was interested in areas of mathematics which involved philosophical ideas.

name: Wade Ellis Sr
summary: Wade Ellis Sr was the twelfth African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He worked on radar and taught at Boston University before being appointed as a professor at Oberlin College in Oberlin, Ohio, where he served for 19 years. From 1967 he served as professor of mathematics at the University of Michigan and Associate Dean of the Horace H Rackham School of Graduate Studies.

name: Achsah Mount Ely
summary: Achsah Mount Ely studied at Vassar College, beginning in 1865, the year teaching began there. She taught at several other institutions before becoming Head of Mathematics at Vassar College. In 1891, she became one of the first two women to join the New York Mathematical Society.

name: William Emerson
summary: William Emerson published textbooks which popularised the work of Isaac Newton.

name: Empedocles of Acragas
summary: Empedocles was a Greek philosopher who is best known for his belief that all matter was composed of four elements: fire, air, water, and earth. Some have considered him the inventor of rhetoric and the founder of the science of medicine in Italy.

name: Johann Franz Encke
summary: Johann Franz Encke was a German astronomer. He worked on the calculation of the periods of comets and asteroids, measured the distance from the earth to the sun, and made observations of the planet Saturn

name: Friedrich Engel
summary: Friedrich Engel worked on Lie algebras as well as continuous groups and partial differential equations.

name: Abramo Giulio Umberto Federigo Enriques
summary: Federigo Enriques was an Italian mathematician who made important contributions to geometry and to the history and philosophy of mathematics.

name: David Enskog
summary: David Enskog was a Swedish mathematical physicist who helped develop the kinetic theory of gases.

name: Lóránd Baron von Eötvös
summary: Lóránd Eötvös was a Hungarian mathematician and physicists who published works on surface tension and gravitation.

name: Donald Birkby Eperson
summary: Donald Eperson was an English schooteacher and clergyman who produced works on recreational mathematics.

name: Paul Epstein
summary: Paul Epstein was a German mathematician best-known for his contributions to number theory.

name: Eratosthenes of Cyrene
summary: Eratosthenes was a Greek mathematician who is famous for his work on prime numbers and for measuring the diameter of the earth.

name: Arthur Erdélyi
summary: Arthur Erdélyi was a Hungarian mathematician who became a lecturer at Edinburgh and after a period in the USA returned to Edinburgh as a Professor. He was an expert on Special Functions.

name: Paul Erdős
summary: Erdős posed and solved problems in number theory and other areas and founded the field of discrete mathematics.

name: Agner Krarup Erlang
summary: Agner Erlang was a Danish mathematician, statistician and engineer, who invented the fields of traffic engineering and queueing theory.

name: Jaime Alfonso Escalante
summary: Jaime Escalante was a high school mathematics teacher in both his native Bolivia and in the United States. He became famous when his students became so successful they were accused of cheating, leading to the 1988 film 'Stand and Deliver'.

name: Maurits Cornelius Escher
summary: Escher is an artist whose works have included a considerable mathematical content.

name: Gustav von Escherich
summary: Gustav von Escherich was an Italian mathematician who was one of the founders of the Mathematical Society of Vienna.

name: Ernest Benjamin Esclangon
summary: Ernest Esclangon was a French astronomer and mathematician who worked on almost-periodic functions.

name: José Fernando Escobar
summary: José Escobar was a Colombian mathematician who made outstanding contributions to the Yamabe problem. He worked most of his life in the United States but made decisive contributions to developing and improving the mathematical level in Colombia.

name: Theodor Estermann
summary: Theodor Estermann was a German mathematician who worked in the field of analytic number theory.

name: Ivor Malcolm Haddon Etherington
summary: Ivor Etherington was an English mathematician who worked on general relativity, and later on genetics and introduced genetic algebras.

name: Euclid of Alexandria
summary: Euclid was a Greek mathematician best known for his treatise on geometry: The Elements. This influenced the development of Western mathematics for more than 2000 years.

name: Eudemus of Rhodes
summary: Eudemus was a Greek who was the first major historian of mathematics.

name: Eudoxus of Cnidus
born_place: Cnidus (on Resadiye peninsula), Asia Minor (now Knidos, Turkey)
summary: Eudoxus was a Greek mathematician and astronomer who contributed to Euclid's Elements. He mapped the stars and compiled a map of the known world. His philosophy influenced Aristotle.

name: Leonhard Euler
summary: Leonhard Euler was a Swiss mathematician who made enormous contibutions to a wide range of mathematics and physics including analytic geometry, trigonometry, geometry, calculus and number theory.

name: Eutocius of Ascalon
summary: Eutocius was a Greek mathematician who wrote commentaries on works of Archimedes and Apollonius.

name: Machgielis Euwe
summary: Machgielis "Max" Euwe was a Dutch chess grandmaster and mathematician. He was the fifth player to become World Chess Champion.

name: Griffith Conrad Evans
summary: Griffith Evans was an American mathematician whose work dealt with potential theory, functional analysis, integral equations and minimal surfaces. He was head of mathematics at Berkeley for many years.

name: Cecil John Alvin Evelyn
summary: Cecil John Alvin Evelyn was an amateur mathematician who produced some works on number theory and geometry.

name: Alice Everett
summary: Alice Everett was a mathematician and astronomer who studied the mathematical tripos at Girton College, worked at the Royal Observatory Greenwich and then at the Potsdam Astrophysical Observatory. She had a second career working on optics at the National Physical Laboratory. Her final career was working on the early developments of television broadcasting.

name: William Norrie Everitt
summary: Norrie Everitt was an English mathematician who spent most of his career at Dundee and Birmingham. He was an expert in the field of spectral analysis and differential equations.

name: James Okoye Chukwuka Ezeilo
born_place: Nanka, Orumba North Local Government Area, Anambra State, Nigeria
summary: James Ezeilo was a Nigerian mathematician who worked in the theory of ordinary differential equations. He was the first professor of mathematics in Nigeria and went on to become vice chancellor of two Nigerian universities.

name: Georg Faber
summary: Georg Faber was a German mathematician whose most important work was on the polynomial expansion of functions.

name: Honoré Fabri
summary: Honoré Fabri was a French Jesuit who worked on astronomy, physics and mathematics.

name: Dmitrii Konstantinovich Faddeev
summary: Dmitrii Faddeev was a Russian mathematician who worked mainly in algebra, and who made significant contributions to other areas such as number theory, function theory, geometry and probability.

name: Ludwig Dmitrievich Faddeev
summary: Ludvig Faddeev was a Russian mathematical physicist who worked in quantum field theory.

name: Vera Nikolaevna Faddeeva
summary: Vera Nikolaevna Faddeeva was a Russian mathematician who worked in the field of numerical linear algebra.

name: Alessandro Faedo
summary: Alessandro Faedo was an Italian mathematician and politician who worked in numerical analysis.

name: Giovanni Francesco Fagnano dei Toschi
summary: Giovanni Fagnano was an Italian priest who worked on geometry and calculus.

name: Giulio Carlo Fagnano dei Toschi
summary: Giulio Fagnano was an Italian mathematician who worked in both complex numbers and on the geometry of triangles.

name: Etta Zuber Falconer
summary: Etta Zuber Falconer was an American mathematician and educator. She was one of the earlier African-American women to receive a Ph.D. in mathematics.

name: Fearon Fallows
summary: Fearon Fallows was a mathematician and astronomer who was appointed as the first Astronomer at the Cape of Good Hope. He arranged for the building of the Royal Observatory at the Cape of Good Hope.

name: Gerd Faltings
summary: Gerd Faltings is a German mathematician whose work in algebraic geometry led to important results in number theory, including helping with the proof of Fermat's Last Theorem.

name: Gino Fano
summary: Gino Fano was an Italian mathematician whose work was mainly on projective and algebraic geometry. He is best known as the founder of the finite geometry.

name: Luigi Fantappiè
summary: Luigi Fantappiè was an Italian mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis and created the theory of analytic functionals.

name: Michael Faraday
summary: Michael Faraday was an English physicist whose discoveries in electricity had an enormous influence on the development of mathematics.

name: John Farey
summary: John Farey was an Engish geologist, noted as a mathematician for the Farey sequence which is a listing of the rationals.

name: Gyula Farkas
summary: Gyula Farkas was a Hungarian mathematician and physicist who worked on linear programming and linear inequalities.

name: Mary Celine Fasenmyer
summary: Mary Celine Fasenmyer was an American mathematician known for her work on hypergeometric functions and linear algebra.

name: Pierre Joseph Louis Fatou
summary: Pierre Fatou was a French mathematician and astronomer who worked in several branches of analysis.

name: Johann Faulhaber
summary: Johann Faulhaber was a German Cossist or early algebraist. He is important for his work explaining the recently invented logarithms.

name: Philippa Garrett Fawcett
summary: In 1890 Philippa Fawcett came top in the Mathematical Tripos Examinations at Cambridge, being placed "ahead of the first Wrangler".

name: Herbert Federer
summary: Herbert Federer was an Austrian-born American mathematician who worked in geometric measure theory.

name: Carlo Federici Casa
summary: Carlo Federici was an Italian mathematician who worked in logic. He moved to Colombia for political reasons.

name: Vitaly Vitalievich Fedorchuk
summary: Vitaly Fedorchuk was a Russian mathematician who worked various areas of topology.

name: Charles Louis Fefferman
summary: Charles Fefferman is an American mathematician who won a Fields Medal for work on partial differential equations and Fourier analysis. He was awarded the Wolf Prize in 2017.

name: Henri Fehr
summary: Henri Fehr was a Swiss mathematician and educationalist who founded two Swiss journals and worked for the improvement of mathematical education.

name: Mitchell Jay Feigenbaum
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Mitchell Feigenbaum was an American mathematical physicist who discovered the so-called Feigenbaum constant in chaos theory.

name: Georg Feigl
summary: Georg Feigl was a German mathematician who worked in the foundations of geometry and topology.

name: Walter Feit
summary: Walter Feit was an Austrian mathematician who (with John Thompson) proved one of the most important theorems about finite simple groups.

name: Lipót Fejér
summary: Fejér's main work was in harmonic analysis working on Fourier series and their singularities. Fejér collaborated to produce important papers with Carathéodory on entire functions and with Riesz on conformal mappings.

name: Michael Fekete
summary: Michael Fekete was a Hungarian mathematician and set theorist who worked on the transfinite diameter of a set.

name: Jacques Feldbau
summary: Jacques Feldbau was a French mathematician who worked on differential geometry and topology.

name: Naum Il'ich Feldman
summary: Naum Il'ich Feldman was a Russian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: William Srecko Feller
summary: William Feller was a Croatian-born American mathematician who worked on probability and is best known as the author of a standard work on Statistics.

name: Ann Elizabeth Hammer Fennema
summary: Elizabeth Fennema was an American mathematician who worked on mathematical education. She received many honours such as the first Annual Award for Outstanding Contribution to Research on Women and Education from the American Educational Research Association, and the Dora Helen Skypek Award from the Association for Women and Mathematics Education.

name: István Fenyő
summary: István Fenyő was a Hungarian applied mathematician who worked in analysis, algebra, geometry and integral equations.

name: Nicola Fergola
died_place: Naples, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (now Italy)
summary: Nicola Fergola was an Italian mathematician with a interest in developing geometry by classical methods.

name: Robert McNair Ferguson
summary: Robert Ferguson was a founder member of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society and became their fifth President.

name: Enrico Fermi
summary: Enrico Fermi was an Italian physicist who created the world's first nuclear reactor. He made important contributions to the development of quantum theory, nuclear and particle physics and to statistical mechanics.

name: Carlos Federico Graef Fernández
summary: Carlos Graef Fernández was an outstanding Mexican mathematician and physicist. As a lecturer, researcher and organiser his contributions were widely recognised.

name: Jacqueline Lelong-Ferrand
summary: Jacqueline Ferrand was a French mathematician who worked on conformal representation theory, potential theory and Riemannian manifolds.

name: William Leonard Ferrar
summary: Bill Ferrar was an English mathematician who worked on the convergence of series. He is best known for his undergraduate text-books. He eventually became Principal of Hertford College Oxford.

name: Lodovico Ferrari
summary: Ferrari was an Italian scholar who started as Cardan's secretary and went on to devise the solution of the quartic equation.

name: William Ferrel
summary: William Ferrel was an American astronomer who worked on the theory of tides.

name: Norman Macleod Ferrers
born_place: Prinknash Park, Upton St Leonards, Gloucestershire, England
summary: Norman Ferrers was an English mathematician, university administrator and editor of a mathematical journal.

name: Karl Wilhelm Feuerbach
summary: Karl Feuerbach was a geometer who discovered the nine point circle of a triangle.

name: Jean Le Fèvre
summary: Jean Le Fèvre was a French astronomer who published astronomical tables.

name: Richard Phillips Feynman
summary: Richard Feynman was a Nobel prize winner famous for his unusual life style and for his popular books and lectures on mathematics and physics.

name: Leonardo Pisano Fibonacci
summary: Leonard of Pisa or Fibonacci played an important role in reviving ancient mathematics and made significant contributions of his own. Liber abaci introduced the Hindu-Arabic place-valued decimal system and the use of Arabic numerals into Europe.

name: Gaetano Fichera
summary: Gaetano Fichera was an Italian mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis, linear elasticity, partial differential equations and several complex variables.

name: Ernst Fiedler
summary: Ernst Fiedler was a German born Swiss school teacher.

name: Miroslav Fiedler
summary: Miroslav Fiedler was a Czech mathematician who worked in linear algebra, graph theory and algebraic graph theory.

name: Otto Wilhelm Fiedler
summary: Wilhelm Fiedler was a German mathematician, known for his textbooks of geometry and for his contributions to descriptive geometry.

name: John Charles Fields
summary: J C Fields provided funds for an international medal for mathematical distinction: the mathematical equivalent of a Nobel prize.

name: László Filep
summary: László Filep was a Hungarian mathematician who specialised in history of mathematics.

name: Louis Napoleon George Filon
summary: L N G Filon was French-born English mathematician, best known for his work on classical mechanics and elasticity.

name: Pierre-Joseph-Étienne Finck
summary: Pierre-Joseph-Étienne Finck wrote books on algebra, mechanics, geometry and analysis.

name: Thomas Fincke
summary: Thomas Fincke was a Danish doctor who wrote a textbook on geometry.

name: Henry Burchard Fine
summary: Henry Fine was an American mathematician responsible for developing the mathematics department at Princeton.

name: Nathan Jacob Fine
summary: Nathan Fine was an American mathematician who worked on the hypergeometric series.

name: Oronce Fine
summary: Oronce Fine was a French mathematician who published a major work on mathematics and astronomy.

name: Benjamin Franklin Finkel
summary: Benjamin Franklin Finkel was a mathematician and educator most remembered today as the founder of the American Mathematical Monthly journal.

name: Paul Finsler
summary: Paul Finsler was a German mathematician who worked on set theory, differential geometry, number theory, probability theory and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Mario Fiorentini
summary: Mario Fiorentini is an Italian partisan, secret agent and mathematician.

name: Ernst Sigismund Fischer
summary: Ernst Fischer is best known for the Riesz-Fischer theorem in the theory of Lebesgue integration.

name: Ronald Aylmer Fisher
summary: Ronald Aylmer Fisher was a British statistician and geneticist important in developing the use of statistics in genetics and biomathematics.

name: Thomas Scott Fiske
summary: Thomas Scott Fiske was an American mathematician who was the founder of the American Mathematical Society.

name: Annie Louise MacKinnon Fitch
died_place: Kirkland, Oneida County, New York, USA
summary: Annie MacKinnon was the third woman to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics from an American university. She was a postdoctoral student at Göttingen with Felix Klein, then a Professor of Mathematics at Wells College, New York. She gave up her career when she married Edward Fitch.

name: Hans Fitting
summary: Hans Fitting was a German mathematician who is well-known for his results in group theory and Lie algebras.

name: George Francis FitzGerald
born_place: Kill-o'-the Grange, Monkstown, Co. Dublin, Ireland
summary: George FitzGerald was a Irish physicist best known for the FitzGerald Contraction -- a way of explaining special relativity.

name: Armand-Hippolyte-Louis Fizeau
summary: Hippolyte Fizeau was a French physicist, best known for measuring the speed of light.

name: Philippe Flajolet
summary: Philippe Flajolet was a French mathematician and computer scientist who worked on the analysis of algorithms.

name: John Flamsteed
summary: John Flamsteed was an English astronomer who published accurate astronomical observations and was the first Astronomer Royal.

name: Moshé Flato
born_place: Tel Aviv, British Mandate for Palestine (now Israel)
summary: Moshé Flato was an Israeli-born French mathematician and theoretical physicist. He applied group theoretic methods to problems in physics.

name: Vincenzo Flauti
summary: Vincenzo Flauti was an Italian mathematician who was a leader of the synthetic school of mathematics.

name: Williamina Paton Fleming
summary: Mina Fleming was born in Dundee, Scotland, but spent her career at the Harvard Observatory in Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA. Her work with photographic plates led her to make many discoveries of stars with peculiar properties.

name: Thomas Muirhead Flett
summary: Thomas Flett was an English mathematician who worked in Real analysis.

name: Andreas Floer
summary: Andreas Floer was a German mathematician best known for his work in symplectic topology and mathematical physics.

name: Achille Marie Gaston Floquet
summary: Gaston Floquet was a French mathematician who worked on mathematical analysis, especially in the theory of differential equations.

name: Gottfried Wilhelm Flügge
summary: Gottfried Wilhelm Flügge was a German mathematician and engineer who wrote the standard work on the theory of shells.

name: Irmgard Flügge-Lotz
summary: Irmgard Flügge-Lotz worked on numerical methods for solving differential equations especially in fluid dynamics.

name: Vladimir Aleksandrovich Fock
summary: Vladimir Fock was a Russian physicist who worked in quantum mechanics and quantum electrodynamics.

name: Ernests Fogels
summary: Ernests Fogels was a Latvian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: François-Jacques-Philippe Folie
summary: François Folie was a Belgian mathematician and astronomer.

name: Sergei Vasilovich Fomin
summary: Sergei Fomin was a Russian mathematician who worked in topology and also in dynamical systems and mathematical biology.

name: Niccolò Tartaglia
summary: Tartaglia was an Italian mathematician who was famed for his algebraic solution of cubic equations which was eventually published in Cardan's Ars Magna.

name: Lester Randolph Ford
summary: Lester Ford was an American mathematician who lectured for several years in Edinburgh before moving back to the USA. He wrote some important text-books and is best known for his contributions to the Mathematical Association of America and the American Mathematical Monthly.

name: Henry George Forder
born_place: Shotesham All Saints, near Norwich, England
died_place: Selwyn Village, Port Chevalier, Auckland, New Zealand
summary: Henry Forder was a New Zealand mathematician who worked in geometry.

name: Andrew Russell Forsyth
summary: Forsyth wrote important works on analysis which were responsible for introducing continental methods into the subject in Britain.

name: George Elmer Forsythe
summary: George Forsythe was a American mathematician and computer scientist who was responsible for the rapid development of computer science.

name: Alfred Leon Foster
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Alfred Leon Foster was an American mathematician who worked on Boolean rings and algebras.

name: Dorothy Mary Elizabeth Foster
summary: Dorothy Foster studied at Bedford College and was awarded a Ph.D. by the University of London in 1960. Except for a few years as an Assistant Lecturer in Mathematics at Royal Holloway College, London, she spent her whole career at the University of St Andrews. She was an expert on geometric number theory.

name: Jean Bernard Léon Foucault
summary: Léon Foucault was a French mathematician and astronomer who is best known for his invention of a pendulum which demonstrates the rotation of the earth.

name: David James Foulis
summary: David Foulis was an American mathematician who worked on the algebraic foundations of quantum mechanics.

name: Louis Lefébure de Fourcy
summary: Louis Lefébure de Fourcy was a French mathematician who taught at the École Polytechnique. He is best known for having refused Galois entry to the school.

name: Jean Baptiste Joseph Fourier
summary: Joseph Fourier studied the mathematical theory of heat conduction. He established the partial differential equation governing heat diffusion and solved it by using infinite series of trigonometric functions.

name: David Herbert Fowler
summary: David Fowler was an English mathematician who is best known as a historian of Greek mathematics.

name: Ralph Fowler
summary: Ralph Howard Fowler was an English physicist and astronomer. He also worked on thermodynamics and statistical mechanics.

name: William Henry Fox Talbot
summary: Fox Talbot was a pioneer English photographer who also did work on elliptic functions.

name: Charles Fox
summary: Charles Fox was an English mathematician who worked on hypergeometric functions, integral transforms, integral equations, the theory of statistical distributions, and the mathematics of navigation.

name: Leslie Fox
summary: Leslie Fox was a British mathematician who specialised in numerical analysis.

name: Ralph Hartzler Fox
summary: Ralph Fox was an American mathematician who made important contributions to differential topology and knot theory.

name: Adolf Abraham Halevi Fraenkel
summary: Abraham Fraenkel was a German-born mathematician who made contributions to axiomatic set theory. He is the F in the ZFC axioms for set theory.

name: Leopoldo Luis Cabo Penna Franca
summary: Leopoldo Franca was a Brazilian mathematician who had a major impact in the development and analysis of innovative finite element methods. He worked mainly on stabilised methods for fluids, acoustics and solids, residual-free methods, and enriched methods for transport equations.

name: François Joseph Français
summary: François Français was one of a pair of French mathematical brothers who worked on partial differential equations.

name: Jacques Frédéric Français
summary: Jacques Français was a French mathematician who published a version of Argand's work on complex numbers.

name: Louis Benjamin Francoeur
summary: Louis Benjamin Francoeur was a French mathematician and astronomer who published some important textbooks.

name: Jérôme Franel
summary: Jérôme Franel was a Swiss mathematician who specialised in analytic number theory.

name: Marguerite Josephine Straus Frank
summary: Marguerite Straus Frank is famed both for her remarkable new discoveries of simple Lie algebras, and her solution to the problem of maximising a concave quadratic function, now known as the Frank-Wolfe algorithm.

name: Philipp Frank
summary: Philipp Frank was an Austrian-born physicist, mathematician and philosopher who moved to America.

name: Benjamin Franklin
summary: Benjamin Franklin was an American scientist and diplomat. His mathematical interests included magic squares.

name: Christine Ladd-Franklin
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Christine Ladd-Franklin was an American psychologist, logician and mathematician who was one of the earliest women to work in American universities.

name: Fabian Franklin
summary: Fabian Franklin was a Hungarian born American mathematician who worked on combinatorics. He was married to Christine Ladd-Franklin.

name: Philip Franklin
summary: Philip Franklin was an American mathematician who worked in analysis and graph theory.

name: Alexander Yule Fraser
summary: Alexander Yule Fraser was an Edinburgh teacher. With Barclay and Knott he was one of the writers who originally proposed the founding of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society.

name: Giovanni Frattini
summary: Giovanni Frattini was an Italian mathematician who made important contributions to group theory.

name: René Maurice Fréchet
summary: Maurice Fréchet was a French mathematician who made major contributions to the topology of point sets and defined and founded the theory of abstract spaces.

name: Erik Ivar Fredholm
summary: Fredholm is best remembered for his work on integral equations and spectral theory.

name: Michael Hartley Freedman
summary: Michael Freedman is an American mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on the Poincaré conjecture.

name: Friedrich Ludwig Gottlob Frege
summary: Gottlob Frege was a German mathematician who was one of the founders of modern symbolic logic putting forward the view that mathematics is reducible to logic.

name: Herta Taussig Freitag
summary: Herta Freitag was an Austrian-American mathematician known for her work on the Fibonacci numbers.

name: Celia Mary Hoyles
summary: Celia Hoyles is a Professor of Mathematics Education at University College London. She has received many honours for her contributions to education such as an OBE, a DBE, and the first Hans Freudenthal Medal by the International Commission on Mathematical Instruction.

name: Jean Frédéric Frenet
summary: Jean Frenet was a French mathematician best remembered for the Serret-Frenet formulas for a space-curve.

name: Jacov Il'ich Frenkel
summary: Jakov Il'ich Frenkel was a Russian physicist who worked in the field of condensed matter physics.

name: Augustin Jean Fresnel
summary: Augustin Fresnel did important work on optics where he was one of the founders of the wave theory of light.

name: Hans Freudenthal
summary: Hans Freudenthal was a German-born Dutch mathematician who made important contributions to algebraic topology. He also published works on history and mathematical education.

name: Erwin Finlay Freundlich
summary: Finlay Freundlich was a distinguished German astronomer who worked with Einstein on measurements of the orbit of Mercury to confirm the general theory of relativity. He left Germany to avoid Nazi rule and became the Napier Professor of Astronomy at St Andrews.

name: Gilbert Leslie Frewin
summary: Leslie Frewin graduated from the University of Edinburgh and taught at George Watson's College before moving to Inverness.

name: Robert Karl Emanuel Fricke
summary: Robert Fricke was a German mathematician who worked in complex analysis, especially on elliptic, modular and automorphic functions.

name: Aleksandr Aleksandrovich Friedmann
died_place: Leningrad, USSR (now St Petersburg, Russia again)
summary: Alexander Friedmann was a Russian physicist and mathematician best-known for his work on the theory of relativity and in particular for introducing the possibility of an expanding universe.

name: Kurt Otto Friedrichs
summary: Kurt Friedrichs was a German American mathematician who worked on many aspects of partial differential equations. He was the co-founder of the Courant Institute.

name: Paolo Frisi
summary: Paolo Frisi was an Italian mathematician who wrote on geometry, mechanics and cosmology.

name: Regnier Gemma Frisius
summary: Regnier Gemma Frisius was a Dutch mathematician who applied his mathematical expertise to geography, astronomy and map making. He became the leading theoretical mathematician in the Low Countries.

name: Ferdinand Georg Frobenius
summary: Georg Frobenius combined results from the theory of algebraic equations, geometry, and number theory, which led him to the study of abstract groups, the representation theory of groups and the character theory of groups.

name: Albrecht Fröhlich
summary: Albrecht Fröhlich was a German mathematician who made important contributions to group theory.

name: Robert Wertheimer Frucht
born_place: Brünn, Austria-Hungary, now Brno, Czech Republic
summary: Roberto Frucht was a Czech-born mathematician who moved to Chile before the Second World War. He worked in group theory and graph theory.

name: Guido Fubini
summary: Guido Fubini was an Italian mathematician who worked in many different areas including analysis, the calculus of variations and group theory.

name: Emil Klaus Julius Fuchs
summary: Klaus Fuchs was a German theoretical physicist best known as an atomic spy who supplied information to the Soviet Union.

name: Lazarus Immanuel Fuchs
summary: Lazarus Fuchs was a Prussian mathematician who worked on differential equations and the theory of functions.

name: Maximilian Ernst Richard Fuchs
summary: Richard Fuchs was a German mathematician who worked on differential equations and aerodynamics.

name: Karl Rudolf Fueter
summary: Rudolf Fueter was a Swiss mathematician, best known for his work on number theory.

name: Thomas Fuller
summary: Thomas Fuller was an African-born slave in America who was a prodigious mental calculator.

name: Hillel Furstenberg
summary: Hillel Furstenberg is a German-born American mathematician working in combinatorics, probability theory, ergodic theory and topological dynamics. He has been awarded major mathematical prizes including the Wolf Prize and the Abel Prize.

name: Friederich Pius Philipp Furtwängler
summary: Philipp Furtwängler was a German mathematician best known for his number theory and in particular for his proof of the principal ideal theorem.

name: Nicolaus Fuss
summary: Nikolai Fuss was a Swiss mathematician whose most important contribution was as amanuensis to Euler after he lost his sight.

name: David Gale
summary: David Gale was an American mathematician and economist who worked in mathematical economics, game theory, and convex analysis.

name: Boris Grigorievich Galerkin
summary: Boris Grigorievich Galerkin was a Soviet mathematician and engineer best known for his method of approximate integration.

name: Galileo Galilei
summary: Galileo Galilei was an Italian scientist who formulated the basic law of falling bodies, which he verified by careful measurements. He constructed a telescope with which he studied lunar craters, and discovered four moons revolving around Jupiter and espoused the Copernican cause.

name: Tibor Gallai
summary: Tibor Gallai was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in combinatorics and graph theory. He was a friend and collaborator of Paul Erdős.

name: Dionisio Gallarati
summary: Dionisio Gallarati was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Évariste Galois
summary: Évariste Galois was a French mathematician who produced a method of determining when a general equation could be solved by radicals and is famous for his development of early group theory. He died very young after fighting a duel.

name: Francis Galton
summary: Francis Galton was an English polymath, explorer, anthropologist and statistician. He invented the concept of "regression to the mean" and is famous as "the father of eugenics".

name: Mauro Graciano Ricalde Gamboa
summary: Graciano Ricalde was a self-taught Mexican mathematician who made contributions to solving quintic equations and Pell's equation. He also made contributions to astronomy but worked for most of his career as an accountant.

name: Alfonso Nápoles Gándara
summary: Alfonso Nápoles Gándara was the first Mexican mathematician to be awarded a Guggenheim fellowship. He was director of the Institute of Mathematics of the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México and president of the Mexican Mathematical Society for many years.

name: Cecilia Helena Payne-Gaposchkin
summary: Cecilia Payne-Gaposchkin was a British mathematician and astronomer who did important work for her Ph.D. at Radcliffe College of Harvard University. She showed that stars were composed almost entirely of hydrogen and helium but, although completely correct, it was rejected by astronomers at the time.

name: Roberto Vázquez García
summary: Roberto Vázquez was a 20th century Mexican mathematician who did outstanding work in topology. He was a pioneer of categorical topology and introduced the concept of a connection category.

name: Lars Gårding
summary: Lars Gårding was a Swedish mathematician who studied partial differential equations and partial differential operators.

name: Martin Gardner
summary: Martin Gardner was an American popular mathematics and science writer who had a long-running column on mathematical recreations in Scientific American.

name: Manuela Garín Pinillos de Álvarez
summary: Manuela Garín was one of the first women to study mathematics at a Mexican university. She played an important role in the Mexican Mathematics Society, organising two Congresses, and was the first director of the School of Advanced Studies of the University of Sonora.

name: Henri Georges Garnir
born_place: Jemeppe sur Meuse, near Liège, Belgium
summary: Henri Garnir was a Belgian mathematician whose fields of research were broad, including algebra and mathematical analysis.

name: Wolfgang Gaschütz
summary: Wolfgang Gaschütz was a German mathematician who worked on group theory, in particular in the theory of finite groups.

name: Qëndrim Gashi
summary: Qëndrim Gashi was a Yugoslavian mathematician, born in what is now Kosovo, who worked in group theory and was a founder of the Kosovan Mathematical Society.

name: Pierre Gassendi
summary: Pierre Gassendi was a French astronomer who was the first to observe a transit of Venus. He wrote on astronomy, his own astronomical observations and on falling bodies.

name: René Eugène Gateaux
summary: René Eugène Gateaux was a French mathematician who worked in the calculus of variations.

name: Caleb Gattegno
summary: Caleb Gattegno was an Egyption mathematical educator who is best known for his innovative approaches to teaching and learning mathematics, foreign languages and reading.

name: Johann Carl Friedrich Gauss
summary: Carl Friedrich Gauss worked in a wide variety of fields in both mathematics and physics incuding number theory, analysis, differential geometry, geodesy, magnetism, astronomy and optics. His work has had an immense influence in many areas.

name: Robert Charles Geary
summary: Robert Geary was an Irish mathematician who contributed to areas of statistical theory while working in Dublin as an official statistician.

name: al-Ishbili Abu Muhammad Jabir ibn Aflah
summary: Jabir ibn Aflah or Geber was an Spanish Islamic mathematician whose works were translated into Latin and so became available to European mathematicians.

name: Leopold Bernhard Gegenbauer
summary: Leopold Gegenbauer was an Austrian mathematician who gave his name to a sequence of orthogonal polynomials.

name: Hilda Geiringer von Mises
summary: Hilda Geiringer was an Austrian-born mathematician who worked in Statistics and Mechanics. She was married to Richard von Mises.

name: Karl Friedrich Geiser
summary: Karl Geiser was a Swiss mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry and minimal sufaces. He organised the first International Mathematical Congress in Zurich.

name: Abraham Markham Gelbart
summary: Abe Gelbart was an American mathematician who worked in complex function theory.

name: Israil Moiseevic Gelfand
summary: Israil Gelfand was a Ukranian mathematician who made important contributions to many areas including group theory, representation theory and functional analysis.

name: Aleksandr Osipovich Gelfond
summary: Gelfond developed basic techniques in the study of transcendental numbers.

name: Henry Gellibrand
summary: Henry Gellibrand was an English clergyman who worked on magnetic declination and who made mathematical contributions to navigation.

name: Geminus
summary: Geminus was a Stoic philosopher who wrote a number of astronomy texts including the influential Isagoge or Introduction to Astronomy. He attempted to prove Euclid's parallel postulate from the other axioms.

name: Zu Geng
summary: Zu Geng was a Chinese mathematician whose greatest achievement was to compute the diameter of a sphere of a given volume.

name: Angelo Genocchi
summary: Angelo Genocchi was an Italian mathematician who worked on number theory, series and the integral calculus.

name: William Gentle
summary: William Gentle graduated from the University of Edinburgh and taught at George Heriot's School Edinburgh. After being wounded in World War I he returned to George Heriot's and eventually became headmaster there.

name: Ruth Ellen Gentry
summary: Ruth Gentry was a pioneering American woman mathematician. She worked mainly in geometry.

name: Gerhard Gentzen
summary: Gerhard Gentzen invented a 'natural deduction' which provided a logic closer to mathematical reasoning than the systems proposed by Frege, Russell and Hilbert.

name: Zoárd Geöcze
summary: Zoárd Geöcze was a Hungarian mathematician famous for his theory of surfaces.

name: Francesco Gerbaldi
summary: Francesco Gerbaldi was an Italian geometer best known for his construction of the so-called six mutually apolar conics.

name: Joseph Diaz Gergonne
summary: Joseph Gergonne was a French mathematician who published an influential journal and made contributions to duality theory in projective geometry.

name: Marie-Sophie Germain
summary: Sophie Germain made a major contributions to number theory (in particular, the theory of primes), acoustics and elasticity.

name: Semyon Aranovich Gershgorin
summary: Semyon Gershgorin was a Belarussian mathematician who produced important results in numerical approximation.

name: František Josef Gerstner
summary: František Josef Gerstner was a Czech mathematician, astronomer and engineer. He is famed for transforming the Prague School of Engineers into the Prague Polytechnic Institute in 1806. It is now the Polytechnic University of Prague. He also produced a non-linear wave solution, known today as Gerstner waves or trochoidal waves.

name: Gherard of Cremona
summary: Gherard of Cremona was an Italian mathematician who worked in Spain and translated mathematical works from Arabic into Latin.

name: Marino Ghetaldi
summary: Marino Ghetaldi was a Croatian mathematician who published work with early applications of algebra to geometry.

name: Aldo Ghizzetti
summary: Aldo Ghizzetti was an Italian mathematician who worked in analysis, and in particular in applications .

name: Pietro Giannini
summary: Pietro Giannini was an 18th century Italian mathematician who spent most of his career in Spain. He wrote several articles and books, the most important being the four volume work Curso matemático written in Spanish.

name: David Gibb
summary: David Gibb graduated from Edinburgh University and went on to become a lecturer and reader there.

name: Josiah Willard Gibbs
summary: J Willard Gibbs was an American mathematician best-known for the Gibbs effect seen when Fourier-analysing a discontinuous function.

name: George Alexander Gibson
summary: George Gibson graduated from Glasgow University and went on to become Professor there. He published several important textbooks and was an enthusiast for the History of Mathematics.

name: Duilio Gigli
born_place: Sansepolcro, Alta Valle del Tevere, Italy
summary: Duilio Gigli was an Italian mathematician who produced works on algebra, geometry and mathematical analysis.

name: David Gilbarg
summary: David Gilbarg was an American mathematician who worked in fluid dynamics and nonlinear partial differential equations.

name: Robert Pollock Gillespie
summary: Robert Gillespie studied at Glasgow and Cambridge and then lectured at Glasgow University. His main interests were in analysis.

name: Leonard Gillman
summary: Leonard Gillman was an American mathematician who was also a classical pianist. He worked in set theory and game theory.

name: Corrado Gini
born_place: Motta di Livenza, near Treviso, Italy
summary: Corrado Gini was an Italian statistician, demographer and sociologist.

name: Jekuthiel Ginsburg
born_place: Lipniki, Volhynia, Russian Empire (now in Volyn Oblast, Ukraine)
summary: Jekuthiel Ginsburg was a Jewish-Polish mathematician whose career, in the first half of the 20th Century, was in the United States. A historian of mathematics, he is best known as the founder and first editor of the journal Scripta Mathematica.

name: Annibale Giuseppe Nicolò Giordano
born_place: Astalonga, San Giuseppe d'Ottajano, Kingdom of Naples (now San Giuseppe Vesuviano, Italy)
summary: Annibale Giordano was an Italian-French mathematician and revolutionary who produced some works on geometry. He was involved in Republican plots against the Bourbon monarchy.

name: Albert Girard
summary: Albert Girard was a French mathematician and musician. His work on trigonometry is the first to use the abbreviations sin, cos, tan.

name: Pierre Simon Girard
summary: Pierre-Simon Girard was a French mathematician and engineer. He published works on fluid flow.

name: Samuel Carlos Gitler Hammer
summary: Samuel Gitler was a Mexican mathematician who made outstanding contributions to algebraic topology. He played a major role in leading algebraic research groups in Mexico City and at the University of Rochester, New York.

name: James Whitbread Lee Glaisher
summary: Lee Glaisher was an English mathematician and astronomer who wrote over 400 articles on astronomy, special functions, calculation of numerical tables, number theory and the history of mathematics.

name: Dorothy Maud Wrinch
summary: Dorothy Maud Wrinch was an Argentinian-English-American mathematician and biochemist famous for her use of mathematical techniques to deduce protein structure.

name: Andrew Mattei Gleason
summary: Andrew Gleason was an American mathematician who made contributions to many areas of mathematics, including the solution of Hilbert's fifth problem.

name: James Glenie
summary: James Glenie was a Scottish mathematician who was involved in an early dispute in the Royal Society.

name: James Gilbert Glimm
summary: James Glimm is an American mathematician who researched in both pure and applied mathematics and whose work has revolutionised shock-wave theory and other fields of study.

name: Israel Everett Glover
summary: Israel Everett Glover was the first African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics by Oklahoma State University. He was appointed as Chairman of the Department of Mathematics at Florida A & M University in Tallahassee, Florida where he presided at the General Session of the five hundred and ninety-fourth meeting of the American Mathematical Society.

name: Lazar Matveevich Gluskin
summary: Lazar Gluskin was a Ukranian mathematician who worked on semigroups of linear transformations.

name: Boris Vladimirovich Gnedenko
summary: Boris Gnedenko was a Soviet mathematician best known for his work in probability theory.

name: Kurt Gödel
summary: Gödel proved fundamental results about axiomatic systems showing in any axiomatic mathematical system there are propositions that cannot be proved or disproved within the axioms of the system.

name: Roger Godement
summary: Roger Godement was a French mathematician, known for his work in functional analysis and for his expository books. He was an active member of Bourbaki.

name: Israel Gohberg
summary: Israel Gohberg was a Bessarabian-born mathematician who worked in operator theory and functional analysis.

name: Levan Petrovich Gokieli
summary: Levan Gokieli was a Georgian mathematician who worked on on mathematical logic, set theory, the history of mathematics and the philosophy of mathematics.

name: Stanisław Gołąb
summary: Stanisław Gołąb was a Polish mathematician who worked in particular on the field of affine geometry.

name: Christian Goldbach
summary: Christian Goldbach was a Prussian mathematician best known for the conjecture he made in a letter to Euler that every even integer > 2 is a sum of two primes.

name: Anatolii Asirovich Goldberg
summary: Anatolii Asirovich Goldbergwas a Ukranian mathematician who moved to Israel. He worked in complex analysis.

name: Alfred William Goldie
summary: Alfred Goldie was an English mathematician who proved an important result in Ring Theory.

name: Archibald Goldie
summary: Archibald Goldie studied at the universities of St Andrews and Cambridge. He served in the Meteorological Service of the British Army in World War I and continued to work in various branches of the Meteorological Office.

name: Cora Susana Sadosky
summary: Cora Sadosky was born in Argentina and became Professor of Mathematics at Howard University in the United States. She wrote over fifty papers in harmonic analysis and operator theory. She promoted women in mathematics as well encouraging greater participation of African-Americans in mathematics.

name: Sydney Goldstein
summary: Sydney Goldstein was a British mathematician best known for his contribution to fluid dynamics.

name: Herman Heine Goldstine
summary: Herman Goldstine was an American mathematician and computer scientist who helped to develop ENIAC, an early electronic digital computer.

name: Linda Goldway Keen
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Linda Keen is an American mathematician who is known for her work in hyperbolic geometry.

name: Jacobus Golius
summary: Jacob Golius or Jacob Gool was an orientalist, astronomer and mathematician based at the University of Leiden in Netherlands.

name: Gene Howard Golub
summary: Gene Golub was an Amercian mathematician who worked in numerical linear algebra.

name: Joaquim Gomes de Souza
summary: Joaquim Gomes de Souza was the first Brazilian to be awarded a doctorate in mathematics. He had great difficulty in getting his memoirs published since leading mathematicians of the time failed to report on them.

name: Elza Furtado Gomide
summary: Elza Furtado Gomide was the second Brazilian woman to be awarded a doctorate in mathematics. She served for many years as Head of Mathematics at the Institute of Mathematics and Statistics in the University of São Paulo. She was influential in promoting a debate on the role of the university in the training of qualified professionals.

name: Benjamin Gompertz
summary: Benjamin Gompertz was an English self-educated mathematician and actuary, who is best known for his "law of mortality".

name: Carlos de Siguenza y Gongora
summary: Siguenza y Gongora was a Mexican astronomer and philosopher.

name: Irving John Good
summary: Irving John Good was an English mathematician who worked at Bletchley Park and at GCHQ and later went on to work with computers and statistics.

name: Reuben Louis Goodstein
summary: Louis Goodstein was an English mathematician who worked on mathematical logic, in particular ordinal numbers, recursive arithmetic, analysis, and the philosophy of mathematics.

name: Gustav Adolph Göpel
summary: Adolph Göpel was a German mathematician who wrote an early paper on hyperelliptic functions.

name: Viktor Aleksandrovich Gorbunov
summary: Viktor Gorbunov was a Russian mathematician who worked in universal algebra and logic.

name: Paul Albert Gordan
summary: Paul Gordan worked with Clebsch on invariant theory and algebraic geometry. He also gave simplified proofs of the transcendence of e and π.

name: Daniel Gorenstein
summary: Daniel Gorenstein was an American mathematician best known for his part in the classification of finite simple groups.

name: William Sealy Gosset
summary: Gosset invented the t-test to handle small samples for quality control in brewing. He wrote under the name "Student".

name: Alice Bache Gould
summary: Alice Bache Gould was an American mathematician, philanthropist and historian, who spent much of her time in South America and Spain.

name: Édouard Jean-Baptiste Goursat
summary: Édouard Goursat was a French mathematician who is best known for his version of the Cauchy-Goursat theorem stating that the integral of a function round a simple closed contour is zero if the function is analytic inside the contour.

name: Govindasvami
summary: Govindasvami was an Indian mathematical astronomer whose most famous treatise was a commentary on work of Bhaskara I.

name: William Timothy Gowers
summary: Timothy Gowers won a Fields medal for his important contributions to functional analysis.

name: Johann Heinrich Graf
summary: Johann Heinrich Graf was a Swiss mathematician who worked mainly on the Bessel functions.

name: Karl Heinrich Gräffe
summary: Karl Gräffe was a German mathematician best remembered for his method of numerical solution of algebraic equations.

name: Eugene Alexander Graham Jr
summary: Eugene Alexander Graham Jr was awarded the Silver Star for gallantry in the Italian campaign of World War II. He was the first African American to study for a Ph.D. in mathematics outside the United States. Because of discrimination in the United States, he spent most of his career in France.

name: Ronald Lewis Graham
summary: Ron Graham was an American mathematician who made important contributions to combinatorics. He collaborated extensively with Paul Erdős.

name: Thomas Smith Graham
summary: Tommy Graham was a Scottish mathematician and algebraist who taught at Glasgow University for many years.

name: Jorgen Pedersen Gram
born_place: Nustrup (18 km W of Haderslev), Denmark
summary: Jorgen Gram was a Danish mathematician who is best remembered for the Gram-Schmidt orthogonalisation process.

name: Luigi Guido Grandi
summary: Guido Grandi was a Camaldolese monk who worked on geometry and hydraulics.

name: Evelyn Boyd Granville
summary: Evelyn Boyd Granville was only the second African-American woman to receive a PhD in mathematics from an American University. She worked in computing.

name: Hermann Günter Grassmann
summary: Hermann Grassmann is chiefly remembered for his development of a general calculus for vectors.

name: Ivor Owen Grattan-Guinness
summary: Ivor Grattan-Guinness was an English historian of mathematics and logic. He was a pioneer in expanding the role of the history of mathematics in education.

name: Hans Grauert
summary: Hans Grauert was a German mathematician who made important contributions to the theory of functions of several complex variables.

name: Dmitry Aleksandrovich Grave
summary: Dmitry Grave was a Russian-born mathematician who worked in algebra and number theory.

name: Charles Graves
summary: Charles Graves was an Irish mathematician who published on geometry and on Gaelic history. He and his brother John are credited with inspiring Hamiton to invent the quaternions.

name: John Thomas Graves
summary: John Graves was an Irish lawyer and mathematician who is credited with inspiring Hamilton to discover the quaternions and with personally discovering the octonions.

name: Willem Jacob 'sGravesande
summary: Willem 'sGravesande was a Dutch mathematician who expounded Newton's philosophy in Europe.

name: Andrew Gray
summary: Andrew Gray was a Scot who became Professor of Physics at University College Bangor and then returned to Glasgow as Kelvin's successor.

name: James Gordon Gray
summary: James Gray was the son of Andrew Gray. He graduated from University College Bangor and occupied a series of posts in Glasgow University, finishing as Professor of Applied Physics.

name: Marion Cameron Gray
summary: Marion Gray was a Scottish mathematician who went to Bryn Mawr College in the USA. The Gray graph is named after her.

name: Mary Lee Wheat Gray
summary: Mary Gray is an American mathematician, statistician, and lawyer. She has written on mathematics, education, computer science, statistics and academic freedom.

name: John Greaves
summary: John Greaves was an English mathematician who was interested in measuring ancient monuments.

name: William Michael Herbert Greaves
summary: William Greaves graduated from Cambridge and then worked at the Royal Observatory Greenwich. He became Professor of Astronomy in Edinburgh. He worked on both theoretical and practical astronomy.

name: George Green
summary: George Green was an English mathematician best-known for Green's function and Green's theorems in potential theory.

name: James Alexander Green
summary: Sandy Green was an American born British mathematician who worked in finite groups and representation theory.

name: Alfred George Greenhill
summary: George Greenhill became Professor of Mathematics at the Royal Military Academy at Woolwich. His main work was on Elliptic Functions but he published widely on applications of mathematics to practical problems.

name: Donald Greenspan
summary: Donald Greenspan was expert in numerical analysis and computational modelling who wrote many books, many of which took a different approach to teaching applied mathematics using numerical methods instead of the differential and integral calculus.

name: Harvey Philip Greenspan
summary: Harvey Greenspan played an important role in establishing Applied Mathematics as a subject in its own right in the United States. He studied fluid dynamics both from a theoretical and from an experimental perspective, making major contributions to fluid flow, wave motion and bio-fluid dynamics.

name: William John Greenstreet
summary: William J Greenstreet graduated from Cambridge and became headmaster of Marling School Stroud. He is best-known as the long-running editor of the Mathematical Gazette.

name: David Gregory
summary: David Gregory was was a nephew of James Gregory who become a professor of mathematics in Edinburgh and Oxford. He did important work on series and in optics and was a strong supporter of Newton in his dispute with Leibniz.

name: Duncan Farquharson Gregory
summary: Duncan Gregory was a Scottish mathematician who was one of the first to investigate modern ideas of abstract algebra. He was a great-great-grandson of James Gregory

name: James Gregory
summary: James Gregory was a Scottish scientist and first Regius Professor of Mathematics at St Andrews who described the first practical reflecting telescope. He worked on using infinite convergent series to find the areas of the circle and hyperbola.

name: Olinthus Gilbert Gregory
summary: Olinthus Gregory was an English mathematician, author and editor. He was one of the founders of the Royal Astronomical Society.

name: Alexander Barrie Grieve
summary: Barrie Grieve graduated from Edinburgh. He continued to research in Geometry and gained a DSc for this work. He became an HM Inspector of Schools.

name: Brian Griffiths
summary: Brian Griffiths was a English mathematician who worked in topology and was a pioneer in the development of mathematical education.

name: Lois Wilfred Griffiths
summary: Lois Wilfred Griffiths was an American mathematician best known for her work in polygonal numbers.

name: Phillip Augustus Griffiths
summary: Phillip Griffiths is an American mathematician, known for his work in geometry and algebraic geometry.

name: Bronius Grigelionis
summary: Bronius Grigelionis was a Lithuanian mathematician who worked in the theory of random processes and their statistics.

name: Francesco Maria Grimaldi
summary: Francesco Grimaldi was an Italian Jesuit priest, mathematician and physicist who worked in mechanics, philosophy, astronomy and optics.

name: Emanuels Grinbergs
summary: Emanuels Grinbergs was a Russian mathematician who worked in geometry and graph theory.

name: Walter Gröbli
summary: Walter Gröbli was a Swiss school teacher who helped organise the first Internatonal Congress of Mathematicians.

name: Detlef Gromoll
summary: Detlef Gromoll was an German mathematician who worked in America. He worked in differential geometry.

name: Mikhael Leonidovich Gromov
summary: Mikhael Gromov is a French-Russian mathematician best-known for his geometry. He won the Abel prize in 2009.

name: Thomas Hakon Grönwall
summary: Thomas Hakon Grönwall was a Swedish mathematician who applied mathematics to chemical and physical problems.

name: Ángel Palacio Gros
summary: Ángel Palacio Gros was a Spanish mathematician who fought for the Republicans and spent 8 years in prison before being able to emigrate to Venezuela. There he did excellent work as a mathematics professor and wrote four mathematics books which ran to several editions.

name: Robert Grosseteste
summary: Robert Grosseteste was an English bishop who worked on geometry, optics and astronomy and made Latin translations of many Greek and Arabic scientific writings.

name: Marcel Grossmann
summary: Marcel Grossmann was a Swiss mathematician and a friend and collaborator of Einstein.

name: Emil Grosswald
summary: Emil Grosswald was a Romanian mathematician who worked mainly in number theory.

name: Alexander Grothendieck
summary: Alexander Grothendieck was a German mathematician and Fields medal winner. He made important contributions in topology, algebra and logic.

name: Karl Walter Gruenberg
summary: Karl Gruenberg was an Austrian mathematician who worked in finite group theory.

name: Branko Grünbaum
summary: Branko Grünbaum was a Jewish Croatian mathematician who survived the Nazi invasion, later escaped to Israel where he obtained his doctorate, and had most of his career in the United States. He was a prolific author writing over 250 papers and four very influential books.

name: Fritz Alfred Joachim Grunewald
summary: Fritz Grunewald was a German mathematician who specialised in group theory.

name: Helmut Grunsky
summary: Helmut Grunsky was a German mathematician who worked in complex analysis and geometric function theory.

name: Géza Grünwald
summary: Géza Grünwald was a Hungarian mathematician who worked on analysis. He died in the Holocaust.

name: Xu Guangqi
summary: Xu Guang-qi was a Chinese mathematician who made Western mathematics available by translating works into Chinese.

name: Guarino Guarini
summary: Guarino Guarini was an Italian mathematician who worked in geometry and philosophy.

name: Salomon Eduard Gubler
summary: Eduard Gubler was a Swiss school teacher. His research interest was in the theory of Bessel functions.

name: Giovanni Battista Guccia
born_place: Palermo, Kingdom of the Two Sicilies (now Italy)
summary: Giovanni Battista Guccia was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Christoph Gudermann
summary: Christoph Gudermann worked on geometry and special functions. He taught Weierstrass.

name: Adam Wilhelm Siegmund Günther
summary: Adam Günther wa a German mathematician who published on pure mathematics and its history, and physics, geophysics, meteorology, geography, and astronomy.

name: Joséphine Guidy-Wandja
summary: Joséphine Guidy-Wandja was the first African woman with a Doctorat 3ème cycle in mathematics (Paris VI), the first African woman with a Ph.D. in mathematics (Abidjan) and the first African woman to become a professor of mathematics in a university (Abidjan).

name: Andrew Paul Guinand
summary: Andy Guinand was an Australian mathematician who worked in number theory (particularly prime numbers and the Riemann hypothesis), as well as generalizations of the Fourier transform.

name: Paul Guldin
summary: Paul Guldin was a Swiss mathematician who wrote on volumes and centres of gravity.

name: Edmund Gunter
summary: Edmund Gunter was an English clergyman who published trigonometric tables and was important in the development of the slide rule.

name: Guo Shoujing
summary: Guo Shoujing was a Chinese astronomer who worked on spherical trigonometry and the calendar.

name: Shanti Swarup Gupta
university: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
summary: Shanti Gupta was an Indian mathematician who worked in America. He worked in statistics and decision theory.

name: Stephen de Gurbs
summary: Stephen de Gurbs was notable for sponsoring a mathematical prize and stained glass window at the University of Aberdeen.

name: William Gilmour Guthrie
summary: William Guthrie graduated from Cambridge and gained an appointment at the University of St Andrews. He moved to become a professor at Magee College in Londonderry and eventually became Principal of the College.

name: Carmen Adelina Gutiérrez Alonso Moreno
summary: Adelina Gutiérrez was a Chilean professor, scientist and academic who was the main force behind setting up the first Bachelor's degree in Astronomy in Chile and later the first Master's degree in Astronomy. She was the first Chilean to obtain a doctorate in astrophysics and also the first woman elected to the Chilean Academy of Sciences.

name: Karl Friedrich August Gutzmer
