born_place: Neu-Roddahn, near Neustadt an der Dosse, Prussia (now Germany)
summary: August Gutzmer was a German mathematician who worked on differential equations.

name: Richard Lloyd Gwilt
summary: Richard Gwilt was an actuary who worked for various Edinburgh insurance companies. He was a Fellow of the Faculty of Actuaries and of the Institute of Actuaries.

name: Béla Gyires
university: József Nádor Mûszaki és Gazdaságtudományi Egyetem
summary: Béla Gyires was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in the theory of matrices, probability theory and mathematical statistics.

name: Julius Gysel
summary: Julius Gysel was a Swiss school-teacher with an interest in geometry.

name: Wang Xiaotong
summary: Wang Xiaotong was a Chinese mathematician and astronomer who was involved in calendar reform and the solution of cubic equations.

name: Wolfgang Siegfried Haack
summary: Wolfgang Siegfried Haack was a German mathematician and aerodynamicist famous for finding a shape with minimum drag.

name: Johannes Haantjes
summary: Johannes Haantjes was a Dutch mathematician who worked in differential geometry.

name: Alfréd Haar
summary: Alfréd Haar was a Hungarian mathematician who is best remembered for his work on analysis on groups, introducing a measure on groups, now called the Haar measure.

name: Jean Nicolas Pierre Hachette
summary: Jean Nicolas Pierre Hachette was a French mathematician who worked on descriptive geometry.

name: Jacques Salomon Hadamard
summary: Jacques Hadamard was a French mathematician whose most important result is the prime number theorem which he proved in 1896. This states that the number of primes < n tends to infinity as fast as n/log e n.

name: John Hadley
summary: John Hadley was an English instrument maker who improved the Gregorian reflecting telescope and invented the quadrant for navigation.

name: Frieda Nugel
summary: Frieda Nugel was a German mathematician who was one of the first women to receive a doctorate in Germany.

name: Hans Hahn
summary: Hans Hahn was an Austrian mathematician who is best remembered for the Hahn-Banach theorem. He also made important contributions to the calculus of variations, developing ideas of Weierstrass.

name: Wolfgang Hahn
summary: Wolfgang Hahn was a German mathematician who worked on special functions, in particular orthogonal polynomials.

name: Jaroslav Hájek
summary: Jaroslav Hájek was a Czech mathematician who worked in theoretical and nonparametric statistics.

name: András Hajnal
summary: András Hajnal was a Hungarian mathematician who worked on set theory, particularly combinatorial set theory, set theoretic topology and combinatorics. He wrote over 60 joint papers with Erdős.

name: Robert Haldane
summary: Robert Haldane was a Scottish clergyman who was appointed Regius Professor of Mathematics at St Andrews, even though he did little mathematics.

name: Marshall Hall Jr
summary: Marshall Hall, Jr was an American mathematician who made important contributions to group theory and combinatorics.

name: Philip Hall
summary: Philip Hall was the main impetus behind the British school of group theory and the growth of group theory to be one of the major mathematical topics of the 20th Century was largely due to him.

name: Ferdinand Augustin Hallerstein
summary: Augustin Hallerstein was born in Ljubljana (now in Slovenia) and entered the Jesuit Order. After studying and teaching in Europe he went to China as a Jesuit missionary. He became head of the Mathematics and Astronomy Board of the Imperial Court but maintained extensive contacts with the Royal Society in London, the Imperial Observatory in Vienna and the Academy of St Petersburg.

name: Edmond Halley
summary: Edmond Halley was an English astronomer who calculated the orbit of the comet now called Halley's comet. He was a supporter of Newton.

name: Paul Richard Halmos
summary: Paul Halmos was a Hungarian-American mathematician who made fundamental advances in the areas of logic, probability, statistics, operator theory and functional analysis. He is best known for some of his text-books and for his collection of mathematicians' photographs.

name: George Henri Halphen
summary: George-Henri Halphen was a French mathematician who worked on the singularity theory of algebraic curves as well as invariant theory and projective differential geometry.

name: George Bruce Halsted
summary: George Halsted was an American mathematician who explored foundations of geometry and introduced non-Euclidean geometry into the United States. He was interested in mathematical education and in the history of mathematics.

name: Hans Ludwig Hamburger
summary: Hans Ludwig Hamburger was a German mathematician. He spent the Second World War in England and afterwards was a professor at universities in Berlin, Cologne and Ankara.

name: Georg Karl Wilhelm Hamel
summary: Georg Hamel was a German mathematician who worked in mechanics, the foundations of mathematics and function theory.

name: Christine Mary Hamill
summary: Christine Hamill was an English mathematician who specialised in group theory and finite geometry.

name: William Stirling Hamilton
summary: William Hamilton was a Scottish philosopher whose approach to logic influenced Boole, De Morgan and others.

name: William Rowan Hamilton
summary: William Rowan Hamilton was an Irish astronomer and mathematician who discovered the quaternions.

name: Peter Ladislaw Hammer
summary: Peter Ladislaw Hammer was a Romanian-born mathematician who worked in Israel, Canada and the USA. He worked in operations research and applied discrete mathematics.

name: John Michael Hammersley
summary: John Hammersley was a Scottish mathematician who worked in statistics and probability and in particular in Monte Carlo methods.

name: Richard Wesley Hamming
summary: Richard Hamming was an American mathematician and computer scientist, best known for the so-called Hamming code.

name: Hermann Hankel
summary: Hermann Hankel was a German mathematician who worked on the theory of complex numbers, the theory of functions and the history of mathematics. He is remembered for the Hankel transform and the Hankel matrix.

name: Frank Harary
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Frank Harary was an American mathematician known as one of the "fathers" of modern graph theory.

name: Frances Hardcastle
summary: Frances Hardcastle was an English mathematician who held fellowships in the United States. She studied point groups and wrote some important works. She also was a major figure in the Women's Suffrage movement and was secretary of the National Union of Women's Suffrage Societies.

name: Patrick Alexander Sinclair Hardie
summary: Patrick Hardie graduated from Edinburgh University. He spent most of his career teaching in Egypt at Alexandria and Cairo.

name: Robert Purves Hardie
summary: Robert Hardie graduated from Oxford and occupied various posts in the Philosophy department of Edinburgh University.

name: Claude Hardy
summary: Claude Hardy was a French lawyer and amateur mathematician who made Latin translations of some of Euclid's work.

name: Godfrey Harold Hardy
summary: Hardy's interests covered many topics of pure mathematics:- Diophantine analysis, summation of divergent series, Fourier series, the Riemann zeta function and the distribution of primes.

name: Spiru Haret
summary: Spiru Haret was a Romanian mathematician, astronomer and politician. He made a fundamental contribution to the n-body problem in celestial mechanics.

name: Harish-Chandra
summary: Harish-Chandra was an Indian-born mathematician and physicist who worked mainly in America and did fundamental work in representation theory, especially on Lie groups.

name: Marie-Jeanne Amélie Harlay
summary: Amélie Harlay was a French astronomer who published navigational tables and catalogues of stars.

name: Leo Harmaja
summary: Leo Harmaja was a Finnish statistician and economist who was the first president of the Finnish Statistical Society.

name: Karl Gustav Axel von Harnack
summary: Axel Harnack was an Estonian-born German mathematician who contributed to potential theory.

name: Laurence Raymond Harper Jr
summary: Laurence Raymond Harper Jr was an African American whose Ph.D. at the University of Chicago was supervised by Abraham Adrian Albert. He was a mathematics professor at the University of Minnesota for 47 years.

name: Thomas Harriot
summary: Thomas Harriot was an English mathematician who did outstanding work on the solution of equations, recognising negative roots and complex roots in a way that makes his solutions look almost like a present day solution.

name: Andrew Searle Hart
summary: Andrew Hart was an Irish mathematician who wrote on geometry.

name: Brian Hartley
summary: Brian Hartley was an English mathematician whose main topic was locally finite groups where he used his wide knowledge of finite groups in proving properties of infinite groups which were in a sense close to finite.

name: Friedrich Moritz Hartogs
summary: Friedrich Hartogs was a Belgian mathematician, known for his work on set theory and foundational results on several complex variables.

name: Douglas Rayner Hartree
summary: Douglas Hartree was an English mathematician and physicist who worked in numerical analysis.

name: Josephat Martin (Fanyana Mutyambizi) Harvey
summary: Martin Harvey was a Rhodesian mathematician who was the first person to gain a doctorate in mathematics from the University of Rhodesia.

name: Colin Brian Haselgrove
summary: Brian Haselgrove was an English mathematician who worked in number theory and is best known for his disproof of the Pólya conjecture.

name: Helmut Hasse
summary: Helmut Hasse did fundamental work in algebra and number theory.

name: István Hatvani
summary: István Hatvani was a Hungarian mathematician who wrote a pioneering work on probability and statistics.

name: Nikolaos I Hatzidakis
summary: Nikolaos Hatzidakis was a Greek mathematician, poet and patriot. He worked in differential geometry.

name: Lene Vestergaard Hau
summary: Lene Hau is a Danish physicist and mathematician. She has led a team at Harvard University who have slowed light and in 2001 succeeded in stopping a beam of light. This has important applications to quantum computing.

name: Samuel Haughton
summary: Samuel Haughton was an Irish mathematician, geologist and priest who published on a wide variety of topics. He is remembered for his work on hanging as a humane method of execution.

name: Otto Haupt
summary: Otto Haupt was a German mathematician who specialised in geometry and real analysis.

name: Felix Hausdorff
summary: Hausdorff worked in topology creating a theory of topological and metric spaces. He also worked in set theory and introduced the concept of a partially ordered set.

name: Thomas Henry Havelock
summary: Thomas Havelock was an English applied mathematician, hydrodynamicist and mathematical physicist. He became a professor at the Armstrong College in Durham. He had close contacts with the Department of Naval Architecture for many years.

name: Stephen William Hawking
summary: Stephen Hawking was one of the world's foremost theoretical physicists famous for his work on black holes.

name: Qamil Haxhibeqiri
summary: Qamil Haxhibeqiri was a Yugoslavian mathematician, born in what is now Kosovo, who worked in topology and was the second president of the Kosovan Mathematical Society.

name: Louise Schmir Hay
summary: Louise Szmir Hay was a French-born American mathematician who worked on recursively enumerable sets and computational complexity theory.

name: Charles Hayes
summary: Charles Hayes was an English mathematician and chronologist, who wrote an early book on the method of fluxions.

name: David Ryan Hayes
summary: David Hayes was an American mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Ellen Amanda Hayes
summary: Ellen Hayes was an American mathematician and astronomer. She was one of the first female American professors. She was one of the first seven women to join the New York Mathematical Society in 1891.

name: Walter Kurt Hayman
summary: Walter Hayman was a German born British mathematician best known for work in complex analysis.

name: Martha Euphemia Lofton Haynes
summary: Euphemia Lofton Haynes was an American mathematician and educator. She was the first African-American woman to earn a PhD in mathematics.

name: Olive Clio Hazlett
summary: Olive Clio Hazlett was an American mathematician who worked in algebra. Between 1914 and 1930 she published fourteen papers that were presented at meetings of the American Mathematical Society. She did outstanding work for the Cryptanalysis Committee during World War II.

name: Thomas Little Heath
summary: Thomas Heath wrote important works on the History of Mathematics: in particular on the mathematics of the ancient Greeks.

name: Henry C Heaton
died_place: Biddle, Power River County, Montana, USA
summary: Henry Heaton was an American amateur mathematician who published a large number of elegant problems and puzzles.

name: Oliver Heaviside
summary: Oliver Heaviside proved important results in electromagnetism and vector calculus. He reduced Maxwell's 20 equations in 20 variables to 4 equations in 2 variables.

name: Percy John Heawood
summary: Heawood made important contributions to the four colour theorem.

name: Daniel Friedrich Hecht
summary: Daniel Hecht was a German mathematician who wrote several high school texts.

name: Erich Hecke
summary: Erich Hecke was a Polish-born German mathematician whose best work was in analytic number theory.

name: Earle Raymond Hedrick
summary: Earle Hedrick was an American mathematician who worked on partial differential equations and on functions of complex variables. He was the first president of the MAA and he became the Vice-president and Provost of the University of California.

name: Poul Heegaard
summary: Poul Heegaard was a Danish mathematician who (with Max Dehn) was the first to classify compact surfaces.

name: Hans Arnold Heilbronn
summary: Hans Heilbronn was a German mathematician who worked in algebraic number theory.

name: Heinrich Eduard Heine
summary: Eduard Heine is best remembered for the Heine-Borel theorem. He was responsible for the introduction of the idea of uniform continuity.

name: Juha Heinonen
summary: Juha Heinonen was a Finnish born mathematician who worked in America and was known for his research on geometric function theory.

name: Valentin Heins
born_place: Free Imperial City of Hamburg (now Germany)
died_place: Free Imperial City of Hamburg (now Germany)
summary: Valentin Heins was a German teacher and accountant who was one of the founders of the Hamburg Mathematical Society

name: Werner Karl Heisenberg
summary: Werner Heisenberg did important work in Quantum Mechanics as well as nuclear physics.

name: Ernst David Hellinger
summary: Hellinger introduced a new type of integral: the Hellinger integral . Jointly with Hilbert he produced an important theory of forms.

name: John Hellins
summary: John Hellins was an English mathematician, astronomer and country parson.

name: Clarisse Doris Hellman
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Doris Hellman was an American historian of Science.

name: Eduard Helly
summary: Helly worked on functional analysis and proved the Hahn-Banach theorem in 1912 fifteen years before Hahn published essentially the same proof and 20 years before Banach gave his new setting.

name: Hermann Ludwig Ferdinand von Helmholtz
summary: Hermann von Helmholtz was a German mathematician who trained as a medical doctor and made important contributions to mathematical physics, optics and acoustics as well as to physiology and psychology.

name: Acharya Hemchandra
summary: Hemchandra was a Sanskrit scholar who published works on science, languages and philosophy.

name: Joel Evans Hendricks
summary: Joel E Hendricks was an American mathematician important as the founder of The Analyst journal.

name: Olaus Magnus Friedrich Erdmann Henrici
summary: Olaus Henrici was a German mathematician who became a professor in London.

name: Peter K Henrici
summary: Peter Henrici was a Swiss mathematician best known for his work in the field of numerical analysis.

name: Anna Adelaide Stafford Henriques
summary: Anna Stafford Henriques was an American mathematician who became one of the first two women to undertake research at the Institute for Advanced Study. She worked at several universities concentrating on teaching.

name: Kurt Hensel
summary: Hensel invented the p-adic numbers, an algebraic theory which has proved important in later applications.

name: Heraclides of Pontus
summary: Heraclides is a Greek astronomer who proposed that the earth rotates on its axis once a day and who may have believed that the sun was the centre of the solar system.

name: Jacques Herbrand
summary: Jacques Herbrand was a French mathematician who died young but made contributions to mathematical logic.

name: Gustav Herglotz
summary: Gustav Herglotz was a Czech-born German mathematician best known for his works on the theory of relativity and seismology.

name: Pierre Hérigone
summary: Pierre Hérigone was a French mathematician who wrote a compendium of elementary mathematics written in French and Latin.

name: John William Jamieson Herivel
summary: John Herivel was an Irish mathematician and historian of science who was a former World War II codebreaker at Bletchley Park.

name: Jakob Hermann
summary: Jakob Hermann was a Swiss mathematician who made contributions to dynamics.

name: Charles Hermite
summary: Charles Hermite's work in the theory of functions includes the application of elliptic functions to the quintic equation. He published the first proof that e is a transcendental number.

name: Heron of Alexandria
summary: Heron or Hero of Alexandria was an important geometer and worker in mechanics who invented many machines including a steam turbine. His best known mathematical work is the formula for the area of a triangle in terms of the lengths of its sides.

name: Caroline Lucretia Herschel
summary: Caroline Herschel recorded the observations and did the calculations on the data of her astronomer brother William.

name: John Frederick William Herschel
summary: John Herschel was an English scientist who worked on astronomy and early photography. He was the son of William Herschel.

name: Frederick William Herschel
born_place: Hanover, Electorate of Holy Roman Empire (now Germany)
summary: William Herschel was a German-born composer who turned to astronomy. He is best known for his discovery of Uranus.

name: Israel Nathan Herstein
summary: Yitz Herstein was a Polish mathematician who worked in America. He worked on ring theory but he is best known for his algebra text-books.

name: Gustav Ludwig Hertz
summary: Gustav Hertz was a German physicist and Nobel Prize winner for his work on inelastic electron collisions in gases.

name: Heinrich Rudolf Hertz
summary: Heinrich Hertz was a German physicist and mathematician best known for his discovery of what became known as wireless waves.

name: Maximilian Jacob Herzberger
summary: Maximilian Herzberger was a German-American mathematician and physicist who made impoertant contributions to optics.

name: Albin Herzog
summary: Albin Herzog was a Swiss mathematician who was director of the ETH Zurich. His main interest was in mechanics.

name: Ludwig Otto Hesse
summary: Otto Hesse worked on the development of the theory algebraic functions and the theory of invariants. He is remembered particularly for introducing the Hessian determinant.

name: Karl Heun
summary: Karl Heun was a German mathematician best known for the Heun differential equation which generalises the hypergeometric differential equation.

name: Hendrik van Heuraet
summary: Hendrik van Heuraet was a Dutch mathematician who made some contributions to integration.

name: Catherina Elisabetha Koopman Hevelius
summary: Elisabetha Koopman was the wife of the Polish astronomer Johannes Hevelius and helped him with his observations.

name: Johannes Hevelius
summary: Johannes Hevelius was a Polish astronomer who published important observations with the help of his wife.

name: Edwin Hewitt
summary: Edwin Hewitt made fundamental contributions to functional analysis, measure theory, and topology as well as Diophantine approximation, the structure of semigroups and abstract harmonic analysis. He is well-known for his discovery, in collaboration with Leonard Jimmie Savage, of the Hewitt-Savage zero-one law.

name: Arend Heyting
summary: Arend Heyting is important in the development of intuitionistic logic and algebra.

name: Erwin Nick Hiebert
summary: Erwin Hiebert was a Canadian historian and philosopher of science.

name: Donald Gordon Higman
summary: Donald Higman was an Canadian mathematician best known for his work in group theory and in particular for the discovery of one of the sporadic simple groups.

name: Graham Higman
summary: Graham Higman was an English mathematician who is known for his outstanding work in all aspects of the theory of groups.

name: Emil Hilb
summary: Emil Hilb was a German mathematician who did excellent work on special functions, differential equations and difference equations. His contributions to the Enzyklopädie der mathematischen Wissenschaften are also important.

name: David Hilbert
born_place: Wehlau, near Königsberg, Prussia (now Kaliningrad, Russia)
summary: Hilbert's work in geometry had the greatest influence in that area after Euclid. A systematic study of the axioms of Euclidean geometry led Hilbert to propose 21 such axioms and he analysed their significance. He made contributions in many areas of mathematics and physics.

name: John A Hildebrant
summary: John Hildebrant was an American mathematician and specialist in semigroup theory.

name: George William Hill
summary: George Hill was an American astronomer and mathematician. who worked on the three-body problem and later on the four-body problem.

name: Micaiah John Muller Hill
summary: M J M Hill was professor at University College, London. He did important work on hydrodynamics and also on the teaching of mathematics, particularly on teaching Euclid's Elements.

name: Einar Carl Hille
summary: Einar Carl Hille was an American mathematician who worked on analysis and functional analysis.

name: Peter John Hilton
summary: Peter Hilton was an English mathematician who made important contributions to homotopy theory. He is best known for his text-books and for his work as a code-breaker in World War II.

name: Carl Friedrich Hindenburg
summary: Carl Friedrich Hindenburg published a series of works on combinatorial mathematics.

name: Xiong Qinglai
born_place: Xizhai village, Mile County, Yunnan, China
summary: Xiong Qinglai was a Chinese mathematician who served as a highly successful president of three major Chinese universities. His outstanding research as a function-theorist was claimed by a reviewer to be of the first rank even comparable with Émile Borel and Rolf Nevanlinna.

name: Hipparchus of Rhodes
summary: Hipparchus was a Greek mathematician who compiled an early example of trigonometric tables and gave methods for solving spherical triangles.

name: Hippias of Elis
summary: Hippias was a Greek contemporary of Socrates whose only contribution to mathematics seems to be the quadratrix - a curve he may have used for squaring the circle and trisecting angles.

name: Hippocrates of Chios
summary: Hippocrates was a Greek mathematician who worked on the classical problems of squaring the circle and duplicating the cube.

name: Heisuke Hironaka
summary: Heisuke Hironaka is a Japanese mathematician who won a Fields Medal in 1970 for his contributions to algebraic geometry.

name: Arthur Hirsch
summary: Arthur Hirsch was a German mathematician (born in Königsberg) who worked on differential equations and hypergeometric functions.

name: Kurt Hirsch
summary: Kurt Hirsch worked in various areas of Group Theory.

name: Thomas Archer Hirst
summary: Thomas Hirst was an English mathematician who worked in geometry. He is best known for his journal in which he recorded impressions of the many mathematicians he met.

name: Friedrich Ernst Peter Hirzebruch
summary: Friedrich Hirzebruch was a German mathematician who made important contributions to topology.

name: Edmund Hlawka
born_place: Bruck an der Mur, Styria, Austria
summary: Edmund Hlawka was an Austrian mathematician who made important contributions to the geometry of numbers, to the theory of uniform distribution and to numerical integration.

name: Thomas Hobbes
summary: Thomas Hobbes was an English scholar and amateur mathematician who wrote on optics and on geometry. He attacked the 'new' methods of mathematical analysis.

name: Ernest William Hobson
summary: Ernest Hobson wrote the first English book on the measure theory and integration of Baire, Borel and Lebesgue.

name: William Vallance Douglas Hodge
summary: William Hodge was Lowndean Professor of Astronomy and Geometry at Cambridge. His main interests were in Algebraic Geometry and Differential Geometry.

name: Jock Hoe
summary: Jock Hoe, a New Zealander with Cantonese parents, made a substantial contribution with his work on The Jade Mirror of the Four Unknowns translating and giving an important commentary on this Chinese mathematical work of 1303.

name: Wassily Hoeffding
summary: Wassily Hoeffding was a Finnish statistician and probability theorist.

name: Hans-Jürgen Hoehnke
born_place: Free City of Danzig (now Gdańsk, Poland)
summary: Hans-Jürgen Hoehnke was a German mathematician, born in what is now Poland, who studied algebra.

name: Lancelot Thomas Hogben
summary: Lancelot Hogben was a biologist who wrote Mathematics for the Million, one of the most popular mathematics books of all time. As well as many important contributions to biology, he published on linguistics and statistics.

name: Ludwig Otto Hölder
summary: Otto Hölder worked on the convergence of Fourier series and in 1884 he discovered the inequality now named after him. He became interested in group theory through Kronecker and Klein and proved the uniqueness of the factor groups in a composition series.

name: Herman Hollerith
summary: Herman Hollerith was the inventor of the punched card system which predated electronic computers.

name: Bernt Michael Holmboe
summary: Bernt Holmboe was a Norwegian mathematician best known as the teacher of Niels Henrik Abel.

name: Johannes de Sacrobosco
summary: John of Holywood or Johannes de Sacrobosco was an English scholar who wrote an important text on astronomy and promoted Arabic methods of arithmetic and algebra.

name: Taira Honda
summary: Taira Honda was a Japanese mathematician who made important contributions to number theory.

name: Liu Hong
summary: Liu Hong was a Chinese astronomer who was involved in calendar reform.

name: Luoxia Hong
summary: Luoxia Hong was a Chinese astronomer who was involved in calendar reform.

name: Chaim Samuel Hönig
summary: Chaim Samuel Hönig was born in Berlin but became a Brazilian citizen. He was the founder of the Brazilian Mathematics Colloquium in 1957 and its first organiser. He was also a founder of the Brazilian Mathematical Society in 1969 and its first president.

name: Robert Hooke
summary: Robert Hooke was an English scientist who made contributions to many different fields including mathematics, optics, mechanics, architecture and astronomy. He had a famous quarrel with Newton.

name: Eberhard Frederich Ferdinand Hopf
summary: Eberhard Hopf was an Austrian mathematician who made significant contributions in topology and ergodic theory.

name: Heinz Hopf
summary: Hopf's work was in algebraic topology. He studied vector fields and extended Lefschetz's fixed point formula. He also studied homotopy classes and defined what is now known as the 'Hopf invariant'.

name: William Hopkins
summary: William Hopkins was an English mathematician best-known as a tutor for the Cambridge tripos examinations.

name: John Hopkinson
summary: John Hopkinson was an English mathematician and engineer who applied mathematics to electricity.

name: Grace Brewster Murray Hopper
summary: Grace Hopper was one of the pioneers in the development of the electronic computer. She is (probably) the only mathematician to have a warship named after her.

name: Lars Valter Hörmander
summary: Lars Hörmander was a Swedish mathematician who won a Fields medal and a Wolf prize for his work on partial differential equations.

name: Friedrich Josef Maria Horn
summary: Friedrich Horn was an Austrian mathematician who applied mathematics to chemical engineering.

name: William George Horner
summary: William Horner was an English mathematician best known for his method of solving algebraic equations.

name: Jeremiah Horrocks
summary: Jeremiah Horrocks was an English astronomer who improved Kepler's tables and worked on the lunar theory.

name: Ellice Martin Horsburgh
summary: Ellice Horsburgh graduated from Edinburgh and became a lecturer in Technical Mathematics at the University.

name: János Horváth
summary: János Horváth was a Hungarian-American mathematician noted for his contributions to analysis especially in functional analysis and distribution theory.

name: Harold Hotelling
summary: Harold Hotelling was an American mathematical statistician who wrote important papers on economics as well as on statistics.

name: Guillaume Jules Hoüel
died_place: Périers sur le Dan (near Caen), France
summary: Jules Hoüel was a French mathematician who publicised non-Euclidean geometry. He also worked on mathematical astronomy.

name: Alston Scott Householder
summary: Alston Householder was an American mathematician who worked in mathematical biology and numerical analysis.

name: John Mackintosh Howie
summary: John Howie was a Scottish mathematician who was Regius Professor of Mathematics at the University of St Andrews for more than 40 years. He was a specialist in semigroup theory.

name: Arnljot Høyland
summary: Arnljot Høyland was a Norwegian mathematical statistician who worked in reliability theory.

name: Fred Hoyle
summary: Fred Hoyle was an English astronomer best known for his espousal of the "steady-state" theory of the universe and rejecting the "big bang" theory. He also wrote science fiction.

name: Juraj Hronec
born_place: Gocovo, Roznava District, Kingdom of Hungary (now Slovakia)
summary: Jur Hronec was a Slovak mathematician who made extraordinary contributions to the development of higher mathematics in Slovakia. He was a major figure in establishing several universities in Slovakia.

name: Xiahou Yang
summary: Xiahou Yang was a Chinese mathematician who wrote the text Xiahou Yang suanjing (Xiahou Yang's Mathematical Manual).

name: Chuan-Chih Hsiung
summary: Chuan-Chih Hsiung was a Chinese-born American mathematician specialising in differential geometry.

name: Pao-Lu Hsu
summary: Pao-Lu Hsu was a Chinese mathematician who worked in probability theory and statistics.

name: Hua Loo-Keng
summary: Hau Loo-Keng was a Chinese mathematician and politician famous for his important contributions to number theory.

name: Edwin Powell Hubble
summary: Edwin Hubble was an American astronomer who first detected that the universe is expanding.

name: Johann van Waveren Hudde
university: Universiteit Leiden and Académie de Saumur
summary: Johann Hudde was a Dutch mathematician who worked on maxima and minima and the theory of equations. He gave an ingenious method to find multiple roots of an equation.

name: Hilda Phoebe Hudson
summary: Hilda Hudson was an English mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry.

name: András P Huhn
summary: András Huhn was a Hungarian mathematician who worked on the representation of distributive semilattices.

name: Liu Hui
summary: Liu Hui was a Chinese mathematician who wrote a commentary of the Nine Chapters on the Mathematical Art.

name: Yang Hui
summary: Yang Hui was a Chinese mathematician who wrote several outstanding mathematical texts. These contained solutions of quadratic equations as well as Pascal's triangle and magic squares.

name: Marie Georges Humbert
summary: Georges Humbert was a French mathematician who worked on geometry and hyperelliptic functions.

name: Pierre Humbert
summary: Pierre Humbert graduated from the École Polytechnique in Paris and then moved to Edinburgh to do research under Whittaker. He spent most of his career in the University of Montpellier. He worked on Special Functions.

name: Abu Zayd Hunayn ibn Ishaq al-Ibadi
summary: Hunayn ibn Ishaq was a Nestorian Christian mathematician who is most important as a translator, making Greek works available to the Islamic mathematicians.

name: Gilbert Agnew Hunt
summary: Gilbert Hunt was an American mathematician who worked in probability theory, Markov processes and potential theory.

name: Edward Vermilye Huntington
summary: Edward Huntington was an American mathematician who worked in what are now known as metamathematics and model theory.

name: Jenő Hunyadi
summary: Jenő Hunyady was a Hungarian mathematician noted for his work on conic sections and linear algebra, specifically on determinants.

name: Witold Hurewicz
summary: Witold Hurewicz made important contributions to algebraic topology including discovering higher homotopy groups.

name: Adolf Hurwitz
summary: Hurwitz studied the genus of the Riemann surface and worked on how class number relations could be derived from modular equations.

name: Charles Hutton
summary: Charles Hutton was an English mathematician who wrote arithmetic textbooks.

name: James Hutton
summary: James Hutton was a Scottish chemist and geologist best known for his theory of the age of the Earth. He was greatly influenced by Newton's work.

name: Christiaan Huygens
summary: Christiaan Huygens was a Dutch mathematician who patented the first pendulum clock, which greatly increased the accuracy of time measurement. He laid the foundations of mechanics and also worked on astronomy and probability.

name: John Hymers
summary: John Hymers wrote many excellent textbooks. He organised the painting of a portrait of William Wordsworth for St John's College, Cambridge. He left a considerable sum of money for the founding and endowment of Hymers' College in Hull.

name: Hypatia of Alexandria
summary: Hypatia was the first woman to make a substantial contribution to the development of mathematics. She was killed by a fanatical Christian sect.

name: Hypsicles of Alexandria
summary: Hypsicles was a Greek mathematician who wrote a treatise on regular polyhedra. He is the author of what has been called Book XIV of Euclid's Elements, a work which deals with inscribing regular solids in a sphere.

name: Caius Iacob
summary: Caius Iacob was a Romanian mathematician and politician who worked in classical hydrodynamics and fluid mechanics.

name: Abu Nasr Mansur ibn Ali ibn Iraq
summary: Abu Nasr Mansur was an Islamic prince and mathematician who collaborated with al-Biruni on astronomy and mathematics. He discovered the sine rule for triangles.

name: Kushyar ibn Labban
summary: Kushyar ibn Labban was a Persian astronomer who wrote an early work on Hindu numerals.

name: Al-Sabi Thabit ibn Qurra al-Harrani
summary: Thabit ibn Qurra was an important Islamic mathematician who worked on number theory, astronomy and statics.

name: Ibrahim ibn Sinan ibn Thabit ibn Qurra
summary: Ibrahim ibn Sinan was an Islamic mathematician and astronomer who studied geometry and in particular tangents to circles. He also made advances in the theory of integration.

name: Abu'l-Hasan Ali ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Yunus
summary: Ibn Yunus was an Islamic mathematician known for his astronomical observations and for his many trigonometrical and astronomical tables.

name: Masatoshi Gündüz Ikeda
summary: Gündüz 0keda was a Japanese-born Turkish mathematician who worked in the field of algebraic number theory.

name: Esteban Terradas i Illa
summary: Esteban Terradas was Spanish was a mathematician, physicist and engineer. He held prestigious positions in Barcelona and Madrid universities and also made considerable contributions to the development of Spanish railways, aerospace, and other industries.

name: Hildegard Rothe-Ille
summary: Hildegard Rothe-Ille was a German mathematician advised by Issai Schur. She married the mathematician Erich Rothe in 1928 and after her marriage reviewed around 170 papers before having to flee from the Nazi regime in 1937.

name: Edward Lindsay Ince
summary: Edward Ince graduated from Edinburgh and researched at Edinburgh and Cambridge. He worked at universities in Leeds, Liverpool, Cairo, Edinburgh and Imperial College London before moving back to Edinburgh as Head of Technical Mathematics. He worked on Special Functions.

name: Leopold Infeld
summary: Leopold Infeld was a Polish physicist who worked in the theory of relativity.

name: Roman Stanislaw Ingarden
summary: Roman Ingarden was a Polish physicist who worked mainly in optics and statistical mechanics.

name: Albert Edward Ingham
summary: Albert Ingham was an English mathematician who worked in number theory and in particular on the prime number theorem.

name: Filadelfo Insolera
summary: Filadelfo Insolera was an Italian mathematician best known for his work on statistics and financial mathematics.

name: Ion N Ionescu-Bizet
summary: Ion Ionescu was a Romanian mathematician and engineer. He was one of the founders of the Gazeta Matematica and contributed a remarkable number of articles and problems to the journal. One of these problems is now known as the Ionescu-Weitzenböck inequality. He is also famed as an engineer for building bridges.

name: Gonzalo Pérez Iribarren
summary: Gonzalo Pérez Iribarren was a Uruguayan mathematician and statistician who was forced to spend ten years in exile during the right-wing dictatorship beginning in 1973. He returned to Uruguay in 1983 and was the main force in rebuilding the Institute of Mathematics and Statistics and setting up the Basic Sciences Development Programme.

name: Rufus Philip Isaacs
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Rufus Isaacs was an American mathematician who specialised in game theory.

name: Gamal Ali Fouad Ismail
summary: Gamal Ismail is an Egyptian mathematician who became Professor of Pure Mathematics at the University College of Women for Art, Science and Education at Ain Shams University in Cairo in 1995.

name: Kiyosi Ito
summary: Kiyosi Ito was a Japanese mathematician who pioneered the theory of stochastic integration and stochastic differential equations. He won the Gauss prize in 2006.

name: Ida Rhodes
summary: Ida Rhodes was born in the Ukraine but emigrated to the United States as a teenager. She studied mathematics and had a variety of jobs before joining the Mathematical Tables Project in New York City. She did important work on the development of computers.

name: Elizaveta Fedorovna Litvinova
summary: Elizaveta Litvinova was the second woman to receive a Ph.D. in mathematics. A competent mathematician, she was denied the possibility to teach and research at high levels in Russia. She was a friend of Sofia Kovalevskaya and wrote a biography of her and of other mathematicians. She also wrote around 70 articles on teaching mathematics.

name: James Ivory
summary: James Ivory was a Scottish mathematician who wrote on mathematical astronomy.

name: Anzelm Iwanik
summary: Anzelm Iwanik was a Polish mathematician who worked on functional analysis, topological dynamics, spectral theory and ergodic theory.

name: Kenkichi Iwasawa
summary: Kenkichi Iwasawa was a Japanese mathematician who worked in algebraic number theory.

name: Sunday Osarumwense Iyahen
summary: Sunday Iyahen was a Nigerian mathematician who worked in topological vector spaces. He became a senator in the Nigerian parliament.

name: Shokichi Iyanaga
summary: Shokichi Iyanaga was a Japanese mathematician who published some papers in topology, functional analysis, and geometry.

name: Jorge Andrés Ize Lamache
summary: Jorge Andrés Ize was a Mexican mathematician who made important contributions to global analysis, analysis on manifolds and operator theory. His work on non-linear problems led to him setting up FENOMEC involving collaboration between several departments of the National Autonomous University of Mexico.

name: Milojica Jacimovic
summary: Milojica Jacimovic is a Montenegrin mathematician whose work is in the area of operations research, mathematical programming, calculus of variations and optimal control. He was the first president of the Society of Mathematicians and Physicists of Montenegro.

name: David Jack
summary: David Jack studied at Edinburgh though his studies were interrupted by war service. He took up a post teaching Physics at St Andrews.

name: Henry Jack
summary: Henry Jack was a Scottish mathematician who taught at Dundee University and made contributions to the theory of polynomials.

name: William Jack
summary: William Jack became Professor of Mathematics at Glasgow University and held this post for 30 years.

name: Dunham Jackson
summary: Dunham Jackson was an American mathematician who worked in approximation theory.

name: Frank Hilton Jackson
summary: Frank Jackson was an English clergyman and mathematician who worked on basic hypergeometric series.

name: John Jackson
summary: John Jackson graduated from Glasgow and Cambridge. He went to the Royal Observatory at Greenwich but his career there was interrupted by World War I. He was then appointed HM Astronomer at the University of Cape Town.

name: Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi
summary: Carl Jacobi made basic contributions to the theory of elliptic functions. He carried out important research in partial differential equations of the first order and applied them to the differential equations of dynamics.

name: Nathan Jacobson
summary: Nathan Jacobson was an American algebraist who is best known for his work in ring theory and for his text-books.

name: Ernst Jacobsthal
summary: Ernst Jacobsthal was a German mathematician who wrote papers in such diverse fields as algebra, analysis, function theory and number theory.

name: François de Paule Jacquier
summary: François Jacquier was a French 18th century mathematician who spent most of his life in the Minim Monastery in Rome. Along with Thomas Le Seur he edited a highly annotated edition of Newton's Principia.

name: Jagannatha Samrat
summary: Jagannatha was an Indian mathematician who is important as a translator of important Greek works into Sanskrit.

name: Hermann Arthur Jahn
summary: Hermann Arthur Jahn was an English scientist who worked on quantum mechanics and group theory.

name: Ioan Mackenzie James
summary: Ioan James is an English mathematician who works in topology and the history of mathematics.

name: Ralph Duncan James
died_place: Salt Spring Island, British Columbia, Canada
summary: Ralph Duncan James was an English-born Canadian mathematician who worked on number theory and mathematical analysis.

name: Zygmunt Janiszewski
summary: Janiszewski produced important results in topology and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Sof'ja Aleksandrovna Janovskaja
summary: Sof'ja Aleksandrovna Janovskaja was a Polish-born mathematician who worked on the philosophy of mathematics and logic.

name: Dov Jarden
born_place: Motele, Russian Empire, now Motal, Belarus
summary: Dov Jarden was a Belarussian-born linguist who wrote on number theory and founded the mathematics journal Riveon.

name: Vojtěch Jarník
summary: Vojtěch Jarník was a Czech mathematician who worked in number theory, mathematical analysis, and graph algorithms.

name: James Hopwood Jeans
summary: James Jeans worked on astronomy as well as thermodynamics, heat and other aspects of radiation.

name: George Barker Jeffery
summary: George Jeffery worked on hydrodynamics, viscous liquids, elasticity and general relativity and he produced exact solutions to Einstein's field equations. He also made contributions to teaching mathematics.

name: Ralph Lent Jeffery
born_place: Overton, Yarmouth County, Nova Scotia, Canada
summary: Ralph Jeffery was a Canadian mathematician who worked on analysis.

name: Bertha Swirles Jeffreys
summary: Bertha Swirles Jeffreys was an English physicist who carried out research on quantum theory. She co-authored an important text-book on mathematical physics with her husband.

name: Harold Jeffreys
summary: Harold Jeffreys was an English mathematician, statistician, geophysicist, and astronomer.

name: Johan Ludwig William Valdemar Jensen
summary: Johan Ludwig Jensen was a Danish mathematician and engineer who worked on the Riemann hypothsis and convex functions.

name: Vaclav Jerabek
summary: Vaclav Jerabek was a Czech mathematician whose main research interest was in constructive geometry.

name: George Birch Jerrard
summary: George Jerrard was an English mathematician who worked on the theory of equations.

name: Børge Christian Jessen
summary: Børge Jessen was a Danish mathematician best known for his work in analysis and in geometry.

name: William Stanley Jevons
summary: Stanley Jevons was an English mathematician, economist and logician.

name: Svetlana Yakovlevna Jitomirskaya
summary: Svetlana Jitomirskaya is a Ukrainian-born American mathematician who is known for her work on dynamical systems and mathematical physics. She has won major prizes including the Ruth Lyttle Satter Prize in Mathematics, the Dannie Heineman Prize for Mathematical Physics, the Olga Alexandrovna Ladyzhenskaya Prize, and the Barry Prize.

name: Ferdinand Joachimsthal
summary: Ferdinand Joachimsthal made substantial contributions to the theory of surfaces and applied the theory of determinants to geometry.

name: Fritz John
summary: Fritz John was a German-born mathematician who worked in partial differential equations and ill-posed problems.

name: Anna Johnson Pell Wheeler
summary: Anna Johnson Wheeler was an American mathematician. She is best known for early work on linear algebra in infinite dimensions, which has later become a part of functional analysis.

name: Barry Edward Johnson
summary: Barry Johnson was an English mathematician who worked on operator algebras.

name: Elgy Sibley Johnson
summary: Elgy Sibley Johnson was an African American mathematician who was awarded a Ph.D. by the Catholic University of America. He served at the District of Columbia Teachers College, then joined the University of the District of Columbia when it was founded in 1976.

name: Katherine Coleman Goble Johnson
born_place: White Sulphur Springs, Greenbrier County, West Virginia, USA
summary: Katherine Johnson was an African-American mathematician who made contributions to NASA's space programmme. She was featured in the 2017 film Hidden figures.

name: William Ernest Johnson
summary: William Johnson was an English mathematician, logician and economist.

name: William Woolsey Johnson
summary: Woolsey Johnson was an American text-book writer and one of the founders of the New York Mathematical Society.

name: David Moncrieff Johnstone
summary: David Johnstone graduated from Edinburgh University and taught at Spier's School Beith and George Heriot's School Edinburgh before moving to the Provincial Training College in Edinburgh.

name: Charles Jasper Joly
summary: Charles Joly was an Irish mathematician who did outstanding work on the quaternions. He became Andrews Professor of Astronomy in the University of Dublin and Royal Astronomer of Ireland at Dunsink Observatory.

name: Douglas Samuel Jones
summary: Douglas Jones was an English mathematician known for his work in the field of electromagnetism. He spent many years as head of department at Dundee.

name: Vaughan Frederick Randal Jones
summary: Vaughan Jones is a New Zealand mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on Knot theory.

name: William Jones
summary: William Jones was a Welsh mathematician who corresponded with many of the important English mathematicians of his day.

name: Marie Ennemond Camille Jordan
summary: Camille Jordan was highly regarded by his contemporaries for his work in algebra, group theory and Galois theory.

name: Ernst Pascual Jordan
summary: Pascual Jordan was a German scientist who worked in quantum mechanics and quantum field theory.

name: Jordanus Nemorarius
summary: Jordanus Nemorarius was a German scholar who wrote several books on arithmetic, algebra, geometry and astronomy. He was among the first to use letters to replace numbers in algebraic calculations.

name: Palle Erik Tikob Jorgensen
summary: Palle Jorgensen is a Danish mathematician who worked mainly in America. He has published a large number of papers in both pure and applied mathematics.

name: Nikolai Egorovich Zhukovsky
summary: Nikolai Joukowski or Zhukovsky was a Russian scientist who did pioneering work on aerodynamics. He is best known for the so-called Joukowski aerofoil.

name: Philip Edward Bertrand Jourdain
summary: Philip Jourdain was an English logician who worked on the foundations of set theory.

name: Jovan Karamata
summary: Jovan Karamata was an outstanding mathematician who lived through the wars of the first half of the 20th century in the Balkans. He gained international fame with a 2-page proof of the Hardy-Littlewood theorem, and also did excellent work on slowly varying functions and on Tauberian theory.

name: Jorge Juan y Santacilia
summary: Jorge Juan was a mathematician and seaman who took part in the famous Franco-Spanish expedition to South America to measure a degree of meridian at the Equator. He introduced the study of Newton to Spain, supervised the modernisation of the Spanish Navy and set the basis for the future Spanish Academy of Sciences.

name: Mei Juecheng
born_place: Xuangcheng, now Xuanzhou City, Anhui province, China
summary: Mei Juecheng was a Chinese mathematician who edited and extended the works of his grand-father Mei Wending.

name: Christian Sophus Juel
summary: Christian Juel was a Danish mathematician, specializing in geometry.

name: Gaston Maurice Julia
summary: Julia was one of the forefathers of modern dynamical systems theory and is best remembered for what is now called the Julia set.

name: Heinrich Wilhelm Ewald Jung
summary: Heinrich Jung was a German mathematician who worked on algebraic functions.

name: Joachim Jungius
summary: Joachim Jungius was a German mathematician who was one of the first to use exponents to represent powers and who used mathematics as a model for the natural sciences.

name: Jyesthadeva
summary: Jyesthadeva was a mathematician from South India who wrote an important work on mathematics and astronomy which summarises the work of the Kerala school.

name: Mark Kac
summary: Mark Kac pioneered the modern development of mathematical probability, in particular its applications to statistical physics.

name: Stefan Marian Kaczmarz
summary: Stefan Kaczmarz was a Polish mathematician whose work provided the basis for modern imaging techniques, including the CAT scan.

name: Mikhail Iosiphovich Kadets
summary: Mikhail Kadets was a Ukranian mathematician who worked in analysis and the theory of Banach spaces.

name: Richard Vincent Kadison
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Richard Kadison was an American mathematician who contributed to the study of operator algebras.

name: Abraham Gotthelf Kästner
summary: Abraham Kästner was a German mathematician who compiled encyclopaedias and wrote text-books. He taught Gauss.

name: Benjamin Fedorovich Kagan
summary: Benjamin Kagan was a Russian and Soviet mathematician who woked on non-Euclidean geometry.

name: Jean-Pierre Kahane
university: Centre national de la recherche scientifique
summary: Jean-Pierre Kahane was a French mathematician who specialised in harmonic analysis , chaos theory and Brownian motion.

name: Erich Kähler
summary: Erich Kähler was a German mathematician who worked in geometry and mathematical physics. His work is valuable in string theory.

name: Franz Daniel Kahn
summary: Franz Kahn was a mathematician and astrophysicist who was a professor at the University of Manchester. He was a world leading expert in theoretical studies of the dynamics of the interstellar medium.

name: Shizuo Kakutani
summary: Shizuo Kakutani was a Japanese-born American mathematician who worked in probability theory, ergodic theory and complex analysis, and is best known for his fixed-point theorem.

name: Jan Kalicki
summary: Jan Kalicki was a Polish mathematician who worked on logical matrices and equational logic.

name: Rudolf Emil Kalman
summary: Rudolf Kalman was a Hungarian-born American mathematician best known for his work in control theory.

name: László Kalmár
summary: László Kalmár worked on mathematical logic and theoretical computer science. He was ackowledged as the leader of Hungarian mathematical logic.

name: Nigel John Kalton
summary: Nigel Kalton was an English-born American mathematician known for his contributions to functional analysis.

name: Theodor Franz Eduard Kaluza
summary: Theodor Kaluza was a German mathematician and physicist known for his work in five-dimensional space-time.

name: Lev Arkad'evich Kaluznin
summary: Lev Arkad'evich Kaluznin was a Russian mathematician who is best known for his work in group theory and in particular permutation groups.

name: Kamalakara
summary: Kamalakara was an Indian astronomer and mathematician who combined traditional Indian astronomy with Aristotelian physics and Ptolemaic astronomy as presented by Islamic scientists.

name: Egbert Rudolf van Kampen
summary: Egbert van Kampen was a Belgian mathematician who made important contributions to topology and algebra.

name: Leonid Vitalyevich Kantorovich
summary: Leonid Kantorovich was a Soviet mathematician and economist who can be regarded as the founder of linear programming.

name: Irving Kaplansky
died_place: Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles, California, USA
summary: Irving Kaplansky was a Canadian mathematician who made major contributions to ring theory, group theory and field theory.

name: Demetrios Andreou Kappos
summary: Demetrios Kappos was a Greek mathematician who worked in probability theory.

name: Dattatreya Ramachandra Kaprekar
summary: D R Kaprekar was a largely self-taught Indian mathematician who worked in in number theory.

name: Samuel Karlin
summary: Samuel Karlin was a Polish-born American mathematician who worked in game theory and its application in statistics and economics.

name: Theodore von Kármán
summary: Theodore von Kármán was a Hungarian born mathematician, aerospace engineer and physicist who worked in the fields of aeronautics and astronautics.

name: Carol Ruth Karp
born_place: Forest Grove, Ottawa County, Michigan, USA
summary: Carol Karp was an American mathematical logician whose research was closely linked to algebra. She made a reputation both as a teacher and researcher, and she was undertaking important work on infinitary logic and recursion theory when she died at the age of 46.

name: Louis Charles Karpinski
summary: Louis Karpinski was an American mathematician and historian of science.

name: Wenceslaus Johann Gustav Karsten
summary: Wenceslaus Karsten was a German mathematician who wrote about the logarithms of negative and complex numbers.

name: Edward Kasner
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Edward Kasner was an American mathematician who worked on differential geometry.

name: Takebe Katahiro
summary: Takebe was a Japanese mathematician who wrote most of Seki's Encyclopaedia.

name: Tosio Kato
summary: Tosio Kato was a Japanese mathematician who worked in partial differential equations, mathematical physics and functional analysis.

name: Katyayana
summary: Katyayana was the author of one of the Sulbasutras: documents containing some of the earliest Indian mathematics.

name: Patrick Keast
summary: Pat Keast was Scottish mathematician who specialised in numerical analysis.

name: John Keill
university: University of Aberdeen and University of Oxford
summary: John Keill was a Scottish mathematician who acted as a propagator of Newton's philosophy.

name: Howard Jerome Keisler
summary: Jerome Keisler is an American mathematician whose work included model theory and non-standard analysis.

name: Lyudmila Vsevolodovna Keldysh
summary: Lyudmila Keldysh was a Russian mathematician known for her work in set theory and geometric topology.

name: Mstislav Vsevolodovich Keldysh
summary: Mstislav Keldysh was a Latvian-born Soviet mathematician and engineer who did important work on aerohydrodynamics. He also worked on functions of a complex variable and differential equations.

name: Philip Kelland
summary: Philip Kelland became professor of mathematics at Edinburgh and worked on heat, light and water waves.

name: Eduard Ott-Heinrich Keller
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Ott-Heinrich Keller was a German mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry and topology.

name: Joseph Bishop Keller
summary: Joseph Keller was an American mathematician who originated the Geometrical Theory of Diffraction to solve problems of wave propagation.

name: John Leroy Kelley
born_place: Merriam near Kansas City, Kansas, USA
summary: John Kelley was an American mathematician who worked in general topology and functional analysis. He is best known for his standard topology textbook.

name: R Bruce Kellogg
summary: Bruce Kellogg was an American mathematician who worked in partial differential eequations (both theoretical and in the modelling of real phenomena).

name: Oliver Dimon Kellogg
summary: Oliver Kellogg was an American mathematician best known for his work on potential theory.

name: Gregory Maxwell Kelly
summary: Gregory Maxwell Kelly was an Australian mathematician who worked in category theory.

name: Paul Joseph Kelly
summary: Paul Kelly was an American mathematician who worked in geometry and graph theory.

name: William Thomson (Lord Kelvin)
summary: William Thomson (Lord Kelvin) became Professor of Natural Philosophy at Glasgow at a very young age. He made important contributions to many areas of Physics including electricity, magnetism and thermodynamics. His work on the first trans-Atlantic telegraph cable made his fortune.

name: John Kemeny
summary: John Kemeny was a Hungarian-born American mathematician and computer scientist best known as the co-inventor of the BASIC computer language.

name: Alfred Bray Kempe
summary: Alfred Kempe published a false "proof" of the four colour theorem in 1879 which stood until Heawood showed the mistake 11 years later. The 'proof' is however still the basis for the computer aided proof discovered 100 years later.

name: David George Kendall
summary: David Kendall was a leading world authority on applied probability and data analysis.

name: Maurice George Kendall
summary: Maurice Kendall was a British statistician, widely known for his contributions to correlation and statistics.

name: Patrick Brendan Kennedy
summary: Patrick Brendan Kennedy was an Irish mathematician who worked in complex analysis. As a young man he was an outstanding chess player.

name: David Kennedy-Fraser
summary: David Kennedy Fraser studied at Glasgow, Leipzig and Cornell Universities. He returned to Edinburgh as a Lecturer in Education before moving to Jordanhill Training College.

name: Johannes Kepler
born_place: Weil der Stadt, Württemberg, Holy Roman Empire (now Germany)
summary: Johannes Kepler was a German mathematician and astronomer who discovered that the Earth and planets travel about the sun in elliptical orbits. He gave three fundamental laws of planetary motion. He also did important work in optics and geometry.

name: Béla Kerékjártó
summary: Béla Kerékjártó was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in topology.

name: William Ogilvy Kermack
summary: William Kermack was a chemist who lost his sight in a laboratory accident and turned instead to applying mathematics to biological problems.

name: John Guthrie Kerr
summary: John Kerr was a lecturer in Mathematics and Physics at the Church of Scotland Teacher-Training College.

name: Roy Patrick Kerr
summary: Roy Kerr is a New Zealand mathematician who found a solution to Einstein's field equations which describes a rotating black hole.

name: John Kersey
summary: John Kersey was a 17th century English mathematician who is most famed for his book Elements of that Mathematical Art Commonly called Algebra (1673). He also made many additions to the 1650 edition of Wingate's Arithmetique.

name: Andor Kertész
summary: Andor Kertész was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in the theory of Abelian groups, modules and rings. He was also interested in the history of mathematics.

name: John Maynard Keynes
summary: John Maynard Keynes published works on probability, but is best known as an economist.

name: 'Mamphono Khaketla
summary: 'Mamphono Khaketla is a Lesotho mathematician who became a lecturer in mathematics at the National Teacher Training College. She has served in the Lesotho government, holding positions such as Minister of Education and Training.

name: Archil Kirillovich Kharadze
summary: Archil Kharadze was a Georgian mathematician who worked in special functions and was influential in the re-founding of the Georgian Mathematical Society in 1962.

name: Aleksandr Yakovlevich Khinchin
summary: Aleksandr Yakovlevich Khinchin was a Russian mathematician who contributed to many fields including number theory and probability.

name: Evgenii Yakovlevich Khruslov
university: Institute for Low Temperature Physics and Engineering
summary: Evgenii Khruslov is a Ukrainian mathematician who applied the theory of partial differential equations to physical problems.

name: Boris Vladimirovich Khvedelidze
summary: Boris Khvedelidze was a Georgian mathematician who worked in the partial differential equations, integral equations, and mathematical physics. He was appointed as a Vice-President of the re-formed Georgian Mathematical Society in 1962.

name: Adolf Kiefer
summary: Adolf Kiefer was a Swiss mathematician who worked mainly in geometry.

name: Jack Carl Kiefer
summary: Jack Kiefer was an American mathematical statistician who worked in the optimal design of experiments and other topics in mathematical statistics.

name: Wilhelm Karl Joseph Killing
summary: Wilhelm Killing was a German mathematician who introduced Lie algebras independently of Lie in his study of non-euclidean geometry. His classification of the simple Lie algebras was one of the finest achievements in the whole of mathematical research.

name: Clive William Kilmister
summary: Clive Kilmister was an applied mathematician who had broad interests including the history of mathematics, philosophy of mathematics and teaching of mathematics. He wrote several books on relativity, Arthur Eddington and Eddington's fundamental theory.

name: Ki Hang Kim
born_place: Anju, South Pyongan, Korea (now North Korea)
summary: Ki Hang Kim was a Korean mathematician who worked in America. He published on semigroups and Boolean matricies as well as in many other areas.

name: John Quill Taylor King
summary: John Quill Taylor King was an African American mathematician who was awarded a Ph.D. by the University of Texas. He was a professor of mathematics at Samuel Huston College continuing to serve at Huston-Tillotson College after it merged with Tillotson College where he was President for over twenty years.

name: John Frank Charles Kingman
summary: John Kingman is an English mathematician known for his work in statistics, queuing theory and mathematical genetics.

name: Chandra Mohan Rao Kintala
summary: Chandra Kintala was an Indian-born American computer scientist who worked on the theory of computer languages.

name: Robion Cromwell Kirby
summary: Robion Kirby is an American mathematician who specialises in low-dimensional topology.

name: Maria Margarethe Winckelmann Kirch
summary: Maria Winckelmann was a German astronomer who helped her husband with his observations. She was the first woman to discover a comet.

name: Gustav Robert Kirchhoff
summary: Kirchhoff was a mathematical physicist best known for his laws on the flow of electric current.

name: Alexandre Aleksandrovich Kirillov
summary: Alexandre Kirillov is a Russian mathematician, known for his works in the fields of representation theory, topological groups and Lie groups.

name: Thomas Penyngton Kirkman
summary: Thomas Kirkman wrote on the theory of groups and his writings are the first systematic account of the elements of group theory in English. He also made many contributions to combinatorics.

name: Andrei Petrovich Kiselev
summary: Andrei Petrovich Kiselev wasa Russian mathematician known mainly for his textbooks.

name: Elemér Kiss
summary: Elemér Kiss was a Hungarian mathematician and historian of mathematics, best known for his work on János Bolyai.

name: Stephen Cole Kleene
summary: Stephen C Kleene was an American mathematician and logician best known his work on recursion theory.

name: Felix Christian Klein
summary: Felix Klein was a German mathematician whose synthesis of geometry as the study of the properties of a space that are invariant under a given group of transformations, known as the Erlanger Programm, profoundly influenced mathematical development.

name: Oskar Klein
summary: Oskar Klein was a Swedish theoretical physicist whose ideas were important in the development of string theory.

name: Morris Kline
born_place: Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA
died_place: Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA
summary: Morris Kline was an American mathematician best known for his books popularising mathematics and on the history of mathematics.

name: Wilhelm Paul Albert Klingenberg
summary: Wilhelm Klingenberg was a German mathematician who worked on differential geometry.

name: Hendrik Douwe Kloosterman
summary: Hendrik Douwe Kloosterman was a Dutch mathematician, known for his work in number theory and representation theory.

name: Leopold Klug
summary: Leopold Klug was a Hungarian mathematician whose areas of research were descriptive geometry and synthetic geometry.

name: Georg Simon Klügel
summary: Georg Klügel was a German mathematician who wrote a Dictionary of Mathematics.

name: Igor Stefan Kluvánek
summary: Igor Kluvánek was Slovakian mathematician who worked in applied mathematics, functional analysis and operator theory. He spent part of his career in Australia before returning to Slovakia.

name: Stanisław Knapowski
university: Uniwersytet im. Adama Mickiewicza w Poznaniu
summary: Stanisław Knapowski was a Polish mathematician who worked on prime numbers and number theory.

name: Bronisław Knaster
summary: Bronisław Knaster was a Polish mathematician who was known for his work in point-set topology.

name: Geoffrey Thomas Kneebone
summary: Geoffrey Kneebone was an English mathematician who is best known for the two books he wrote with J G Semple

name: Adolf Kneser
summary: Adolf Kneser was a German mathematician who wrote on integral equations.

name: Hellmuth Kneser
summary: Hellmuth Kneser was a Estonian-born German mathematician best known for his work in group theory and topology.

name: John Peter Louis Knopfmacher
summary: John Knopfmacher was a South African mathematician who worked mainly in number theory.

name: Konrad Hermann Theodor Knopp
summary: Konrad Knopp was a German mathematician who worked on generalised limits and complex functions. He was the co-founder of Mathematische Zeitschrift in 1918.

name: Wilbur Richard Knorr
summary: Wilbur Knorr was an American historian of mathematics best known for his work on ancient Greek mathematics.

name: Cargill Gilston Knott
summary: Cargill Knott became a Reader in Applied Mathematics at Edinburgh University. With Barclay and Fraser he was one of the writers who originally proposed the founding of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society.

name: Donald Ervin Knuth
summary: Donald Knuth is an American mathematician and computer scientist most famous for his contributions to the study of algorithms and inventing the TeX typesetting language.

name: Hermann Kober
summary: Hermann Kober was a Polish-born mathematician who spent much of his life as a school teacher in England but published many papers on analysis.

name: Niels Fabian Helge von Koch
summary: Helge von Koch is best known for the fractal Koch curve.

name: Nikolai Evgrafovich Kochin
summary: Nikolai Kochin was a Russian mathematician who was one of the founders of modern dynamic meteorology.

name: Pelageia Yakovlevna Polubarinova Kochina
summary: Pelageia Kochina was a Russian applied mathematician, known for her work on fluid mechanics and hydrodynamics.

name: Kunihiko Kodaira
summary: Kunihiko Kodaira was a Japanese mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work in algebraic geometry.

name: Paul Koebe
summary: Paul Koebe was a German mathematician who worked on complex functions. His colleagues found him brilliant but difficult.

name: Gabriel Xavier Paul Koenigs
summary: Gabriel Koenigs was a French mathematician who worked on analysis and geometry.

name: Jurjen Ferdinand Koksma
summary: Jurjen Ferdinand Koksma was a Dutch mathematician who worked in analytic number theory.

name: Ellis Robert Kolchin
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Ellis Kolchin was an American mathematician who worked on differential algebra, differential equations and linear algebraic groups.

name: Andrey Nikolaevich Kolmogorov
summary: Andrey Kolmogorov was one of the developers of probability theory. He later used this work to study the motion of the planets and the turbulent flow of air from a jet engine.

name: Gury Vasilievich Kolosov
summary: Gury Vasilievich Kolosov was a Russian mathematician who worked on the theory of elasticity.

name: Dénes König
summary: Dénes König was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in graph theory.

name: Julius König
summary: Julius König was a Hungarian mathematician who worked on algebra, number theory, geometry, set theory and analysis.

name: Johann Samuel König
summary: Samuel König was a German mathematician who is best remembered for his part in a dispute with Maupertuis over the Principle of Least Action.

name: Leo Königsberger
summary: Leo Königsberger was a German mathematician who worked on elliptic functions and differential equations. He is known for his biographies of Helmholtz and Jacobi.

name: Maxim Lvovich Kontsevich
summary: Maxim Kontsevich is a Russian and French mathematician best known for his work on geometric aspects of mathematical physics including knot theory, quantisation, and mirror symmetry.

name: Tjalling Charles Koopmans
summary: Tjalling Charles Koopmans was a Dutch American mathematician and economist. He won the Nobel prize in Economics for his work on the theory of the optimum allocation of resources.

name: Aleksandr Nikolaevich Korkin
summary: Aleksandr Korkin was a Russian mathematician whose major contribution was to the development of partial differential equations.

name: Diederik Johannes Korteweg
summary: Diederik Korteweg was a Dutch mathematician with wide interests, now best-known as the joint discoverer of the Korteweg-de Vries equation for solitary waves.

name: Damodar Dharmanand Kosambi
summary: D D Kosambi was an Indian mathematician who, in addition to many mathematics and mathematical physics papers, published on genetics, numismatics, Indology, Sanskrit studies, and Indian history. He brought mathematics, statistics, Marxism and critical analysis into his studies of historiography.

name: Aleksei Ivanovich Kostrikin
born_place: Bolshoi Morets, Yelan district, Volgograd, Russia
summary: Alexei Kostrikin was a Russian mathematician who worked in algebra and algebraic geometry.

name: Jean-Louis Koszul
summary: Jean-Louis Koszul was a French mathematician who worked in geometry. He was a member of Bourbaki.

name: Aleksandr Petrovich Kotelnikov
summary: Aleksandr Kotelnikov was a Russian mathematician who worked on non-Euclidean geometry.

name: Gottfried Maria Hugo Köthe
summary: Gottfried Maria Hugo Köthe was an Austrian mathematician who worked in abstract algebra, functional analysis and topological vector spaces.

name: László György Kovács
summary: László Kovács was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in group theory.

name: Sofia Vasilyevna Kovalevskaya
summary: Sofia Kovalevskaya was a Russian born mathematician who made valuable contributions to the theory of differential equations. She finished her career in Sweden.

name: Edna Ernestine Kramer Lassar
summary: Edna Ernestine Kramer Lassar was an American mathematician and author of mathematics books.

name: Hendrik Anthony Kramers
summary: Hendrik Kramers was a Dutch physicist who worked with Niels Bohr to understand how electromagnetic waves interact with matter.

name: Christian Kramp
summary: Christian Kramp was a French mathematician who worked on analysis and combinatorics. He introduced the factorial notation.

name: Mark Aleksandrovich Krasnosel'skii
university: Institute of Mathematics of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine
summary: Mark Krasnoselsky was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked in nonlinear functional analysis and its applications.

name: Nikolai Nikolaevich Krasovskii
summary: Nikolay Krasovsky was a Russian mathematician who worked in control theory, dynamical systems and differential games.

name: Mykhailo Pilipovich Krawtchouk
summary: Mykhailo Pilipovich Krawtchouk was a Soviet Ukrainian mathematician who worked on differential and integral equations.

name: Mark Grigorievich Krein
summary: Mark G Krein was a Soviet mathematician who worked in functional analysis, operator theory, classical analysis and representation theory.

name: Georg Kreisel
summary: Georg Kreisel was an Austrian-born mathematical logician who studied and worked in the United Kingdom and America and chiefly studied proof and computation.

name: Pavel Krejčí
summary: Pavel Krejčí is a Czech mathematician who is known for his work on the applications of differential equations to hysteresis problems.

name: Leopold Kronecker
summary: Leopold Kronecker's primary contributions were in the theory of equations. He made major contributions in elliptic functions and the theory of algebraic numbers.

name: Alexander Semenovich Kronrod
summary: Alexander Kronrod was a Russian mathematician and computer scientist who worked on applications of mathematical methods to physical problems. He is also known for his contributions to economics and medicine.

name: Wolfgang Krull
summary: Wolfgang Krull proved the Krull-Schmidt theorem for decomposing abelian groups of operators and defined the Krull dimension of a ring.

name: Joseph Bernard Kruskal, Jr.
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Joseph Kruskal was an American mathematician, statistician and computer scientist who worked in combinatorics and graph theory.

name: Martin David Kruskal
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Martin Kruskal was an American mathematician and physicist who worked in plasma physics as well as soliton equations, asymptotic analysis, and surreal numbers.

name: William Henry Kruskal
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: William Kruskal was an American mathematician and statistician best known for his work on the analysis of variance.

name: Aleksei Nikolaevich Krylov
summary: Aleksei Krylov was a Russian applied mathematician who worked in many areas including shipbuilding, magnetism, artillery, mathematics, astronomy, and geodesy.

name: Nikolai Mitrofanovich Krylov
summary: Nikolai Krylov was a Russian mathematician who published over 200 papers on analysis and mathematical physics.

name: Nikolai Sergeevitch Krylov
summary: Nikolay Sergeevitch Krylov was a Russian theoretical physicist who worked in classical mechanics, statistical physics and quantum mechanics.

name: Shen Kua
summary: Shen Kua was a Chinese scholar who wrote on a wide variety of topics including mathematics, music, astronomy, calendars, cartography, geology, optics and medicine.

name: Jonas Kubilius
summary: Jonas Kubilius was a Lithuanian mathematician who worked in probability theory and number theory.

name: Vera Nikolaevna Kublanovskaya
summary: Vera Kublanovskaya was a Russian mathematician who developed computational methods for solving spectral problems of algebra.

name: Marek Kuczma
summary: Marek Kuczma was a Polish mathematician who worked in the area of functional equations.

name: Nicolaas Hendrik Kuiper
summary: Nicolaas Kuiper was a Dutch mathematician who made important contributions to operator theory as well as to topology and statistics.

name: Aderemi Oluyomi Kuku
summary: Aderemi Kuku is a Nigerian mathematician who specialised in K-theory. He taught a wide range of mathematical courses at both undergraduate and graduate levels.

name: Jakob Philipp Kulik
summary: Jakob Kulik was a Ukranian-born mathematician who wrote textbooks on mathematics and mechanics.

name: Hitoshi Kumano-Go
summary: Hitoshi Kumano-Go was a Japanese mathematician who specialised in partial differential equations.

name: Ernst Eduard Kummer
summary: Eduard Kummer's main achievement was the extension of results about the integers to other integral domains by introducing the concept of an ideal.

name: Krystyna Maria Trybulec Kuperberg
summary: Krystyna Kuperberg is a Polish mathematician who works in America. She is known for her work in dynamical systems, geometry and topology.

name: Kazimierz Kuratowski
summary: Kazimierz Kuratowski worked in the area of topology and set theory. He is best known for his theorem giving a necessary and sufficient condition for a graph to be planar.

name: Duro Kurepa
born_place: Majske Poljane near Glina, Austria-Hungarian Empire (now Croatia)
summary: Duro Kurepa was a Croatian mathematician who worked in mathematical logic and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Sigekatu Kuroda
summary: Sigekatu Kuroda was a Japanese mathematician who worked in number theory and mathematical logic.

name: Aleksandr Gennadievich Kurosh
summary: Aleksandr Kurosh proved important results in Group Theory and is best-known as the author of one of the standard text-books in the subject.

name: József Kürschák
summary: József Kürschák was a Hungarian mathematician who founded the theory of valuations.

name: Martin Wilhelm Kutta
summary: Wilhelm Kutta was a German engineer who is best known for his work on the numerical solution of differential equations (the Runge-Kutta method).

name: Brian Kuttner
summary: Brian Kuttner was an English mathematician who worked on Fourier Series.

name: Nicolas-Louis de Lacaille
summary: Nicolas-Louis de Lacaille was a French astronomer and geodesist who catalogued the stars of the Southern Hemisphere and named 14 out of the 88 constellations.

name: Marius Lacombe
summary: Marius Lacombe was a Swiss schoolteacher who helped organise the first International Congress of Mathematicians.

name: Sylvestre François Lacroix
summary: Sylvestre Lacroix was a French mathematician who wrote important textbooks on geometry and analysis.

name: Olga Alexandrovna Ladyzhenskaya
summary: Olga Ladyzhenskaya was a Russian mathematician who worked on partial differential equations and finite-difference methods.

name: Laurent Lafforgue
summary: Laurent Lafforgue is a French mathematician known for his work in the fields of number theory and analysis.

name: Joseph-Louis Lagrange
summary: Joseph-Louis Lagrange was an Italian-born French mathematician who excelled in all fields of analysis and number theory and analytical and celestial mechanics.

name: Rafael Laguardia
