summary: Rafael Laguardia was a Uraguayan mathematician best known for founding the Institute of Mathematics and Statistics in Montevideo.

name: Edmond Nicolas Laguerre
summary: Edmond Laguerre studied approximation methods and is best remembered for the special functions: the Laguerre polynomials.

name: Ivo Lah
born_place: Strukljeva vas near Cerknica, Austrian Empire (now Slovenia)
summary: Ivo Lah was a Slovenian mathematician and actuary who worked in both mathematics and statistics.

name: Imre Lakatos
summary: Imre Lakatos was a Hungarian philosopher of mathematics and science, who moved to Britain after the Russian invasion of Hungary in 1953.

name: Joseph-Jérôme Lefrançais de Lalande
summary: Jérôme Lalande was a French astronomer who made important measurements of the Solar System.

name: Lalla
summary: Lalla was an Indian mathematician who wrote mainly on the application of mathematics to astronomy.

name: Horace Lamb
summary: Horace Lamb wrote important texts and made important contributions to applied mathematics, in particular to acoustics and fluid dynamics.

name: Johann Heinrich Lambert
summary: Johann Lambert was the first to provide a rigorous proof that π is irrational.

name: Gabriel Lamé
summary: Gabriel Lamé worked on a wide variety of different topics. His work on differential geometry and contributions to Fermat's Last Theorem are important. He proved the theorem for n = 7.

name: Bernard Lamy
summary: Bernard Lamy was a French mathematician who wrote on geometry and mechanics.

name: Cornelius Lanczos
summary: Cornelius Lanczos worked on relativity and mathematical physics and invented what is now called the Fast Fourier Transform.

name: Edmund Georg Hermann Landau
summary: Landau gave the first systematic presentation of analytic number theory and wrote important works on the theory of analytic functions of a single variable.

name: Lev Davidovich Landau
summary: Lev Landau was an Azerbaijan-born mathematician who made fundamental discoveries in theoretical physics. He won the Nobel prize for his theory of superfluidity.

name: John Landen
summary: John Landen was an English amateur mathematician who wrote on mechanics, summation of series and elliptic functions.

name: Georg Landsberg
summary: Georg Landsberg was a German mathematician, known for his work in the theory of algebraic functions and as a co-author with Kurt Hensel of a classic text on the theory of algebraic functions of one variable.

name: Peter Redford Scott Lang
summary: Peter Scott Lang became Regius Professor of Mathematics at St Andrews. He held this position for 42 years.

name: Serge Lang
summary: Serge Lang was a French-born mathematician who spent most of his life in the USA. He is best-known for his outstanding undergraduate text-books.

name: Robert Phelan Langlands
summary: Robert P Langlands is a Canadian mathematician who works in representation theory and number theory. He has been awarded all the major mathematical prizes including the Shaw Prize, the Wolf Prize and the Abel Prize.

name: Edward Mann Langley
summary: Edward Langley was an English mathematical schoolteacher who was a founder and editor of The Mathematical Gazette.

name: Johan Philip van Lansberge
summary: Philippe van Lansberge was a Flemish clergyman who wrote on mathematics and astronomy. He calculated π to 28 places by a new method.

name: Pierre-Simon Laplace
summary: Pierre-Simon Laplace proved the stability of the solar system. In analysis Laplace introduced the potential function and Laplace coefficients. He also put the theory of mathematical probability on a sound footing.

name: Joseph Larmor
summary: Joseph Larmor worked on electricity, dynamics and thermodynamics.

name: Emanuel Lasker
summary: Lasker became World Chess Champion in 1894 and held the championship until 1921. In mathematics he introduced the notion of a primary ideal.

name: Matthieu Paul Hermann Laurent
summary: Hermann Laurent was a Luxembourg mathematician and statistician.

name: Pierre Alphonse Laurent
summary: Pierre Laurent was a French mathematician best-known for his study of the so-called Laurent Series in Complex analysis.

name: João Baptista Lavanha
summary: Joao Baptista Lavanha was a Portuguese engineer who wrote on mathematics and navigation.

name: Mikhail Alekseevich Lavrentev
summary: Mikhail Lavrent'ev is remembered for an outstanding book on conformal mappings and he made many important contributions to that topic.

name: George Lawson
summary: George Lawson graduated from St Andrews and became assistant to the professor. He eventually became Rector of Waid Academy Anstruther.

name: Anneli Cahn Lax
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Anneli Lax was a Polish-born American mathematician who was important for her contributions to mathematical education and mathematical publishing.

name: Gaspar Lax
summary: Gaspar Lax was a Spanish scholar who published several mathematics books based on the work of earlier mathematicians.

name: Peter David Lax
summary: Peter Lax is a Hungarian mathematician who works on scattering theory.

name: Guacolda Antoine Lazzerini
summary: Guacolda Antoine Lazzerini was a mathematics teacher at both school and university level in Chile. She made many contributions to the development of education in Chile during her long active life.

name: Constantin Marie Michel Hubert Jérôme Le Paige
summary: Constantin Le Paige was a Belgian mathematician who worked on the theory of algebraic form, especially algebraic curves and surfaces.

name: Jean-Marie Le Roux
summary: Jean-Marie Le Roux was a French applied mathematician who worked on partial differential equations, integral equations, and differential geometry.

name: Jacques Alexandre Le Tenneur
summary: Jacques Le Tenneur was a French amateur mathematician who published a work on dynamics following Galileo's point of view.

name: Urbain Jean Joseph Le Verrier
summary: Urbain Le Verrier is best known for the calculations which led to the discovery of Neptune.

name: Henrietta Swan Leavitt
summary: Henrietta Leavitt was an American astronomer who discovered the relation between the luminosity and the period of Cepheid variables. This was a vital step in measuring the distance to remote galaxies.

name: Henri Léon Lebesgue
summary: Lebesgue formulated the theory of measure in 1901 and the following year he gave the definition of the Lebesgue integral that generalises the notion of the Riemann integral.

name: Victor Amédée Lebesgue
summary: Victor-Amédée Lebesgue was a French mathematician who worked on number theory.

name: Walter Ledermann
summary: Walter Ledermann was a refugee from Germany who did his doctorate at St Andrews and taught here until 1946. He did important work in algebra and in particular in group theory.

name: Alice Elizabeth Lee
summary: Alice Lee was awarded a D.Sc. in 1899, and had an outstanding career as a statistician working in both Bedford College and University College in London. Her work was important in disproving the belief that skull size was related to intelligence, the argument that was being used at that time to "prove" women were intellectually inferior to men.

name: John Leech
died_place: On board the SS Waverley, at sea between Rothesay and Largs, Scotland
summary: John Leech was an English mathematician who is best known for the Leech lattice which is important in the theory of finite simple groups.

name: Magnus Gösta Mittag-Leffler
summary: Gösta Mittag-Leffler was a Swedish mathematician who worked on the general theory of functions. His best known work concerned the analytic representation of a one-valued function.

name: Solomon Lefschetz
summary: Lefschetz was the main source of the algebraic aspects of topology.

name: Adrien-Marie Legendre
summary: Adrien-Marie Legendre's major work on elliptic integrals provided basic analytical tools for mathematical physics. He gave a simple proof that π is irrational as well as the first proof that π2 is irrational.

name: Émile Léger
summary: Émile Léger was a French mathematician who was the first to notice that the Euclidean algorithm converges most slowly for consecutive Fibonacci numbers.

name: Derrick Henry Lehmer
summary: Derrick H Lehmer was an American mathematician who worked in number theory and in particular generalised Lucas's test for Mersenne primes.

name: Derrick Norman Lehmer
summary: Derrick Norman Lehmer was an American mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Emma Markovna Trotskaia Lehmer
summary: Emma Markovna Lehmer was a Russian-born mathematician known for her work on reciprocity laws in algebraic number theory.

name: Anna Marguerite Marie Lehr
summary: Marguerite Lehr was an outstanding lecturer and, as one of the first to present a course of mathematics on television in 1952-53, she was in great demand both as a lecturer and as a consultant for presenting mathematics on film or TV.

name: Olli Erkki Lehto
summary: Olli Lehto was a Finnish mathematician who worked in in geometric function theory.

name: Gottfried Wilhelm von Leibniz
summary: Gottfried Leibniz was a German mathematician who developed the present day notation for the differential and integral calculus though he never thought of the derivative as a limit. His philosophy is also important and he invented an early calculating machine.

name: Eižens Leimanis
summary: Eižens Leimanis was a Latvian mathematician who worked on the three-body problem.

name: Pierre Lelong
summary: Pierre Lelong was a French mathematician who worked in the theory of several complex variables.

name: Georges Henri-Joseph-Edouard Lemaître
summary: Georges Henri Joseph Édouard Lemaître was a Belgian mathematician and astronomer who worked on the theory of an expanding universe.

name: Émile Michel Hyacinthe Lemoine
summary: Émile Lemoine was a French civil engineer, mathematician and geometer.

name: Heinrich-Wolfgang Leopoldt
summary: Heinrich-Wolfgang Leopoldt was a German mathematician who worked in algebraic number theory.

name: Nicole-Reine Etable de Labrière Lepaute
summary: Nicole-Reine Lepaute was a French noblewoman who helped Lalande with astronomical calculations.

name: Jean Leray
summary: Jean Leray was a French mathematician who worked on algebraic topology and differential equations.

name: Matyáš Lerch
born_place: Milínov (near Sušice), South Bohemia (now Czech Republic)
summary: Mathias Lerch was a Czech mathematician who worked in analysis and number theory.

name: John Leslie
summary: John Leslie was a Scottish mathematician who became Professor of Natural Philosophy at Edinburgh and wrote popular textbooks.

name: Joshua Allensworth Leslie
summary: Joshua Allensworth Leslie was an African American mathematician born in Jamaica. He studied for his Ph.D. at the University of Paris advised by Henri Cartan. He was a professor at the University of Ibadan in Nigeria, Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois, and Howard University. He was awarded a Major Research Instrumentation grant to study the application of topology and group theory to solving differential equations.

name: Stanisław Leśniewski
summary: Stanisław Lesniewski was a Russian-born mathemtician who was one of the founders of the Polish school of logic.

name: Mikhail Moiseevich Lesokhin
summary: Mikhail Lesokhin wasa Russion mathematician whose research was mostly in semigroup theory.

name: Leucippus of Miletus
summary: Leucippus was a Greek philosopher who originated the atomic theory of indivisibles developed later by Democritus.

name: Beppo Levi
summary: Beppo Levi was an Italian mathematician who wrote articles on logic, differential equations, complex variable, as well as on the border between analysis and physics.

name: Eugenio Elia Levi
summary: Eugenio Levi was an Italian mathematician who worked in complex analysis, differential geometry, Lie groups, partial differential equations and the minimum principle.

name: Boris Yakovlevich Levin
summary: Boris Yakovlevich Levin was a Soviet mathematician who made contributions to function theory.

name: Frank Levin
summary: Frank Levin was an American mathematician who worked mainly in infinite group theory.

name: Norman Levinson
summary: Norman Levinson was an American mathematician who worked with Fourier transforms, complex analysis, non-linear differential equations, number theory and signal processing.

name: Jacob Levitzki
summary: Jacob Levitzk was a Ukrainian-born Israeli mathematician who worked on noncommutative rings.

name: Hyman Levy
summary: Hyman Levy was a Scottish mathematician whose main work was in the numerical solution of differential equations.

name: Marie-Hélène Schwartz
summary: Marie-Hélène Schwartz was the daughter of Paul Lévy and the wife of Laurent Schwartz. She lived through very difficult times but went on to have an outstanding career at the University of Lille. She worked on functions of a complex variable, Ahlfors theory, the Poincaré-Hopf theorem, and finally characteristic classes of singular varieties.

name: Paul Pierre Lévy
summary: Paul Lévy was a French mathematician who, after starting out as an expert on functional analysis, made important advances in probability theory.

name: Volodymyr Levytsky
summary: Volodymyr Levytsky was a Ukrainian mathematician who studied functions of a complex variable.

name: Clarence Irving Lewis
summary: Clarence Lewis was an American philosopher and logician.

name: John Trevor Lewis
summary: John Lewis was a Welsh applied mathematican who worked on quantum mechanics.

name: Hans Lewy
summary: Hans Lewy was a Polish-born American mathematician who worked on partial differential equations and on functions of several complex variables.

name: Anders Johan Lexell
summary: Anders Lexell made major contributions to spherical geometry and trigonometry.

name: Wilhelm Lexis
summary: Wilhelm Lexis studied data presented as a series over time thus initiating the study of time series.

name: Simon Antoine Jean Lhuilier
summary: Simon Lhuilier was a Swiss mathematician who worked on analysis, topology and probability.

name: Li Zhi
summary: Li Zhi was a Chinese mathematician who described methods for solving equations.

name: Li Rui
summary: Li Rui was a Chinese mathematician who produced commentaries on important Chinese mathematical works.

name: Li Shanlan
summary: Li Shanlan was the greatest Chinese mathematician of the 19th century who translated Western works and gave many summation formulas.

name: Paulette Libermann
summary: Paulette Libermann was a French mathematician who survived the terrors of World War II and made important contributions to differential geometry.

name: Count Guglielmo Libri Carucci dalla Sommaja
summary: Guglielmo Libri was an Italian mathematician who worked on mathematical physics, number theory and the theory of equations. He also published works on the history of mathematics.

name: André Lichnerowicz
summary: André Lichnerowicz was a French mathematician who worked in differential geometry and mathematical physics.

name: Leon Lichtenstein
summary: Leon Lichtenstein was a Polish-born mathematician, who made contributions to the areas of differential equations, conformal mapping, potential theory, hydrodynamics and astronomy.

name: Duncan Liddel
university: Europa-Universität Viadrina Frankfurt an der Oder and Universität Breslau
summary: Duncan Liddel was a Scottish mathematician, physician and astronomer who lectured on mathematics and astronomy on the continent. He made several endowments to Marischal College, Aberdeen.

name: George James Lidstone
summary: George Lidstone was an actuary who worked for various Edinburgh insurance companies. He wrote papers on various numerical and statistical topics.

name: Marius Sophus Lie
summary: Sophus Lie was a Norwegian mathematician who made major advances in the theory of continuous groups of transformations and differential equations. Lie groups and Lie algebras are named after him.

name: Evgenii Mikhailovich Lifshitz
summary: Evgeny Lifshitz was a leading Ukranian physicist, best known for the textbook he wrote with Lev Landau.

name: Michael James Lighthill
summary: James Lighthill was one of the foremost English applied mathematicians of his day. He worked on aerodynamics.

name: Elon Lages Lima
summary: Elon Lima was a Brazilian mathematician who is famed as the most famous mathematics textbook writer in the Portuguese language. He also made important research contributions in topology and was a major contributor to the Brazilian Mathematics Colloquium between 1961 and 1983.

name: Ernst Leonard Lindelöf
summary: Ernst Lindelöf was a Finnish mathematician who worked on topology and partial differential equations. He also wrote on the history of Scandinavian mathematics.

name: Carl Louis Ferdinand von Lindemann
summary: Ferdinand von Lindemann was the first to prove that π is transcendental, i.e. π is not the root of any algebraic equation with rational coefficients.

name: Adolf Lindenbaum
summary: Adolf Lindenbaum was a Polish mathematician, logician and topologist. He was executed by the Nazis.

name: Joram Lindenstrauss
born_place: Tel Aviv, British Mandate for Palestine (now Israel)
summary: Joram Lindenstrauss was an Israeli mathematician working in functional analysis.

name: James Bowman Lindsay
summary: James Bowman Lindsay was a Scottish mathematician and inventor who made early progress in telegraphy and the incandescent light bulb.

name: Edward Hubert Linfoot
summary: Hubert Linfoot was a British mathematician who worked in optics as well as pure mathematics.

name: Yuri Vladimirovich Linnik
summary: Yuri Linnik was a Ukranian-born mathematician who worked on number theory, probability theory and mathematical statistics.

name: Jacobus Hendricus van Lint
born_place: Bandoeng, Netherlands East Indies, now Indonesia
summary: Jack van Lint was an Indonesian-born Dutch mathematician who worked number theory and also in combinatorics and coding theory.

name: Jacques-Louis Lions
summary: Jacques-Louis Lions was a French mathematician who produced an enormous volume of original work in many different areas.

name: Pierre-Louis Lions
summary: Pierre-Louis Lions is a French mathematician best known for his work on partial differential equations and the calculus of variations.

name: Joseph Liouville
summary: Joseph Liouville is best known for his work on transcendental numbers. He constructed an infinite class of such numbers.

name: Rudolf Otto Sigismund Lipschitz
summary: Rudolf Lipschitz is remembered for the "Lipschitz condition", an inequality that guarantees a unique solution to the differential equation y' = f (x, y).

name: Jules Antoine Lissajous
summary: Jules Lissajous was a French mathematician best known for the Lissajous figures produced from a pair of sine waves.

name: Johann Benedict Listing
summary: Johann Listing wrote one of the earliest texts on Topology.

name: Dudley Ernest Littlewood
summary: Dudley Ernest Littlewood was a British mathematician known for his work in group representation theory.

name: John Edensor Littlewood
summary: Littlewood collaborated with G H Hardy, working on the theory of series, the Riemann zeta function, inequalities and the theory of functions.

name: Mikhail Samuilovich Livsic
summary: Moshe Livsic was a Ukrainian-born mathematician who worked in functional analysis.

name: Wilhelm Ljunggren
summary: Wilhelm Ljunggren was a Norwegian mathematician who specialised in number theory.

name: Bartholomew Lloyd
summary: Bartholomew Lloyd was an Irish mathematician who became a bishop and provost of Trinity College Dublin.

name: Humphrey Lloyd
summary: Humphrey Lloyd was an Irish applied mathematician who worked on conical refraction and geomagnetism.

name: Ramon Llull
summary: Ramon Llull was a Majorcan philosopher whose logical methods influenced Leibniz.

name: Martin Hugo Löb
summary: Martin Löbwas a German mathematician who worked in in England after World War II. He specialised in mathematical logic.

name: Nikolai Ivanovich Lobachevsky
summary: Nikolai Lobachevsky published his work on non-Euclidean geometry, the first account of the subject to appear in print.

name: Phyllis Nicolson
summary: Phyllis Nicolson was an English mathematician best known for her work in numerical analysis.

name: James Balfour Lockhart
summary: Balfour Lockhart graduated from Edinburgh University, his studies being interrupted by war service. He taught for most of his career at Edinburgh Academy, finishing as Head of Mathematics.

name: Jean-Louis Loday
born_place: Le Pouliguen, Pays de la Loire, France
summary: Jean-Louis Loday wasa French mathematician whoo worked in the field of cyclic homology.

name: Alfred Lodge
summary: Alfred Lodge was an English mathematician who was the first president of the Mathematical Association.

name: Charles Loewner
summary: Charles Loewner was an American mathematician who made important progress on the Bieberbach conjecture.

name: Alfred Loewy
summary: Alfred Loewy was a German mathematician who worked on linear groups, the algebraic theory of differential equations and actuarial mathematics.

name: Gilberto Francisco Loibel
summary: Gilberto Francisco Loibel was a Brazilian mathematician who played a major role in the development of mathematical sciences in Brazil. He supervised 19 Master's dissertations and 8 Doctoral theses.

name: Sidney Luxton Loney
summary: Sidney Luxton Loney was an English mathematican best known as the author of a series of popular texts on both pure and applied mathematics.

name: William Oughter Lonie
summary: William Oughter Lonie was a Scottish teacher whose ideas were influential in the development of Scottish education.

name: Yaroslav Borisovich Lopatynsky
summary: Yaroslav Lopatinskii was a Ukrainian mathematician known for his contributions to the theory of differential equations.

name: Graciela Beatriz Salicrup López
died_place: San José Insurgentes, Mexico City, Mexico
summary: Graciela Salicrup trained as an architect and then worked as an archaeologist. She became a mathematics undergraduate at the age of 29 and went on to the become a leading topologist. She died at the age of 47 when at her most mathematically productive.

name: Edgar Raymond Lorch
died_place: Manhattan, New York City, New York County, USA
summary: Raymond Lorch was a Swiss-born American mathematician who worked in general topology and functional analysis.

name: Lee Alexander Lorch
summary: Lee Lorch was an American mathematician who was an early civil rights activist, and communist.

name: George G Lorentz
summary: George Gunter Lorentz was a Russian-born American mathematician who worked in approximation theory, interpolation theory of operators, and functional analysis.

name: Hendrik Antoon Lorentz
summary: Hendrik Lorentz is best known for his work on electromagnetic radiation and the FitzGerald-Lorentz contraction. He developed the mathematical theory of the electron.

name: Edward Norton Lorenz
summary: Edward Lorenz was an American mathematician and meteorologist first recognised the phenomenum of chaos in complex systems.

name: Antonio Maria Lorgna
summary: Antonio Maria Lorgna or Antonio Mario Lorgna was an Italian mathematician who founded the Accademia Nazionale delle Scienze.

name: Gino Benedetto Loria
summary: Gino Loria was an Italian mathematician and historian of mathematics who worked on projective geometry, special curves, algebraic geometry and elliptic functions.

name: Jerzy Maria Michał Łoś
summary: Jerzy Łoś was a Polish mathematician, logician, economist, and philosopher. He is especially known for his work in model theory.

name: László Lovász
summary: László Lovász is a Hungarian mathematician best known for his work in combinatorics, for which he was awarded the 2021 Abel Prize.

name: Augustus Edward Hough Love
summary: Augustus Love was an English mathematician known for his work on the theory of elasticity. He also worked on wave propagation and the structure of the Earth.

name: Leopold Löwenheim
summary: Leopold Löwenheim was a German mathematician who worked on mathematical logic and is best-known for the Löwenheim-Skolem paradox.

name: Samuel Loyd
summary: Sam Loyd was an American amateur mathematician best known for his invention of puzzles as well as chess problems.

name: François Édouard Anatole Lucas
summary: Edouard Lucas was a French mathematician who is best known for his results in number theory. He studied the Fibonacci sequence and devised the test for Mersenne primes still used today.

name: Edith Hirsch Luchins
summary: Edith Luchins was a Polish-American mathematician who applied mathematical methods to problems in the philosophy of science and psychology.

name: Jacob Lüroth
summary: Jacob Lüroth was a German mathematician who worked on rational curves and the invariance of dimension. He discovered the Student t-distribution before Gosset.

name: Eugene Lukacs
summary: Eugene Lukacs was a Hungarian-American statistician known for his work on characterisation of distributions and stability theory.

name: Jan Łukasiewicz
summary: Jan Łukasiewicz, who was born in what is now Ukraine, was an important mathematical logician. He introduced the so-called Polish notation.

name: Yudell Leo Luke
summary: Yudell Luke was an American mathematician who worked in many areas including aeronautics and approximation theory.

name: Günter Lumer
summary: Günter Lumer was born in Germany but his Jewish family were forced to flee from the Nazis in 1933, eventually going to Uruguay where Günter was educated. He spent half his career in the United States and half in Belgium. He was a creative and prolific mathematician whose works have great influence on the research community in functional analysis and evolution equations.

name: Thomas Arnot Lumsden
summary: Thomas Lumsden graduated from Edinburgh University. He became a lecturer in Mathematics at Birmingham University. He was killed in action in World War II.

name: Alexandru Ioan Lupas
summary: Alexandru Lupas was a Romanian mathematician who was a specialist in approximation theory and classical analysis.

name: George Lusztig
summary: George Lusztig is a Romanian-born mathematician who works on geometric representation theory and algebraic groups. He has been awarded prestigious mathematics prizes, including the Brouwer Medal, the Leroy P Steele Award, the Shaw Prize and the Wolf Prize.

name: Nikolai Nikolaevich Luzin
summary: Nikolai Nikolaevich Luzin was a Russian mathematician who made important contributions to the foundations of mathematics, measure theory and topology. He was head of the "Luzitania" research group at Moscow.

name: Evgeny Sergeevich Lyapin
summary: Evgeny Sergeevich Lyapin was a Ukranian mathematician who worked in algebraic systems.

name: Aleksandr Mikhailovich Lyapunov
summary: Aleksandr Lyapunov was a Russian mathematician best known for his development of the stability theory of a dynamical system. He also made contributions to mathematical physics and probability theory.

name: Roger Conant Lyndon
summary: Roger Lyndon was an American mathematician who worked in topology and group theory.

name: Carlos Benjamin de Lyra
summary: Benjamin Carlos de Lyra was a Brazilian mathematician who worked in algebraic topology.

name: Leslie Saunders Mac Lane
summary: Saunders Mac Lane was an American mathematician who worked in cohomology and category theory, but who is best known for the algebra book he wrote with Garrett Birkhoff.

name: Francis Sowerby Macaulay
summary: Francis Macaulay was an English mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry and commutative algebra.

name: Alexander Murray Macbeath
summary: Murray Macbeath was a Scottish mathematician who worked at Bletchley Park during the war. He specialised in discrete and transformation groups.

name: Hugh MacColl
summary: Hugh MacColl was a Scottish mathematician, logician and novelist.

name: James MacCullagh
summary: James MacCullagh was an Irish mathematician who published on crystalline refraction and reflection.

name: Hector Munro Macdonald
summary: Hector Macdonald graduated from Aberdeen and Cambridge Universities. He stayed on at Cambridge and won the Adams prize. He returned to Aberdeen as Professor. He did important work on electromagnetic waves.

name: James Alexander Macdonald
summary: James Macdonald graduated from Edinburgh University. he was appointed the first Rector of Leith Academy and went on to become an HM Inspector of Schools.

name: William James Macdonald
summary: William James Macdonald was a Scottish school teacher who was a pioneer of the introduction of modern geometry to the mathematical curriculum.

name: Cyrus Colton MacDuffee
summary: Cyrus MacDuffee was an American mathematiian who wrote a number of influential research papers in abstract algebra.

name: Alexander Macfarlane
summary: Alexander Macfarlane began his research on experimental physics but moved to mathematics and logic. He is best known for his two famous posthumous publications on British mathematicians of the nineteenth century, many of whom he had personally known.

name: John Machin
summary: John Machin was an English mathematician and astronomer best known for the formulas he invented for calculating π.

name: Archibald James Macintyre
summary: Archibald Macintyre was an English mathematician who worked on complex analysis. He taught in Aberdeen and at the Univeversity of Cincinatti. He was married to Sheila Scott Macintyre.

name: Sheila Scott Macintyre
summary: Sheila Scott Macintyre taught at the University of Aberdeen and worked in analysis.

name: James Peter Hymers Mackay
summary: James Mackay is a Scottish mathematician and lawyer. As Lord Mackay of Clashfern he served 10 years as Lord Chancellor.

name: John Sturgeon Mackay
summary: John S Mackay was a Scottish school teacher who was the first President of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society. He published numerous papers on Geometry.

name: Charles Frederick Fraser MacKenzie
summary: Charles MacKenzie was a Scottish mathematican who left his Cambridge fellowship to become a bishop in Africa.

name: Gladys Isabel Mackenzie
summary: Gladys Mackenzie graduated from the University of Edinburgh and became an assistant in the Natural Philosophy department. She moved to Newnham College Cambridge and late to Bristol University and Queen Elizabeth College London. She published papers on X-ray spectroscopy.

name: George Whitelaw Mackey
summary: George Mackey was an American mathematician who worked on the representation theory of groups.

name: John Mackie
summary: John Mackie graduated from Edinburgh University and went on to teach at Leith Academy, eventually becoming Rector.

name: Colin Maclaurin
born_place: Kilmodan (12 km N of Tighnabruaich), Cowal, Argyllshire, Scotland
summary: Colin Maclaurin was a Scottish mathematician who published the first systematic exposition of Newton's methods, written as a reply to Berkeley's attack on the calculus for its lack of rigorous foundations.

name: Percy Alexander MacMahon
summary: Percy MacMahon was a Maltese-born mathematician who worked in number theory and combinatorics.

name: Donald Macmillan
summary: Donald Macmillan graduated from Aberdeen University and became Principal of Clifton Bank School in St Andrews.

name: Jessie Chrystal MacMillan
summary: Chrystal Macmillan was the first female science graduate at Edinburgh University and the first female honours graduate in Mathematics. She became active in the Women's Suffrage Movement and went on to become a lawyer.

name: Thomas Murray MacRobert
summary: Thomas MacRobert studied at Glasgow and Cambridge universities. He returned to Glasgow to a series of posts culminating in the professorship. He worked on Complex Analysis.

name: Ada Isabel Maddison
summary: Isabel Maddison was an English mathematician best known for her work on differential equations.

name: Madhava of Sangamagramma
summary: Madhava was a mathematician from South India. He made some important advances in infinite series including finding the expansions for trigonometric functions.

name: Mohammed Reda Madwar
summary: Mohammed Madwar graduated from Edinburgh University and after a period in Egypt returned to Edinburgh to gain his doctorate in Astronomy. He went back to Egypt and became Professor of Astronomy at Cairo University.

name: Enrico Magenes
summary: Enrico Magenes was an Italian mathematician who worked on partial differential equations.

name: Giovanni Antonio Magini
summary: Giovanni Magini was an Italian scientist who worked in astronomy and had a version of an earth-centred Solar system.

name: Demetrios G Magiros
summary: Demetrios Magiros was a Greek-born American mathematician whose main interest was on the stability of dynamical systems.

name: Levan G Magnaradze
summary: Levan Magnaradze was a Georgian mathematician who played a major role in the Georgian Mathematical Society.

name: Leonty Filippovich Magnitsky
summary: Leonty Magnitsky was a Russian teacher who wrote the first guide to mathematics published in Russia.

name: Hans Heinrich Wilhelm Magnus
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Wilhelm Magnus was a German American mathematician who worked in combinatorial group theory, Lie algebras, mathematical physics, elliptic functions, and the study of tessellations.

name: Prasanta Chandra Mahalanobis
summary: Prasanta Mahalanobis was an Indian mathematiccian who made important contibutions to statistics and to its application in meteorology and anthropology.

name: Mahāvīra
summary: Mahāvīra was an Indian mathematician who extended the mathematics of Brahmagupta.

name: Mahendra Suri
summary: Mahendra Suri was an Indian mathematician and follower of Jain. He was the first to write a Sanskrit treatise on the astrolabe.

name: Kurt Mahler
summary: Kurt Mahler was a German mathematician who made important contributions to the theory of transcendental numbers.

name: Philip Kumar Maini
summary: Philip Maini is an Irish mathematical biologist who works in modelling processes in biology and medicine.

name: John Maior
summary: John Maior was a Scottish mathematician who worked in Paris and St Andrews where he taught logic and theology.

name: Anatoly Ivanovich Malcev
summary: Anatoly Malcev was a Russian mathematician noted for his work on the decidability of various algebraic structures.

name: Nicolas Malebranche
summary: Nicolas Malebranche was a major French philosopher and follower of Descartes whose ideas he developed to bring them more in line with standard Roman Catholic orthodox belief.

name: Gian Francesco Malfatti
summary: Gianfrancesco Malfatti was an Italian mathematician who worked on geometry, probability and mechanics and made contributions to the problem of solving polynomial equations.

name: Bernard Malgrange
summary: Bernard Malgrange is a French mathematician who worked on differential equations and singularity theory.

name: Vivienne Malone-Mayes
summary: Vivienne Malone-Mayes was an American mathematician and educationalist.

name: Étienne Louis Malus
summary: Étienne Louis Malus was a French mathematician who was almost entirely concerned with the study of light.

name: Manava
summary: Manava was the author of one of the Sulbasutras: documents containing some of the earliest Indian mathematics.

name: Szolem Mandelbrojt
summary: Szolem Mandelbrojt was a Polish-born French mathematician who specialized in mathematical analysis. He was an early Bourbakist and was the uncle of Benoit Mandelbrot.

name: Benoit Mandelbrot
summary: Benoit Mandelbrot was largely responsible for the present interest in Fractal Geometry. He showed how Fractals can occur in many different places in both Mathematics and elsewhere in Nature.

name: Ricardo Mañé Ramirez
university: Instituto de Matemática Pura e Aplicada
summary: Ricardo Mañé was an outstanding Uruguayan mathematician, famed for his work in dynamical systems, especially for proving the Stability Conjecture. He worked for his whole career at the Instituto Nacional de Matemática Pura e Aplicada in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

name: Eustachio Manfredi
summary: Eustachio Manfredi was an Italian mathematician, astronomer and poet.

name: Gabriele Manfredi
summary: Gabriele Manfredi was an Italian mathematician who was an early worker on differential equations.

name: Yuri Ivanovich Manin
born_place: Simferopol, Crimean Autonomous Soviet Republic (now Ukraine -- occupied by Russia)
summary: Yuri Ivanovich Manin was a Soviet mathematician, known for work in algebraic geometry and diophantine geometry. He also wrote on mathematical logic, computing and theoretical physics.

name: Victor Mayer Amédée Mannheim
summary: Amédée Mannheim was a French mathematician and the inventor of the modern slide rule.

name: Paul Mansion
summary: Paul Mansion was a Belgian mathematician who wrote extensively on non-Euclidean geometry, history of mathematics and differential equations.

name: Shisong Mao
born_place: Chao Xian, (now Chaohu, Anhui Province), China
summary: Shisong Mao was a Chinese mathematical statistician who was a pioneer in Chinese Mathematical Statistics especially in Statistics education.

name: Vladimir Aleksandrovich Marchenko
summary: Vladimir Alexandrovich Marchenko is a Ukrainian-born mathematician who specializes in mathematical physics.

name: Guri Ivanovich Marchuk
summary: Guri Marchuk was a Russian mathematician who worked in the fields of computational mathematics and the physics of the atmosphere.

name: Józef Marcinkiewicz
university: Uniwersytet im. Stefana Batorego w Wilnie-Polska
summary: Józef Marcinkiewicz was a Polish mathematician who worked in real analysis and partial differential equations.

name: Roberto Marcolongo
summary: Roberto Marcolongo was an Italian mathematician, known for his research in vector calculus and theoretical physics.

name: Edward Marczewski
summary: Edward Marczewski was a Polish mathematician who worked in measure theory, descriptive set theory, general topology, probability theory and universal algebra.

name: Pietro Abbati Marescotti
born_place: Modena, Duchy of Modena and Reggio (now Italy)
died_place: Modena, Duchy of Modena and Reggio (now Italy)
summary: Pietro Marescotti was an Italian mathematician who did research in the areas of algebraic equations, probability and group theory.

name: Gregori Aleksandrovic Margulis
summary: Grigori Margulis is a Russian-born American mathematician known for his work on lattices in Lie groups.

name: Marinus of Neapolis
born_place: Neapolis, Palestine (called Shechem in Bible, now Nablus, Israel)
summary: Marinus succeeded Proclus as head of the Academy at Athens. He published some work on astronomy.

name: Andrei Andreyevich Markov
summary: A A Markov was a Russian mathematician who is is best known for his work in probability and for stochastic processes especially Markov chains.

name: Artemas Martin
summary: Artemas Martin was a self-taught mathematician and book-collector whose output covered a wide range of mathematical problems.

name: Emilie Norton Martin
summary: Emilie Martin was an American mathematician and professor of mathematics at Mount Holyoke College. Her research focused on primitive substitution groups.

name: Lajos Martin
summary: Lajos Martin was a Hungarian mathematician and engineer best known for his works in transportation and aerodynamics.

name: Enzo Martinelli
summary: Enzo Martinelli was an Italian mathematician who worked in the theory of functions of several complex variables.

name: Karl Peter Heinrich Maruhn
summary: Karl Maruhn was a German mathematician who worked in aerodynamics, hydrodynamics and potential theory.

name: Verdiana Grace Masanja
summary: Verdiana Masanja is the first Tanzanian woman to earn a doctorate in mathematics. She became a professor at the University of Dar es Salaam. She works to increase women's participation in science, mathematics and technology education in Africa.

name: Lorenzo Mascheroni
summary: Lorenzo Mascheroni was a geometer who proved in 1797 that all Euclidean constructions can be made with compasses alone, so a straight edge in not needed.

name: Heinrich Maschke
summary: Heinrich Maschke was a German mathematician born in what is now Poland who worked on group theory and on differential geometry.

name: Francis Maseres
summary: Francis Maseres was an English mathematician who wrote some influential text-books.

name: Nevil Maskelyne
summary: Nevil Maskelyne was an English astronomer who measured the Earth's density in a famous experiment at Schiehallion.

name: Charles Max Mason
summary: Max Mason was an American mathematician who work on differential equations, the calculus of variations and electromagnetic theory.

name: José Luis Massera
summary: José Luis Massera was an outstanding Uruguayan mathematician who had problems with his career due to his left-wing political views. He was imprisoned for nine years by the right-wing Uruguayan military dictatorship.

name: Michael Mästlin
summary: Michael Mästlin was a German astronomer who was Kepler's teacher and who publicised the Copernican system.

name: George Ballard Mathews
summary: George Mathews was an English mathematician. Most of his research was on number theory but he also worked on analysis and geometry.

name: Claude Louis Mathieu
summary: Claude-Louis Mathieu was a French astronomer who was one of those responsible for the adoption of the metric system.

name: Émile Léonard Mathieu
summary: Emile Mathieu is remembered especially for his discovery (in 1860 and 1873) of five sporadic simple groups named after him.

name: Myron Mathisson
summary: Myron Mathisson was a Polish theoretical physicist who is known for his work in general relativity.

name: Yuri Vladimirovich Matiyasevich
summary: Yuri Matiyasevich is a Russian mathematician and computer scientist who is known for his negative solution of Hilbert's tenth problem.

name: Yozo Matsushima
summary: Yozo Matsushima was a Japanese mathematician who worked in Lie groups and algebras.

name: John William Mauchly
summary: John Mauchly was an American physicist who, along with Prosper Eckert designed ENIAC, the first general purpose electronic computer.

name: Annie Scott Dill Maunder
summary: Annie Scott Dill Maunder was a Northern Irish astronomer and mathematician who studied the mathematical tripos at Cambridge then worked at the Royal Observatory Greenwich. She was the first to find evidence of the movement of sunspot emergence from the poles toward the equator over the sun's 11-year cycle.

name: Pierre Louis Moreau de Maupertuis
summary: Pierre-Louis Maupertuis was a French mathematician who is most famous for formulating the principle of least action.

name: Gyula Iulius Maurer
summary: Gyula Maurer was a Hungarian mathematician (born in what is now Romania) who worked in group theory.

name: Francesco Maurolico
summary: Francisco Maurolico was an Italian Benedictine who wrote important books on Greek mathematics. He also worked on geometry, the theory of numbers, optics, conics and mechanics.

name: Edwin Arthur Maxwell
summary: E A Maxwell wrote several popular textbooks and made many outstanding contributions to the teaching of mathematics, particularly through his contributions to the Mathematical Association. He was an outstanding lecturer at the Queens' College, Cambridge where he undertook many administrative duties.

name: James Clerk Maxwell
summary: James Clerk Maxwell was a Scottish mathematician who did revolutionary work on electricity, magnetism, optics and on the kinetic theory of gases.

name: Kenneth Ownsworth May
summary: Kenneth May was an American mathematician and historian of mathematics best known for founding the journal Historia Mathematica.

name: Robert McCredie May
summary: Robert May was an Australian mathematical biologist whose work played a key role in the development of theoretical ecology.

name: Christian Gustav Adolph Mayer
died_place: Gries bei Bozen, Austria (now Bolzano, Italy)
summary: Christian Adolph Mayer was a German mathematician who worked on differential equations, the calculus of variations and mechanics.

name: Tobias Mayer
summary: Tobias Mayer was a German scientist who developed the method of determining longitude by lunar observations.

name: Simon Mayr
summary: Simon Mayr was a German astronomer who may have observed Jupiter's moons before Galileo.

name: Vladimir Gilelevich Maz'ya
summary: Vladimir Maz'ya is a Russian mathematician who works in mathematical analysis and partial differential equations.

name: Barry Charles Mazur
summary: Barry Mazur is an American mathematician who made contributions to geometric topology, differential topology and algebraic geometry.

name: Stanisław Meiczyslaw Mazur
summary: Stanislaw Mazur was a Polish mathematician (born in what is now Ukraine) who worked in functional analysis, summability theory, infinite games and computable functions.

name: Stefan Mazurkiewicz
summary: Stefan Mazurkiewicz was a Polish mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis, topology, and probability.

name: Walter Samuel McAfee
born_place: Ore City, Upshure County, Texas, USA
summary: Walter McAfee was an African-American scientist and astronomer, best known for his part in the world's first lunar radar echo experiments.

name: Neil McArthur
summary: Neil McArthur graduated from Glasgow University and apart from a period of war service spent his whole career at the University.

name: James Alexander McBride
summary: James McBride studied at Queen's College Belfast and then taught at various Glasgow schools finishing as Rector of Queen's Park School. He published a number of papers in Geometry and was a founder member of the Euclidean Club.

name: John Emory McClintock
summary: Emory McClintock was an American mathematician and actuary.

name: James Robert McConnell
died_place: Dalkey, Dún Laoghaire-Rathdown, County Dublin, Ireland
summary: James McConnell was an Irish mathematician who worked on quantum mechanics and the applications of Lie groups.

name: John McCowan
born_place: Bridge of Allan, near Stirling, Scotland
died_place: Bridge of Allan, near Stirling, Scotland
summary: John McCowan was a Scottish physicist who was a pioneer in the study of fluid mechanics and wave theory.

name: William Hunter McCrea
summary: William Hunter McCrea was an English astronomer and mathematician whose research on the composition of the Sun and on star formation led to the development of the big bang theory.

name: Reuben Roosevelt McDaniel
summary: Reuben R McDaniel was the fifth African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He served most of his career at Virginia State College (now Virginia State University), as head of mathematics, then as Director of the School of Arts and Sciences.

name: Margaret Dusa Waddington McDuff
summary: Dusa McDuff is an English mathematician who works on symplectic geometry.

name: Donald Cameron McIntosh
summary: Donald McIntosh graduated from the University of Aberdeen and taught at George Watson's Ladies College in Edinburgh. He was appointed a Director of Education.

name: Anderson Gray McKendrick
summary: Anderson McKendrick trained as a medical doctor in Glasgow and came to Edinburgh as Superintendent of the College of Physicians Laboratory. He made some significant mathematical contributions to biology.

name: John Bryce McLeod
summary: Bryce McLeod was a Scottish mathematician who worked on linear and nonlinear partial and ordinary differential equations.

name: Curtis Tracy McMullen
summary: Curtis McMullen is an American mathematician who was awarded the Fields Medal in 1998 for his work in complex dynamics, hyperbolic geometry and Teichmüller theory.

name: Dougald Black McQuistan
summary: Dougald McQuistan studied at Glasgow and Cambridge. He became Professor of Natural Philosophy at the Royal Technical College in Glasgow.

name: Vincent Vernon McRae
summary: Vincent Vernon McRae was an African American mathematician who worked as an operations analyst in the Operations Research Office of Johns Hopkins University. He became Technical Assistant to the President of the United States' Advisor on Science and Technology.

name: Edward James McShane
summary: Edward J McShane was an American mathematician noted for his work in the calculus of variations and integration theory.

name: George Cunliffe McVittie
summary: George McVittie studied at Edinburgh and Cambridge. He then held posts at Leeds, Edinburgh and London and became Professor of Astronomy at the University of Illinois. His main work was in Relativity and Cosmology.

name: John McWhan
summary: John McWhan studied at Glasgow and Göttingen. He returned to a post at Glasgow University.

name: Pierre François-André Méchain
summary: Pierre Méchain undertook surveys to produce maps and also worked in astronomy where he is particularly famed as a discoverer of comets.

name: Alfreds Arnolds Adolfs Meders
summary: Alfreds Meders was a Latvian mathematician who worked on differential geometry and mathematical analysis.

name: Mei Wending
born_place: Xuangcheng, now Xuanzhou, Anhui province, China
summary: Mai Wending was a Chinese mathematician and astronomer who wrote on simultaneous equations and advocated the use of Western ideas in Chinese mathematics.

name: John George Brotchie Meiklejohn
summary: John Meiklejohn graduated from Edinburgh and taught at Dundee High School.

name: Hans Meinhardt
summary: Hans Meinhardt was a German scientist who is known for his pioneering work in the field of pattern formation in biology.

name: Daniel Friedrich Ernst Meissel
summary: Ernst Meissel's mathematical work covers number theory, work on Möbius inversion and the theory of partitions as well as work on Bessel functions, asymptotic analysis, refraction of light and the three body problem.

name: Heinrich Meissner
born_place: Free Imperial City of Hamburg (now Germany)
died_place: Free Imperial City of Hamburg (now Germany)
summary: Heinrich Meissner was a German mathematician who wrote some popular textbooks. He was one of the founders of the Hamburg Mathematical Society.

name: Robert Hjalmar Mellin
summary: Hjalmar Mellin was a Finnish mathematician and functional theorist.

name: Júlio César de Mello e Souza
summary: Júlio César de Mello e Souza was a Brazilian mathematician who wrote very popular texts such as The man who counted under the pseudonym Malba Tahan. Brazil's National Day of Mathematics was instituted in 2013 to be on 6 May, Mello e Souza's birthday

name: Luigi Federico Menabrea
summary: Luigi Menabrea was a French-born soldier and engineer who made contributions to elasticity theory and became prime-minister of Italy.

name: Menaechmus
summary: Menaechmus was a Greek mathematician who tutored Alexander the Great in the subject. He was the first to investigate the ellipse, parabola and hyperbola as sections of a cone.

name: Nathan Saul Mendelsohn
summary: Nathan Mendelsohn was an American-born Canadian mathematician who worked in several areas of discrete mathematics, including group theory and combinatorics.

name: Menelaus of Alexandria
summary: Menelaus was one of the later Greek geometers who applied spherical geometry to astronomy. He is best known for the so-called Menelaus's theorem.

name: Karl Menger
summary: Karl Menger was an Austrian-American mathematician who worked on algebras, geometries, curve and dimension theory. He also contributed to game theory and social sciences.

name: Pietro Mengoli
summary: Pietro Mengoli was an Italian mathematician who worked on infinite series and limits of geometric figures.

name: Dmitrii Evgenevich Menshov
summary: Dmitrii Menshov was a Russian mathematician known for his contributions to the theory of trigonometric series.

name: Hugues Charles Robert Méray
summary: Charles Méray was a French mathematician who published an early work on the arithmetical theory of irrational numbers.

name: Gerardus Mercator
summary: Gerardus Mercator was a Flemish map-maker and geographer who is best known for the map projection which bears his name.

name: Nicolaus Mercator
born_place: Eutin, Holstein, Holy Roman Empire (now Germany)
summary: Nicolaus Mercator was a German mathematician best known for his series for log(1 + x).

name: Alan Mercer
summary: Alan Mercer was an English mathematician who made important contributions to the field of Operational Research.

name: James Mercer
summary: James Mercer was an English mathematician who worked in analysis -- in particular in integral equations.

name: Charles Watkins Merrifield
summary: Charles Merrifield was an English mathematician who worked on elliptic functions and played an important role in the development of mathematical ssocieties.

name: Alexander Johnson Merriles
summary: Alexander Merriles graduated from Edinburgh University and afterwards taught at Edinburgh Provincial Training College and George Watson's Ladies' College in Edinburgh.

name: Marin Mersenne
summary: Marin Mersenne was a French monk who is best known for his role as a clearing house for correspondence between eminent philosophers and scientists and for his work in number theory.

name: Franz Carl Joseph Mertens
born_place: Schroda, Posen, Prussia (now Środa Wielkopolska, Poland)
summary: Franz Mertens was a Polish-born mathematician who made contributions to a wide variety of areas. He formulated the Mertens conjecture which (had it been true) would have implied the Riemann Hypothesis.

name: Ivan Vsevolodovich Meshchersky
summary: Ivan Vsevolodovich Meshchersky was a Russian mathematician famous for his work on mechanics.

name: Ida Martha Metcalf
summary: Ida Martha Metcalf was the second woman to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics in America. She was never able to gain a position in keeping with her abilities and qualifications. She was open in her criticisms of the education system and of discrimination.

name: William Henry Metzler
summary: William Metzler was a Canadian mathematician who published papers on the theory of matrices and determinants.

name: Paul-André Meyer
summary: Paul-André Meyer was a French mathematician who worked in the theory of stochastic processes.

name: Friedrich Wilhelm Franz Meyer
summary: Wilhelm Meyer studied algebraic geometry, algebraic curves and invariant theory.

name: John Henry Michell
summary: John Henry Michell was an Australian mathematician, who made important contributions to the fields of hydrodynamics and elasticity.

name: Ruth Ingrid Michler
summary: Ruth Michler was an American mathematician who became an expert in commutative algebra and algebraic geometry. She organised several special sessions at meetings of the American Mathematical Society. She was killed in a road accident in Boston at the age of 33.

name: Gheorghe Mihoc
summary: Gheorghe Mihoc was a Romanian mathematician and statistician.

name: Solomon Grigoryevich Mikhlin
summary: Solomon Grigoryevich Mikhlin was a Belarussian mathematician of who worked in the fields of linear elasticity, singular integrals and numerical analysis.

name: Jan Geniusz Mikusiński
summary: Jan Mikusiński was a Polish mathematician known for his pioneering work in mathematical analysis.

name: George Abram Miller
summary: George Miller was an American mathematician who worked mostly on group theory but he was also interested in the history of mathematics.

name: John Miller
summary: John Miller studied at Glasgow and Göttingen. He returned to Glasgow to the Royal College of Science and Technology (the precursor to Strathclyde University).

name: Kelly Miller
summary: Kelly Miller was an African-American mathematician, sociologist, essayist, newspaper columnist and author.

name: Archibald Milne
summary: Archibald Milne graduated from Edinburgh University and taught at the Church of Scotland Training College in Edinburgh.

name: Edward Arthur Milne
summary: Arthur Milne was an English mathematician and astrophysicist who worked on the structure of stars and developed an alternative to the theory of relativity.

name: William Proctor Milne
summary: William P Milne studied at Aberdeen and Cambridge universities. He taught at Clifton College and then became Professor of Mathematics at Leeds.

name: Louis Melville Milne-Thomson
summary: Louis Milne-Thomson was an English applied mathematician best known for his textbooks on applied mathematics.

name: Eric Charles Milner
summary: Eric Milner was an English mathematician who spent much of his time abroad and who worked mainly in combinatorial set theory.

name: John Willard Milnor
summary: John Milnor is an American mathematician known for his work in differential topology, K-theory and dynamical systems.

name: Subbaramiah Minakshisundaram
summary: Subbaramiah Minakshisundaram was an Indian mathematician who worked on partial differential equations.

name: Ernst Ferdinand Adolf Minding
summary: Ferdinand Minding worked in differential geometry and the theory of surfaces.

name: Henri Paul Mineur
summary: Henri Mineur was a French astronomer and mathematician who observed the variation of star movements based on their distance from the core of a galaxy.

name: Hermann Minkowski
summary: Minkowski developed a new view of space and time and laid the mathematical foundation of the theory of relativity.

name: Carlo Miranda
summary: Carlo Miranda was an Italian mathematician who worked on mathematical analysis, partial differential equations and complex analysis.

name: Leon Mirsky
summary: Leon Mirsky worked in Number Theory, Linear Algebra and Combinatorics.

name: Maryam Mirzakhani
summary: Maryam Mirzakhani was an Iranian mathematician who worked in America and was the first woman to be awarded a Fields Medal. She worked in the geometry of Riemann surfaces.

name: Richard von Mises
summary: Richard Von Mises was an applied mathematician who worked on fluid mechanics, aerodynamics, aeronautics statistics and probability theory. He gave the first university course on powered flight in 1913.

name: Luna Isaac Mishoe
summary: Luna Isaac Mishoe was one of the first twenty African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He taught mathematics and physics at Morgan State College in Baltimore, did postdoctoral research at Oxford University in England and from 1960 served as president of Delaware State College.

name: James Mitchell
summary: James Mitchell studied at Edinburgh and Berlin. He taught at Waid Academy, at Nairn Academy and Lochgilphead School Argyll where he became headmaster.

name: Maria Mitchell
summary: Maria Mitchell was the first observer to see a new telescopic comet, for which see received a Danish medal in 1847. In 1848 she became the first woman elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. She became the first professor of astronomy at Vassar College and was a founder of the American Association for the Advancement of Women.

name: Andrew Ronald Mitchell
summary: Ron Mitchell was a Scottish applied mathematician and numerical analyst.

name: Yurii Alekseevich Mitropolskii
summary: Yurii Alekseevich Mitropolskiy was a Ukrainian mathematician known for his contributions to dynamical systems and nonlinear oscillations.

name: Fatma Moalla
summary: Fatma Moalla is a Tunisian mathematician who has undertaken research on Finsler spaces. In 1961 she became the first Tunisian to have been awarded the Agrégation in Mathematics in France and, in 1965, the first Tunisian woman to be awarded a doctorate in mathematics in France.

name: August Ferdinand Möbius
summary: August Möbius is best known for his work in topology, especially for his conception of the Möbius strip, a two dimensional surface with only one side.

name: Horace Yomishi Mochizuki
summary: Horace Mochizuki was an American mathematician who worked in group theory and is particularly known for his work on the Burnside conjecture.

name: Franc Mocnik
summary: Franc Močnik was a Slovenian mathematician, pedagogue and writer of mathematical textbooks.

name: George Lowe Moffat
summary: George Moffat graduated from Edinburgh University and taught at Dumfries Academy and Glasgow Academy where he became Head of Mathematics.

name: Ismail Jacobus Mohamed
born_place: Barkly East, Eastern Cape, South Africa
summary: Ismail Mohamed was a South African mathematician who specialised in group theory. He was imprisoned by the South African government but later became a member of parliament for the ANC.

name: Ernst Max Mohr
born_place: Ebersbach an der Fils, Württemberg, Germany
summary: Ernst Max Mohr was a German mathematician who worked in the field of hydrodynamics, applied mathematics and differential equations, but also published on polynomials.

name: Georg Mohr
summary: Georg Mohr was a Danish mathematician who anticipated Mascheroni's proof that all ruler and compass constructions can be accomplished with compasses alone.

name: Margaret Barr Moir
summary: Margaret Barr Moir was a Scottish mathematical physicist who became a lecturer in mathematics at the University of Western Australia in Perth. She may be the first woman appointed as a university lecturer in mathematics in Australia. She lost her job after the University had to make substantial cut-backs following the Great Depression.

name: Benjamin Lawrence Moiseiwitsch
summary: Benjamin Moiseiwitsch was an English mathematician who worked on differential and integral equations and was interested in connections between art and mathematics.

name: Grigore C Moisil
summary: Grigore Constantin Moisil was a Romanian mathematician and computer scientist who worked in the fields of mathematical logic and differential equations.

name: Elena Moldovan Popoviciu
summary: Elena Popoviciu was a Romanian mathematician who worked in functional analysis.

name: Theodor Molien
summary: Theodor Molien was born in what is now Latvia and studied associative algebras and polynomial invariants of finite groups.

name: Karl Brandan Mollweide
summary: Karl Mollweide was a German mathematician and astronomer. He invented a map projection called the Mollweide projection.

name: Samuel Molyneux
summary: Samuel Molyneux was an English astronomer who produced some new telescope designs.

name: William Molyneux
summary: William Molyneux was an Irish scientist and philosopher who worked on optics.

name: Gaspard Monge
summary: Gaspard Monge is considered the father of differential geometry because of his work Application de l'analyse à la géométrie where he introduced the concept of lines of curvature of a surface in 3-space.

name: Guidobaldo Marchese del Monte
summary: Guidobaldo del Monte was an Italian mathematician who wrote on statics and also on perspective and astronomy.

name: Luiz Henrique Jacy Monteiro
summary: Luiz Henrique Jacy Monteiro was a Brazilian mathematician who played a major role in the development of Brazilian mathematics in the middle of the 20th century. He did much to introduce modern mathematics to Brazilian school teachers as well as to university students.

name: Paul Antoine Aristide Montel
summary: Paul Montel was a French mathematician who worked on complex analytic functions.

name: Domenico Montesano
summary: Domenico Montesano was an Italian mathematician who studied the theory of linear congruences and conic bilinear complexes.

name: Deane Montgomery
summary: Deane Montgomery was an American mathematician who worked in algebraic and geometric topology.

name: Elliott Waters Montroll
summary: Elliott Montroll was an American scientist and mathematician who worked in a variety of applied mathematical and statistical areas.

name: Jean Étienne Montucla
summary: Étienne Montucla was a French historian of mathematics who wrote in 1754 a history of the problem of squaring the circle.

name: Eliakim Hastings Moore
summary: Eliakim Moore was an American mathematician who worked on abstract algebra, algebraic geometry, number theory and integral equations.

name: Jonas Moore
summary: Jonas Moore was an English man of science important for his support of mathematics and astronomy.

name: Robert Lee Moore
summary: Robert Lee Moore was an American mathematician, known for his work in general topology and the "Moore method" of teaching university mathematics.

name: Patrick Alfred Pierce Moran
born_place: Kings Cross, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
summary: Patrick Moran was an Australian statistician who worked in probability theory and its application to population and evolutionary genetics.

name: Cathleen Synge Morawetz
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Cathleen Morawetz was a Canadian mathematician who worked on the partial differential equations governing fluid flow, particularly those of mixed type occurring in transonic flow.

name: Louis Joel Mordell
summary: Mordell is best known for his investigations of equations of the form of y2 = x3 + k which had been studied by Fermat.

name: Henry More
summary: Henry More was an English philosopher of science whose ideas may have influenced Newton.

name: Giacinto Morera
summary: Giacinto Morera was an Italian mathematician who made contributions to dynamics.

name: Alexander Morgan
summary: Alexander Morgan was a Scotish mathematician who had an important influence on the development of education in Scotland.

name: William Morgan
summary: William Morgan was an early actuary.

name: Shigefumi Mori
summary: Shigefumi Mori is a Japanese mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on algebraic manifolds.

name: Arthur Jules Morin
summary: Arthur Jules Morin was a French mathematician who became an army general. He worked on a variety of applied mathematical topics.

name: Jean-Baptiste Morin
summary: Jean-Baptiste Morin was a French astrologer and astronomer who attempted to solve the longitude problem using lunar observations.

name: Ugo Morin
summary: Ugo Morin was an Italian mathematician who worked in classical algebraic geometry and abstract algebra.

name: Taro Morishima
summary: Taro Morishima was a Japanese mathematician who worked in algebra and number theory.

name: Frank Morley
summary: Frank Morley wrote mainly on geometry but also on algebra. He is best known for his theorem about the trisectors of the angles of a triangle.

name: John Todd Morrison
summary: John Morrison was appointed Professor of Physics at Victoria College Stellenbosch in South Africa. He did important work on the magnetic survey of South Africa.

name: Harold Calvin Marston Morse
summary: Morse developed variational theory in the large with applications to equilibrium problems in mathematical physics, a theory which is now called Morse theory and forms a vital role in global analysis.

name: Keith William Morton
summary: Bill Morton is an English mathematician who worked on partial differential equations and their numerical analysis.

name: Vernon Charles Morton
summary: Vernon Morton was an English mathematician who was head of Pure Mathematics at Aberystwyth for many years.

name: Henry Moseley
summary: Henry Moseley was an English churchman, mathematician, and scientist. He served as Professor of Natural and Experimental Philosophy and Astronomy at King's College, London. He then became of of the first H.M. inspectors of schools.

name: Jürgen Kurt Moser
summary: Jürgen Moser was a German-born American mathematician who worked in Hamiltonian dynamical systems and partial differential equations.

name: Leo Moser
university: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
summary: Leo Moser was an Austrian-born Canadian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: William Oscar Jules Moser
summary: William Moser was a Canadian mathematician who worked in combinatorial geometry and group theory.

name: Ali Moustafa Mosharrafa
summary: b>Ali Moustafa Mosharrafa was an Egyptian theoretical physicist who contributed to the development of quantum theory as well as the theory of relativity.

name: Charles Frederick Mosteller
summary: Frederick Mosteller was an Americcan statistician who wrote widely and had a big influence on the development of statistics in America.

name: George Daniel Mostow
summary: Dan Mostow was an outstanding mathematician winning the Leroy Steele Prize in 1993 and the Wolf Prize in Mathematics in 2013 for his fundamental and pioneering contribution to geometry and Lie group theory. He also played a major role in supporting mathematics as president of the American Mathematical Society and in many other leading roles.

name: Andrzej Mostowski
summary: Andrzej Mostowski was a Polish mathematician who worked on logic and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Rajeev Motwani
died_place: Atherton, San Mateo County, California, USA
summary: Rajeev Motwani was an Indian-born American computer scientist whose research focused on theoretical computer science and is known for his contribution to the Google search engine.

name: Theodore Samuel Motzkin
summary: Theodore Samuel Motzkin was a German-born American mathematician best known for his work on linear programming.

name: Ruth Moufang
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Ruth Moufang studied projective planes, introducing Moufang planes and non-associative systems called Moufang loops.

name: Magdalena Araceli Mouján Otaño
summary: Magdalena Mouján was an Argentine mathematician who became famed as a writer of science fiction. She taught mathematics and statistics at various Argentine universities: Universidad Católica de la Plata, Universidad Nacional de Córdoba, Universidad Nacional del Comahue, and Universidad Nacional de Luján.

name: Forest Ray Moulton
summary: Forest Ray Moulton was an American astronomer. He was one of the proponents of the planetesimal hypothesis of the origin and evolution of the solar system.

name: C V Mourey
summary: C V Mourey was a French mathematician who is known solely from one work in which he introduces the ideas of complex numbers.

name: Gabriel Mouton
summary: Gabriel Mouton was a French clergyman who worked on interpolation and on astronomy.

name: Thomas Muir
born_place: Stonebyres, Falls of Clyde, Lanarkshire, Scotland
summary: Thomas Muir was a Scot who went on to be Superintendent General of Education in South Africa and is best known for his five volume History of Determinants.

name: Robert Franklin Muirhead
summary: Robert Muirhead studied at Glasgow, Cambridge and Göttingen. He taught in various schools and founded the Glasgow Tutorial College.

name: Emil Müller
summary: Emil Müller was an Austrian mathematician who was one of the founders of the Austrian Mathematical Society.

name: Johann Müller Regiomontanus
born_place: Unfinden (near Königsberg, Lower Franconia (now in Bavaria) Germany)
summary: Regiomontanus or Johann Müller was a German scholar who made important contributions to trigonometry and astronomy.

name: Anna Margaret Mullikin
summary: Anna Margaret Mullikin was an American mathematician who was one of the early investigators of point set theory.

name: David Bryant Mumford
summary: David Mumford is an English-born American mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on algebraic geometry.

name: Walter Douglas Munn
summary: Douglas Munn was a Scottish mathematician who made important progress in semigroup theory.

name: Francis Dominic Murnaghan
summary: Francis Dominic Murnaghan was an Irish mathematician who worked in the application of group theory to continuum mechanics.

name: Gerard John Murphy
summary: Gerard Murphy was an Irish mathematician who worked in functional analysis.

name: Robert Murphy
summary: Robert Murphy was an Irish mathematician who worked on the theory of equations and was among the first to consider algebras of operators.

name: James Dickson Murray
summary: James Murray is a Scottish mathematician who is best known for his authoritative and extensive work Mathematical Biology.

name: Nikoloz Muskhelishvili
summary: Niko Muskhelishvili was a Georgian mathematician and physicist who worked in elasticity and was one of the founders of the Georgian Academy of Sciences.

name: José Celestino Mutis
summary: José Celestino Mutis was a Spanish scientist who organised and directed the Royal Botanical Expedition of the New Kingdom of Granada, one of the most important scientific expeditions of the eighteenth century.

name: Claude Mydorge
summary: Claude Mydorge was a French geometer who published books on optics and conic sections.

name: Claude Mylon
summary: Claude Mylon was a French mathematician important because of his correspondence with the leading mathematicians of the day.

name: Leopoldo Nachbin
summary: Leopoldo Nachbin was an outstanding Brazilian mathematician who spent time as a Visiting Professor at many of the top institutions worldwide. He worked on ordered systems, topology, topological vector spaces, approximation theory, harmonic analysis, and infinite-dimensional holomorphy.

name: Masayoshi Nagata
summary: Masayoshi Nagata was a Japanese mathematician who worked in the field of commutative algebra.

name: Christian Heinrich von Nagel
summary: Christian Heinrich von Nagel was a German geometer. The "Nagel point" of a triangle is named after him.

name: Mark Aronovich Naimark
summary: Mark Aronovich Naimark was a Ukranian mathematician who worked in functional analysis and mathematical physics.

name: Hidegorô Nakano
summary: Hidegorô Nakano was a Japanese mathematician who is remembered today for Nakano spaces, and for his results on vector lattices and operator theory in Hilbert spaces.

name: Tadashi Nakayama
summary: Tadashi Nakayama was a Japanese mathematician who made important contributions to representation theory.

name: Pia Maria Nalli
summary: Pia Nalli was an Italian mathematician known for her work on algebraic geometry, functional analysis and tensor analysis.

name: John Napier
summary: John Napier was a Scottish scholar who is best known for his invention of logarithms, but other mathematical contributions include a mnemonic for formulas used in solving spherical triangles and two formulas known as Napier's analogies.

name: Narayana Pandit
summary: Narayana was an Indian mathematician who wrote on arithmetic following the work of Bhaskara II.

name: John Forbes Nash
summary: John Nash was an American mathematician who won the Nobel Prize for Economics for his work in game theory. He achieved fame through the film A Beautiful Mind.

name: Crispin St John Alvah Nash-Williams
summary: Crispin Nash-Williams was a Welsh mathematician who worked in discrete mathematics, especially graph theory.

name: Jason John Nassau
summary: Jason J Nassau was an American mathematician who published papers in both mathematics and astronomy.

name: Claude Louis Marie Henri Navier
summary: Claude-Louis Navier was a French mathematician best known for the Navier-Stokes equations describing the behaviour of a incompressible fluid.

name: Victoria Ruth Neale
summary: Vicky Neale was an exceptional university teacher and had the ability to bring many people to mathematics through her outreach work. She tragically died from cancer aged 39.

name: William Neile
summary: William Neile was an English mathematician who was the first to calculate the arc-length of the cubical parabola.

name: Aleksandr Ivanovich Nekrasov
summary: Aleksandr Nekrasov was a Russian mathematician who applied mathematics to hydromechanics and aeromechanics.

name: Evelyn Merle Roden Nelson
summary: Evelyn Nelson was a Canadian mathematician who worked in the area of universal algebra with applications to theoretical computer science.

name: Haim Nessyahu
summary: Haim Nessyahu was a young Israeli mathematician who has an Israel Mathematical Union prize named for him.

name: Eugen Otto Erwin Johannes Netto
summary: Eugen Netto was a German mathematician who made major steps towards abstract group theory when he combined permutation group results and groups in number theory. He also worked on space-filling curves.

name: Joseph Jean Baptiste Neuberg
summary: Joseph Neuberg was a Luxembourg mathematician who worked primarily in geometry.

name: Joachim Neubüser
summary: Joachim Neubüser was one of the first to create a computer package to study discrete mathematics, in particular group theory. The system GAP, development of which bgan in 1985, was awarded the ACM/SIGSAM Richard Dimick Jenks Memorial Prize for Excellence in Software Engineering applied to Computer Algebra in July 2008.

name: Otto Neugebauer
summary: Otto Neugebauer was an Austrian mathematician who made important contributions to the history of ancient mathematics and astronomy.

name: Bernhard Hermann Neumann
summary: Bernhard Neumann was a German-born British-Australian mathematician who was one of the leading figures in group theory.

name: Carl Gottfried Neumann
summary: Carl Neumann was a German mathematician who worked on the Dirichlet principle and on integral equations. He was one of the founders of Mathematische Annalen.

name: Franz Ernst Neumann
summary: Franz Neumann worked on crystallography and other physical applications of mathematics.

name: Hanna Neumann
summary: Hanna Neumann worked in group theory. Her thesis examined free products with amalgamation. Later she worked on varieties of groups and her book Varieties of Groups (1967) is a classic.

name: John von Neumann
summary: John Von Neumann built a solid framework for quantum mechanics. He also worked in game theory, studied what are now called von Neumann Algebras, and was one of the pioneers of computer science.

name: Víctor Manuel Neumann-Lara
summary: Víctor Neumann-Lara was a mathematician who worked on graph theory, general topology, game theory and combinatorics, building a very active research school in Mexico

name: Rolf Herman Nevanlinna
summary: Rolf Nevanlinna was a Finnish mathematician famous for his work on complex analysis.

name: Jacques Jean-Pierre Joseph Neveu
summary: Jacques Neveu was a Belgian mathematician who worked in France, specialising in probability theory.

name: Eric Harold Neville
summary: E H Neville was professor of mathematics at the University of Reading. He played an important role in mathematical education, particularly with the British Association for the Advancement of Science, with the Mathematical Association and with the International Commission on Mathematical Instruction. He wrote a number of important texts and many interesting articles.

name: Simon Newcomb
summary: Simon Newcomb was a Canadian-born mathematician whose work on mathematical astronomy was very important. He also wrote on economics.

name: Maxwell Herman Alexander Newman
summary: Max Newman was an English mathematician who worked on combinatorial topology and theoretcal computer science. His codebreaking work in World War II has made him famous.

name: Mary Frances Winston Newson
summary: Mary Newson was an American mathematician. She became the first female American to receive a PhD in mathematics from a European university.

name: Isaac Newton
summary: Isaac Newton was the greatest English mathematician of his generation. He laid the foundation for differential and integral calculus. His work on optics and gravitation make him one of the greatest scientists the world has known.

name: Jerzy Neyman
born_place: Bendery, Bessarabia, Russian Empire (now Transnistria, Moldova)
summary: Jerzy Neyman was a Russian born American mathematician who did important work in probability and statistics including applications to meteorology and medicine.

name: Onorato Nicoletti
summary: Onorato Nicoletti was an Italian mathematician who worked in various fields of mathematics, including numerical analysis, infinitesimal analysis and differential equations.

name: Jean-Nicolas Nicollet
