summary: Joseph Nicolas Nicollet was a French cartographer, astronomer and mathematician known for his expeditions to map the USA.

name: Nicomachus of Gerasa
born_place: Gerasa, Roman Syria (possibly now Jarash, Jordan)
summary: Nicomachus was one of the leading members of the Pythagorean School whose Introduction to Arithmetic was the standard arithmetic text for more than 1000 years.

name: Nicomedes
summary: Nicomedes was a Greek mathematician famous for his treatise On conchoid lines which contains his discovery of the conchoid curve which he used to solve various mathematical problems, including the trisection of angles.

name: Jakob Nielsen
summary: Jakob Nielsen was a Danish mathematician best known for his work on automorphisms of surfaces.

name: Niels Nielsen
summary: Niels Nielsen was a Danish mathematician who worked on special functions and number theory.

name: Florence Nightingale
summary: Florence Nightingale is best known for her work as a nurse, but she was also a pioneering statistician.

name: Albert Nijenhuis
summary: Albert Nijenhuis was a Dutch-born American mathematician who worked in differential geometry and the theory of deformations. He later worked in combinatorics.

name: Otton Marcin Nikodym
summary: Otton Nikodym was a Polish mathematician who worked in America and is known for his work on integration theory.

name: Serge Mikhalovich Nikolski
born_place: Zavod Talitsa, Perm Province, Russian Empire
summary: Serge Nikolski was a Russian mathematician who worked in functional analysis and partial differential equations.

name: Nilakantha Somayaji
summary: Nilakantha was a mathematician and astronomer from South India who wrote texts on both astronomy and infinite series.

name: Louis Nirenberg
summary: Louis Nirenberg was a Canadian mathematician whohas made important contributions to linear and nonlinear partial differential equations and their application to complex analysis and geometry.

name: Charles Niven
summary: Charles Niven was a Scot who became Professor of Mathematics at Cork. He returned to Aberdeen as Professor of Natural Philosophy and held this post for 42 years.

name: William Davidson Niven
summary: William Niven was a Scottish mathematician who was a friend of Maxwell and worked on electricity, magnetism and harmonic functions.

name: Charles Albert Noble
summary: Charles Noble was an American mathematician best known for his work in the development of mathematical education.

name: Emmy Amalie Noether
summary: Emmy Noether is best known for her contributions to abstract algebra, in particular, her study of chain conditions on ideals of rings.

name: Fritz Alexander Ernst Noether
summary: Fritz Noether was a German mathematician who emigrated from Nazi Germany to the Soviet Union and was later executed by the Stalinist NKVD. He was the son of Max Noether and the brother of Emmy Noether.

name: Max Noether
summary: Max Noether was a German mathematician who was one of the leaders of nineteenth century algebraic geometry. Although himself a very distinguished mathematician, his daughter Emmy Noether was to bring greater innovation to mathematics than did her father.

name: Niels Erik Norlund
summary: Niels Norlund was a Danish mathematician and astronomer who worked in the theory of difference equations.

name: Douglas Geoffrey Northcott
summary: Douglas Northcott was an English mathematician best known for his work on ideal theory.

name: Petr Sergeevich Novikov
summary: Petr Sergeevich Novikov is a Russian mathematician known for his work on combinatorial problems in group theory including the word problem for groups and the Burnside problem.

name: Sergei Petrovich Novikov
summary: Sergei Novikov is a Russian mathematician who worked in algebraic topology and soliton theory. He won a Fields medal in 1970 and a Wolf prize in 2005.

name: Annie Hutton Numbers
summary: Annie Hutton Numbers graduated from Edinburgh University and worked in the Chemistry department in Edinburgh. She taught in schools in Ipswich and High Wycombe.

name: Pedro Nunes Salaciense
summary: Pedro Nunes or Nunez was a Portuguese scholar who worked in geometry, spherical trigonometry, algebra as well as geography, physics, and cosmology.

name: Kristen Nygaard
summary: Kristen Nygaard was a Norwegian computer scientist, programming language pioneer, and politician. He was the co-inventor of object-oriented programming and the language Simula.

name: Matthew O'Brien
summary: Matthew O'Brien was an Irish mathematician best known for his theory and application of the vector method.

name: Daniel Joseph Kelly O'Connell
summary: Daniel Joseph O'Connell was an English Jesuit priest, astronomer and seismologist who worked on eclipsing binaries and variable stars.

name: John J O'Connor
summary: John O'Connor is an English-born mathematician best known as one of the creators of the MacTutor History of Mathematics archive

name: Lochlainn O'Raifeartaigh
summary: Lochlainn O'Raifeartaigh was an Irish physicist who worked in the field of theoretical particle physics.

name: Abdel-Shafy Fahmy Obada
summary: Abdel-Shafy Obada is an Egyptian mathematician who has made important contributions to quantum field theory.

name: Chike Edozien Umezei Obi
summary: Chike Obi was a Nigerian mathematician and politician. He was the first Nigerian to hold a doctorate in mathematics. His research was on non-linear ordinary differential equations.

name: William of Ockham
summary: William of Ockham was an English mathematician and philosopher best known for Ockham's razor, one version of which is: It is vain to do with more what can be done with less.

name: Oenopides of Chios
summary: Oenopides was a Greek who made important contributions to astronomy and may have been the first to fix a value for the obliqity of the ecliptic.

name: Albert Cyril Offord
summary: Albert Cyril Offord was an English mathematician who was the first professor of mathematics at the London School of Economics.

name: Georg Simon Ohm
summary: Georg Simon Ohm was a German mathematician best known for Ohm's Law on electrical resistance.

name: Martin Ohm
summary: Martin Ohm wa a German mathematician who attempted to put mathematics on to a rigorous basis. He was the brother of the better known Georg Ohm.

name: Kiyoshi Oka
summary: Kiyoshi Oka was a Japanese mathematician who worked in the theory of several complex variables.

name: George Olatokunbo Okikiolu
summary: George Okikiolu is a Nigerian mathematician and inventor who published papers on integral operators on Banach spaces.

name: Katherine Adebola Okikiolu
summary: Katherine Okikiolu was born in England, the daughter of a Nigerian mathematician. She went to the United States where she was awarded a Presidential Early Career Award for Scientists and Engineers for both her mathematical research and her development of mathematics curricula for inner-city school children.

name: Chukwuka Benjamin Okonjo
summary: Chukwuka Okonjo was a Nigerian mathematician and economist who was the Eze (King) of the Obahai Royal Family of Ogwashi-Ukwu

name: Andrei Yuryevich Okounkov
summary: Andrei Yuryevich Okounkov won a Fields Medal in 2006 for his contributions bridging probability, representation theory and algebraic geometry.

name: Edwin Glenn Olds
summary: Edwin Glenn Olds was an American mathematician and statistician. He was mainly interested in probability and was regarded as an outstanding teacher.

name: Czesław Olech
summary: Czesław Olech was a Polish mathematician who worked in differential equations and control theory.

name: Olga Arsen'evna Oleinik
summary: Olga Oleinik was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked on the theory of partial differential equations.

name: Gloria Rita Olive
summary: Gloria Olive was an American mathematician who worked on on applications of generalised powers.

name: Théodore Olivier
summary: Théodore Olivier was a French geometer who made string models of ruled surfaces.

name: Kathleen Timpson Ollerenshaw
summary: Kathleen Ollerenshaw was an English mathematician and educationalist who overcame deafness and went on to become an important political advisor. She was elected Lord Mayor of Manchester.

name: Adegoke Olubummo
summary: Adegoke Olubummo was a Nigerian mathematician who was the first Nigerian professor of mathematics.

name: Yewande Olubummo
summary: Yewande Olubummo is a Nigerian mathematician who works in the United States. In 2006-2010 she was chair of the mathematics department at Spelman College. She publishes papers on functional analysis and dynamical systems. With National Science Foundation support she led a programme to encourage minority undergraduates in mathematics to go on to graduate study.

name: Victor Omololu Sowemimo Olunloyo
summary: Victor Olunloyo is a Nigerian mathematician who published results on number theory. He became governor of Oyo State in Nigeria in October 1983 until unseated by a military coup.

name: Octav Onicescu
summary: Octav Onicescu was a Romanian mathematician with research interests that included many areas such as probability, Riemannian manifolds, absolute differential calculus, functional analysis, algebra, and the topological theory of functions. He is considered as the founder of the Romanian school of probability.

name: Ernst Julius Öpik
summary: Ernst Öpik was an Estonian astronomer who specialised in the study of minor bodies, such as asteroids, comets and meteors He spent the second half of his career in Northern Ireland.

name: Alexander Oppenheim
summary: Alexander Oppenheim was a British mathematician who worked in number theory. He became vice-chancellor of the University of Malaya.

name: Øystein Ore
summary: Øystein Ore was a Norwegian mathematician who worked in ring theory, Galois theory and graph theory.

name: Nicole Oresme
summary: Nicole Oresme was a French mathematician who invented coordinate geometry long before Descartes. He was the first to use a fractional exponent and also worked on infinite series.

name: Władysław Orlicz
summary: Władysław Orlicz was a Polish mathematician who worked in functional analysis and topology.

name: Donald Samuel Ornstein
summary: Don Ornstein is an American mathematician working in the area of ergodic theory.

name: William McFadden Orr
summary: William McFadden Orr was an Irish mathematician who worked on thermodynamics and fluid flow.

name: Mollie Orshansky
summary: Mollie Orshansky was an American economist and statistician who developed the Orshansky Poverty Thresholds, used for measuring household incomes.

name: Steven Alan Orszag
born_place: Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA
summary: Steven Orszag was an American mathematician who specialised in the areas of computational fluid dynamics, turbulence theory and numerical analysis.

name: Carl Wilhelm Oseen
summary: Wilhelm Oseen was a Swedish mathematician who worked in fluid dynamics.

name: William Fogg Osgood
summary: William Osgood was important in bringing the latest ideas of mathematical research to the United States.

name: Timofei Fedorovic Osipovsky
summary: Timofei Fedorovic Osipovsky was a Russian mathematician who wrote some influential textbooks.

name: Mikhail Vasilevich Ostrogradski
summary: Mikhail Ostrogradski worked on hydrodynamics, elasticity, heat and electricity.

name: Iossif Vladimirovich Ostrovskii
summary: Iossif Ostrovskii was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked in the theory of integer and meromorphic functions and their application in the theory of probability.

name: Alexander Markowich Ostrowski
summary: Alexander Ostrowski was a Ukranian-born mathematician who worked on a wide variety of topics in both analysis and algebra.

name: Marie Françoise Ouedraogo
summary: Marie Françoise Ouedraogo became the first female doctorate from Burkina Faso. She is President of the African Women Mathematicians Association, and a member of IMU Women in Mathematics Advisory Group.

name: William Oughtred
summary: William Oughtred was an English mathematician who is best known for his invention of an early form of the slide rule. He invented many new symbols including X for multiplication and :: for proportion.

name: Jacques Ozanam
summary: Jacques Ozanam was a French mathematician who was a popular writer of text-books.

name: Luca Pacioli
summary: Luca Pacioli was an Italian mathematician who published the influential book Summa in 1494 giving a summary of all the mathematics known at that time.

name: Donald Cecil Pack
summary: Donald Pack was an English mathematician who worked on supersonic airflows. He went on to become principal of Strathclyde University.

name: Henri Eugène Padé
summary: Henri Padé made important contributions to the theory of continued fractions.

name: Reinher of Paderborn
summary: Reinher of Paderborn was a German mathematician who worked on the mathematics of the calendar and in particular on the calculation of Easter.

name: Alessandro Padoa
summary: Alessandro Padoa was an Italian mathematician and logician.

name: Herbert Pahlings
summary: Herbert Pahlings was a German mathematician who worked in group theory and the representation theory of finite groups.

name: Paul Painlevé
summary: Paul Painlevé worked on differential equations. He served twice as prime-minister of France.

name: Raymond Edward Alan Christopher Paley
summary: Raymond Paley was an English mathematician who worked in interpolation and allied trigonometrical problems. He died in a skiing accident.

name: Jacob Palis Jr
summary: Jacob Palis was a Brazilian mathematician who was a leading expert in dynamical systems. He gained many international prizes for his outstanding research contributions and also served as president of the International Mathematical Union as well as several other academies and societies.

name: Roger Paman
summary: Roger Paman was an English mathematician who took part in a voyage hoping to circumnavigate the world. He made contributions to the development of the calculus.

name: Pandrosion of Alexandria
summary: Pandrosion of Alexandria was a Greek mathematician of the 4th century A.D. She developed an approximate method for doubling the cube. She lived earlier than Hypatia.

name: Panini
summary: Panini was a Sanskrit grammarian who gave a comprehensive and scientific theory of phonetics, phonology, and morphology.

name: Pietro Paoli
summary: Pietro Paoli was an Italian mathematician. He worked mainly in calculus and its applications to optics and mechanics.

name: Denis Papin
summary: Denis Papin was a French inventor who worked on the steam engine and invented the pressure cooker and the paddle boat.

name: Pappus of Alexandria
summary: Pappus is the last of the great Greek geometers and one of his theorems is cited as the basis of modern projective geometry. He wrote commentaries on Euclid's Elements and Ptolemy's Almagest.

name: Paramesvara
summary: Paramesvara was an Indian astronomer and mathematician who wrote many commentaries on earlier works as well as making observations.

name: Stephen Parkinson
summary: Stephen Parkinson became famous when he was Senior Wrangler, pushing William Thomson into second place. He had a highly successful career at a lecturer and tutor at St John's College Cambridge.

name: William Parry
summary: Bill Parry was an English mathematician who worked in the study of dynamical systems, and, in particular, in ergodic theory.

name: Leopold Alexander Pars
summary: Leopold "Alan" Pars was a British applied mathematician who is best known for his textbooks.

name: Marc-Antoine Parseval des Chênes
summary: Antoine Parseval was a French mathematician best known for his theorem in Fourier analysis.

name: Blaise Pascal
summary: Blaise Pascal was a very influential French mathematician and philosopher who contributed to many areas of mathematics. He worked on conic sections and projective geometry and in correspondence with Fermat he laid the foundations for the theory of probability.

name: Ernesto Pascal
summary: Ernesto Pascal was an Italian mathematician best known for a wide range of textbooks that he produced.

name: Étienne Pascal
summary: Étienne Pascal was a French lawyer and amateur mathematician. He was the father of Blaise Pascal.

name: Moritz Pasch
summary: Moritz Pasch was a German mathematician who worked on the foundations of geometry. He found a number of assumptions in Euclid that nobody had noticed before.

name: Andrew Gordon Speedie Pask
summary: Gordon Pask was an English polymath who made contributions to a wide variety of areas including cybernetics and psychology.

name: Julio Rey Pastor
university: Georg-August-Universität Göttingen and Universidad Complutense de Madrid
summary: Rey Pastor was a Spanish mathematician and historian of science who was important in developing mathematics in Argentina.

name: Leonid Andreevich Pastur
university: Institute for Low Temperature Physics and Engineering
summary: Leonid Pastur is a Ukrainian mathematical physicist and theoretical physicist.

name: Vijay Kumar Patodi
summary: Vijay Patodi was an Indian mathematician who made important contributions to differential geometry and topology.

name: James Paton
summary: James Paton graduated from Edinburgh and spent most of his career at the University finishing as head of the Department of Meteorology.

name: Wolfgang Ernst Pauli
summary: Wolfgang Pauli won a Nobel prize for his work on quantum mechanics.

name: Zdzisław Ignacy Pawlak
summary: Zdzislaw Pawlak was a Polish mathematician and computer scientist who was known for his contribution to many branches of theoretical computer science.

name: George Peacock
born_place: Thornton Hall, Denton, County Durham, England
summary: George Peacock published his Treatise on Algebra which attempted to give algebra a logical treatment comparable to Euclid's Elements .

name: Giuseppe Peano
born_place: Cuneo, Piemonte, Kingdom of Sardinia (now Italy)
summary: Giuseppe Peano was the founder of symbolic logic and his interests centred on the foundations of mathematics and on the development of a formal logical language.

name: Egon Sharpe Pearson
summary: Egon Pearson was an English statistician who worked on statistical hypothesis testing. He was the son of Karl Pearson.

name: Karl Pearson
summary: Karl Pearson was an English mathematician and biostatistician. He introduced the idea of correlation and applied statistics to biological problems of heredity and evolution. With Francis Galton, he was a supporter of eugenics.

name: William Peddie
summary: William Peddie graduated from Edinburgh University and then lectured in Physics. He was appointed Professor of Physics at Queen's College Dundee and held this post for 37 years.

name: Timothy John Pedley
summary: Tim Pedley is an English mathematician whose principal research interest is the application of fluid mechanics to biology and medicine.

name: Daniel Pedoe
summary: Dan Pedoe was an English-born mathematician and geometer.

name: Rudolf Ernst Peierls
summary: Rudolf Peierls was one of the most influential of the German mathematical physicists who migrated and settled in Britain during the Nazi era.

name: Benjamin Peirce
summary: Benjamin Peirce was an early American mathematician who worked on celestial mechanics and geodesy on the applied side and linear associative algebra and number theory on the pure side. He has been called the "Father of pure mathematics" in America.

name: Benjamin Osgood Peirce
summary: Benjamin Osgood Peirce was an American mathematician who became an important figure in applied mathematics in the United States.

name: Charles Sanders Peirce
summary: Charles Peirce was an eccentric American mathematician whose most important work was on philosophy.

name: Maurício Matos Peixoto
university: Universidade Federal Rural do Rio de Janeiro
summary: Maurício Peixoto was a Brazilian mathematician who did outstanding work on the structural stability of dynamical systems. In a series of four papers he developed what today is known as Peixoto's Theorem.

name: Tadija Pejovic
summary: Tadija Pejovic was a Serbian mathematician who was the first president of the Society of Mathematicians and Physicists of Serbia.

name: John Pell
summary: John Pell was an English mathematician best known for Pell's equation which in fact he had little to do with.

name: William George Penney
summary: William George Penney was a British nuclear physicist who led Britain's development of the atomic bomb.

name: Roger Penrose
summary: Roger Penrose is a British mathematician who published both on pure mathematics and cosmology. He won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2020.

name: Grigori Yakovlevich Perelman
summary: Grigori Perelman is a Russian mathematician who proved the Poincaré Conjecture and who refused to accept a Fields Medal or the $1 000 000 Clay Prize.

name: Joseph Jean Camille Pérès
summary: Joseph Pérès was a French mathematician who worked in rational mechanics. He was one of the founders of IHES.

name: Henry Perigal Jr
summary: Henry Perigal was a clerk, stockbroker, amateur mathematician and astronomer. He is known for his mechanical production of geometric curves, for his dissection proof of Pythagoras' theorem and for his unorthodox ideas on astronomy.

name: Bernadette Perrin-Riou
summary: Bernadette Perrin-Riou is a French mathematician who has made important contributions to number theory. She was awarded the 1999 Ruth Lyttle Satter Prize from the American Mathematical Society.

name: Oskar Perron
summary:
Oskar Perron was a German mathematician best known for the Perron paradox:
Suppose the largest natural number is N. Then if N > 1 we have N2 > N contradicting the definition. Hence (!) N = 1.

name: Perseus
summary: Perseus is associated with the discovery of so-called spiric curves.

name: Benoît Lucien Albert Perthame
summary: Benoît Perthame is a leading expert in partial differential equations and a pioneer in the field of mathematical biology

name: Ernst Peschl
summary: Ernst Peschl was a German mathematician who worked on geometric complex analysis, partial differential equations and the theory of functions of several complex variables.

name: Rózsa Péter
summary: Rózsa Péter was a Hungarian mathematician and logician. She became a founder of recursive function theory.

name: Julius Peter Christian Petersen
summary: Julius Petersen was a Danish mathematician who worked on geometry and graph theory. He is best remembered for the Petersen graph.

name: Karl Mikhailovich Peterson
summary: Karl Peterson was a Latvian mathematician worked in differential geometry and partial differential equations.

name: Hans Petersson
summary: Hans Petersson was a German mathematician who worked in the theory of modular and automorphic forms.

name: Alexis Thérèse Petit
summary: Aléxis Petit was a French mathematician who worked on the theory of heat.

name: Pierre Petit
summary: Pierre Petit was a French scientist who had a strong influence on the French government. He was one of Mersenne's collaborators.

name: Ivan Georgievich Petrovsky
summary: Ivan Petrovsky was a Russian mathematician who worked in the field of partial differential equations.

name: Volodymyr Petryshyn
born_place: Liashky Murovani, Lwów, Poland (now Murovane, Lviv, Ukraine)
summary: Volodymyr Petryshyn was a Ukranian mathematician who worked in functional analysis. He killed his wife while suffering from a mental breakdown.

name: Józeph Miksa Petzval
summary: Józeph Petzval was a Hungarian mathematician who invented the Laplace transform independently of Laplace.

name: Georg Peurbach
summary: Georg Peurbach was an Austrian astronomer who published observations as well as a textbook on trigonometric calculation.

name: Johann Friedrich Pfaff
summary: Johann Friedrich Pfaff was an influential German mathematician who worked on systems of partial differential equations.

name: Georgii Yurii Vasilovich Pfeiffer
summary: Georgii Pfeiffer did important work on partial differential equations.

name: Flora Philip
born_place: Tobermory, Isle of Mull, Argyle, Scotland
summary: Flora Philip was a Scottish mathematician who studied at Edinburgh University and was among the first women to receive a degree there when they changed the rules. She was the first woman member of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society.

name: Robert Philip
summary: Robert Philip graduated from St Andrews and became a teacher at Madras College St Andrews. He moved to Hutcheon's School Glasgow and eventually became headmaster there.

name: Philon of Byzantium
summary: Philon was a Greek who wrote about various aspects of Mechanics and worked on the problem of the duplication of the cube.

name: Lars Edvard Phragmén
summary: Edvard Phragmén was a Swedish mathematician who worked on the theory of functions.

name: Henry Thomas Herbert Piaggio
summary: H T H Piaggio graduated from Cambridge and then worked at the University of Nottingham. He is best known for his text-book on Differential Equations.

name: Ilya Iosifovich Piatetski-Shapiro
summary: Ilya Piatetski-Shapiro was a Russian-born Israeli mathematician who worked in analytic number theory, group representations and algebraic geometry.

name: Giuseppe Piazzi
born_place: Ponte in Valtellina, now in Italy
summary: Giuseppe Piazzi was a mathematician and astronomer, most famed for his discovery of Ceres between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter. He also did important work on the proper motions of stars.

name: Gheorghe Pic
summary: Gheorghe Pic was a Czech mathematician who worked in algebra.

name: Charles Émile Picard
summary: Émile Picard worked in algebraic geometry as well as elasticity, heat and electricity.

name: Jean Picard
summary: Jean Picard was a French astronomer who increased the accuracy of astronomical observations.

name: Georg Alexander Pick
summary: Georg Pick was an Austrian mathematician best known for his formula on the area of a polygon in a lattice of points.

name: David Kennedy Picken
summary: David Picken studied at Glasgow and Cambridge universities. After a period as a lecturer at Glasgow he became Professor of Mathematics at Victoria College, Wellington New Zealand. He later moved to the University of Melbourne in Australia.

name: Mauro Picone
summary: Mauro Picone was an Italian mathematician who worked on ordinary and partial differential equations.

name: Jean-Paul Pier
summary: Jean-Paul Pier was a Luxembourg mathematician who published on harmonic analysis, functional analysis and also on the History of Mathematics. He was the founder of the Luxembourg Mathematical Society.

name: Joseph Alphonso Pierce
died_place: San Antonio, Bexar County, Texas, USA
summary: Joseph Pierce was the sixth African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He taught mathematics in universities for most of his career, undertook research in statistics, and is most famed for the classic book Negro Business and Business Education (1947) which was reprinted almost 50 years after it was first published.

name: Mario Pieri
died_place: S Andrea di Compito (near Lucca), Tuscany, Italy
summary: Mario Pieri was an Italian mathematician who worked in projective geometry and the foundations of geometry.

name: James P Pierpont
summary: James Pierpont was an American mathematician who worked on the Galois theory of equations.

name: K C Sreedharan Pillai
university: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
summary: Sree Pillai was an Indian mathematician who worked in America. His principle work was in statistics.

name: Salvatore Pincherle
summary: Salvatore Pincherle was an Italian mathematician who can claim to be one of the founders of functional analysis. He established the Italian Mathematical Union.

name: Peter Pinkerton
summary: Peter Pinkerton studied at Glasgow and Dublin. After teaching at various schools he became Rector of Glasgow High School.

name: Marie Paris Pishmish de Recillas
summary: Paris Pishmish was a Turkish astronomer with a doctorate from Istanbul University advised by Finlay Freundlich. She was the first person employed to teach astronomy in Mexico with an astronomy doctorate. She spent most of her career in Mexico City and made substantial contributions to both teaching and research.

name: Jean Georges Gilles Pisier
summary: Gilles Pisier is a French mathematician, born in New Caledonia, whose main research field is functional analysis.

name: Charles Pisot
summary: Charles Pisot was a French mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Bartholomeo Pitiscus
summary: Bartholomeo Pitiscus was a Polish theologian who first coined the word Trigonometry.

name: Edwin James George Pitman
summary: Edwin Pitman was an Australian mathematician who made contributions to statistics and probability theory.

name: Harry Raymond Pitt
born_place: Greets Green, West Bromwich, Staffordshire, England
summary: Harry Pitt was an Engish mathematician who worked in real analysis and probability theory.

name: Giovanni Antonio Amedeo Plana
summary: Giovanni Plana was an Italian mathematician who worked on astronomy, integrals, elliptic functions, heat, electrostatics and geodesy.

name: Enrique Aurelio Planchart Rotundo
summary: Enrique Planchart worked at Simón Bolívar University in Venezuela for 47 years, first as a professor of mathematics, then as rector of the university. He fought for improvements in mathematical education, and was praised as a "defender of democracy, the University and youth".

name: Michel Plancherel
summary: Michel Plancherel's main research fields were analysis, mathematical physics and algebra. He is best known for Plancherel's theorem in harmonic analysis.

name: Max Karl Ernst Ludwig Planck
summary: Max Planck initiated the study of quantum mechanics when he announced in 1900 his theoretical research into the radiation and absorption of heat/light by a black body.

name: Joseph Antoine Ferdinand Plateau
summary: Joseph Plateau was a Belgian mathematician best known for Plateau's problem on surfaces of minimal area.

name: Plato
summary: Plato is one of the most important Greek philosophers. He founded the Academy in Athens. His works on philosophy, politics and mathematics were very influential and laid the foundations for Euclid's systematic approach to mathematics.

name: John Playfair
summary: John Playfair worked on geology, physics and geometry and studied at the University of St Andrews. His best-known contribution to mathematics is his form of Euclid's parallelism axiom.

name: Åke Vilhelm Carl Pleijel
summary: Åke Pleijel was a Swedish mathematician who worked on differential equations and potential theory.

name: Josip Plemelj
born_place: Grad on Bled, Austrian Empire (now Slovenia)
summary: Josip Plemelj was a Slovenian mathematician who worked in the theory of analytic functions and the application of integral equations to potential theory.

name: Vera Pless
summary: Vera Pless was an American mathematician who specialized in combinatorics and coding theory.

name: Abraham Ezechiel Plessner
summary: Abraham Plessner was a Polish born mathematician who is viewed as a founder of the Moscow school of functional analysis.

name: Julius Plücker
born_place: Elberfeld (now Wuppertal), Duchy of Berg (now Germany)
summary: Julius Plücker was a German mathematician who made important contributions to analytic geometry and physics.

name: Henry Crozier Keating Plummer
summary: Henry Plummer was a mathematician and astronomer who for some years was Royal Astronomer of Ireland and Andrews Professor of Astronomy at Trinity College, Dublin. He left Ireland to take up the Professorship of Mathematics at the Military College of Science at Woolwich. He made important contributions to mathematical astronomy.

name: Aleksei Vasilevich Pogorelov
summary: Aleksei Vasilevich Pogorelov was a Russian mathematician who worked in geometry.

name: Jules Henri Poincaré
summary: Henri Poincaré can be said to have been the originator of algebraic topology and of the theory of analytic functions of several complex variables.

name: Louis Poinsot
summary: Louis Poinsot was the inventor of geometrical mechanics, investigating how a system of forces acting on a rigid body could be resolved into a single force and a couple.

name: Siméon Denis Poisson
summary: Siméon-Denis Poisson worked on definite integrals and Fourier series. This was the foundation of later work in this area by Dirichlet and Riemann.

name: Balthasar van der Pol
summary: Balthasar van der Pol was a Dutch physicist famous for the non-linear van der Pol equation.

name: Giovanni Poleni
summary: Giovanni Poleni was an Italian mathematician who worked on hydraulics, physics, astronomy and archaeology.

name: John Charlton Polkinghorne
summary: John Polkinghorne was an English mathematical physicist, an Anglican priest and a theologian. He worked in quantum mechanics.

name: Leo Félix Pollaczek
summary: Leo Félix Pollaczek was an Austrian-French engineer and mathematician who worked in number theory, mathematical analysis, mathematical physics and probability theory.

name: Marcus Vitruvius Pollio
summary: Marcus Vitruvius Pollio was a Roman who wrote an influential early work on Architecture.

name: Georgii Nikolaevich Polozii
summary: Georgii Polozii was a Russian mathematician who mostly worked in pure mathematics such as complex analysis, approximation theory and numerical analysis.

name: George Pólya
summary: Pólya worked in probability, analysis, number theory, geometry, combinatorics and mathematical physics.

name: Dimitrie Pompeiu
summary: Dimitrie Pompeiu was a Romanian mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis, complex function theory and rational mechanics.

name: Giuseppe Pompilj
summary: Giuseppe Pompilj was an Italian mathematician who worked in geometry and mathematical statistics.

name: Jean Victor Poncelet
summary: Jean-Victor Poncelet was one of the founders of modern projective geometry. His development of the pole and polar lines associated with conics led to the principle of duality.

name: Lev Semenovich Pontryagin
summary: Lev Semenovich Pontryagin was a blind Russian mathematician who produced important work in algebra and topology.

name: Jan Popken
summary: Jan Popken was a Dutch mathematician specialising in number theory.

name: John Anthony Pople
summary: John Pople was an English theoretical chemist who shared the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1998 for his development of computational methods in quantum chemistry.

name: Blagoj Sazdov Popov
summary: Blagoj Popov was a Macedonian mathematician who specialised in the application of mathematics to engineering and physics.

name: Tiberiu Popoviciu
summary: Tiberiu Popoviciu was a Romanian mathematician who worked in real and numerical analysis and helped to found computer science in Romania.

name: Platon Sergeevich Poretsky
summary: Platon Sergeevich Poretsky was a Russian astronomer, mathematician, and logician.

name: Porphyry Malchus
summary: Porphyry Malchus wrote a commentary on Euclid's Elements and a Life of Pythagoras.

name: Posidonius of Rhodes
summary: Posidonius was a Greek philosopher, astronomer and mathematician. He followed the Stoic doctrine and attemped to estimate the size of the Sun and moon.

name: Emil Leon Post
summary: Emil Post was a Polish-born American mathematician and logician who is best known for his work on polyadic groups, recursively enumerable sets, and degrees of unsolvability, as well as for his contribution to the unsolvability of problems in combinatorial mathematics.

name: Mikhail Mikhailovich Postnikov
summary: Mikhail Postnikov was a Soviet mathematician who worked in algebraic and differential topology.

name: Vladimir Petrovich Potapov
summary: Vladimir Potapov was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked on matrix functions.

name: Renfrey Burnard Potts
summary: Renfrey Potts was an Australian mathematician who worked in operations research and network problems.

name: Aleksandr Yakovlevich Povzner
summary: Aleksandr Povzner was a Ukranian-born mathematician who worked in the spectral theory of differential operators.

name: Sheila Christina Power Tinney
summary: Sheila Power was an Irish mathematician and theoretical physicist.

name: Cheryl Elisabeth Praeger
summary: Cheryl Praeger is an Australian mathematician who has applied the ideas of symmetry to a wide variety of mathematical problems.

name: William Prager
summary: William Prager was a German-born American applied mathematician who worked in the field of mechanics.

name: Ludwig Prandtl
summary: Ludwig Prandtl was a German engineer who worked on aerodynamics.

name: John Henry Pratt
summary: John Pratt worked in India as a chaplain. He published works on the shape of the earth.

name: Gordon Bamford Preston
summary: Gordon Preston was an English mathematician who worked at Bletchley Park in World War II. He was an important worker in semigroup theory.

name: Richard Price
summary: Richard Price was a Welsh congregational minister who made contributions to statistics.

name: Sotero Prieto Rodríguez
summary: Sotero Prieto was a Mexican mathematician who was important in the development of mathematical education in Mexico.

name: Alfred Pringsheim
summary: Alfred Pringsheim was a German mathematician who worked on real and complex functions.

name: Ivan Ivanovich Privalov
born_place: Nizhny Lomov, Penza guberniya (now oblast), Russia
summary: Ivan Privalov was a Russian mathematician who worked on analytic functions.

name: Proclus Diadochus
summary: Proclus was a Greek philosopher who became head of Plato's Academy and is important mathematically for his commentaries on the work of other mathematicians.

name: Giovanni Prodi
summary: Giovanni Prodi was an Italian mathematician who was important in the development of Italian mathematical education.

name: Yurii Vasilevich Prokhorov
summary: Yuri Prokhorov was a Russian mathematician who worked in probability theory.

name: Joseph Proudman
summary: Joseph Proudman was a mathematician who made major contributions to oceanography, particularly to the theory of tides. He was Professor of Applied Mathematics, then Professor of Oceanography at the University of Liverpool. He headed the Liverpool Tidal Institute, now called the Proudman Oceanographic Laboratory.

name: Prthudakasvami
summary: Prthudakasvami was an Indian mathematician best known for his work on solving equations.

name: Ernst Paul Heinz Prüfer
summary: Heinz Prüfer was a German mathematician who proved important results about abelian groups.

name: Claudius Ptolemy
summary: Ptolemy was the most influential of Greek astronomers and geographers of his time. He propounded the geocentric theory of the solar system that prevailed for 1400 years.

name: Pierre Henri Puiseux
summary: Pierre Puiseux was a French astronomer who worked on the aberration of light, asteroids and lunar dynamics.

name: Victor Alexandre Puiseux
summary: Victor Puiseux worked on elliptic functions and studied computational methods in astronomy.

name: Louis Puissant
summary: Louis Puissant was a French mathematician and geographer who is best remembered for his invention of a new map projection.

name: John Robertson Pullar
summary: John Pullar graduated from St Andrews and taught at Madras College St Andrews, at Hamilton Academy and at Montrose Academy.

name: Umberto Puppini
summary: Umberto Puppini was an Italian mathematical physicist who worked in hydraulics and became a member of the fascist govermant in the 1920s and 1930s.

name: Madan Lal Puri
summary: Madan Lal Puri is an Indian-born statistician whose work in nonparametric statistics and probability theory has had profound effects on the way statistics is understood and applied.

name: John Purser
summary: John Purser was an Irish mathematician who taught at Queen's College Belfast.

name: Pythagoras of Samos
summary: Pythagoras was a Greek philosopher who made important developments in mathematics, astronomy, and the theory of music. The theorem now known as Pythagoras's theorem was known to the Babylonians 1000 years earlier but he may have been the first to prove it.

name: Qadi Zada al-Rumi
summary: Qadi Zada was an Islamic mathematician who wrote a number of commentaries of works on mathematics and astronomy.

name: Lambert Adolphe Jacques Quetelet
summary: Adolphe Quetelet was a Flemish scientist who was influenced by Pierre Laplace and Joseph Fourier. He was the first to use the normal curve other than as an error law.

name: Daniel Gray Quillen
summary: Dan Quillen was an American mathematician who won a Fields medal for his work in algebraic topology.

name: Willard Van Orman Quine
summary: Willard Van Orman Quine was an American philosopher and logician in the analytic tradition.

name: Joseph Ludwig Raabe
summary: Joseph Raabe is mostly remembered for Raabe's Test for convergence of series.

name: Hans Rademacher
summary: Hans Rademacher was a German-born mathematician who worked in analytic number theory, mathematical genetics, the theory of functions of a real variable and quantum theory.

name: Ferenc Radó
summary: Ferenc Radó was a Romanian mathematician who worked in the algebraic foundations of geometry and mathematical programming.

name: Richard Rado
summary: Richard Rado was a German-born British mathematician who worked on combinatorics and graph theory.

name: Tibor Radó
summary: Tibor Radó was a Hungarian mathematician best known for his solution to the Plateau Problem.

name: Johann Radon
summary: Johann Radon worked on the calculus of variations, differential geometry and measure theory.

name: Louis Raffy
summary: Louis Raffy was a French mathematician who published extensively on infinitesimal geometry.

name: Johann Heinrich Rahn
summary:
Johann Rahn was a Swiss mathematician who was the first to use the symbol
÷ for division.

name: Cadambathur Tiruvenkatacharlu Rajagopal
summary: Cadambathur Tiruvenkatacharlu Rajagopal was an Indian mathematician who worked on three main areas: (i) sequences, series and summability; (ii) functions of a complex variable; and (iii) the history of medieval Kerala mathematics.

name: Stephen James Rallis
summary: Stephen Rallis was an American mathematician who worked on the theory of group representations.

name: Kollagunta Gopalaiyer Ramanathan
summary: Kollagunta Ramanathan was an Indian mathematician who worked in number theory and was important in developing mathematical research and teaching in India.

name: Chidambaram Padmanabhan Ramanujam
summary: C P Ramanujam was an Indian mathematician who worked in number theory and algebraic geometry.

name: Srinivasa Aiyangar Ramanujan
summary: Ramanujan made substantial contributions to the analytical theory of numbers and worked on elliptic functions, continued fractions, and infinite series.

name: Ramchundra
summary: Ramchundra was an Indian mathematician whose book, Treatise on Problems of Maxima and Minima, was promoted by De Morgan.

name: Ramiro Lodovico Rampinelli
summary: Ramiro Rampinelli was a member of the Olivetan Order and an outstanding teacher of mathematics, most famed as the teacher of Maria Gaetana Agnesi. He flourished in Italy in the early 18th century at a time when much mathematical learning was led by those in religious Orders.

name: Peter Ramsay
summary: Peter Ramsay graduated from Glasgow University and taught at George Watson's School in Edinburgh.

name: Jesse Ramsden
summary: Jesse Ramsden was an English instrument maker who made improvements to telescopes.

name: Frank Plumpton Ramsey
summary: Frank Ramsey was an English mathematician most important for his work on the foundations of mathematics and philosophy, but best known for his so-called Ramsey theory in combinatorics.

name: Peter Ramus
summary: Peter Ramus was a French mathematician who wrote a whole series of textbooks on logic and rhetoric, grammar, mathematics, astronomy and optics.

name: Robert Alexander Rankin
summary: Robert Rankin was Professor of Mathematics at Glasgow for many years. He worked on number theory and the theory of functions.

name: William John Macquorn Rankine
summary: William Rankine worked on several areas of applied mathematics including mechanics, thermodynamics and waves.

name: Calyampudi Radhakrishna Rao
summary: C R Rao is an Indian-born mathematician and statistician who has worked most of his life in America. His statistical work has been applied in many fields.

name: András Rapcsák
summary: András Rapcsák was a Hungarian mathematician who specialised in geometry.

name: Joseph Raphson
summary: Joseph Raphson was an English mathematician credited with the independent discovery of Newton's method for solving equations numerically.

name: Helena Rasiowa
summary: Helena Rasiowa was an Austrian-born Polish mathematician who worked in algebraic logic and the mathematical foundations of computer science.

name: Marina Ratner
summary: Marina Ratner was a Russian mathematician who worked in Israel and America. She worked in ergodic theory.

name: Cora Eloísa Ratto de Sadosky
summary: Cora Ratto de Sadosky was a mathematician and political activist who taught at the University of Buenos Aires, Argentina for ten years before a coup in Argentina forced her to resign. She spent her last years in exile in Spain.

name: Lászlo Rátz
summary: László Rátz was a Hungarian mathematics high school teacher best known for educating such people as John von Neumann and Eugene Wigner.

name: John William Strutt (Lord Rayleigh)
summary: Lord Raleigh (John Strutt) was an English scientist who worked on the theory of waves. He became the Cavendish Professor of Physics at Cambridge and was awarded the Nobel prize for the discovery of the gas Argon.

name: Margaret Eva Rayner
summary: Margaret Rayner was a British mathematician who did important work on isoperimetric inequalities, mathematical education, and the history of mathematics. She became vice principal of St Hilda's College, Oxford and president of the Mathematical Association.

name: Amy Rayson
summary: Amy Rayson was a graduate of Girton College, University of Cambridge but spent most of her career teaching mathematics in private schools in New York. She was one of the first seven women to join the New York Mathematical Society, all seven joining in the year 1891. She continued to attend meetings of the American Mathematical Society.

name: Andrei Mikhailovich Razmadze
summary: Andrea Razmadze was a Georgian mathematician who worked in in the calculus of variations.

name: Arthur Hinton Read
summary: Arthur Hinton Read was brought up in St Andrews, worked at Bletchley Park during World War II and then joined the staff in the St Andrews University Mathematics Department. He was awarded a Ph.D. by Harvard for studies supervised by Ahlfors. He died in an avalanche in the Scottish Highlands.

name: Johann Jakob Rebstein
summary: Jacob Rebstein was a Swiss mathematician primarily known for his pioneering work as a geometer and surveying expert.

name: Félix Recillas Juarez
summary: Félix Recillas was a Mexican mathematician who was awarded a Ph.D. by Princeton advised by Chevalley and made a major contribution to building successful mathematical research schools in Mexico.

name: Robert Recorde
summary: Recorde was a Welsh doctor and mathematician who invented the "equals" symbol '=' which appears in his book The Whetstone of Witte (1557).

name: László Rédei
summary: László Rédei was a Hungarian mathematician who worked on algebraic number theory and abstract algebra.

name: Rimhak Ree
born_place: Hamhung, South Hamgyong Province, Korea (now North Korea)
summary: Rimhak Ree was a Korean-born Canadian mathematician who worked in group theory.

name: Georges Henri Reeb
summary: Georges Reeb was a French mathematician who worked in differential topology, differential geometry, topological dynamics and non-standard analysis.

name: David Rees
summary: David Rees was a Welsh mathematician who worked on semigroups and on commutatiive algebra. During World War II he worked on cracking codes.

name: Hans Reichardt
summary: Hans Reichardt was a German mathematician who worked in number theory, the history of mathematics and differential geometry.

name: Hans Reichenbach
summary: Hans Reichenbach was a German philosopher of science and proponent of logical empiricism.

name: Kurt Werner Friedrich Reidemeister
summary: Kurt Reidemeister was a pioneer of knot theory and his work had a great influence on group theory.

name: Irving Reiner
summary: Irving Reiner was an American mathematician who (with Curtis) produced an important book on group representations.

name: Karl August Reinhardt
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Karl August Reinhardt was a German mathematician who worked on various tiling problems He gave a partial solution to Hilbert's eighteenth problem.

name: Erasmus Reinhold
summary: Erasmus Reinhold was a German astronomer and mathematician who catalogued a large number of stars and published important astronomical tables.

name: Linards Eduardovich Reiziņš
summary: Linards Reiziņš was a Latvian mathematician who specialised in the field of differential equations.

name: Marian Adam Rejewski
born_place: Bromberg, Prussian partition of Poland (now Bydgoszcz, Poland)
summary: Marian Adam Rejewski was a Polish mathematician and cryptologist. He was one of the team that reconstructed the German military Enigma cypher machine before World War II.

name: Franz Rellich
born_place: Tramin, South Tirol, Austro-Hungarian Empire (now Italy)
summary: Franz Rellich was an Austrian-German mathematician who made important contributions in mathematical physics, particular in quantum mechanics.

name: Robert Erich Remak
summary: Robert Remak was a German mathematician. He worked in group theory as well as algebraic number theory, mathematical economics and geometry of numbers. He died in Auschwitz.

name: Evgeny Yakovlevich Remez
summary: Evgeny Yakovlevich Remez was a Belarus mathematician. He is known for his work in the constructive function theory.

name: Georgios Ioannou Remoundos
summary: Georgios Remoundos was a Greek mathematician who worked on the theory of functions and the theory of differential equations.

name: Basil Cameron Rennie
summary: Basil Rennie was an English mathematician who moved to Australia and worked on topics in both pure and applied mathematics.

name: Alfréd Rényi
summary: Alfréd Rényi was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in probability theory, combinatorics, graph theory and number theory.

name: Mór Réthy
summary: Mór Réthy was a Hungarian mathematician. He became an expert on the Bolyais.

name: Gerd Edzard Harry Reuter
summary: Harry Reuter was born in Germany but came to England as a refugee in 1935. His career was at the University of Manchester, the University of Durham and Imperial College, London. He contributed to a wide range of topics but is best know for outstanding contributions to probability, particularly to Markov processes.

name: Karl Theodor Reye
summary: Theodor Reye worked in Geometry and Projective Geometry.

name: Antoine-André-Louis Reynaud
summary: Antoine-André-Louis Reynaud was a French mathematician who published a number of extremely influential textbooks.

name: Charles René Reyneau
summary: Charles René Reyneau was a French mathematician who published an influential textbook on the newly invented calculus.

name: Osborne Reynolds
summary: Osborne Reynolds was an Irish mathematician and physicist best known for introducing the Reynolds number classifying fluid flow.

name: Georg Joachim von Lauchen Rheticus
summary: Georg Joachim Rheticus was an Austrian mathematician and astronomer who published the trigonometrical sections of Copernicus's De Revolutionibus.

name: Paulo Ribenboim
summary: Paulo Ribenboim is a Brazilian mathematician who works in number theory.

name: Jacopo Francesco Riccati
summary: Jacopo Riccati was an Italian mathematician who wrote on philosophy, physics and differential equations. He is chiefly known for the Riccati differential equation.

name: Vincenzo Riccati
summary: Vincenzo Riccati was an Italian Jesuit who worked on hyperbolic functions.

name: Giordano Riccati
summary: Giordano Riccati made contributions to music, architecture, mechanics and mathematics. He studied and experimented with Young's modulus 25 years before Young.

name: Giovanni Ricci
summary: Giovanni Ricci was an Italian mathematician who worked in number theory, differential geometry, mathematical analysis and theory of series.

name: Matteo Ricci
summary: Matteo Ricci was an Italian Jesuit who went to China as a missionary and introduced the Chinese to Western mathematics.

name: Michelangelo Ricci
summary: Michelangelo Ricci was an Italian churchman who made some early applications of induction.

name: Giovanni Battista Riccioli
summary: Giovanni Battista Riccioli was an Italian astronomer and a Jesuit priest. He is known for his experiments with pendulums and falling bodies.

name: Jules Antoine Richard
summary: Jules Richard worked on Geometry but is best known for Richard's paradox involving the set of real numbers which can be defined in a finite number of words.

name: Louis Paul Emile Richard
summary: Louis Richard was a French mathematician who is best-known as the teacher of Evariste Galois.

name: Archibald Read Richardson
summary: Archibald Richardson graduated from Imperial College London and then taught at the college. He was badly wounded in World War I. He became Professor of Mathematics at Swansea. His main interests were in algebra.

name: Lewis Fry Richardson
summary: Lewis Fry Richardson was an English mathematician, physicist and meteorologist who pioneered modern mathematical techniques of weather forecasting.

name: Roland George Dwight Richardson
died_place: South River Lake, Antigonish, Nova Scotia, Canada
summary: Roland Richardson was a Canadian mathematician who worked in the USA. He is known for his work at Brown University and with the American Mathematical Society.

name: Jean Richer
summary: Jean Richer was a French mathematician and astronomer who worked for the French Academy of Sciences on the longitude problem.

name: Herbert William Richmond
summary: Herbert Richmond studied at Cambridge and spent his whole career there, His main interest was in Algebraic Geometry.

name: Georg Friedrich Bernhard Riemann
summary: Bernhard Riemann's ideas concerning geometry of space had a profound effect on the development of modern theoretical physics. He clarified the notion of integral by defining what we now call the Riemann integral.

name: Adam Ries
summary: Adam Ries was a German mathematician who published one of the first widely available arithmetic texts.

name: Frigyes Riesz
summary: Riesz was a founder of functional analysis and his work has many important applications in physics.

name: Marcel Riesz
summary: Marcel Riesz was a Hungarian-born mathematician who worked on summation methods, potential theory and other parts of analysis, as well as number theory and partial differential equations.

name: John Frankland Rigby
born_place: Westhoughton, near Bolton, Greater Manchester, England
summary: John Frankland Rigby worked for his whole career at the University of Cardiff. As a geometer he was famed for the 'Rigby points'. A leading expert on mathematics and art, he was also an enthusiastic and highly successful teacher.

name: Guglielmo Righini
summary: Guglielmo Righini was an Italian astronomer, specializing in the study of the sun. He also wrote on the history of science.

name: John Robert Ringrose
summary: John Ringrose is an English mathematician who is a leading world expert on non-self-adjoint operators and operator algebras.

name: Sixto Ríos García
summary: Sixto Ríos García was a Spanish mathematician who wrote many important papers in both analysis and statistics.

name: Joseph Fels Ritt
summary: Joseph Ritt was an American mathematician who worked on ordinary and partial differential equations.

name: David Rittenhouse
born_place: Paper Mill Run, near Germantown, Pennsylvania, USA
summary: David Rittenhouse was (with Benjamin Franklin) one of only two 18th Century American mathematicians.

name: Gary Francis Roach
summary: Gary Roach was a Welsh mathematician who spent much of his career in Scotland. His research was mainly in the area of applied analysis.

name: Richard Alexander Robb
summary: Richard Robb studied at Glasgow and Michigan universities. Most of his career was spent at Glasgow University lecturing on Mathematics and Statistics.

name: Herbert Ellis Robbins
summary: Herbert Robbins was an American mathematician and statistician who worked in topology, measure theory, statistics,and other fields.

name: Samuel Roberts
summary: Samuel Roberts was an English mathematician who was an important participant in the founding of the London Mathematical Society.

name: Edmund F Robertson
summary: Edmund Robertson is a Scottish mathematician who worked in computational group theory and is best known as one of the creators of the MacTutor History of Mathematics archive

name: Howard Percy Robertson
summary: Bob Robertson was an American mathematician who made important contributions to Differential Geometry and Relativity.

name: Benjamin Robins
summary: Benjamin Robins was an English engineer who wrote on Newton's mathematics and invented the ballistic pendulum.

name: Abraham Robinson
summary: Abraham Robinson was a Polish-born mathematician best known for the development of non-standard analysis.

name: Gilbert de Beauregard Robinson
summary: G de B Robinson was a Canadian mathematician best known for his work on combinatorics and the representation theory of the symmetric groups.

name: Raphael Mitchel Robinson
summary: Raphael Robinson was an American mathematician who was interested in a wide variety of problems including number theory and tilings.

name: Yves-André Rocard
summary: Yves-André Rocard was a French physicist who worked in a variety of fields including radio-astronomy and development of the French atomic bomb.

name: Gustav Roch
summary: Gustav Roch was a German mathematician known for the Riemann-Roch theorem which relates the genus of a topological surface to algebraic properties of the surface.

name: José Monteiro da Rocha
died_place: São José de Ribamar, near Lisbon, Portugal
summary: Monteiro da Rocha was a Portuguese mathematician who made important contributions to applied mathematics and astronomy.

name: Benjamin Olinde Rodrigues
summary: Olinde Rodrigues was a French mathematician best known for his formula for the Legendre polynomials.

name: Argelia Velez-Rodriguez
summary: Argelia Velez-Rodriguez is a Cuban-American mathematician and educator. She was the first Black woman to earn a doctorate in mathematics in Cuba.

name: Claude Ambrose Rogers
summary: Ambrose Rogers wrote extensively on Number Theory and on Sphere-packing problems.

name: Leonard James Rogers
summary: Leonard James Rogers was an English mathematician who is best known for what are now called the Rogers-Ramanujan identities.

name: Werner Wolfgang Rogosinski
summary: Werner Rogosinski was a Polish pure mathematician who moved to Britain before World War II. He worked on series and co-authored a book with G H Hardy.

name: Karl Friedrich Wilhelm Rohn
summary: Karl Rohn was a German mathematician, who studied geometry.

name: Hans Rohrbach
summary: Hans Rohrbach was a German mathematician who worked in algebra and number theory. He later worked as cryptanalyst.

name: Vladimir Abramovich Rokhlin
summary: Vladimir Abramovich Rokhlin was a mathematician who was born in what is now Azerbaijan and worked in algebraic topology and geometry.

name: Michel Rolle
summary: Michel Rolle was a French mathematician best known for the so-called Rolle's theorem.

name: Werner Romberg
summary: Werner Romberg was a German mathematician and physicist. He worked in numerical analysis.

name: Adolphe Rome
summary: Adolphe Rome was a classical philologist who worked on the history of ancient Greek mathematics and astronomy, particularly the work of Archimedes, Ptolemy, Heron and especially Pappus and Theon of Alexandria.

name: Thomas Gerald Room
summary: Thomas Room was an Australian mathematician who is best known for the invention of the so-called Room square.

name: Jakob Rosanes
summary: Jakob Rosanes was a German mathematician and chess master who worked on algebraic geometry and invariant theory.

name: Ferdinando Pio Rosellini
summary: Fernando Pio Rosellini was an Italian educationalist.

name: Johann Georg Rosenhain
summary: Johann Rosenhain was a German mathematician who introduced theta characteristics.

name: Edward Burns Ross
summary: Edward Ross studied at Edinburgh and Cambridge universities. After working with Karl Pearson in London he was appointed Professor of Mathematics at the Christian College in Madras India. Ill health forced him to retire back to Scotland.

name: Gian-Carlo Rota
summary: Gian-Carlo Rota was an Italian-born American mathematician and philosopher.

name: Klaus Friedrich Roth
summary: Klaus Roth won a Fields Medal in 1958 for his work on approximating algebraic numbers by rationals.

name: Leonard Roth
summary: Leonard Roth was an English mathematician who worked on Algebraic Geometry.

name: Uriel George Rothblum
born_place: Tel Aviv, British Mandate for Palestine (now Israel)
summary: Uri Rothblum was an Israeli mathematician who made important contributions to operations research.

name: Erich Hans Rothe
died_place: Ann Arbor, Washtenaw County, Michigan, USA
summary: Erich Hans Rothe was a German mathematician who worked in the field of analysis.

name: Eugène Rouché
summary: Eugène Rouché was a French geometer best known for his theorem on complex functions.

name: Edward John Routh
summary: Edward Routh was a Canadian-born English mathematician, best-known as an outstanding coach of students preparing for the Mathematical Tripos examination of the University of Cambridge.

name: Norman Arthur Routledge
summary: Norman Routledge was an English mathematician and schoolteacher. He was a personal friend of Alan Turing.

name: Samarendra Nath Roy
summary: Samarendra Nath Roy was an Indian-born American mathematician and an applied statistician.

name: Jerzy Witold Rozycki
died_place: Mediterranean Sea, near the Balearic Islands
summary: Jerzy Rozycki was a Polish mathematician who, along with his colleagues Marian Adam Rejewski and Henryk Michal Zygalski, did amazingly valuable work decoding messages sent by the German Enigma machines. Although impossible to quantify, many lives must have been saved since, it is claimed, their work contributed to the shortening of World War II by between three to five years.

name: Ruan Yuan
summary: Ruan Yuan was a Chinese scholar who wrote biographies of astronomers and mathematicians.

name: Mary Ellen Rudin
summary: Mary Ellen Rudin was an American mathematician known for herwork in general topology.

name: Walter Rudin
summary: Walter Rudin was an Austrian-born American mathematician who worked in complex and harmonic analysis and is also known for his mathematical analysis textbooks.

name: Ferdinand Rudio
summary: Rudio was a German mathematician who helped organise the first International Congress of Mathematicians at Zurich and edited the first volumes of Euler's collected works.

name: Christoff Rudolff
summary: Christoff Rudolff was a German mathematician whose book Coss is the first German algebra book.

name: Daniel Jay Rudolph
summary: Daniel Rudolph was an American mathematician who worked in ergodic theory and dynamical systems.

name: Paolo Ruffini
summary: Paolo Ruffini was an Italian mathematician who gave a proof that the quintic equation could not be solved earlier than Abel.

name: Hanno Rund
summary: Hanno Rund was a German mathematician who spent much of his time in Africa. He published in differential geometry.

name: Carl David Tolmé Runge
summary: Carl Runge worked on a procedure for the numerical solution of algebraic equations and later studied the wavelengths of the spectral lines of elements.

name: Harold Stanley Ruse
summary: Harold Ruse graduated from Oxford and held a position at Edinburgh University. he later became a professor at Southampton and Leeds. He worked on Harmonic Spaces.

name: Alexander Durie Russell
summary: Alexander Durie Russell graduated from Edinburgh University at taught at Morelands School Edinburgh, at Stranraer High School and at Falkirk High School where he spent 38 years.

name: Bertrand Arthur William Russell
summary: In a long and varied career Russell published a vast number of books on logic, theory of knowledge, and many other topics. His best known work was Principia Mathematica .

name: Beatrice Beulah Russell
summary: Beulah Russell taught mathematics at several colleges in the United States including William and Mary. She attended the Edinburgh Mathematical Society Colloquium held in St Andrews, Scotland, in 1930 becoming the first female professor to attend the St Andrews Colloquium.

name: John Scott Russell
summary: John Scott Russell was a Scottish engineer and naval architect best known for his identification of a solitary wave: a precursor of today's solitons.

name: Daniel Edwin Rutherford
summary: Dan Rutherford was appointed to be the first Gregory Professor of Applied Mathematics at St Andrews in 1964. In spite of his title, he was primarily a pure mathematician with an interest in algebra.

name: Heinz Rutishauser
summary: Heinz Rutishauser was a Swiss mathematician who worked in numerical mathematics and computer science.

name: Karel Rychlik
born_place: Benesov near Prague, Austria-Hungary (now Czech Republic)
summary: Karel Rychlik was a Czech mathematician who worked in the fields of algebra, number theory, mathematical analysis and the history of mathematics.

name: Johannes Robert Rydberg
summary: Johannes Robert Rydberg was a Swedish mathematician and physicist whose most important work was on spectroscopy.

name: Giovanni Girolamo Saccheri
summary: Giovanni Saccheri was an Italian Jesuit who did important early work on non-euclidean geometry.

name: Horst Sachs
summary: Horst Sachs was a German mathematician and an expert in graph theory.

name: Donald Harry Sadler
summary: Donald Sadler was a mathematical astronomer who spent his career working at the Nautical Almanac Office. He made major contributions to the construction of mathematical tables. He served as President of the Royal Astronomical Society and worked tirelessly for international collaboration.

name: Manuel Sadosky
summary: Manuel Sadosky is known today as the 'Father of computing in Argentina'. In addition he promoted applied mathematics, supported science, education and scientific popularisation. He lived though difficult political times and was forced to leave Argentina on several occasions.

name: Gregorius Saint-Vincent
summary: Gregory of Saint-Vincent was a Flemish Jesuit who wrote a book covering many aspects of contemporary mathematics.

name: André Sainte-Laguë
born_place: Saint Martin de Curton, Lot-et-Garonne, Aquitaine, France
summary: André Sainte-Laguë was French mathematician who is famed for his work in inventing a proportional voting method and for writing a thesis which may be thought of as the first ever textbook on graph theory. He promoted new methods of education and was a leader of many associations.

name: George Musengi Saitoti
died_place: Kibiku forest, Ngong, near Nairobi, Kenya
summary: George Saitoti was a Kenyan mathematician and economist who did research in topology. He became a member of the Kenyan parliament and Executive Chairman of the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund. He was killed in a suspicious helicopter crash.

name: Stanisław Saks
summary: Stanisław Saks was a Polish mathematician who worked in topology, set theory and functional analysis. He was one of the frequenters of the Scottish Café.

name: Raphaël Salem
summary: Raphaël Salem was a Greek mathematician who is best known for his methods of applying probability to Fourier series.

name: George Salmon
summary: George Salmon made many discoveries about ruled surfaces and other surfaces.

name: Alexander Andreevich Samarskii
summary: Alexander Andreevich Samarskii was a Ukranian-born mathematician who worked in mathematical physics, applied mathematics, numerical analysis and mathematical modelling.

name: Hans Samelson
summary: Hans Samelson was a German-born American mathematician who worked in differential geometry, topology and Lie groups and algebras.

name: Anatoly Mykhailovych Samoilenko
university: Institute of Mathematics of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine
summary: Anatoly Mykhailovych Samoilenko was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked on linear and nonlinear ordinary differential equations.

name: Ralph Allen Sampson
summary: Ralph Sampson was an Irish astronomer who worked on the theory of the motions of Jupiter's four Galilean satellites.

name: Pierre Samuel
summary: Pierre Samuel was a French mathematician who worked in commutative algebra and its applications to algebraic geometry.

name: William Sanders
summary: William Sanders was the second Regius Chair of Mathematics at the University of St Andrews in St Andrews, Scotland. He began as a regent at the university in 1671, became Chair of Philosophy in 1672, and was appointed Regius Chair in 1674. He published three books: The Great and New Art of Weighing Vanity, Theses Philosophicae, and Elementa Geometriae.

name: Mildred Leonora Sanderson
summary: Mildred Sanderson was L E Dickson's first female Ph.D. student and was described by him as "my most gifted pupil." Tragically, she died in the year following the award of her doctorate.

name: Edward Sang
summary: Edward Sang was a Scottish mathematician who wrote extensively on mathematical, mechanical, optical and actuarial topics as well as publishing astronomical and logarithmic tables.

name: Sankara Narayana
summary: Sankara Narayana was an Indian astronomer and mathematician. He wrote a commentary on the work of Bhaskara I.

name: Giovanni Sansone
summary: Giovanni Sansone was an Italian mathematician, known for his works on mathematical analysis, the theory of orthogonal functions and the theory of ordinary differential equations.

name: Luís Antoni Santaló Sors
summary: Luís Antoni Santaló was a Spanish mathematician who worked on on convex sets and wrote some important Spanish text-books.

name: Winifred Lydia Caunden Sargent
summary: Winifred Lydia Caunden Sargent was an English mathematician who worked in Lebesgue integration, and fractional integration and differentiation.

name: Shigeo Sasaki
summary: Shigeo Sasaki was a Japanese mathematician working on differential geometry.

name: Mikio Sato
summary: Mikio Sato was a Japanese mathematician whose vision of "algebraic analysis" and mathematical physics initiated several fundamental branches of mathematics.

name: Nicholas Saunderson
summary: Nicholas Saunderson was a blind English mathematician who developed a high reputation as a teacher.

name: Joseph Saurin
summary: Joseph Saurin was a French mathematician who made contributions to the calculus.

name: Leonard Jimmie Savage
summary: Leonard Jimmie Savage was an American mathematician and statistician.

name: Félix Savart
summary: Félix Savart was a French mathematician who worked on electricity and enunciated the Biot-Savart law.

name: Felix Savary
summary: Félix Savary worked on electromagnetism and electrodynamics.

name: Henry Savile
summary: Henry Savile was an English mathematician who founded professorships of geometry and astronomy at Oxford.

name: Walter Warwick Sawyer
summary: W W Sawyer was an English-born mathematician who is best known for his inspiring books on elementary mathematics.

name: Alice Turner Schafer
summary: Alice Schafer was an American mathematician who was one of the founding members of the Association for Women in Mathematics.

name: Juan Jorge Schäffer
summary: Juan Jorge Schäffer was born in Austria, became a citizen of Uruguay where he had most of his schooling and undergraduate studies, and worked at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, USA from 1968. His outstanding research papers on functional analysis and ordinary differential equations made important contributions to the development of mathematics in Uruguay.

name: Robert Schatten
summary: Robert Schatten was an American mathematician who made fundamental contributions to functional analysis.

name: Doris Jean Wood Schattschneider
born_place: Staten Island, New York City, New York, USA
summary: Doris Schattschneider is an American mathematician who became professor of mathematics at the Moravian College. She was the first female editor of Mathematics Magazine and won many awards for her excellence in expository writing.

name: Juliusz Pawel Schauder
summary: Julius Schauder was a Polish mathematician known for his work in functional analysis, partial differential equations and mathematical physics.

name: Henry Scheffé
summary: Henry Scheffé worked in several different areas of Statistics, including linear models, analysis of variance and nonparametrics.

name: Georg Wilhelm Scheffers
summary: Georg Scheffers was a German mathematician specializing in differential geometry.

name: Christoph Scheiner
born_place: Markt Wald, near Mindelheim in Swabia (now in Germany)
summary: Christoph Scheiner was a German Jesuit priest, physicist and astronomer.

name: Richard Herbert Schelp
summary: Richard Schelp was an American mathematician who researched in graph theory and combinatorics.

name: Heinrich Ferdinand Scherk
summary: Heinrich Scherk was a mathematician born in what is now Poland who discovered an important example of a minimal surface.

name: Wilhelm Schickard
summary: Wilhelm Schickard was a German astronomer who invented a calculating machine long before Pascal. He worked on astronomy, mathematics and surveying.

name: Menahem Max Schiffer
summary: Menahem Schiffer was a German-born American mathematician who worked on complex analysis, partial differential equations and mathematical physics.

name: Ludwig Schläfli
summary: Ludwig Schläfli's work was in geometry, arithmetic and function theory. He is best known for the so-called Schläfli symbols which are used to classify polyhedra.

name: Robert Schlapp
summary: Robert Schlapp studied at Edinburgh and Cambridge universities. He spent his whole career at Edinburgh University teaching mathematics and Physics. He was also interested in the History of Mathematics.

name: Ludwig Schlesinger
summary: Ludwig Schlesinger was a mathematician, born in what is now Slovakia, who worked on differential equations.

name: Oscar Xaver Schlömilch
summary: Oscar Schlömilch was a German mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis.

name: Leopold Karl Schmetterer
summary: Leopold Schmetterer was an Austrian mathematician who worked on analysis, probability and statistics.

name: Hermann Ludwig Schmid
summary: Hermann Ludwig Schmid was a German mathematician who worked in algebra and algebraic number theory.

name: Erhard Schmidt
summary: Schmidt is best remembered for the Gram-Schmidt orthogonalisation process, which takes a basis of a space and constructs an orthogonal one from it.

name: Friedrich Karl Schmidt
summary: Friedrich Schmidt was a German mathematician who made contributions to algebra and number theory.

name: John Harry Schmidt
summary: Harry Schmidt was a German mathematician who wrote on the application of mathematics to physics.

name: Otto Yulyevich Schmidt
summary: Otto Schmidt was a Soviet scientist, mathematician, astronomer, geophysicist, statesman and explorer. His mathematical work was in group theory.

name: Wolfgang M Schmidt
summary: Wolfgang Schmidt is an Austrian mathematician who did his most important work in number theory.

name: Theodor Schneider
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Theodor Schneider was a German mathematician, best known for his solution of Hilberts 7th problem.

name: Richard Melvin Schoen
summary: Richard Schoen is an American mathematician known for his work in differential geometry and geometric analysis. He has been awarded many major mathematics prizes including the Bôcher Memorial Prize, the Wolf Prize and the Rolf Schock Prize.

name: Isaac Jacob Schoenberg
university: Alexandru Ioan Cuza University of Iasi
summary: Isaac Jacob Schoenberg was a Romanian-born American mathematician best known for his discovery of splines.

name: Ágoston Scholtz
born_place: Kotterbach, Zips district, Austro-Hungary (now Rudnany, Slovakia)
summary: Ágoston Scholtz was a Hungarian mathematician, one of the founders of the Hungarian Mathematics and Physics Association. He worked on projective geometry and theory of determinants.

name: Arnold Scholz
summary: Arnold Scholz was a German mathematician who proved important results in number theory.

name: Heinrich Scholz
summary: Heinrich Scholz was a German logician, philosopher and theologian.

name: Arthur Moritz Schönflies
born_place: Landsberg an der Warthe, Prussia (now Gorzów-Wielkopolski, Poland)
summary: Schönflies worked first on geometry and kinematics but became best known for his work on set theory and crystallography. He classified the 230 space groups in 1891.

name: Frans van Schooten
summary: Frans van Schooten was a Dutch mathematician who was one of the main people to promote the spread of Cartesian geometry.

name: Friedrich Hermann Schottky
summary: Friedrich Schottky was a German mathematician who worked on elliptic, abelian, and theta functions.

name: Pieter Hendrik Schoute
summary: Pieter Hendrik Schoute was a Dutch mathematician known for his work on regular polytopes and Euclidean geometry.

name: Jan Arnoldus Schouten
born_place: Nieuwer Amstel (now part of Amsterdam), Netherlands
summary: Jan A Schouten worked on tensor analysis and its applications.

name: Carl Schoy
summary: Carl Schoy was a German historian of mathematics specialising in Arabian mathematics and astronomy.

name: Oded Schramm
summary: Oded Schramm was an Israeli-American mathematician known for his work in conformal field theory and probability theory.

name: Otto Schreier
summary: Otto Schreier worked in combinatorial group theory, particularly on subgroups of free groups and on knot groups.

name: Friedrich Wilhelm Karl Ernst Schröder
summary: Ernst Schröder was a German mathematician who did important work is in the area of algebra, set theory and logic. His work on ordered sets and ordinal numbers is fundamental to the subject.

name: Erwin Rudolf Josef Alexander Schrödinger
summary: Erwin Schrödinger made important contributions to the development of Quantum Mechanics and received a Nobel prize in 1933.

name: Heinrich Eduard Schröter
summary: Heinrich Schröter was a German mathematician, who studied geometry.

name: Hans Herbert Schubert
summary: Hans Schubert was a German mathematician who worked on differential equations.

name: Hermann Cäsar Hannibal Schubert
summary: Hermann Schubert was a German mathematiciaan who worked on parts of algebraic geometry that involve a finite number of solutions. This is called Enumerative Geometry.

name: Issai Schur
died_place: Tel Aviv, British Mandate for Palestine (now Israel)
summary: Issai Schur is mainly known for his fundamental work on the representation theory of groups but he also worked in number theory and analysis.

name: Marcel Paul Schützenberger
summary: Marcel-Paul Schützenberger was a French mathematician and medical doctor. He worked in the fields of formal language, combinatorics and semigroup theory.

name: Jacob T Schwartz
summary: Jacob T Schwartz was an American mathematician and computer scientist who researched in both pure maathematics and computer science.
