name: Laurent Moise Schwartz
summary: Laurent Schwartz was a French mathematician who is best known for his work in the theory of distributions.

name: Hermann Amandus Schwarz
born_place: Hermsdorf am Kynast, Silesia (now Sobieszów, Jelenia Góra, Poland)
summary: Hermann Schwarz worked on the conformal mapping of polyhedral surfaces onto the spherical surface and on a problem of the calculus of variation, namely surfaces of least area.

name: Stefan Schwarz
born_place: Nové Mesto nad Váhom, Austria-Hungarian Empire (now Slovakia)
summary: Stefan Schwarz was a Slovakian mathematician who worked in semigroups, number theory and finite fields.

name: Karl Schwarzschild
summary: Karl Schwarzschild was a German physicist and astronomer who investigated the mathematics which eventually led to the prediction of the existence of black holes.

name: Hans Wilhelm Eduard Schwerdtfeger
summary: Hans Wilhelm Eduard Schwerdtfeger was a German-born mathematician who worked in Galois theory, matrix theory, group theory and complex analysis.

name: Julian Seymour Schwinger
summary: Schwinger formulated quantum electrodynamics and thus reconciled quantum mechanics with Einstein's special theory of relativity.

name: Bernardino Gaetano Scorza
summary: Gaetano Scorza was an Italian mathematician who worked in algebraic geometry.

name: Michael Scot
summary: Michael Scot (or Scotus) helped in the transmission of Islamic mathematics from Spain to the rest of Europe.

name: Agnes Mary Scott
summary: Agnes Scott graduated from Edinburgh University. She went on to teach at Raffles' Girls School in Singapore.

name: Charlotte Angas Scott
summary: Charlotte Angas Scott studied at Cambridge but was not allowed to take her degree. After graduate work at Cambridge she became the first Head of Mathematics at Bryn Mawr College in Pennsylvania USA.

name: Elizabeth Leonard Scott
summary: Elizabeth Scott was an American mathematician who worked in statistics.

name: Robert Forsyth Scott
summary: Robert Scott spent most of his career as Bursar and Master of St John's College Cambridge. He published a book on Determinants.

name: Thomas Jefferson Jackson See
summary: T J J See was an American astronomer who studied in the University of Missouri and in Berlin. He fell out with his astronomical colleagues and was eventually banned from publishing. He spend the last part of his life arguing against Einstein's Theory of Relativity.

name: Irving Ezra Segal
summary: Irving Segal was an American mathematician known for work on theoretical quantum mechanics.

name: Lee Aaron Segel
summary: Lee Segel was an American mathematical biologist who moved to Israel. He is known for his work in the spontaneous appearance of order in convection, slime molds and chemotaxis.

name: Johann Andreas von Segner
summary: Jan Segner was a Hungarian mathematician who was the first professor of mathematics at Göttingen. He made substantial contributions to the theoery of Dynamics.

name: Beniamino Segre
summary: Beniamino Segre was an Italian mathematician who was a major contributor to algebraic geometry and was one of the founders of finite geometry.

name: Corrado Segre
summary: Corrado Segre was an Italian mathematician who was responsible for important early work in algebraic geometry.

name: Johan Jacob Seidel
summary: Jaap Seidel was a Dutch mathematician who who worked in geometry and graph theory.

name: Philipp Ludwig von Seidel
summary: Philipp von Seidel was a German mathematician who worked on dioptics and mathematical analysis.

name: Abraham Seidenberg
summary: Abraham Seidenberg was an American mathematician who worked in commutative algebra, algebraic geometry, differential algebra and the history of mathematics.

name: Karl Johannes Herbert Seifert
summary: Herbert Seifert was a German mathematician who made important contributions to topology and knot theory.

name: Enoch Beery Seitz
born_place: Rush Creek Township, Fairfield County, Ohio, USA
died_place: Kirksville Benton Township, Adair, Missouri, USA
summary: Enoch Beery Seitz was an American mathematician who contributed over 500 published problems and solutions to various publications.

name: Takakazu Shinsuke Seki
summary: Takakazu Seki was a Japanese mathematician who was the first person to study determinants. He also discovered Bernoulli numbers before Jacob Bernoulli.

name: Atle Selberg
summary: Atle Selberg was a Norwegian mathematician known for his work in analytic number theory and on discrete groups and automorphic forms.

name: Reinhard Selten
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Reinhard Selten was a Polish mathematician and economist who shared the 1994 Nobel Prize in Economics with John Nash for his work on game theory.

name: John Greenlees Semple
summary: John Semple was a Irish mathematician whose most important work was in Algebraic geometry.

name: Marjorie Lee Wikler Senechal
summary: Marjorie Senechal is an American mathematician who worked on tessellations and quasicrystals. She won the Mathematical Association of America's Carl B Allendoerfer Award for excellence in expository writing in Mathematics Magazine for her article, Which Tetrahedra Fill Space? Her book American Silk 1830-1930 won the Millia Davenport Publication Award of the Costume Society of America.

name: Serenus
summary: Serenus was a Greek geometer who wrote commentaries on other mathematicians' work as well as proving some geometric theorems of his own.

name: Akos Seress
summary: Akos Seress was a Hungarian mathematician specialising in combinatorics and group theory.

name: Petre Sergescu
summary: Petre Sergescu was a Romanian mathematician important in the development of sciences in Romania.

name: Jean-Pierre Albert Achille Serre
summary: Jean-Pierre Serre is a French mathematician who has made important contributions to algebraic topology, algebraic geometry, and algebraic number theory. He was a member of Bourbaki.

name: Joseph Alfred Serret
summary: Joseph Serret was a French mathematician best remembered for the Serret-Frenet formulas for a space-curve.

name: James Burton Serrin
summary: James Serrin was an American mathematician who worked in nonlinear analysis, partial differential equations, fluid mechanics, continuum mechanics, and thermodynamics.

name: François Joseph Servois
summary: François-Joseph Servois was a French mathematician who worked on projective geometry.

name: Francesco Severi
summary: Severi's most important contributions are to algebraic geometry.

name: Igor Rostislavovich Shafarevich
summary: Igor Shafarevich was a Russian mathematician who worked in algebraic number theory and algebraic geometry. He was an important dissident during the Soviet era.

name: William Shanks
born_place: Corsenside (8 km NE of Bellingham), Northumberland, England
summary: William Shanks is famed for his calculation of π to 707 places in 1873, which unfortunately was only correct for the first 527 places.

name: Claude Elwood Shannon
summary: Claude Shannon founded the subject of information theory and he proposed a linear schematic model of a communications system.

name: Harlow Shapley
summary: Harlow Shapley was an American astronomer who made important discoveries about the position of the sun in the galaxy.

name: Oleksandr Mikolaiovich Sharkovsky
university: Institute of Mathematics of National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine
summary: Oleksandr Sharkovsky was a Ukrainian mathematician who made contributions to the theory of discrete dynamical systems.

name: Abraham Sharp
born_place: Little Horton, near Bradford, Yorkshire, England
died_place: Little Horton, near Bradford, Yorkshire, England
summary: Abraham Sharp was an English mathematician who worked with Flamsteed. He calculated π to 72 places.

name: Samuil Osipovich Shatunovsky
summary: Samuil Osipovich Shatunovsky was a Ukranian-born mathematician who worked in mathematical analysis and algebra.

name: Henry Maurice Sheffer
summary: Henry Sheffer was a mathematical logician who introduced what is now called the NAND operator which lies at the basis of the entire computer industry. He showed that all logical operators can be derived from a single one, NAND.

name: Saharon Shelah
born_place: Jerusalem, British Mandate for Palestine (now Israel)
summary: Saharon Shelah is an Israeli mathematician who worked in America on mathematical logic.

name: Geoffrey Colin Shephard
summary: Geoffrey Shephard was an outstanding geometer who wrote many interesting and important papers. His books, especially one co-authored with Branko Grünbaum on tilings, have become classics.

name: John Cedric Shepherdson
summary: John Shepherdson was a English mathematician who worked in ring theory and mathematical logic.

name: William Fleetwood Sheppard
summary: William Sheppard read Mathematics at Cambridge and then went on to study Law. He was appointed to the Department of Education. His mathematical interests were mainly in Statistics.

name: Soraya Sherif
summary: Soraya Sherif is an Egyptian mathematician who was awarded a Ph.D. from the University of Birmingham, England, for her thesis on Tauberian theorems. She taught at the University College for Girls, Ain Shams University, Cairo and has published many papers on Tauberian theorems.

name: Walter Andrew Shewhart
summary: Walter Andrew Shewhart was an American physicist, engineer and statistician who worked on statistical quality control.

name: Allen Lowell Shields
summary: Allen Shields was an American mathematician who worked on a wide range of mathematical topics including measure theory, complex functions, functional analysis and operator theory.

name: Tatsujiro Shimizu
summary: Tatsujiro Shimizu was a Japanese mathematician who worked in complex analysis. He founded the Japanese Association of Mathematical Sciences.

name: Goro Shimura
summary: Goro Shimura was a Japanese mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry.

name: Lev Genrikhovich Shnirelman
summary: Lev Shnirelman was a Belarussian mathematician who made important contributions to the Goldbach conjecture.

name: Kenjiro Shoda
summary: Kenjiro Shoda was a Japanese mathematician who worked in algebra.

name: Josif Zakharovich Shtokalo
summary: Josif Shtokalo was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked in the areas of differential equations, operational calculus and the history of mathematics.

name: Francesco Siacci
summary: Francesco Siacci was an Italian mathematician whose most important work was in application of mechanics to artillery.

name: Georg Joseph Sidler
summary: Georg Sidler was a Swiss mathematician and astronomer.

name: Carl Ludwig Siegel
summary: Carl Siegel was a German mathematician who worked in algebraic number theory and also on celestial mechanics.

name: Wacław Sierpiński
summary: Sierpiński's most important work is in the area of set theory, point set topology and number theory. In set theory he made important contributions to the axiom of choice and to the continuum hypothesis.

name: Karl Sigmund
born_place: Gars am Kamp, Lower Austria, Austria
summary: Karl Sigmund is an Austrian mathematician who is one of the pioneers of evolutionary game theory. He is also interested in the history of science.

name: Roman Sikorski
summary: Roman Sikorski was a Polish mathematician whose research interests included Boolean algebras, mathematical logic, functional analysis, the theory of distributions, measure theory, general topology and descriptive set theory.

name: José Sebastiao e Silva
summary: José Sebastião e Silva was a Portuguese mathematician who worked in analytic functionals and the theory of distributions.

name: Leon Melvyn Simon
summary: Leon Simon is an Australian mathematician who made contributions to geometric measure theory, harmonic maps and partial differential equations.

name: Simplicius
summary: Simplicius was a Greek mathematician who wrote commentaries on the works of other philosophers and mathematicians including Euclid and Aristotle.

name: Mary Constance Simpson
summary: Mary Simpson graduated from Edinburgh and then took up a post at Queen's College Dundee.

name: Thomas Simpson
summary: Thomas Simpson was an English mathematician who is best remembered for his work on interpolation and numerical methods of integration.

name: Charles Coffin Sims
summary: Charlie Sims was an American mathematician best known for his work in group theory and in particular for the discovery of one of the sporadic simple groups.

name: Robert Simson
summary: Robert Simson was a Scottish mathematician best known for the Simson line of a triangle, even though he was not the first discoverer of it.

name: Yakov Grigorevich Sinai
summary: Yakov Grigorevich Sinai is a Russian mathematician known for his work on dynamical systems. In 2014 he was awarded the Abel Prize for his fundamental contributions to dynamical systems, ergodic theory, and mathematical physics.

name: Abu Said Sinan ibn Thabit ibn Qurra
summary: Sinan ibn Thabit was the son and father of other Islamic mathematicians. He is more important for his contributions to medicine than to mathematics.

name: Isadore Manuel Singer
summary: Isadore Singer was an American mathematician best known for the Atiyah-Singer index theorem which had great influence in unifying mathematics and physics.

name: Udita Narayana Singh
summary: Udita Narayana Singh was an Indian mathematician who worked in Fourier series and became vice-chancellor of Allahabad University

name: David Breyer Singmaster
summary: David Singmaster was an American mathematician who worked for most of his career in London, England. He was a leading expert on puzzles and recreational mathematics, and is particularly famed for his books on Rubik's Cube.

name: Dmitrii Matveevich Sintsov
summary: Dmitrii Matveevich Sintsov was a Russian mathematician who worked on the theory of conics and the theory of nonholonomic differential geometry.

name: Sylvia Winifred Skan
summary: Sylvia Skan was an English applied mathematician who worked on fluid dynamics and aerodynamics. For most of her career, she worked for the Aerodynamics Department of the National Physical Laboratory. She wrote many papers and the two volume book Handbook for computers.

name: Thoralf Albert Skolem
summary: Thoralf Skolem was a Norwegian mathematician who worked in mathematical logic and set theory.

name: Alexander Ivanovich Skopin
summary: Alexander Skopin was a Russian mathematician who worked in abstract algebra.

name: Anatolii Volodymyrovych Skorokhod
summary: Anatoliy Skorokhod was a Ukrainian mathematician who worked in probability theory, stochastic processes and mathematical statistics.

name: Rudolf Skuherský
summary: Rudolf Skuhersky was the first Professor of Descriptive Geometry at the Prague Polytechnic. He argued for reforms of the Polytechnic to have lectures in both Czech and German. He was elected to parliament as a member of the Czech National Party.

name: Noel Bryan Slater
summary: Noel Slater was an English mathematician who worked on the theory of chemical reactions.

name: Herbert Ellsworth Slaught
summary: Herbert Ellsworth Slaught was an American mathematician who became president of the Mathematical Association of America.

name: Tadeusz Boleslaw Ślebarski
summary: Tadeusz Ślebarski was a Polish-born astronomer who taught for many years at the University of St Andrews.

name: Brian David Sleeman
summary: Brian Sleeman was an English mathematician who spent much of his career in Scotland. He specialised in applied analysis and mathematical biology.

name: Ivan Vladislavovich Śleszyński
summary: Ivan Śleszyński was a Ukranian born mathematician whose main work was on continued fractions, least squares and axiomatic proof theory based on mathematical logic.

name: Mary Taylor Slow
summary: Mary Taylor Slow was a British mathematician and physicist who worked on the theory of radio waves and the application of differential equations to physics.

name: Jerzy Słupecki
summary: Jerzy Słupecki was a Chinese-born Polish mathematician who made important contributions to logic.

name: Evgeny Evgenievich Slutsky
summary: Evgeny Slutsky was important in the application of mathematical methods in economics.

name: Stephen Smale
summary: Stephen Smale received the Fields medal in 1966 for his work on differential geometry.

name: Glenny Smeal
summary: Glenny Smeal studied at Melbourne University and Imperial College London. After some time in Edinburgh he moved to a post in Statistical Methods and Computation at Leeds.

name: Vladimir Ivanovich Smirnov
summary: Vladimir Smirnov was a Russian mathematician who made important contributions in both pure and applied mathematics, and also in the history of mathematics.

name: David Eugene Smith
died_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: David Eugene Smith was an American mathematician who is very important in the history of mathematics and in the development of mathematical education.

name: Henry John Stephen Smith
summary: Henry Smith was an Irish mathematician whose most important contributions are in number theory where he worked on elementary divisors.

name: John Humphrey Smith
summary: John Smith graduated from Glasgow University and then stayed on as a lecturer. He taught at Campbeltown Grammar School and Dollar Academy and then became an HM Schools Inspector.

name: Karen Ellen Smith
summary: Karen Smith is an American mathematician who works on commutative algebra and algebraic geometry. She is the Keeler Professor of Mathematics at the University of Michigan. She won the Ruth Lyttle Satter Prize in Mathematics for her development of tight closure methods in commutative algebra and especially for her application of these methods in algebraic geometry.

name: Frank Smithies
summary: Frank Smithies was a Scottish mathematician who worked on integral equations, functional analysis, and the history of mathematics.

name: Marian Smoluchowski
summary: Marian Smoluchowski was an Austrian physicist who was a pioneer of statistical physics.

name: Raymond Merrill Smullyan
born_place: Far Rockaway, Long Island, New York City, USA
summary: Raymond Smullyan was an American mathematician, magician, concert pianist, logician and philosopher, best known for his popular puzzle books.

name: Ian Naismith Sneddon
summary: Ian Sneddon was the Simson Professor of Mathematics at the University of Glasgow and worked on partial differential equations.

name: George Waddel Snedecor
summary: George Waddel Snedecor was an American mathematician and statistician who worked on correlation.

name: Willebrord van Royen Snell
summary: Willebrord Snell was a Dutch mathematician who is best known for the law of refraction, a basis of modern geometric optics; but this only become known after his death when Huygens published it.

name: Virgil Snyder
summary: Virgil Snyder was an American mathematician, specializing in algebraic geometry.

name: Sergei Lvovich Sobolev
summary: Sergei Sobolev was a Russian mathematician who worked on mathematical analysis and partial differential equations.

name: Yulian-Karl Vasilievich Sokhotsky
summary: Yulian Vasilievich Sokhotsky was a Polish mathematician who worked on complex analysis and special functioins.

name: Yurii Dmitrievich Sokolov
summary: Yurii Dmitrievich Sokolov was a Russian mathematician who worked on the n-body problem.

name: Donald Moiseyevitch Solitar
summary: Donald Solitar was a Canadian mathematician who worked in combinatorial group theory.

name: Andrzej Sołtysiak
university: Uniwersytet im. Adama Mickiewicza w Poznaniu
summary: Andrzej Sołtysiak is a Polish mathematician who specialises in functional analysis and spectral theory .

name: Mary Fairfax Greig Somerville
summary: Mary Somerville wrote many works which influenced Maxwell. Her discussion of a hypothetical planet perturbing Uranus led Adams to his investigation. Somerville College in Oxford was named after her.

name: Arnold Johannes Wilhelm Sommerfeld
summary: Arnold Sommerfeld was a theoretical physicist who worked in electromagnetic theory, relativity and quantum theory.

name: Duncan MacLaren Young Sommerville
summary: Duncan Sommerville studied at St Andrews and then had a post as a lecturer there. He left to become Professor of Pure and Applied mathematics at Victoria College, Wellington New Zealand. He worked on non-Euclidean geometry and the History of Mathematics.

name: Osip Ivanovich Somov
summary: Osip Somov was a Russian mathematician who was the first in Russia to deal with the solution of kinematic problems.

name: Nikolay Yakovlevich Sonin
summary: Nikolay Sonin was a Russian mathematician who worked on special functions and numerical integration.

name: Vera Turán Sós
summary: Vera Sós was a Hungarian mathematician who specialised in number theory and combinatorics. She worked at the Alfréd Rényi Institute of Mathematics and won many prizes including the Tibor Szele Medal (1974) and the Széchenyi Prize (1997).

name: Laila Soueif
summary: Laila Soueif is an Egyptian mathematician who became a professor of mathematics at Cairo University. She is an activist for human rights and has been involved in many demonstrations including calling for academic freedom at Cairo University.

name: Edwin Henry Spanier
summary: Edwin Spanier was an American mathematician who worked in algebraic topology. He wrote one of the standard textbooks in the subject.

name: Wilhelm Otto Ludwig Specht
summary: Wilhelm Specht was a German mathematician who in worked group theory and representation theory.

name: Ernst Paul Specker
summary: Ernst Specker was a Swiss mathematician who made decisive contributions towards shaping directions in topology, algebra, mathematical logic, combinatorics and algorithms.

name: Ambrosius Paul Speiser
summary: Ambros Speiser was a Swiss engineer and mathematician who led the development of the first Swiss computer.

name: Andreas Speiser
summary: Andreas Speiser was a Swiss mathematician and philosopher of science who worked in number theory, group theory and the theory of Riemann surfaces. He was also interested in the history of mathematics.

name: David Allan Spence
summary: David Spence was a New Zealand-born mathematician who worked in the aeronautics industry and on geophysical problems.

name: William Spence
summary: William Spence was a Scottish mathematician who worked on logarithmic functions.

name: Anthony James Merrill Spencer
summary: Anthony Spencer was an English applied mathematician who worked in the mechanics of advanced materials.

name: Donald Clayton Spencer
summary: Donald Spencer was an American mathematician, known for work on deformations of complex manifolds.

name: Emanuel Sperner
summary: Emanuel Sperner was a German mathematician who worked in the foundations of geometry.

name: Pauline Sperry
summary: Pauline Sperry was an American mathematician who worked in projective differential geometry.

name: Vera Martha Winitzky de Spinadel
summary: Vera W de Spinadel was the first woman to be awarded a mathematics Ph.D. by the University of Buenos Aires. She was an Argentine mathematician whose main contributions were to mathematics in architecture, art, and design. She introduced the "metallic means family" which generalises the Golden Ratio.

name: Lyman Spitzer
summary: Lyman Spitzer was an American theoretical physicist and astronomer best known for pioneering the idea of a space telescope. He also worked on nuclear fusion.

name: Sporus of Nicaea
summary: Sporus was a Greek mathematician who worked on the classical problems of squaring the circle and duplicating the cube.

name: William Spottiswoode
summary: William Spottiswoode was an English mathematician, physicist and publisher.

name: Thomas Bond Sprague
summary: Thomas Bond Sprague became the most important actuary of the late 19th Century. He wrote more than 100 papers.

name: Tonny Albert Springer
summary: Tonny Springer was a Dutch mathematician who worked on algebra and the theory of linear algebraic groups.

name: Sridhara
summary: Sridhara was an Indian mathematician who wrote on practical applications of algebra and was one of the first to give a formula for solving quadratic equations.

name: Bhama Srinivasan
summary: Bhama Srinivasan is an Indian-born mathematician who has worked in England and America and is known for her work in the representation theory of finite groups.

name: Sripati
summary: Sripati was an Indian who wrote works on astronomy and arithmetic.

name: Paul Gustav Samuel Stäckel
summary: Paul Stäckel was a German mathematician who worked on differential geometry, number theory and non-Euclidean geometry.

name: John Robert Stallings
summary: John Stallings was an American mathematician who worked in geometric group theory and 3-manifold topology.

name: Guido Stampacchia
university: Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa and Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II
summary: Guido Stampacchia was an Italian mathematician who worked on the calculus of variations and elliptic partial differential equations.

name: Jan Jansz de Jonge Stampioen
summary: Jan Stampioen was a Dutch mathematician who published a work on spherical trigonometry.

name: Dimitrie D Stancu
summary: Dimitrie Stancu was a Romanian mathematician who worked in the field of numerical analysis and approximation theory.

name: Marceli Stark
summary: Marceli Stark was a Polish mathematician who published many important text-books.

name: Karl Georg Christian von Staudt
born_place: Imperial Free City of Rothenburg (now Rothenburg ob der Tauber, Germany)
summary: Karl von Staudt was a German mathematician who worked on projective geometry.

name: Catherine Cassels Steele
summary: Catherine Steele graduated from the University of St Andrews. She went on to a doctorate in Chemistry and studied at the University of Illinois and at Harvard. She taught for some time at a Horticultural College in Kent before returning to the USA.

name: Norman Earl Steenrod
summary: Norman Steenrod was an American mathematician who worked in algebraic topology and was one of the founders of homological algebra.

name: Josef Stefan
summary: Josef Stefan was an Austrian physicist, mathematician, and poet.

name: Peter Stefan
summary: Peter Stefan was a Slovak mathematician who was known for his works on dynamical systems and mathematical entropy.

name: John Edward Aloysius Steggall
summary: John Steggall was appointed to be the first Professor of Mathematics at the newly-formed University College Dundee: soon to become Queen's College and part of the University of St Andrews. He held this post for 50 years.

name: Elias Menachem Stein
summary: Elias Stein was a Belgian-born American mathematician who worked in the field of harmonic analysis.

name: Philip Bernard Stein
born_place: Germeneitz (near Švėkšna), Šilutė District Municipality, Klaipeda County, Lithuania
summary: Philip Stein was a Lithuanian-born mathematician who became a professor of mathematics in South Africa. He worked on the theory of functions of real and complex variables.

name: Jakob Steiner
summary: Jakob Steiner was one of the greatest contributors to projective geometry.

name: Ottó Steinfeld
summary: Ottó Steinfeld was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in Rings and Semigroup theory.

name: Hugo Dyonizy Steinhaus
summary: Hugo Steinhaus was a Polish mathematician whose book Mathematical Snapshots has been very influential.

name: Ernst Steinitz
born_place: Laurahütte, Silesia, Germany (now Siemianowice Śląskie, Poland)
summary: Ernst Steinitz worked on the theory of fields.

name: Vladimir Andreevich Steklov
summary: Vladimir Steklov was a Russian mathematician who made many important contributions to applied mathematics.

name: Vyacheslaw Vassilievich Stepanov
summary: Vyacheslaw Stepanov was a Russian mathematician who worked in analysis, especially in the theory of ordinary differential equations and almost periodic functions.

name: Mary Ann Elizabeth Stephansen
summary: Elizabeth Stephansen was a Norwegian mathematician and educator who was the first Norwegian woman to be awarded a doctoral degree in science.

name: Clarence Francis Stephens
summary: Clarence Francis Stephens was the ninth African American to be awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics. He developed what became known as the 'Morgan-Potsdam Miracle' method of teaching, based on problem solving with very few lectures.

name: Moritz Abraham Stern
summary: Moritz Abraham Stern was a German mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Simon Stevin
summary: Simon Stevin was a Flemish mathematician who presented the first elementary and thorough account of decimal fractions and introduced their use in mathematics.

name: Dugald Stewart
summary: Dugald Stewart was a Scottish mathematician who also worked in moral philosophy and held chairs in both these subjects at Edinburgh University.

name: Matthew Stewart
summary: Matthew Stewart was a Scottish geometer who wrote on geometry and planetary motion.

name: Keith Stewartson
summary: Keith Stewartson was an English mathematician who worked in the theory of fluid flow.

name: Eduard L Stiefel
summary: Eduard Stiefel was a Swiss mathematician best known for his invention (with Hassler Whitney) of topological characteristic classes.

name: Thomas Jan Stieltjes
summary: Thomas Stieltjes worked on almost all branches of analysis, continued fractions and number theory.

name: Michael Stifel
summary: Michael Stifel was a German mathematician who invented logarithms independently of Napier using a totally different approach.

name: James Stirling
summary: James Stirling was a Scottish mathematician whose most important work Methodus Differentialis in 1730 is a treatise on infinite series, summation, interpolation and quadrature.

name: Simion Stoilow
summary: Simion Stoilow was a Romanian mathematician, creator of the Romanian school of complex analysis.

name: George Gabriel Stokes
summary: George Stokes established the science of hydrodynamics with his law of viscosity describing the velocity of a small sphere through a viscous fluid.

name: Otto Stolz
born_place: Hall (now Solbad Hall in Tirol), Austria
summary: Otto Stolz was an Austrian mathematician who worked on mathematical analysis and infinitesimals.

name: Edmund Stone
summary: Edmund Stone was a gardener of the Duke of Argyll who published some work on cubic curves. He was elected to the Royal Society.

name: Marshall Harvey Stone
summary: Stone is best known for the Stone-Weierstrass theorem on uniform approximation of continuous functions by polynomials.

name: Fredrik Carl Mulertz Størmer
summary: Carl Størmer was a Norwegian mathematician and astrophysicist. In mathematics, he is known for his work in number theory.

name: William Edward Story
summary: William Story was an American mathematician important in the development of mathematics at Johns Hopkins University and Clark Universities.

name: Volker Strassen
summary: Volker Strassen is a German mathematiican who can be considered the founding father of algebraic complexity theory.

name: Ernst Gabor Straus
summary: Ernst Straus was a German-born American mathematician who worked in a variety of areas including relativity and combinatorics.

name: Washington Irving Stringham
born_place: Yorkshire Centre, now Delevan, Cattaraugus County, New York, USA
summary: Irving Stringham was an American mathematician who worked in geometry and became head of mathematics at Berkeley.

name: Stein Arild Stromme
summary: Stein Stromme was a Norwegian mathematician best known for his work in algebraic geometry

name: Theodore Strong
summary: Theodore Strong was an early American mathematician who made contributions to mathematical education.

name: Dirk Jan Struik
summary: Dirk Struik was a Dutch mathematician who is mainly known for his work in the history of mathematics.

name: James Stuart
summary: James Stuart was a Scottish educational pioneer and politician.

name: Beauregard Stubblefield
summary: Beauregard Stubblefield was an African American mathematician who, despite his excellent undergraduate record, was turned down for graduate work at several universities. He showed great determination and eventually was awarded a Ph.D. from the University of Michigan. He served at several universities including Oakland University in Michigan, the Appalachian State University in Boone, North Carolina and then at the U.S. Department of Commerce in Boulder, Colorado.

name: Christian Hugo Eduard Study
summary: Eduard Study was a German mathematician who became a leader in the geometry of complex numbers. He also worked on invariant theory.

name: Ernst Carl Gerlach Stueckelberg
summary: Ernst Carl Gerlach Stueckelberg was a Swiss mathematician and physicist. Although he made important advances never received the recognition for his achievements which many felt that he clearly deserved.

name: Jacques Charles François Sturm
summary: Charles-François Sturm is best remembered for the Sturm-Liouville problem, an eigenvalue problem in second order differential equations.

name: Friedrich Otto Rudolf Sturm
summary: Rudolf Sturm was a German mathematician who worked in geometry.

name: Mikhail Fedorovich Subbotin
summary: Mikhail Subbotin was a Soviet Polish mathematician and astronomer who worked on general properties of motion in the n-body problem.

name: Bella Abramovna Subbotovskaya
summary: Bella Subbotovskaya was a Russian mathematician most famous for founding the "The Jewish People's University" in Moscow.

name: Zyoiti Suetuna
summary: Zyoiti Suetuna was a Japanese mathematician who worked mainly in number theory.

name: Dennis Parnell Sullivan
summary: Dennis Sullivan is an American mathematician known for his work on topology, both algebraic and geometric, and on dynamical systems. He has been awarded major mathematical prizes including the Wolf Prize and the Abel Prize.

name: Umirzak Makhmutovich Sultangazin
born_place: Karaoba, Sarykol district, Kostanay region, Kazakh SSR, USSR (now Kazakhstan)
summary: Umirzak Sultangazin was a Kazakhstan mathematician who did excellent work on kinetic transport theory. He was an important figure in building up mathematics in Kazakhstan and was involved in the Mir and Soyuz space programmes.

name: Sun Zi
summary: Sun Zi was a Chinese mathematician who wrote Sunzi suanjing (Sun Zi's Mathematical Manual).

name: Karl Frithiof Sundman
summary: Karl Sundman was a Finnish mathematician who used analytic methods to find a solution to the three-body problem.

name: Ferran Sunyer i Balaguer
summary: Ferran Sunyer was a Catalan mathematician who overcame severe disabilities to produce some important results in complex analysis.

name: Anton Kazimirovich Suschkevich
summary: Anton Sushkevich was a Russian mathematician who worked on group theory and semigroups.

name: Mikhail Yakovlevich Suslin
summary: Mikhail Suslin was a Russian mathematician who worked in general topology and descriptive set theory.

name: Wilhelm Süss
university: Johann Wolfgang Goethe-Universität Frankfurt am Main
summary: Wilhelm Süss was a German mathematician important as the founder of the Oberwolfach Mathematical Institute.

name: Heinrich Suter
born_place: Hedingen (2 km N of Affoltern), Zürich Canton, Switzerland
summary: Heinrich Suter was a Swiss historian of science specializing in Islamic mathematics and astronomy.

name: Oliver Graham Sutton
summary: Graham Sutton was a mathematician who made important contributions applying mathematics to meteorology. He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1949, appointed CBE in 1950 for distinguished service to government scientific work, and knighted in 1955 for services to mathematics and science.

name: Georgii Dmitrievic Suvorov
summary: Georgii Dmitrievic Suvorov was a Russian mathematician who made important contributions to function theory and topology.

name: Michio Suzuki
summary: Michio Suzuki was a Japanese mathematician who studied group theory and discovered the groups named after him.

name: Satoshi Suzuki
summary: Satoshi Suzuki wa a Japanese mathematician who worked in algrabraic geometry.

name: Erling Sverdrup
summary: Erling Sverdrup was a Norwegian statistician and actuarial mathematician. He played a major role in the Norwegian cryptography unit during World War II.

name: Lorna Mary Swain
summary: Lorna Mary Swain was a British mathematician who was one of few early female lecturers at the University of Cambridge.

name: Hendrika Cornelia Scott Swart
summary: Henda Swart was the first person to be awarded a doctorate in mathematics from Stellenbosch University. She worked on the geometry of projective planes and graph theory. She became professor of mathematics at the University of KwaZulu-Natal and served as editor-in-chief of the journal Utilitas Mathematica.

name: Stanisław Sławomir Świerczkowski
university: Institute of Mathematics, Polish Academy of Sciences
summary: Stanisław Świerczkowski was a Polish mathematician who worked in many areas including Diophantine approximation, geometry and the foundations of mathematics.

name: Peter Ludwig Mejdell Sylow
summary: Ludwig Sylow was a high school teacher who proved what is perhaps the most profound result in the theory of finite groups.

name: James Joseph Sylvester
summary: J J Sylvester did important work on matrix theory. He discovered the discriminant of a cubic equation and first used the name 'discriminant' for equations of higher order.

name: John Lighton Synge
summary: John Synge was an Irish mathematician whose most important contributions were to theoretical physics. He wrote over 400 papers and 11 books.

name: Franciszek Hugon Szafraniec
summary: Franciszek Szafraniec is a Polish mathematician best known for his work in operator theory.

name: Domokos Szász
summary: Domokos Szász is a Hungarian mathematician known for his work in mathematical physics and dynamical systems.

name: Otto Szász
summary: Otto Szász was a Hungarian mathematician who worked on real analysis, especially Fourier series.

name: Gábor Szegő
summary: Gábor Szegő worked in the area of extremal problems and Toeplitz matrices.

name: George Szekeres
summary: George Szekeres was a Hungarian-born mathematician who worked for most of his life in Australia on geometry and combinatorics.

name: Tibor Szele
summary: Tibor Szele was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in combinatorics and abstract algebra.

name: Endre Szemerédi
summary: Endre Szemerédi is a Hungarian-born American mathematician and computer scientist, working in the field of combinatorics and theoretical computer science.

name: Wanda Montlak Szmielew
summary: Wanda Szmielew was a Polish mathematical logician who first proved the decidability of the first-order theory of abelian groups.

name: Andrea Tacquet
summary: Andrea Tacquet was a Flemish Jesuit who wrote some popular teaching works.

name: Peter Guthrie Tait
summary: P G Tait collaborated with Maxwell, Thomson (Lord Kelvin) and Hamilton to make important contributions in both mathematics and physics. He wrote extensively on quaternions and knot theory.

name: Teiji Takagi
summary: Takagi worked on class field theory, building on Heinrich Weber's work.

name: Walter Richard Talbot
summary: Walter R Talbot was an American mathematician who worked in group theory. He was the fourth African American to earn a Ph.D. in Mathematics.

name: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
summary: Nassim Taleb is a Lebanon-born American mathematician and statistician whose work concerns problems of randomness, probability and uncertainty.

name: Jacob David Tamarkin
summary: Yakov Tamarkin was a Ukranian-American mathematician who made important contributions to mathematical analysis.

name: Hideo Tanaka
summary: Hideo Tanaka wasa Japanese mathematician known for his work on fuzzy sets.

name: Yutaka Taniyama
summary: Yutaka Taniyama was a Japanese mathematician best known for the Tanayama-Shimura conjecture, whose proof led to a proof of Fermat's Last Theorem.

name: Rosalind Cecilia Hildegard Tanner
summary: Cecily Tanner was the daughter of the mathematicians William Henry Young and Grace Emily Chisholm. She published excellent papers on Riemann-Stieltjes integrals, then she became interested in the history of mathematics. Her efforts led to Thomas Harriot's work being much more widely known and understood.

name: Jules Tannery
summary: Jules Tannery was a French mathematician whose main contributions were to the history and philosophy of mathematics.

name: Paul Tannery
summary: Paul Tannery was a French mathematician who was famous as an historian of mathematics.

name: Terence Chi-Shen Tao
summary: Terence Tao is an Australian-American mathematician who won a Fields Medal in 2006 for his contributions to partial differential equations, combinatorics, harmonic analysis and additive number theory. He has continued to prove remarkable results on an exceptionally wide range of topics.

name: Richard Alfred Tapia
summary: Richard Tapia is an American mathematician who worked in mathematical optimisation. He is known as a champion of diversity in US education.

name: Marian Țarină
summary: Marian Țarină was a Romanian mathematician who worked in geometry and was also interested in the history of mathematics.

name: Gaston Tarry
summary: Gaston Tarry was a French combinatorialist whose best-known work is a method for solving mazes.

name: Alfred Tarski
summary: Alfred Tarski made important contributions in many areas of mathematics, including metamathematics, set theory, measure theory, model theory, and general algebra.

name: John Torrence Tate
summary: John Torrence Tate was an American mathematician who won both the Wolf and Abel prizes for his work in Number Theory.

name: Alfred Tauber
summary: Alfred Tauber was a Slovakian-born mathematician, known for his contribution to mathematical analysis and to the theory of functions of a complex variable.

name: Franz Adolph Taurinus
summary: Franz Taurinus was a German mathematician best known for his work on non-Euclidean geometry.

name: Olga Taussky-Todd
born_place: Olmütz, Austro-Hungarian Empire (now Olomouc, Czech Republic)
summary: Olga Taussky-Todd was an Austrian born mathematician who worked on algebraic number theory and matrix theory.

name: Brook Taylor
summary: Brook Taylor was an English mathematician who added to mathematics a new branch now called the 'calculus of finite differences', invented integration by parts, and discovered the celebrated formula known as Taylor's expansion.

name: Geoffrey Ingram Taylor
summary: Geoffrey Taylor was a British physicist and mathematician who worked in fluid dynamics and wave theory.

name: Henry Martyn Taylor
summary: Henry Martyn Taylor was an outstanding English mathematician who lost the sight of both eyes. He devised a Braille system to allow mathematical and other scientific works to become available to the blind.

name: James Taylor
summary: James Taylor was a Scottish mathematics teacher who taught at Dollar Academy.

name: Richard Lawrence Taylor
summary: Richard Taylor is a British mathematician who works in America in the field of number theory.

name: Paul Julius Oswald Teichmüller
summary: Oswald Teichmüller's main contribution was in the area of geometric function theory.

name: Francisco Gomes Teixeira
summary: Gomes Teixeira was a Portuguese mathematician and historian of mathematics.

name: George Frederick James Temple
died_place: Quarr Abbey, Isle of Wight, England
summary: George Temple was an English mathematician who worked on a wide variety of topics including analysis, relativity, aerodynamics and quantum mechanics.

name: Charles Hughes Terrot
summary: Charles Terrot was an amateur mathematician who became Bishop of Edinburgh. He wrote an early paper on complex numbers.

name: Johannes Nikolaus Tetens
summary: Johannes Tetens was a Danish physicist who made contributions to philosophy and insurance.

name: Thales of Miletus
summary: Thales was the first known Greek philosopher, scientist and mathematician. He is credited with five theorems of elementary geometry.

name: Theaetetus of Athens
summary: Theaetetus was a Greek mathematician who made very important contributions to the theory of irrationals. His work is described in the Euclid's Elements.

name: Feodor Theilheimer
died_place: Chevy Chase, Montgomery County, Maryland, USA
summary: Feodor Theilheimer was a German mathematician who was forced to move to America. He worked for the US Department of Defense on the research and development of ship design and construction.

name: Theodorus of Cyrene
summary: Theodorus was a Greek philosopher in the Cyrenaic school of moral philosophy. He was a pupil of Protagoras and the tutor of Plato and of Theaetetus.

name: Theodosius of Bithynia
summary: Theodosius was a Greek mathematician and astronomer who worked on the geometry of the sphere.

name: Theon of Alexandria
summary: Theon was a Greek mathematician who worked in Alexandria as a teacher of mathematics and astronomy. He was the father of the first woman mathematician Hypatia.

name: Theon of Smyrna
summary: Theon was a Greek philosopher who described how prime numbers, geometrical numbers such as squares, progressions, music and astronomy are interrelated.

name: Thorvald Nicolai Thiele
summary: Thorvald Thiele was a Danish mathematician and astronomer. He worked in statistics, interpolation and the three-body problem.

name: Lê Văn Thiêm
born_place: Duc Tho District, Ha Tinh Province, Vietnam
summary: Lê Văn Thiêm was a Vietnamese mathematician who became one of the founders of higher education in his country.

name: John Alexander Third
summary: J A Third became Director of Education for Ayrshire. A prize at the University of Aberdeen is named after him.

name: George Thom
summary: George Thom was a Scot who became Rector of Dollar Institution (later to become Dollar Academy). He held this post for 24 years.

name: René Thom
summary: René Thom was a French mathematician who is known for his development of catastrophe theory, a mathematical treatment of continuous action producing a discontinuous result.

name: Carl Johannes Thomae
summary: Carl Johannes Thomae was a German mathematician who worked in function theory.

name: Robert Wayne Thomason
summary: Robert Thomason was an American mathematician who worked on algebraic K-theory.

name: Abigail A Thompson
summary: Abigail Thompson is an American mathematician who studies combinatorial methods in 3-dimensional topology.

name: John Griggs Thompson
summary: John Thompson is an American mathematician best known for his proof (with Walter Feit) of one of the most important theorems on finite simple groups.

name: Robert Charles Thompson
summary: Robert C Thompson was an Canadian mathematician who moved to the USA. He worked on linear algebra and matrix theory.

name: James Thomson
born_place: Annaghmore, near Ballynahinch, Co. Down, Ireland
summary: James Thomson campaigned to reform Glasgow University. He wrote many textbooks. He was the father of Lord Kelvin.

name: William Thomson
summary: William Thomson was appointed Professor of Mathematics at Victoria College Stellenbosch in South Africa and went on to become Principal of the University of South Africa in Pretoria.

name: William Leslie Thomson
summary: William Leslie Thomson studied at Edinburgh and Cambridge. He taught at Kirkwall, at Kilmarnock and at George Heriot's School in Edinburgh.

name: William Richard Maximilian Hugo Threlfall
summary: William Threlfall was a German mathematician who worked on algebraic topology. With Herbert Seifert he wrote a standard work on topology.

name: Axel Thue
summary: Thue studied Diophantine equations, showing that, for example, y3 - 2x2 = 1 cannot be satisfied by infinitely many pairs of integers.

name: William Paul Thurston
summary: Bill Thurston was an American mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on 2 and 3 dimensional manifolds.

name: Thymaridas of Paros
summary: Thymaridas was a Greek follower of Pythagoras who wrote on prime numbers and gave methods for solving simultaneous linear equations .

name: Pavel Tichy
summary: Pavel Tichy was a Czech mathematician who spent most of his career in New Zealand. He worked in mathematical logic.

name: Horst Tietz
summary: Horst Tietz was a German mathematician who worked primarily in the field of function theory.

name: Heinrich Franz Friedrich Tietze
summary: Heinrich Tietze was an Austrian mathematician, known for the Tietze extension theorem. He also developed the Tietze transformations for group presentations, and was the first to pose the group isomorphism problem.

name: Ene-Margit Tiit
summary: Ene-Margit Tiit is an Estonian mathematician who was the first president of the Estonian Statistical Society.

name: Andrei Nikolaevich Tikhonov
summary: Andrey Nikolayevich Tikhonov was a Russian mathematician who worked in topology, functional analysis, mathematical physics, and ill-posed problems.

name: Geoffrey Timms
summary: Geoffrey Timms studied at Leeds and Cambridge and then took up a post at St Andrews. During World War II he served at Bletchley Park and Cheltenham and joined the Foreign Office afterwards.

name: Sydney Rex Tims
summary: Rex Tims was an English mathematician and university teacher.

name: Jan Tinbergen
summary: Jan Tinbergen was a Dutch economist who was awarded the first Nobel Prize in Economics.

name: François-Félix Tisserand
summary: Félix Tisserand was a French astronomer who updated Laplace's standard work.

name: Edward Charles Titchmarsh
summary: Edward Titchmarsh was an English mathematician best known for his work in analysis.

name: Gheorghe Țițeica
summary: Gheorghe Țițeica was a Romanian mathematician who worked in geometry. He was a founder of the Romanian school of differential geometry.

name: Jacques Tits
summary: Jacques Tits was a Belgium-born French mathematician who worked on group theory and geometry.

name: Jack Todd
summary: John Todd was an Irish-born numerical analyst. He was married to Olga Taussky.

name: John Arthur Todd
summary: John Todd graduated from Cambridge and stayed on to do research under Baker. After a period at Manchester and Princeton he returned to Cambridge where he spent the rest of his career. He worked on invariant theory, group theory and canonical systems.

name: Isaac Todhunter
summary: Isaac Todhunter is best known for his textbooks and his writing on the history of mathematics.

name: Otto Toeplitz
died_place: Jerusalem (under the British Mandate at the time)
summary: Toeplitz worked on infinite linear and quadratic forms. In the 1930's he developed a general theory of infinite dimensional spaces and criticised Banach's work as being too abstract.

name: Leonida Tonelli
summary: Leonida Tonelli was an Italian mathematician who worked on the theory of functions and the calculus of variations.

name: Evangelista Torricelli
summary: Evangelista Torricelli was an Italian scientist who was the first man to create a sustained vacuum and to discover the principle of a barometer. He also achieved some important results in the development of the calculus.

name: William Trail
summary: William Trail was a Scottish mathematician who became Professor of Mathematics at Aberdeen.

name: Boris Avraamovich Trakhtenbrot
university: Institute of Mathematics, Ukrainian Academy of Science
summary: Boris Trakhtenbrot was an Moldovan-born Russian mathematician who worked in logic, algorithms, theory of computation and cybernetics.

name: Avraham Naumovich Trahtman
summary: Abram Trakhtman is a Russian-born mathematician who is best known for solving the 'Road Colouring Problem'.

name: Francesco Giacomo Tricomi
summary: Francesco Tricomi studied differential equations which became very important in the theory of supersonic flight. He wrote a number of excellent books which were translated into several different languages.

name: Edward Troughton
summary: Edward Troughton was an English maker of scientific instruments.

name: Neil Sidney Trudinger
summary: Neil Trudinger is an Australian mathematician who worked in the theory of partial differential equations.

name: Clifford Ambrose Truesdell III
summary: Clifford Truesdell was an American mathematician best known as a historian of science.

name: Ehrenfried Walter von Tschirnhaus
summary: Ehrenfried Tschirnhaus was a German mathematician who worked on the solution of equations and the study of curves. He is best known for the transformation which removes the term of degree n-1 from an equation of degree n.

name: Albert William Tucker
summary: Albert Tucker was a Canadian mathematician who worked in topology, game theory and non-linear programming. He gave the name and interpretation to the "prisoner's dilemma" in game theory.

name: Robert Tucker
summary: Robert Tucker was an English mathematician, who was secretary of the London Mathematical Society for more than 30 years.

name: John Wilder Tukey
summary: John Tukey introduced the Fast Fourier Transform and worked in other areas of Statistics.

name: Cuthbert Tunstall
summary: Cuthbert Tunstall wrote the first printed work published in England devoted exclusively to mathematics.

name: Paul Turán
summary: Paul Turán was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in number theory.

name: Alan Mathison Turing
summary: Alan Turing's work was fundamental in the theoretical foundations of computer science.

name: Herbert Westren Turnbull
summary: Herbert Turnbull was Regius Professor of Mathematics at University of St Andrews from 1921 to 1950. He was an expert in Invariant Theory and an enthusiast for the History of Mathematics.

name: John Turner
summary: John Turner graduated from the university of Edinburgh and taught at the Royal High School of Edinburgh.

name: Peter Turner
summary: Peter Turner was an English scholar who held two mathematical chairs, but published no mathematics.

name: William Thomas Tutte
summary: Bill Tutte was an English mathematician best known for his work on code-breaking in World War II.

name: Helge Arnulf Tverberg
summary: Helge Tverberg was a Norwegian mathematician who worked in combinatorics.

name: Charles Tweedie
summary: Charles Tweedie studied at Edinburgh, Göttingen and Berlin. He returned to Edinburgh as assistant to Chrystal. He served as a Schools Inspector and published works on the History of Mathematics.

name: David Tweedie
born_place: Swinton School House, Swinton, Berwickshire, Scotland
summary: David Tweedie graduated from Edinburgh University and taught at George Watson's College in Edinburgh. He spent more than 30 years teaching in various institutions in Egypt.

name: David Jackson Tweedie
summary: David J Tweedie graduated with an Ordinary degree from Edinburgh University and then taught at George Heriot's Hospital School in Edinburgh. He became headmaster of the school at Kilconquhar in Fife.

name: Hoàng Tụy
born_place: Xuan Dài village, Diên Bàn, Vietnam
summary: Hoàng Tụy was a Vietnamese mathematician who was one of the founders of higher education in Vietnam. He was the first secretary of the Vietnamese Mathematical Society.

name: Olabisi Oreofe Ugbebor
summary: Olabisi Ugbebor is the first female professor of mathematics in Nigeria. She has written many papers on Brownian motion and on economics, and is a co-author of books such as Further Mathematics, Analytical Geometry and Mechanics, and Fundamentals of Abstract Algebra.

name: George Eugene Uhlenbeck
summary: George Uhlenbeck was an Indonesian born American theoretical physicist who worked in quantum mechanics and introduced the idea of electron spin.

name: Karen Keskulla Uhlenbeck
summary: Karen Uhlenbeck is an American mathematician who is a leading expert on partial differential equations. In 2019 she became the first female winner of the Abel Prize.

name: Stanislaw Marcin Ulam
summary: Stan Ulam solved the problem of how to initiate fusion in the hydrogen bomb. He also devised the 'Monte-Carlo method' widely used in solving mathematical problems using statistical sampling.

name: Francis Robbins Upton
summary: Francis Upton was an American physicist and mathematician who worked with Thomas Edison in the development of incandescent light bulbs, electric generators, and electric power distribution.

name: Kazimierz Urbanik
summary: Kazimierz Urbanik was a Polish mathematician (born in what is now Ukraine) best known for his work in stochastic processes and probability theory.

name: Manuel Valdivia Urena
summary: Manuel Valdivia was a Spanish mathematician who worked in topology and analysis.

name: Fritz Joseph Ursell
summary: Fritz Ursell was a German-born mathematician who moved to England and became a leading expert in the mathematical modelling of waves.

name: Pavel Samuilovich Urysohn
summary: Pavel Urysohn was a Ukranian mathematician who proved important results in general topology and dimension theory.

name: Giovanni Enrico Eugenio Vacca
summary: Giovanni Vacca was an Italian mathematician and historian of science. He was interested in the history of Chinese science.

name: Viktor Vladimirovich Vagner
summary: Viktor Vladimirovich Wagner was a Russian mathematician who worked in differential geometry and on semigroups.

name: Giovanni Vailati
summary: Giovanni Vailati was an Italian philosopher, historian of science, and mathematician.

name: Steven Vajda
summary: Steven Vajda was a Hungarian mathematician who played an important role in the development of mathematical programming and operational research.

name: Luca Valerio
summary: Luca Valerio was an Italian mathematician who applied methods of Archimedes to find volumes and centres of gravity of solid bodies. He corresponded with Galileo.

name: Leslie Gabriel Valiant
summary: Leslie Valiant is a British American computer scientist who has made fundamental contributions to many aspects of theoretical computer science.

name: Georges Jean Marie Valiron
summary: Georges Valiron was a French mathematician, best known for his contributions to analysis.

name: Gyula Vályi
summary: Gyula Vályi was a Hungarian mathematician and theoretical physicist known for his work on mathematical analysis, geometry and number theory.

name: Bartel Leendert van der Waerden
summary: Van der Waerden was a Dutch mathematician best known for his "Modern Algebra" text-book. He also worked on topology and on the history of mathematics.

name: Edward Burr Van Vleck
summary: Edward Van Vleck was an American mathematician who worked in the fields of function theory and differential equations.

name: Alexandre-Théophile Vandermonde
summary: Alexandre-Theophile Vandermonde was a French mathematician best known for his work on determinants.

name: Harry Schultz Vandiver
summary: Harry Vandiver was an American mathematician, known for work in number theory.

name: James Ray Vanstone
summary: James Vanstone was a Canadian mathematician who dealt with differential geometry and multilinear algebra, especially in connection with the theory of relativity.

name: Sathamangalam Ranga Iyengar Srinivasa Varadhan
summary: Srinivasa Varadhan is an Indian mathematician who works in America. He is who is known for his fundamental contributions to probability theory. He won the Abel prize in 2007.

name: Varahamihira
summary: Varahamihira was an Indian astrologer whose main work was a treatise on mathematical astronomy which summarised earlier astronomical treatises. He discovered a version of Pascal's triangle and worked on magic squares.

name: Ottó Varga
summary: Ottó Varga was a Hungarian mathematician who worked in differential geometry.

name: Richard Steven Varga
summary: Richard Varga was an American mathematician who worked in numerical analysis and linear algebra.

name: Pierre Varignon
university: Académie royale des sciences de Paris
summary: Pierre Varignon was a French mathematician who worked on graphical statics and mechanics.

name: Theodoros A Varopoulos
summary: Theodoros Varopoulos was a Greek mathematician known for his research in multivariable complex equations.

name: Mikhail Egorovich Vashchenko-Zakharchenko
summary: Mikhail Vashchenko-Zakharchenko worked on the theory of linear differential equations, the theory of probability and non-euclidean geometry.

name: Oswald Veblen
summary: Veblen made important contributions to projective and differential geometry, and topology.

name: Georg Freiherr von Vega
summary: Jurij Vega wrote about artillery but he is best remembered for his tables of logarithms and trigonometric functions.

name: Ilya Nestorovich Vekua
born_place: Shesheleti, Kutaisi Governorate, Russian Empire (now Ochamchira District, Abkhazia, breakaway region of Georgia)
summary: lya Vekua was a Georgian mathematician, specializing in partial differential equations, singular integral equations, generalized analytic functions and the mathematical theory of elastic shells.

name: John Venn
summary: John Venn was an English mathematician and logician best known for the Venn diagrams which can be used to visualise the unions and intersections of sets.

name: Ferdinand Verbiest
summary: Ferdinand Verbiest was a Flemish missionary to China in the 17th century. He produced the first Manchu edition of the first six books of Euclid, a remarkable world map, and a steam automobile. He is also famed as an astronomer, designing astronomical instruments and producing calendars.

name: Samuel Verblunsky
summary: Samuel Verblunsky was an English mathematician who worked on orthogonal polynomials and harmonic functions.

name: Pierre François Verhulst
summary: Pierre Verhulst was a Belgian statistician who worked on population growth.

name: Pierre Vernier
summary: Pierre Vernier was a French engineer best known for inventing the Vernier measuring scale.

name: Siobhán O'Shea Vernon
summary: Siobhán Vernon was the first Irish-born woman to get a PhD in pure mathematics in Ireland.

name: Giuseppe Veronese
summary: Giuseppe Veronese was an Italian mathematician who worked on the geometry of multidimensional spaces, model theory and transfinite numbers.

name: Ernest-Paulin-Joseph Vessiot
summary: Ernest Vessiot was a French mathematician who worked on the integrability of ordinary differential equations.

name: Maryna Sergiivna Viazovska
summary: Maryna Viazovska is a Ukrainian mathematician who is professor at the Chair of Number Theory at the Institute of Mathematics of the École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne in Switzerland. She won a Fields Medal for solving the sphere-packing problem in dimension 8. In collaboration with others she solved the sphere-packing problem in dimension 24.

name: Ivan Vidav
summary: Ivan Vidav was a Slovenian mathematician who worked in differential equations, functional analysis and algebra.

name: François Viète
summary: François Viète was a French amateur mathematician and astronomer who introduced the first systematic algebraic notation in his book In artem analyticam isagoge . He was also involved in deciphering codes.

name: Leopold Vietoris
summary: Leopold Vietoris was a long-lived Austrian mathematician best known for his contributions to topology, especially the Mayer-Vietoris sequence. He was also interested in mathematical history.

name: Vijayanandi
summary: Vijayanandi was an Indian mathematician and astronomer who made some contributions to trigonometry.

name: Nicolas Vilant
summary: Nicolas Vilant was Regius Professor of Mathematics at St Andrews University. He is best known for his textbooks.

name: Samuel Vince
summary: Samuel Vince came from a working class family but, with the support of several priests, was able to study the mathematical tripos at Cambridge and he was Senior Wrangler in 1775. He wrote many works on mathematics, physics and astronomy. He was Plumian professor of astronomy and experimental philosophy at Cambridge for 25 years.

name: Ivan Matveevich Vinogradov
born_place: Milolyub, Velikie Luki, Pskov province, Russia
summary: Vinogradov used trigonometric series to attack deep problems in analytic number theory.

name: Calogero Vinti
summary: Calogero Vinti was an Italian mathematician who worked in analysis, including the calculus of variations, differential equations and approximation theory.

name: Giuseppe Vitali
summary: Giuseppe Vitali was an Italian mathematician who worked in various branches of analysis including measure theory.

name: Anatoli Georgievich Vitushkin
summary: Georgievich Vitushkin was a Russian mathematician who worked on analytic capacity and other parts of mathematical analysis.

name: Giulio Benedetto Isacco Vivanti
born_place: Mantua, Kingdom of Lombardy-Venetia, Austria (now Italy)
summary: Giulio Vivanti was an Italian mathematician who worked in analysis. He suffered from anti-Jewish legislation later in his life.

name: Vincenzo Viviani
summary: Vincenzo Viviani was an Italian engineer who worked on the geometry of the cycloid.

name: Adriaan Vlacq
summary: Adriaan Vlacq was a Dutch bookseller and publisher who devised and published tables of logarithms.

name: Vasilii Sergeevich Vladimirov
summary: Vasily Vladimirov was a Russian mathematician who worked in number theory as well as mathematical physics.

name: Vladimir Aleksandrovich Voevodsky
summary: Vladimir Voevodsky was a Russian-born American mathematician who was awarded a Fields Medal in 2002 for his work in developing a homotopy theory for algebraic varieties.

name: Samuel Giuseppe Vito Volterra
summary: Vito Volterra published papers on partial differential equations, particularly the equation of cylindrical waves. His most famous work was done on integral equations.

name: Georgy Fedoseevich Voronoy
summary: Georgy Voronoy was a Ukranian mathematician best known for the Voronoi diagram which is a partitioning of a plane into regions based on distance to a finite set of points.

name: Gheorghe Vrănceanu
summary: Gheorghe Vrănceanu was a Romanian mathematician, best known for his work in differential geometry and topology.

name: Margaret Jane Helen Arnott Wadsworth
summary: Jane Wadsworth (née Arnott) was a statistician who applied her skills to data coming from a wide range of topics relating to medical research. She devoted the latter part of her life to combatting the AIDS epidemic by constructing and carrying out surveys to establish the pattern of HIV infection in Britain.

name: Abraham Wald
summary: Abraham Wald was a mathematician born in what is now Romania who worked on decision theory, geometry and econometrics.

name: Muriel Kennett Wales
summary: Muriel Wales was born in Northern Ireland but lived in Canada from the age of one. In 1941 she was awarded a Ph.D. in mathematics from the University of Toronto. She worked at the Montreal Laboratory of the National Research Council of Canada but from 1950 worked as a claims agent for her step-father's shipping company.

name: Arnold Walfisz
summary: Arnold Walfisz was a Polish mathematician who worked in analytic number theory.

name: Arthur Geoffrey Walker
summary: Geoffrey Walker studied at Oxford and Edinburgh. He taught at Imperial College London, Liverpool and Sheffield before returning to Liverpool as Professor of Pure Mathematics. He worked on Differential Geometry, Relativity and Cosmology.

name: Gilbert Thomas Walker
summary: Gilbert Walker was an English mathematician who was Senior wrangler in the Mathematical Tripos at Cambridge in 1889, and elected a fellow of Trinity College. His interest moved to meteorology and he worked in India from 1903 to 1924 becoming Director-General of the Indian Observatories. Returning to England, he was appointed Professor of Meteorology at Imperial College of Science and Technology. His interests included boomerangs, and the flight of birds.

name: John James Walker
summary: John James Walker was an English mathematician whose work was mainly in analysis of plane curves and in quaternions.

name: Charles Terence Clegg Wall
summary: Terry Wall is an English mathematician who has made important contributions to algebraic and differential topology.

name: Hubert Stanley Wall
born_place: Rockwell City, Calhoun County, Iowa, USA
summary: Hubert Stanley Wall was an American mathematician who worked in the field of continued fractions.

name: Alexander Doniphan Wallace
summary: Alexander Doniphan Wallace was an American mathematician who worked in topology.

name: William Wallace
summary: William Wallace worked on geometry and discovered the (so-called) Simson line of a triangle.

name: Derek Arthur Waller
born_place: Dinnington, near Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England
summary: Derek Waller was an English mathematician who worked in category theory, algebra and graph theory.

name: John Wallis
summary: John Wallis was an English mathematician who built on Cavalieri's method of indivisibles to devise a method of interpolation. Using Kepler's concept of continuity he discovered methods to evaluate integrals.

name: John Walsh
summary: John Walsh was an eccentric Irish mathematician who wrote on a wide variety of mathematical topics.

name: Joseph Leonard Walsh
summary: Joseph Leonard Walsh was an American mathematician who worked in the field of analysis.

name: Marion Ilse Walter
summary: Marion Ilse Walter was born in Berlin and escaped the Nazis on the Kindertransport to England. She emigrated to the United States in 1948 and after earning her doctorate, founded the Mathematics Department at Simmons College. She published over 40 journal articles, several children's books, and the popular book The Art of Problem Posing.

name: Ernest Thomas Sinton Walton
summary: Ernest Walton was an Irish physicist who won a Nobel Prize for his work on particle accelerators. He was a founder member of the Trinity College Dublin Mathematical Society.

name: Hsien Chung Wang
summary: Hsien Chung Wang was a Chinese-born American mathematician who worked in differential geometry, Lie groups and algebraic topology.

name: Yuan Wang
summary: Wang Yuan ass a Chinese mathematician best known for his contributions to the Goldbach conjecture.

name: Friedrich Heinrich Albert Wangerin
summary: Albert Wangerin was a German mathematician who worked on potential theory, spherical functions and differential geometry.

name: Talitha Michal Washington
summary: Talitha Washington is an American mathematician who, in 2001, became the first African American to graduate with a doctorate in mathematics from the University of Connecticut. She became co-leader of the National Science Foundation's 'Improving Undergraduate STEM Education: Hispanic-Serving Institutions' programme and won the 2019 Black Engineer of the Year STEM Innovator Award.

name: Pierre Laurent Wantzel
summary: Pierre Wantzel was a French mathematician who proved that several ancient geometric problems were impossible to solve using only ruler and compass constructions.

name: Seth Ward
summary: Seth Ward was an English mathematician and astronomer and a founder-member of the Royal Society.

name: Jack Warga
summary: Jack Warga was a Polish-born American mathematician who worked in optimal control theory and nonsmooth analysis.

name: Edward Waring
summary: Edward Waring was an English mathematician who gave many results about decomposing numbers into sums of powers and sums of primes.

name: Mary Wynne Warner
university: Institute of Mathematics, Polish Academy of Sciences
summary: Mary Warner was a Welsh mathematician who was a pioneer in fuzzy mathematics.

name: Stefan E Warschawski
summary: Stefan E Warschawski was a Belarussian-born American mathematician who was known for his research on complex analysis and in particular on conformal maps.

name: John James Waterston
summary: John James Waterston was a Scottish physicist who worked in the kinetic theory of gases.

name: George Neville Watson
summary: Neville Watson studied at Cambridge, and then taught at Cambridge and University College London before becoming Professor at Birmingham. He is best known as the joint author with Whittaker of one of the standard text-books on Analysis.

name: Henry William Watson
summary: Henry Watson was an English mathematician who wrote some influential text-books on electricity and magnetism.

name: William Watson
summary: William Watson graduated in Mathematics and Physics from Edinburgh University. He became head of the Physics department at Heriot Watt College in Edinburgh.

name: James Watt
summary: James Watt was an Edinburgh lawyer and actuary. He was interested in science, being a member of the Scottish Meteorological Society and the Royal Scottish Geographical Society.

name: James MacPherson Wattie
summary: James Wattie studied at Aberdeen and Oxford. He taught for a while at George Watson's College in Edinburgh and the Church of Scotland Training College in Aberdeen before becoming a Schools Inspector.

name: Rolin-Louis Wavre
summary: Rolin Wavre was a Swiss mathematician who worked on logic and the philosophy of mathematics as well as on geology and astronomy.

name: Tadeusz Ważewski
summary: Tadeusz Ważewski was a Polish mathematician who contributed to the theory of differential equations, control theory and the theory of analytic spaces.

name: Charles Ernest Weatherburn
summary: Charles Weatherburn worked on vector analysis and differential geometry.

name: Kenneth Kilpatrick Weatherhead
summary: K K Weatherhead graduated from Edinburgh University although his studies were interrupted by service in World War I. He became an actuary, working for various Edinburgh insurance companies.

name: Warren Weaver
summary: Warren Weaver was an American mathematician famous as one of the pioneers of machine translation.

name: Heinrich Martin Georg Friedrich Weber
summary: Heinrich Weber was a German mathematician whose main work was in algebra, number theory, analysis and applications of analysis to mathematical physics.

name: Heinrich Friedrich Weber
summary: Heinrich Friedrich Weber was a German physicist who was important in the history of the Zürich Polytechnic. His most famous student was Einstein.

name: Johanna Salome Weber
summary: Johanna Weber was a mathematician who began her career in Germany but continued after World War II in England. She worked on aerodynamics and played a large part in designing the wings of Concorde and of the Airbus.

name: Wilhelm Eduard Weber
summary: Wilhelm Weber was a German physicist who did important work on electricity. He collaborated with Gauss.

name: Joseph Henry Maclagen Wedderburn
summary: Joseph Wedderburn worked for most of his life in Princeton. He made important advances in the theory of rings, algebras and matrix theory.

name: Udo Hugo Helmuth Wegner
summary: Udo Wegner was a German mathematician who lost his post after World War II because of his Nazi connections.

name: Karl Theodor Wilhelm Weierstrass
summary: Karl Weierstrass is best known for his construction of the theory of complex functions by means of power series.

name: André Abraham Weil
summary: André Weil was a French mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry and number theory.

name: Adolf Weiler
summary: Adolf Weiler was a Swiss mathematician. His research interests lay in Steiner geometry.

name: Julius Weingarten
summary: Julius Weingarten was a German mathematician best known for the Weingarten equations in the differential geometry of surfaces.

name: Alexander Weinstein
summary: Alexander Weinstein is famed for solving a variety of boundary value problems which have been used in a wide range of applications. He spent a large part of his life suffering discrimination and fleeing from persecution which he successfully survived physically but paid a price mentally.

name: Julius Lugwig Weisbach
summary: Julius Weisbach was a German mathematician who wrote on mechanics, hydraulics and surveying as well as mathematics.

name: Karl Heinrich Weise
summary: Karl-Heinrich Weise was a German mathematician who worked on differential geometry and topology.

name: William Gordon Welchman
summary: William Gordon Welchman was an English mathematician who played an important part in the World War II codebreaking at Bletchley Park.

name: Walter Frank Raphael Weldon
summary: Raphael Weldon was a pioneer in the application of Statistics to biology and a founder of the journal Biometrika.

name: Agnes Ermina Wells
summary: Agnes Wells was an American mathematician and astronomer who worked during the first half of the 20th century. She spent most of her career expertly guiding women students and trying to improve the status of women in American society.

name: Magnus Joseph Wenninger
summary: Magnus Wenninger was an American mathematician who constructed polyhedron models, and wrote books about them.

name: Johann Werner
summary: Johann Werner was a German mathematician whose main work was on astronomy, mathematics and geography.

name: Wendelin Werner
summary: Wendelin Werner is a German-born French mathematician known for his work on random processes. He was awarded a Fields Medal in 2006

name: Caspar Wessel
summary: Caspar Wessel was a Norwegian mathematician who invented a geometric way of representing complex numbers which pre-dated Argand.

name: John West
summary: John West was a Scottish mathematician who became a pastor in Jamaica. He published works on geometry.

name: Eléna Wexler-Kreindler
summary: Eléna Wexler-Kreindler was a Romanian mathematician who worked in modern algebra. She spent most of her career in France.

name: Hermann Klaus Hugo Weyl
summary: From 1923-38 Weyl evolved the concept of continuous groups using matrix representations. With his application of group theory to quantum mechanics he set up the modern subject.

name: Eduard Weyr
summary: Eduard Weyr was a Czech mathematician who was the discoverer of a certain canonical form for square matrices.

name: Emil Weyr
summary: Emil Weyr was born in what is now the Czech Republic and worked in descriptive and projective geometry.

name: William Whewell
summary: William Whewell is most famous today for his work on the philosophy of science, history of science, and moral philosophy.

name: Charles Matthew Whish
summary: Charles Whish was an English civil servant who worked for the East India Company. He was the first to bring to the notice of the western mathematical scholarship the achievements of the Kerala school of astronomy and mathematics.

name: William Whiston
summary: William Whiston was an English mathematician who succeeded Newton as Lucasian professor at Cambridge, but was later deprived of his chair on religious grounds.

name: Henry Seely White
summary: Henry White worked on invariant theory, the geometry of curves and surfaces, algebraic curves and twisted curves. He is one of the few mathematicians in our archive to die on his birthday (in 1943).

name: Alfred North Whitehead
born_place: Ramsgate, Isle of Thanet, Kent, England
summary: Alfred Whitehead was a mathematician and philosopher who collaborated with Bertrand Russell on Principia Mathematica (1910-13).

name: John Henry Constantine Whitehead
summary: J H C Whitehead was a topologist and differential geometer who is best remembered for his work on homotopy equivalence.

name: Derek Thomas Whiteside
summary: Tom Whiteside was an English historian of mathematics who specialised in Isaac Newton.

name: Hassler Whitney
summary: Hassler Whitney was an American mathematician who did important work in manifolds, embeddings, immersions, characteristic classes and geometric integration theory.

name: Mary Watson Whitney
summary: Mary Watson Whitney was a mathematician and astronomer. She wrote around 70 astronomy papers, and directed the Vassar College Observatory. She was one of the first seven women to join the New York Mathematical Society in 1891

name: Gerald James Whitrow
