summary: Gerald Whitrow undertook research on relativity and wrote a number of books, especially on 'time'. He believed that the history of science was important in works describing technical mathematics. He put this into practice in both his papers and his books.

name: Edmund Taylor Whittaker
summary: Edmund Whittaker's best known work is in analysis, in particular numerical analysis, but he also worked on celestial mechanics and the history of applied mathematics and physics.

name: John Macnaghten Whittaker
summary: John Macnaghten Whittaker worked in Quantum Mechanics and Complex Analysis. He became Vice-Chancellor of Sheffield University.

name: William Allen Whitworth
summary: Allen Whitworth became an editor of the newly founded journal Messenger of Mathematics while still an undergraduate at St John's College, Cambridge. He was later elected a fellow of the College and wrote several popular teaching books. He later had a career in the Church and, because of his proposal and encouragement, St John's College set up a Mission for the disadvantaged in London.

name: Gordon Thomas Whyburn
summary: Gordon Whyburn was an American mathematician who worked on topology.

name: William Marvin Whyburn
summary: William Whyburn was an American mathematician best known for his work on ordinary differential equations.

name: David Vernon Widder
summary: David Widder was an American mathematician who worked on integral transforms and partial differential equations.

name: Johannes Widman
summary: Johannes Widman was a German mathematician who is best remembered for an early arithmetic book which contains the first appearance of + and – signs.

name: James Wiegold
summary: Jim Wiegold was a Welsh mathematician who worked in group theory.

name: Helmut Wielandt
summary: Helmut Wielandt worked on finite groups and on finite and infinite permutation groups.

name: Wilhelm Carl Werner Otto Fritz Franz Wien
born_place: Gaffken, near Fischhausen, East Prussia (now Primorsk Kaliningrad Oblast Russia)
summary: Wilhelm Wien was a German physicist who won the Nobel prize for discovering the proton.

name: Ludwig Christian Wiener
summary: Christian Wiener was a German mathematician, physicist and philosopher. He was the first person to identify qualitatively the molecular cause of Brownian motion.

name: Hermann Ludwig Gustav Wiener
summary: Hermann Wiener was a German mathematician who worked on the foundations of geometry.

name: Norbert Wiener
summary: Norbert Wiener was an American mathematician who did important work on probability.

name: Eugene Paul Wigner
summary: Eugene Paul Wigner was a Hungarian-American theoretical physicist and mathematician who won a Nobel prize for his contributions to the theory of the atomic nucleus and elementary particles.

name: Ernest Julius Wilczynski
summary: Ernest Wilczynski was an American mathematician who may be considered the founder of projective differential geometry.

name: Raymond Louis Wilder
summary: Raymond Wilder was an American mathematician who worked in topology as well as producing works on philosophy.

name: Andrew John Wiles
summary: Andrew Wiles is an English mathematician famous for having proved Fermat's Last Theorem in 1995. He has received numerous honours including being made a Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire by the Queen in 2000, and being awarded the Wolf Prize, the Shaw Prize, the Clay Research Award and the Abel Prize.

name: Herbert Saul Wilf
summary: Herbert Wilf was an American mathematician who worked in combinatorics and graph theory.

name: Jesse Ernest Wilkins Jr
summary: J Ernest Wilkins was an African-American mathematician and nuclear scientist. He worked on various pure mathematical topics as well as researching in nuclear engineering and optics.

name: John Wilkins
born_place: Fawsley (4 km S of Daventry), Northamptonshire, England
summary: John Wilkins was an English mathematician who was one of the founders of the Royal Society. He wrote on astronomy and mechanical machines.

name: James Hardy Wilkinson
summary: Jim Wilkinson was an English mathematician who worked in numerical analysis.

name: Samuel Stanley Wilks
summary: Samuel Wilks was an American mathematician who worked in mathematical statistics.

name: Evan James Williams
summary: Evan James Williams was a mathematician and physicist who made outstanding contributions to atomic physics, especially when working with Niels Bohr. During World War II he worked for the Admiralty applying methods of Operations Research to deal with the problem of German U-boats. It is claimed that his contributions led to the defeat of the U-boat campaign which made planning for the Allies to invade Europe possible.

name: Lloyd Kenneth Williams
summary: Lloyd Kenneth Williams was an African American mathematician who taught at the University of San Francisco while studying for his doctorate at University of California at Berkeley. He served as Chair of Mathematics at several universities, ending has career at Texas Southern University in Houston.

name: William Lloyd Garrison Williams
summary: Lloyd Williams was an American mathematician most important for his role in founding the Canadian Mathematical Society.

name: John Williamson
summary: John Williamson graduated from Edinburgh University and then had an appointment at St Andrews. He spent some time in Chicago and eventually moved to the USA to a post at Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore. His most important work was in Algebra.

name: Alexander Wilson
summary: Alexander Wilson was a Scottish astronomer who published observations on sunspots.

name: Bertram Martin Wilson
summary: Bertram Wilson graduated from Cambridge and had posts at Liverpool and Dundee. He died very young.

name: Edwin Bidwell Wilson
summary: Edwin Wilson was an American mathematician and statistician who worked in many different areas.

name: John Wilson
summary:
John Wilson is best known for Wilson's theorem:
If p is prime then 1 + (p - 1)! is divisible by p.

name: John Wilson
summary: John Wilson was a Scottish mathematician who took over the Rectorship of his father's Academy in Bannockburn and later moved to Edinburgh as a tutor in mathematics and physics.

name: Ernst Eduard Wiltheiss
summary: Eduard Wiltheiss was a German mathematician who made major contributions to the theory of abelian functions.

name: John Raymond Wilton
summary: John Raymond Wilton studied at Adelaide and Cambridge. He lectured at Sheffield before returning to Adelaide as a Professor. He worked in Analysis and Number Theory.

name: Anders Wiman
summary: Anders Wiman was a Swedish mathematician who worked on algebraic geometry and applications of group theory.

name: Wilhelm Winkler
born_place: Prague, Bohemia, Austro-Hungarian Empire (now Czech Republic)
summary: Wilhelm Winkler was a Czech-born statistician and politician whose work covered a wide field of theoretical and applied statistics.

name: Joseph Winlock
summary: Joseph Winlock was a mid 19th century American mathematician and astronomer who became Superintendent of the American Nautical Almanac and then the Director of the Harvard College Observatory.

name: Anna Winlock
summary: Anna Winlock was the daughter of the mathematician and astronomer Joseph Winlock and, following his death, was employed as an assistant at the Harvard College Observatory. She did outstanding work as a computer and gained fame computing the orbit of an asteroid discovered in 1901.

name: Aurel Friedrich Wintner
summary: Aurel Wintner studied at Budapest and Leipzig. He spent most of his career in Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore, USA. He published on Number Theory, Differential Equations, Probability and Celestial Mechanics.

name: Wilhelm Wirtinger
born_place: Ybbs an der Donau, Melk, Niederösterreich, Austria
died_place: Ybbs an der Donau, Melk, Niederösterreich, Austria
summary: Wilhelm Wirtinger was an Austrian mathematician who worked in complex analysis, geometry, algebra, number theory, Lie groups and knot theory.

name: John Wishart
summary: John Wishart made important contributions to Statistics.

name: Ernst Witt
summary: Ernst Witt was a German mathematician and a leading algebraist. He proved important results on Lie algebras.

name: Edward Witten
summary: Edward Witten is an American mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on quantum field theory.

name: Ludwig Josef Johann Wittgenstein
summary: Ludwig Wittgenstein was a philosopher who worked on the foundations of mathematics and on mathematical logic.

name: Paul Wittich
summary: Paul Wittich was a Polish mathematician and astronomer who anticipated Tycho Brahe's planetary theory. He may have influenced Napier.

name: František Wolf
summary: František Wolf was a Czech mathematician known for his contributions to trigonometry and mathematical analysis.

name: Johann Rudolf Wolf
summary: Rudolf Wolf was a Swiss astronomer and mathematician best known for his research on sunspots.

name: Jacob Wolfowitz
summary: Jacob Wolfowitz worked on nonparametric statistical inference with Wald and also collaborated on sequential analysis.

name: Joseph Wolstenholme
summary: Joseph Wolstenholme was an English mathematician who made a significant contribution to mathematical education.

name: John Ronald Womersley
summary: John Womersley was an applied mathematician who became involved in the early development of computers. Perhaps his most significant work, however, was in essentially creating the mathematical theory of blood flow.

name: Mario Israel Wschebor Wonsever
summary: Mario Wschebor was a Uruguayan mathematician and statistician who has a remarkable record of outstanding papers, and an international reputation of speaking at conferences around the world. Yet his career was disrupted by having to flee because of political events. He was also passionate about political and social issues and fought throughout his career for an improved university system.

name: Dudley Weldon Woodard
summary: Dudley Woodard was an American mathematician and educator who was the second African-American to earn a PhD in Mathematics.

name: Sarah Woodhead
summary: Sarah Woodhead was one of five pioneering female students at Girton College, Cambridge, which was established to allow women to benefit from a university education, and became the first woman to pass the Tripos examinations in mathematics at Cambridge.

name: Robert Woodhouse
summary: Robert Woodhouse was an English mathematician and astronomer who attempted to bring continental methods into English mathematics.

name: Leslie Colin Woods
summary: Leslie Woods was a New Zealand mathematician who worked in fluid mechanics, particularly in the area of plasmas.

name: Robert Simpson Woodward
summary: Robert Woodward was an American civil engineer, physicist and mathematician who also worked in astronomy.

name: Christopher Wren
summary: Christopher Wren was an English architect and mathematician who became Savilian Professor of Astronomy at Oxford. He is best known for the buildings he designed after the Great Fire of London.

name: Thomas Lancaster Wren
summary: Thomas Wren was an English mathematician whose main work was in geometry.

name: Edward Maitland Wright
summary: Edward Wright was a number theorist and collaborator of G H Hardy. He was Professor of Mathematics at Aberdeen for many years and went on to become Principal of the university.

name: Fred Boyer Wright
summary: Fred Boyer Wright was an African American mathematician whose Ph.D. was supervised by Irving Kaplansky. After working at the Institute for Air Weapons Research for the Navy he was appointed as an Assistant Professor of Mathematics at Tulane University.

name: Sewall Green Wright
summary: Sewall Green Wright was an American geneticist who worked on on evolutionary theory.

name: Sijue Wu
summary: Sijue Wu was born and brought up in China but went to the United States to study for her doctorate. She became Robert W and Lynne H Browne Professor of Mathematics at the University of Michigan. Her research involves the mathematics of water waves.

name: Wen-Tsun Wu
summary: Wen-Tsun Wu was a Chinese mathematician who worked in topology and computer mathematics.

name: Hans Wussing
summary: Hans Wussing was a German mathematician who was one of the most important historians of mathematics and science.

name: Shaun Wylie
summary: Shaun Wylie was a British mathematician who made important contributions to code-breaking in World War II. He wrote an important text-book on algebraic topology.

name: Xenocrates of Chalcedon
born_place: Chalcedon (now Kadiköy, near Istanbul), Bithynia (now Turkey)
summary: Xenocrates was a student of Plato who went on to become head of the Academy. He was an early believer in the atomic theory and originated the classical distinction between mind, body and soul.

name: Xu Yue
summary: Xu Yue was a Chinese mathematician who wrote a commentary of the Nine Chapters on the Mathematical Art.

name: Hidehiko Yamabe
summary: Hidehiko Yamabe was a Japanese mathematician who published important results in differential geometry and on group theory, including Hilbert's fifth problem.

name: Kentaro Yano
summary: Kentaro Yano was a Japanese mathematician who worked on differential geometry.

name: Frank Yates
summary: Frank Yates was an English statistician whose work was important in the development of the subject.

name: Yativrsabha
summary: Yativrsabha was a Jaina mathematician who gave a description of the universe which is of historical importance in understanding Jaina science and mathematics.

name: Shing-Tung Yau
summary: Shing-Tung Yau is a Chinese mathematician who won a Fields Medal for his work on differential geometry and partial differential equations. He has also received other prestigious mathematical prizes such as the Wolf Prize and the Shaw Prize.

name: Yavanesvara
summary: Yavanesvara was an Indian astrologer who translated an important Greek text on astrology.

name: Jean-Christophe Yoccoz
summary: Jean-Christophe Yoccoz was a French mathematician who was awarded a Fields Medal in 1994 for his work on dynamical systems.

name: Kosaku Yosida
summary: Kosaku Yosida was a Japanese mathematician who worked in the field of functional analysis.

name: William John Youden
summary: William John Youden was an Australian born American statistician who formulated new statistical techniques in statistical analysis and in the design of experiments.

name: Alfred Young
summary: Alfred Young was an English mathematician who worked in group theory. Both Young diagrams and Young tableaux are named after him.

name: Andrew White Young
summary: Andrew Young graduated from Edinburgh and taught at St Andrews and London Universities. He then trained as a lawyer and worked as a solicitor in Edinburgh for the rest of his career.

name: Lai-Sang Young
summary: Lai-Sang Young is a Hong Kong born American mathematican known for her work on ergodic properties of dynamical systems.

name: Laurence Chisholm Young
summary: Laurence Chisholm Young was a German-born mathematician who worked in measure theory, the calculus of variations, optimal control theory and potential theory.

name: Thomas Young
summary: Thomas Young was an English mathematician and physicist best known for Young's modulus and his work on interference.

name: William Henry Young
summary: William Young discovered Lebesgue integration, independently but two years after Lebesgue. He studied Fourier series and orthogonal series in general.

name: George Udny Yule
summary: George Yule was an English mathematician who is best known for his book: Introduction to the Theory of Statistics.

name: Adolph Andrei Pavlovich Yushkevich
summary: Adolph Pavlovich Yushkevich was a Soviet historian of mathematics. He was an expert in medieval mathematics of the East and the work of Leonhard Euler.

name: Adriaan Cornelis Zaanen
summary: Adriaan Cornelis Zaanen was a Dutch mathematician who worked mainly in analysis.

name: Karlis Zalts
summary: Karlis Zalts was a Latvian mathematician with wide-ranging interests in topics such as mechanical calculators, statistics and nomography as well as folklore, education, and philosophy.

name: Kazimierz Zarankiewicz
summary: Kazimierz Zarankiewicz was a Polish mathematician who worked in topology.

name: Stanisław Zaremba
summary: Stanisław Zaremba was a Polish mathematician who worked in partial differential equations and classical analysis, particularly on harmonic functions.

name: Oscar Zariski
summary: Zariski's work was on foundations of algebraic geometry using algebraic methods. He worked on the theory of normal varieties, local uniformisation and the reduction of singularities of algebraic varieties.

name: Hans Julius Zassenhaus
summary: Zassenhaus did important work on Group Theory and Lie algebras.

name: Édouard Zeckendorf
summary: Edouard Zeckendorf was a Belgian medical doctor and mathematician best known for his work on Fibonacci numbers.

name: Erik Christopher Zeeman
summary: Chris Zeeman was a British mathematician known for his work in geometric topology and singularity theory. He was responsible for founding the mathematics department at Warwick University.

name: Johann Georg Zehfuss
born_place: Darmstadt-Bessungen, Darmstadt, Grand Duchy of Hesse, now Germany
summary: Georg Zehfuss was a German mathematician and physicist who made important contributions to the theory of the tensor product of matrices.

name: Efim Isaakovich Zelmanov
summary: Efim Zelmanov is a Russian-born American mathematician best known for his solution of the restricted Burnside problem.

name: Zeno of Elea
summary: Zeno of Elea was a Greek philosopher famous for posing so-called paradoxes which challenged mathematicians' view of the real world for many centuries.

name: Zeno of Sidon
summary: Zeno of Sidon was a Greek philosopher who became head of the Epicurean school. He criticised some of the axioms that Euclid set out in The Elements.

name: Zenodorus
summary: Zenodorus was a Greek mathematician who studied the area of a figure with a fixed perimeter and the volume of a solid figure with fixed surface.

name: Ernst Friedrich Ferdinand Zermelo
summary: Ernst Zermelo was a German mathematician who did pioneering work on the foundations of mathematics.

name: Panagiotis S Zervos
summary: Panagiotis Zervos was a Greek mathematician who worked in the theory of systems of differential equations.

name: Hieronymous Georg Zeuthen
summary: Hieronymus Georg Zeuthen was a Danish mathematician who worked on the geometry of conic sections, algebraic surfaces and the history of mathematics.

name: Zhao Youqin
summary: Zhao Youqin was a Chinese mathematician and astronomer who published work on the structure of the universe. He described how to calculate π.

name: Orymbek Akhmetbekovich Zhautykov
born_place: Village No 2, Kounrad district, Karaganda region, Russian Empire (now Kazakhstan)
summary: Orymbek Zhautykov was a Kazakh mathematician who published over 200 works consisting of research papers, popular science works, pedagogical works, works on the history of mathematics, undergraduate textbooks and other articles.

name: Leo Zippin
born_place: New York City, New York, USA
summary: Leo Zippin was an American mathematician who is best known for being one of those who solved Hilbert's Fifth Problem.

name: Egor Ivanovich Zolotarev
summary: Egor Zolotarev was a Russian mathematician who produced fundamental work on analysis and number theory.

name: Kazimierz Żorawski
summary: Kazimierz Żorawski was a Polish mathematician who worked on invariants of differential forms, integral invariants of Lie groups, differential geometry and fluid mechanics.

name: Max August Zorn
summary: Max Zorn was a German mathematician, best known for the so-called Zorn's lemma, equivalent to the Axiom of Choice .

name: Konrad Zuse
summary: Konrad Zuse was a German computer pioneer who invented the world's first programmable computer: the Z3.

name: Fritz Zwicky
summary: Fritz Zwicky was a Bulgarian-born Swiss astronomer who worked most of his life in the USA. He made important contributions in theoretical and observational astronomy.

name: Henryk Michał Zygalski
summary: Henryk Zygalski was a Polish mathematician and cryptologist who worked at breaking German Enigma ciphers before and during World War II.

name: Antoni Szczepan Zygmund
summary: Zygmund's work in harmonic analysis has application in the theory of waves and vibrations. He also did major work in Fourier analysis and its application to partial differential equations.

name: Eustachy Karol Żyliński
born_place: Kuna, near Haisyn, Russian Empire (now Ukraine)
summary: Eustachy Żyliński was a Ukranian mathematician dealing with number theory, algebra, logic and the basics of mathematics.
